BOOK [I]0-i THE FRUIT OF THE TREE [I]0-i IN [the surgical ward of [the Hope Hospital]253-the hope hospital at [Hanaford]1-hanaford]252-the surgical ward of the hope hospital at hanaford , [a nurse]254-a nurse was bending over [a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed . [His]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed head stirred uneasily , and slipping [her]254-a nurse arm behind [him]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed [she]254-a nurse effected a professional readjustment of the pillows . " Is that better ? "[254-a nurse] As [she]254-a nurse leaned over , [he]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed lifted [his]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed anxious bewildered eyes , deep - sunk under ridges of suffering . " [I]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed do n't s'pose there 's any kind of a show for [me]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed , is there ? "[255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed] [he]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed asked , pointing with [his]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed free hand -- the stained seamed hand of [the mechanic]256-the mechanic -- to the inert bundle on the quilt . [Her]254-a nurse only immediate answer was to wipe the dampness from [his]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed forehead ; then [she]254-a nurse said : " [We]3322-we 'll talk about that to - morrow . "[254-a nurse] " Why not now ? "[254-a nurse] " Because [Dr.]95-dr. garford Disbrow ca n't tell till the inflammation goes down . "[254-a nurse] " Will it go down by to - morrow ? "[254-a nurse] " It will begin to , if [you]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed do n't excite [yourself]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed and keep up the fever . "[254-a nurse] " Excite [myself]254-a nurse ? [I]254-a nurse -- there 's four of 'em at home---- "[254-a nurse] " Well , then there are four reasons for keeping quiet , "[254-a nurse] [she]254-a nurse rejoined . [She]254-a nurse did not use , in speaking , the soothing inflection of [her]254-a nurse trade : [she]254-a nurse seemed to disdain to cajole or trick [the sufferer]257-the sufferer . [Her]254-a nurse full young voice kept its cool note of authority , [her]254-a nurse sympathy revealing itself only in the expert touch of [her]254-a nurse hands and the constant vigilance of [her]254-a nurse dark steady eyes . This vigilance softened to pity as [the patient]258-the patient turned [his]258-the patient head away with a groan . [His]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed free left hand continued to travel the sheet , clasping and unclasping itself in contortions of feverish unrest . It was as though all the anguish of [his]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed mutilation found expression in that lonely hand , left without work in [the world]259-the world now that its mate was useless . [The nurse]260-the nurse felt a touch on [her]260-the nurse shoulder , and rose to face [the matron]261-the matron , [a sharp - featured woman with a soft intonation]262-a sharp - featured woman with a soft intonation . " This is [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst , [Miss Brent]97-miss brent . [The assistant manager from [the mills]3324-the mills]3323-the assistant manager from the mills . [He]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed wishes to see [Dillon]98-dillon . "[262-a sharp - featured woman with a soft intonation] [John Amherst]99-amherst 's step was singularly noiseless . [The nurse , sensitive by nature and training to all physical characteristics]263-the nurse , sensitive by nature and training to all physical characteristics , was struck at once by the contrast between [his]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed alert face and figure and the silent way in which [he]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed moved . [She]260-the nurse noticed , too , that the same contrast was repeated in the face itself , its spare energetic outline , with the high nose and compressed lips of [the mover of [men]265-men]264-the mover of men , being curiously modified by the veiled inward gaze of the grey eyes [he]255-a young man whose bandaged right hand and arm lay stretched along the bed turned on [her]260-the nurse . It was one of the interests of [Justine Brent]100-justine 's crowded yet lonely life to attempt a rapid mental classification of [the persons [she]260-the nurse met]266-the persons she met ; but the contradictions in [Amherst]96-amherst 's face baffled [her]260-the nurse , and [she]260-the nurse murmured inwardly " [I]260-the nurse do n't know "[260-the nurse] as [she]260-the nurse drew aside to let [him]96-amherst approach the bed . [He]96-amherst stood by [her]260-the nurse in silence , [his]96-amherst hands clasped behind [him]96-amherst , [his]96-amherst eyes on [the injured man , who lay motionless , as if sunk in a lethargy]267-the injured man , who lay motionless , as if sunk in a lethargy . [The matron]261-the matron , at the call of [another nurse]269-another nurse , had minced away down [the ward]270-the ward , committing [Amherst]96-amherst with a glance to [Miss Brent]97-miss brent ; and [the two]271-the two remained alone by the bed . After a pause , [Amherst]96-amherst moved toward the window beyond the empty cot adjoining [[Dillon]98-dillon 's]272-dillon 's . One of the white screens used to isolate [dying patients]273-dying patients had been placed against this cot , which was the last at that end of [the ward]270-the ward , and the space beyond formed a secluded corner , where a few words could be exchanged out of reach of the eyes in the other beds . " Is [he]96-amherst asleep ? "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst asked , as [Miss Brent]97-miss brent joined [him]96-amherst . [Miss Brent]97-miss brent glanced at [him]96-amherst again . [His]96-amherst voice betokened not merely education , but something different and deeper -- the familiar habit of gentle speech ; and [his]96-amherst shabby clothes -- carefully brushed , but ill - cut and worn along the seams -- sat on [him]96-amherst easily , and with the same difference . " The morphine has made [him]96-amherst drowsy , "[97-miss brent] [she]97-miss brent answered . " The wounds were dressed about an hour ago , and [the doctor]3325-the doctor gave [him]96-amherst a hypodermic . "[97-miss brent] " The wounds -- how many are there ? "[97-miss brent] " Besides the hand , [his]96-amherst arm is badly torn up to the elbow . "[97-miss brent] [Amherst]96-amherst listened with bent head and frowning brow . " What do [you]96-amherst think of the case ? "[96-amherst] [She]97-miss brent hesitated . " [Dr. Disbrow]101-dr. disbrow has n't said---- "[97-miss brent] " And it 's not [your]96-amherst business to ? "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst smiled slightly . " [I]96-amherst know [hospital]3326-hospital etiquette . But [I]96-amherst have a particular reason for asking . "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst broke off and looked at [her]97-miss brent again , [his]96-amherst veiled gaze sharpening to a glance of concentrated attention . " [You]97-miss brent 're not [one of [the regular nurses]3328-the regular nurses]3327-one of the regular nurses , are [you]97-miss brent ? [Your]97-miss brent dress seems to be of a different colour . "[97-miss brent] [She]97-miss brent smiled at the " seems to be , "[97-miss brent] which denoted a tardy and imperfect apprehension of the difference between dark - blue linen and white . " No : [I]97-miss brent happened to be staying at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , and hearing that [they]1-hanaford were in want of [a surgical nurse]3329-a surgical nurse , [I]97-miss brent offered [my]97-miss brent help . "[97-miss brent] [Amherst]96-amherst nodded . " So much the better . Is there any place where [I]96-amherst can say two words to [you]97-miss brent ? "[96-amherst] " [I]96-amherst could hardly leave [the ward]270-the ward now , unless [Mrs. Ogan]102-mrs. ogan comes back . "[96-amherst] " [I]96-amherst do n't care to have [you]97-miss brent call [Mrs. Ogan]102-mrs. ogan , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst interposed quickly . " When do [you]96-amherst go off duty ? "[96-amherst] [She]97-miss brent looked at [him]96-amherst in surprise . " If what [you]96-amherst want to ask about is -- anything connected with the management of things here -- [you]96-amherst know [we]3331-we 're not supposed to talk of [[our]3331-we patients]3332-our patients outside of [the hospital]3333-the hospital . "[97-miss brent] " [I]96-amherst know . But [I]96-amherst am going to ask [you]97-miss brent to break through the rule -- in [that poor fellow]3334-that poor fellow 's behalf . "[96-amherst] A protest wavered on [her]97-miss brent lip , but [he]96-amherst held [her]97-miss brent eyes steadily , with a glint of good - humour behind [his]96-amherst determination . " When do [you]96-amherst go off duty ? "[96-amherst] " At six . "[97-miss brent] " [I]96-amherst 'll wait at [the corner of [South Street]2-south street]3335-the corner of south street and walk a little way with [you]97-miss brent . "[96-amherst] " Very well , "[97-miss brent] [she]97-miss brent said , without farther hesitation ; and [Amherst]96-amherst , with a slight nod of farewell , passed through the door near which [they]275-they had been standing . II WHEN [Justine Brent]100-justine emerged from [the Hope Hospital]253-the hope hospital the October dusk had fallen and [the wide suburban street]277-the wide suburban street was almost dark , except when the illuminated bulk of [an electric car]278-an electric car flashed by under the maples . [She]100-justine crossed [the tracks]279-the tracks and approached [the narrower thoroughfare where [Amherst]96-amherst awaited [her]100-justine]280-the narrower thoroughfare where amherst awaited her . [He]96-amherst hung back a moment , and [she]100-justine was amused to see that [he]96-amherst failed to identify [the uniformed nurse]281-the uniformed nurse with [the girl in [her]281-the uniformed nurse trim dark dress , soberly complete in all its accessories , who advanced to [him]96-amherst , smiling under [her]281-the uniformed nurse little veil]282-the girl in her trim dark dress , soberly complete in all its accessories , who advanced to him , smiling under her little veil . " Thank [you]100-justine , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said as [he]96-amherst turned and walked beside [her]100-justine . " Is this [your]100-justine way ? "[96-amherst] " [I]96-amherst am staying in [Oak Street]3-oak street . But it 's just as short to go by [Maplewood Avenue]4-maplewood avenue . "[96-amherst] " Yes ; and quieter . "[96-amherst] For a few yards [they]283-they walked on in silence , [their]283-they long steps falling naturally into time , though [Amherst]96-amherst was somewhat taller than [[his]96-amherst companion]284-his companion . At length [he]96-amherst said : " [I]96-amherst suppose [you]100-justine know nothing about the relation between [Hope Hospital]5-hope hospital and [the Westmore Mills]3336-the westmore mills . "[96-amherst] " Only that [the hospital]3333-the hospital was endowed by [one of [the Westmore family]3339-the westmore family]3338-one of the westmore family . "[96-amherst] " Yes ; an old [Miss Hope]103-miss hope , [a great - aunt of [Westmore]104-westmore 's]3340-a great - aunt of westmore 's . But there is more than that between [them]283-they -- all kinds of subterranean passages . "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst paused , and began again : " For instance , [Dr. Disbrow]101-dr. disbrow married [the sister of [[our]3342-our manager]3343-our manager 's wife]3341-the sister of our manager 's wife . "[96-amherst] " [[Your]96-amherst chief at [the mills]3324-the mills]3344-your chief at the mills ? "[96-amherst] " Yes , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said with a slight grimace . " So [you]100-justine see , if [Truscomb]105-truscomb -- [the manager]3346-the manager -- thinks one of [the mill - hands]3347-the mill - hands is only slightly injured , it 's natural that [[his]105-truscomb brother - in - law]3348-his brother - in - law , [Dr. Disbrow]101-dr. disbrow , should take an optimistic view of the case . "[96-amherst] " [Natural]106-natural ? [I]96-amherst do n't know---- "[96-amherst] " Do n't [you]96-amherst think it 's natural that [a man]3349-a man should be influenced by [[his]3349-a man wife]3350-his wife ? "[96-amherst] " Not where [his]3349-a man professional honour is concerned . "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst smiled . " That sounds very young -- if [you]96-amherst 'll excuse [my]96-amherst saying so . Well , [I]96-amherst wo n't go on to insinuate that , [Truscomb]105-truscomb being high in favour with [the Westmores]107-the westmores , and [the Westmores]107-the westmores having a lien on [the hospital]3333-the hospital , [Disbrow]101-dr. disbrow 's position there is also bound up with [his]101-dr. disbrow taking -- more or less -- the same view as [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's . "[96-amherst] [Miss Brent]97-miss brent had paused abruptly on [the deserted pavement]285-the deserted pavement . " No , do n't go on -- if [you]96-amherst want [me]97-miss brent to think well of [you]96-amherst , "[97-miss brent] [she]97-miss brent flashed out . [Amherst]96-amherst met the thrust composedly , perceiving , as [she]97-miss brent turned to face [him]96-amherst , that what [she]97-miss brent resented was not so much [his]96-amherst insinuation against [[his]96-amherst superiors]286-his superiors as [his]96-amherst allusion to the youthfulness of [her]97-miss brent sentiments . [She]97-miss brent was , in fact , as [he]96-amherst now noticed , still young enough to dislike being excused for [her]97-miss brent youth . In [her]97-miss brent severe uniform of blue linen , [her]97-miss brent dusky skin darkened by [the nurse]260-the nurse 's cap , and by the pale background of [the hospital]3333-the hospital walls , [she]97-miss brent had seemed older , more competent and experienced ; but [he]96-amherst now saw how fresh was the pale curve of [her]97-miss brent cheek , and how smooth the brow clasped in close waves of hair . " [I]96-amherst began at the wrong end , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst acknowledged . " But let [me]97-miss brent put [Dillon]98-dillon 's case before [you]97-miss brent dismiss [me]97-miss brent . "[97-miss brent] [She]97-miss brent softened . " It is only because of [my]97-miss brent interest in that poor fellow that [I]97-miss brent am here---- "[97-miss brent] " Because [you]96-amherst think [he]96-amherst needs help -- and that [you]96-amherst can help [him]96-amherst ? "[97-miss brent] But [she]97-miss brent held back once more . " Please tell [me]97-miss brent about [him]96-amherst first , "[97-miss brent] [she]97-miss brent said , walking on . [Amherst]96-amherst met the request with another question . " [I]96-amherst wonder how much [you]97-miss brent know about factory life ? "[96-amherst] " Oh , next to nothing . Just what [I]96-amherst 've managed to pick up in these two days at [the hospital]3333-the hospital . "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst glanced at [her]97-miss brent small determined profile under its dark roll of hair , and said , half to [himself]96-amherst : " That might be a good deal . "[96-amherst] [She]97-miss brent took no notice of this , and [he]96-amherst went on : " Well , [I]96-amherst wo n't try to put the general situation before [you]97-miss brent , though [Dillon]98-dillon 's accident is really the result of it . [He]96-amherst works in [the carding room]3353-the carding room , and on the day of the accident [his]96-amherst ' card ' stopped suddenly , and [he]96-amherst put [his]96-amherst hand behind [him]96-amherst to get a tool [he]96-amherst needed out of [his]96-amherst trouser - pocket . [He]96-amherst reached back a little too far , and the card behind [him]96-amherst caught [his]96-amherst hand in its million of diamond - pointed wires . [Truscomb]105-truscomb and [the overseer of [the room]3355-the room]3354-the overseer of the room maintain that the accident was due to [his]96-amherst own carelessness ; but the hands say that it was caused by the fact of the cards being too near together , and that just such an accident was bound to happen sooner or later . "[96-amherst] [Miss Brent]97-miss brent drew an eager breath . " And what do _ [you]96-amherst _ say ? "[97-miss brent] " That [they]3356-they 're right : [the carding - room]3357-the carding - room is shamefully overcrowded . [Dillon]98-dillon has n't been in [it]3357-the carding - room long -- [he]96-amherst worked [his]96-amherst way up at [the mills]3324-the mills from being [a bobbin - boy]3359-a bobbin - boy -- and [he]96-amherst had n't yet learned how cautious [a man]3349-a man must be in [there]3361-there . The cards are so close to each other that even [the old hands]3362-the old hands run narrow risks , and it takes [the cleverest operative]3363-the cleverest operative some time to learn that [he]96-amherst must calculate every movement to a fraction of an inch . "[96-amherst] " But why do [they]3356-they crowd [the rooms]3364-the rooms in that way ? "[97-miss brent] " To get the maximum of profit out of the minimum of floor - space . [He]322-he read on , indifferent to [his]322-he surroundings , till [the car]332-the car left [the asphalt streets]333-the asphalt streets and illuminated [shop - fronts]334-shop - fronts for a grey intermediate region of mud and macadam . Then [he]322-he pocketed [his]322-he volume and sat looking out into the gloom . [The houses]335-the houses grew less frequent , with darker gaps of night between ; and the rare street - lamps shone on cracked pavements , crooked telegraph - poles , hoardings tapestried with patent - medicine posters , and all the mean desolation of [an American industrial suburb]336-an american industrial suburb . Farther on there came [a weed - grown field or two]337-a weed - grown field or two , then a row of [[operatives]338-operatives ' houses]339-operatives ' houses , [the showy gables of [the " Eldorado "[338-operatives] road - house]341-the " eldorado " road - house]340-the showy gables of the " eldorado " road - house -- [the only building in [Westmore]104-westmore]342-the only building in westmore on which fresh paint was freely lavished -- then [the company " store]3461-the company " store , "[338-operatives] [the [machine shops]344-machine shops and other out - buildings]343-the machine shops and other out - buildings , [the vast forbidding bulk of [the factories]346-the factories looming above [the river - bend]347-the river - bend]345-the vast forbidding bulk of the factories looming above the river - bend , and the sudden neatness of [the manager]3346-the manager 's turf and privet hedges . The scene was so familiar to [Amherst]96-amherst that [he]322-he had lost the habit of comparison , and [his]322-he absorption in the moral and material needs of [the workers]349-the workers sometimes made [him]322-he forget the outward setting of [their]349-the workers lives . But to - night [he]322-he recalled [the nurse]260-the nurse 's comment--"it looks so dead"--and[260-the nurse] the phrase roused [him]322-he to a fresh perception of the scene . With sudden disgust [he]322-he saw the sordidness of it all -- [the poor monotonous houses]351-the poor monotonous houses , the trampled grass - banks , the lean dogs prowling in refuse - heaps , the reflection of a crooked gas - lamp in [a stagnant loop of [the river]353-the river]352-a stagnant loop of the river ; and [he]322-he asked [himself]322-he how it was possible to put any sense of moral beauty into lives bounded forever by the low horizon of [the factory]3376-the factory . There is a fortuitous ugliness that has life and hope in it : the ugliness of [overcrowded city streets]355-overcrowded city streets , of the rush and drive of packed activities ; but this out - spread meanness of [the suburban working colony]356-the suburban working colony , uncircumscribed by any pressure of surrounding life , and sunk into blank acceptance of [its]356-the suburban working colony isolation , [its]356-the suburban working colony banishment from beauty and variety and surprise , seemed to [Amherst]96-amherst the very negation of hope and life . " [She]3462-she 's right , "[322-he] [he]322-he mused--"it 's dead -- stone dead : there is n't a drop of wholesome blood left in it . Being habitually charged with a voluminous correspondence , [she]178-mrs. ansell had foreseen this contingency and met it by despatching [[her]178-mrs. ansell maid]320-her maid for [her]178-mrs. ansell own writing - case , which was now outspread before [her]178-mrs. ansell in all its complex neatness ; but at [Bessy]122-bessy 's appeal [she]178-mrs. ansell wiped [her]178-mrs. ansell pen , and turned a sympathetic gaze on [[her]178-mrs. ansell companion]296-her companion . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's face drew all its charm from its adaptability . [It]454-it was a different face to [each speaker]455-each speaker : now kindling with irony , now gently maternal , now charged with abstract meditation -- and [few]456-few paused to reflect that , in each case , it was merely the mirror held up to [some one else]457-some one else 's view of life . "[120-mr. langhope] * * * * * The next morning , when [Amherst]96-amherst presented [himself]96-amherst at the [Westmore]104-westmore door , [he]96-amherst had decided to follow [[his]96-amherst chief]475-his chief 's instructions to the letter , and ask for [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope only . The decision had cost [him]96-amherst a struggle , for [his]96-amherst heart was big with its purpose ; but though [he]96-amherst knew that [he]96-amherst must soon place [himself]96-amherst in open opposition to [Truscomb]119-mrs. truscomb , [he]96-amherst recognized the prudence of deferring the declaration of war as long as possible . On [his]96-amherst round of [the mills]3324-the mills , that morning , [he]96-amherst had paused in [the room]3355-the room where [Mrs. Dillon]98-dillon knelt beside [her]98-dillon mop and pail , and had found [her]98-dillon , to [his]96-amherst surprise , comparatively reassured and cheerful . [Dr. Disbrow]101-dr. disbrow , [she]98-dillon told [him]96-amherst , had been in the previous evening , and had told [her]98-dillon to take heart about [Jim]131-jim , and left [her]98-dillon enough money to get along for a week -- and a wonderful new cough - mixture that [he]101-dr. disbrow 'd put up for [her]98-dillon special . [Amherst]96-amherst found it difficult to listen calmly , with [the nurse]260-the nurse 's words still in [his]96-amherst ears , and the sight before [him]96-amherst of [Mrs. Dillon]98-dillon 's lean shoulder - blades travelling painfully up and down with the sweep of the mop . " [I]96-amherst do n't suppose that cost [Truscomb]119-mrs. truscomb ten dollars , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said to [himself]96-amherst , as the lift lowered [him]96-amherst to the factory door ; but another voice argued that [he]96-amherst had no right to accuse [Disbrow]101-dr. disbrow of acting as [[his]96-amherst brother - in - law 's agent]479-his brother - in - law 's agent , when the gift to [Mrs. Dillon]98-dillon might have been prompted by [his]96-amherst own kindness of heart . " And what prompted the lie about [[her]98-dillon husband]3393-her husband ? Well , perhaps [he]3393-her husband 's [an incurable optimist]3535-an incurable optimist , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst summed up , springing into [the Hanaford car]480-the hanaford car . " [You]96-amherst 'd really be handsome , [Johnny]132-johnny , if [you]96-amherst were only a little vainer , "[396-his mother] [she]396-his mother said , pushing [him]96-amherst away to survey the result ; and when [he]96-amherst stared at [her]396-his mother , repeating : " [I]396-his mother never heard that vanity made [a man]3349-a man better - looking , "[396-his mother] [she]396-his mother responded gaily : " Oh , up to a certain point , because it teaches [him]3349-a man how to use what [he]3349-a man 's got . "[96-amherst] [The servant to whom [he]96-amherst gave [his]96-amherst message]482-the servant to whom he gave his message showed [him]96-amherst into [the library]483-the library , with a request that [he]96-amherst should wait ; and there , to [his]96-amherst surprise , [he]96-amherst found , not [the white - moustached gentleman whom [he]96-amherst had guessed the night before to be [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope]484-the white - moustached gentleman whom he had guessed the night before to be mr. langhope , but [a young lady in deep black]485-a young lady in deep black , who turned on [him]96-amherst a look of not unfriendly enquiry . It was not [Bessy]125-bessy 's habit to anticipate the clock ; but [her]396-his mother distaste for [her]396-his mother surroundings , and the impatience to have done with the tedious duties awaiting [her]396-his mother , had sent [her]396-his mother [downstairs]486-downstairs before the rest of the party . [Her]396-his mother life had been so free from tiresome obligations that [she]396-his mother had but a small stock of patience to meet [them]487-them with ; and already , after a night at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , [she]396-his mother was pining to get back to the comforts of [[her]396-his mother own country - house]488-her own country - house , the soft rut of [her]396-his mother daily habits , the funny chatter of [[her]396-his mother little girl]489-her little girl , the long stride of [[her]396-his mother Irish hunter]490-her irish hunter across [the Hempstead plains]491-the hempstead plains -- to everything , in short , that made it conceivably worth while to get up in the morning . " [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore ? " [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb sent [me]96-amherst to tell [you]104-westmore that [he]105-truscomb is ill , and will not be able to show [you]104-westmore [the mills]3324-the mills today . [I]96-amherst did n't mean to ask for [you]104-westmore -- [I]96-amherst was told to give the message to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst scrupulously explained , trying to repress the sudden note of joy in [his]96-amherst voice . [He]96-amherst was subject to [the unobservant man]503-the unobservant man 's acute flashes of vision , and [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's beauty was like a blinding light abruptly turned on eyes subdued to obscurity . As [he]96-amherst spoke , [his]96-amherst glance passed from [her]104-westmore face to [her]104-westmore hair , and remained caught in its meshes . [He]96-amherst had never seen such hair -- it did not seem to grow in the usual orderly way , but bubbled up all over [her]104-westmore head in independent clusters of brightness , breaking , about the brow , the temples , the nape , into little irrelevant waves and eddies of light , with dusky hollows of softness where the hand might plunge . It takes but the throb of a nerve to carry such a complex impression from the eye to the mind , but [the object of the throb]504-the object of the throb had perhaps felt the electric flash of its passage , for [her]104-westmore colour rose while [Amherst]96-amherst spoke . " Ah , here is [[my]104-westmore father]3479-my father now , "[104-westmore] [she]104-westmore said with a vague accent of relief , as [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's stick was heard tapping its way across [the hall]505-the hall . "[104-westmore] " [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst ? "[120-mr. langhope] [Langhope]120-mr. langhope , with extended hand , echoed affably but vaguely ; and it became clear that neither [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore nor [[her]104-westmore father]3496-her father had ever before heard the name of [[their]508-their assistant manager]509-their assistant manager . The discovery stung [Amherst]96-amherst to a somewhat unreasoning resentment ; and while [he]96-amherst was trying to subordinate this sentiment to the larger feelings with which [he]96-amherst had entered [the house]311-the house , [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , turning [her]178-mrs. ansell eyes on [him]96-amherst , said gently : " [Your]96-amherst name is unusual . [I]178-mrs. ansell had a friend named [Lucy Warne]133-lucy warne who married [a very clever man]3549-a very clever man -- [a mechanical genius----]3550-a mechanical genius---- "[178-mrs. ansell] [Amherst]96-amherst 's face cleared . " [[My]96-amherst father]3479-my father _ was _ [a genius]3552-a genius ; and [[my]96-amherst mother]3553-my mother is [Lucy Warne]133-lucy warne , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said , won by the soft look and the persuasive voice . " What a delightful coincidence ! [We]3554-we were girls together at [Albany]16-albany . [You]96-amherst must remember [Judge Warne]134-judge warne ? "[178-mrs. ansell] [she]178-mrs. ansell said , turning to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , who , twirling [his]120-mr. langhope white moustache , murmured , a shade less cordially : " Of course -- of course -- delightful -- most interesting . "[178-mrs. ansell] [Amherst]96-amherst did not notice the difference . [His]96-amherst perceptions were already enveloped in the caress that emanated from [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's voice and smile ; and [he]96-amherst only asked [himself]96-amherst vaguely if it were possible that [this graceful woman]511-this graceful woman , with [her]511-this graceful woman sunny autumnal air , could really be [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother 's contemporary . But the question brought an instant reaction of bitterness . " Poverty is the only thing that makes [people]3450-people old nowadays , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst reflected , painfully conscious of [his]96-amherst own share in the hardships [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother had endured ; and when [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell went on : " [I]96-amherst must go and see [her]511-this graceful woman -- [you]96-amherst must let [me]96-amherst take [her]511-this graceful woman by surprise , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said stiffly : " [We]3556-we live out at [the mills]3324-the mills , a long way from here . "[96-amherst] " Oh , [we]3556-we 're going [there]3361-there this morning , "[178-mrs. ansell] [she]178-mrs. ansell rejoined , unrebuffed by what [she]178-mrs. ansell probably took for a mere social awkwardness , while [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore interposed : " But , [Maria]123-maria , [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb is ill , and has sent [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst to say that [we]3556-we are not to come . "[104-westmore] " Yes : so [Gaines]110-mr. gaines has just telephoned . It 's most unfortunate , "[120-mr. langhope] [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope grumbled . [He]120-mr. langhope too was already beginning to chafe at the uncongenial exile of [Hanaford]1-hanaford , and [he]120-mr. langhope shared [[his]120-mr. langhope daughter]514-his daughter 's desire to despatch the tiresome business before [them]515-them . " But how ill is [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb ? Do [you]96-amherst think [he]105-truscomb can take [us]515-them over [the mills]3324-the mills tomorrow ? "[178-mrs. ansell] [she]178-mrs. ansell appealed to [Amherst]96-amherst . " [I]178-mrs. ansell 'm afraid not ; [I]178-mrs. ansell am sure [he]105-truscomb ca n't . [He]105-truscomb has a touch of bronchitis . "[178-mrs. ansell] This announcement was met by a general outcry , in which sympathy for [the manager]3346-the manager was not the predominating note . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell saved the situation by breathing feelingly : " [Poor man]3560-poor man ! "[178-mrs. ansell] and after a decent echo of the phrase , and a doubtful glance at [[her]178-mrs. ansell father]3496-her father , [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore said : " If it 's bronchitis [he]105-truscomb may be ill for days , and what in [the world]259-the world are [we]515-them to do ? "[104-westmore] " Pack up and come back later , "[120-mr. langhope] suggested [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope briskly ; but while [Bessy]125-bessy sighed " Oh , that dreadful journey ! "[125-bessy] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy interposed with authority : " One moment , [Langhope]120-mr. langhope , please . [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst , is [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore expected at [the mills]3324-the mills ? "[125-bessy] " Yes , [I]104-westmore believe [they]3563-they know [she]104-westmore is coming . "[104-westmore] " Then [I]125-bessy think , [[my]125-bessy dear]3368-my dear , that to go back to [New York]7-new york without showing [yourself]3368-my dear would , under the circumstances , be -- er -- an error in judgment . "[125-bessy] " [Good Lord]135-good lord , [Tredegar]125-bessy , [you]125-bessy do n't expect to keep [us]3565-us kicking [our]3565-us heels here for days ? "[3496-her father] [[her]518-her father]3496-her father ejaculated . " [I]520-the lawyer can certainly not afford to employ [mine]520-the lawyer in that manner for even a fraction of a day , "[520-the lawyer] rejoined [the lawyer]520-the lawyer , always acutely resentful of the suggestion that [he]520-the lawyer had a disengaged moment ; " but meanwhile---- "[520-the lawyer] " [Father]3502-father , "[125-bessy] [Bessy]125-bessy interposed , with an eagerly flushing cheek , " do n't [you]3502-father see that the only thing for [us]3565-us to do is to go over [the mills]3324-the mills now -- at once -- with [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst ? "[125-bessy] [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope stared : [he]120-mr. langhope was always adventurously ready to unmake plans , but it flustered [him]120-mr. langhope to be called on to remake them . " Eh -- what ? Now -- at once ? But [Gaines]110-mr. gaines was to have gone with [us]3565-us , and how on earth are [we]3565-us to get at [him]110-mr. gaines ? [He]110-mr. gaines telephoned [me]120-mr. langhope that , as the visit was given up , [he]110-mr. gaines should ride out to [[his]110-mr. gaines farm]3568-his farm . "[120-mr. langhope] " Oh , never mind -- or , at least , all the better ! "[514-his daughter] [[his]120-mr. langhope daughter]514-his daughter urged . " [We]3565-us can see [the mills]3324-the mills just as well without [him]110-mr. gaines ; and [we]3565-us shall get on so much more quickly . "[514-his daughter] " Well -- well -- what do [you]120-mr. langhope say , [Tredegar]125-bessy ? "[120-mr. langhope] murmured [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , allured by [her]514-his daughter last argument ; and [Bessy]125-bessy , clasping [her]514-his daughter hands , summed up enthusiastically : " And [I]125-bessy shall understand so much better without a lot of [people]3450-people trying to explain to [me]125-bessy at once ! "[125-bessy] [Her]514-his daughter sudden enthusiasm surprised [no one]3425-no one , for even [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , expert as [she]178-mrs. ansell was in the interpreting of tones , set it down to the natural desire to have done as quickly as might be with [Hanaford]116-hanaford . " [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore has left [[her]104-westmore little girl]489-her little girl at [home]3405-home , "[178-mrs. ansell] [she]178-mrs. ansell said to [Amherst]96-amherst , with a smile intended to counteract the possible ill - effect of the impression . But [Amherst]96-amherst suspected no slight in [[his]96-amherst employer]500-his employer 's eagerness to visit [Westmore]104-westmore . [His]96-amherst overmastering thought was one of joy as the fulness of [his]96-amherst opportunity broke on [him]96-amherst . To show [her]514-his daughter [the mills]3324-the mills [himself]96-amherst -- to bring [her]514-his daughter face to face with [[her]514-his daughter people]525-her people , unhampered by [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's jealous vigilance , and [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's false explanations ; to see the angel of pity stir the depths of those unfathomable eyes , when [they]526-their rested , perhaps for the first time , on suffering that it was in [their]526-their power to smile away as easily as [they]526-their had smiled away [his]96-amherst own distrust -- all this the wonderful moment had brought [him]96-amherst , and thoughts and arguments thronged so hot on [his]96-amherst lips that [he]96-amherst kept silence , fearing lest [he]96-amherst should say too much . [IV JOHN AMHERST]99-amherst was [no one - sided idealist]527-no one - sided idealist . [He]99-amherst felt keenly the growing complexity of the relation between [employer]528-employer and [worker]529-worker , the seeming hopelessness of permanently harmonizing [their]526-their claims , the recurring necessity of fresh compromises and adjustments . [He]99-amherst hated rant , demagogy , the rash formulating of emotional theories ; and [his]99-amherst contempt for bad logic and subjective judgments led [him]99-amherst to regard with distrust the panaceas offered for the cure of economic evils . But [his]99-amherst heart ached for the bitter throes with which [the human machine]530-the human machine moves on . [He]99-amherst felt the menace of industrial conditions when viewed collectively , [their]526-their poignancy when studied in the individual lives of [the toilers among whom [his]99-amherst lot was cast]531-the toilers among whom his lot was cast ; and clearly as [he]99-amherst saw the need of a philosophic survey of the question , [he]99-amherst was sure that only through sympathy with its personal , human side could a solution be reached . The disappearance of the old familiar contact between [master]532-master and [man]533-man seemed to [him]99-amherst one of the great wrongs of the new industrial situation . That the breach must be farther widened by the ultimate substitution of [the stock - company]534-the stock - company for [the individual employer]535-the individual employer -- a fact obvious to [any student of economic tendencies]536-any student of economic tendencies -- presented to [Amherst]96-amherst 's mind one of the most painful problems in the scheme of social readjustment . But it was characteristic of [him]99-amherst to dwell rather on the removal of immediate difficulties than in the contemplation of those to come , and while [the individual employer]535-the individual employer was still to be reckoned with , the main thing was to bring [him]99-amherst closer to [[his]99-amherst workers]538-his workers . Till [he]99-amherst entered personally into [their]538-his workers hardships and aspirations -- till [he]99-amherst learned what [they]538-his workers wanted and why [they]538-his workers wanted it -- [Amherst]96-amherst believed that no mere law - making , however enlightened , could create a wholesome relation between [the two]271-the two . This feeling was uppermost as [he]96-amherst sat with [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore in [the carriage which was carrying [them]538-his workers to [the mills]3324-the mills]540-the carriage which was carrying them to the mills . [He]96-amherst had meant to take [the trolley]542-the trolley back to [Westmore]104-westmore , but at a murmured word from [Mr. Tredegar Bessy]125-bessy had offered [him]96-amherst a seat at [her]104-westmore side , leaving [others]3447-others to follow . This culmination of [his]96-amherst hopes -- the unlooked - for chance of a half - hour alone with [her]104-westmore -- left [Amherst]96-amherst oppressed with the swiftness of the minutes . [He]96-amherst had so much to say -- so much to prepare [her]104-westmore for -- yet how begin , while [he]96-amherst was in utter ignorance of [her]104-westmore character and [her]104-westmore point of view , and while [her]104-westmore lovely nearness left [him]96-amherst so little chance of perceiving anything except itself ? But [he]96-amherst was not often the victim of [his]96-amherst sensations , and presently there emerged , out of the very consciousness of [her]104-westmore grace and [her]104-westmore completeness , a clearer sense of the conditions which , in a measure , had gone to produce them . [Her]104-westmore dress could not have hung in such subtle folds , [her]104-westmore white chin have nestled in such rich depths of fur , the pearls in [her]104-westmore ears have given back the light from such pure curves , if thin shoulders in shapeless gingham had not bent , day in , day out , above the bobbins and carders , and weary ears throbbed even at night with the tumult of the looms . [Amherst]96-amherst , however , felt no sensational resentment at the contrast . [He]96-amherst had lived too much with ugliness and want not to believe in [human nature]544-human nature 's abiding need of [their]544-human nature opposite . [He]96-amherst was glad there was room for such beauty in [the world]259-the world , and sure that its purpose was an ameliorating one , if only it could be used as [a beautiful spirit]546-a beautiful spirit would use it . [The carriage]547-the carriage had turned into [one of [the nondescript thoroughfares]549-the nondescript thoroughfares , half [incipient street]550-incipient street , [half decaying lane]551-half decaying lane , which dismally linked [the mill - village]552-the mill - village to [Hanaford]1-hanaford]548-one of the nondescript thoroughfares , half incipient street , half decaying lane , which dismally linked the mill - village to hanaford . [Bessy]125-bessy looked out on the ruts , the hoardings , the starved trees dangling their palsied leaves in the radiant October light ; then [she]104-westmore sighed : " What a good day for a gallop ! "[104-westmore] [Amherst]96-amherst felt a momentary chill , but the naturalness of the exclamation disarmed [him]96-amherst , and the words called up thrilling memories of [his]96-amherst own college days , when [he]96-amherst had ridden [[his]96-amherst grandfather]553-his grandfather 's horses in [the famous hunting valley not a hundred miles from [Hanaford]1-hanaford]554-the famous hunting valley not a hundred miles from hanaford . [Bessy]125-bessy met [his]96-amherst smile with a glow of understanding . " [You]96-amherst like riding too , [I]125-bessy 'm sure ? "[125-bessy] " [I]96-amherst used to ; but [I]96-amherst have n't been in the saddle for years . [Factory managers]3573-factory managers do n't keep [hunters]3574-hunters , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said laughing . [Her]104-westmore murmur of embarrassment showed that [she]104-westmore took this as an apologetic allusion to [his]96-amherst reduced condition , and in [his]96-amherst haste to correct this impression [he]96-amherst added : " If [I]96-amherst regretted anything in [my]96-amherst other life , it would certainly be a gallop on a day like this ; but [I]96-amherst chose [my]96-amherst trade deliberately , and [I]96-amherst 've never been sorry for [my]96-amherst choice . "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst had hardly spoken when [he]96-amherst felt the inappropriateness of [this avowal]555-this avowal ; but [her]104-westmore prompt response showed [him]96-amherst , a moment later , that it was , after all , the straightest way to [his]96-amherst end . " [You]96-amherst find the work interesting ? [I]104-westmore 'm sure it must be . [You]96-amherst 'll think [me]104-westmore very ignorant -- [[my]104-westmore husband]3575-my husband and [I]104-westmore came [here]3415-here so seldom ... [I]104-westmore feel as if [I]104-westmore ought to know so much more about it , "[104-westmore] [she]104-westmore explained . At last the note for which [he]96-amherst waited had been struck . " Wo n't [you]104-westmore try to -- now [you]104-westmore 're [here]3415-here ? There 's so much worth knowing , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst broke out impetuously . [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore coloured , but rather with surprise than displeasure . " [I]104-westmore 'm very stupid -- [I've]104-westmore no head for business -- but [I]104-westmore will try to , "[104-westmore] [she]104-westmore said . " It 's not business that [I]104-westmore mean ; it 's the personal relation -- just the thing the business point of view leaves out . Financially , [I]104-westmore do n't suppose [[your]96-amherst mills]3578-your mills could be better run ; but there are over [seven hundred women]3579-seven hundred women working in [them]3578-your mills , and there 's so much to be done , just for [them]3579-seven hundred women and [[their]3579-seven hundred women children]3580-their children . "[104-westmore] [He]96-amherst caught a faint hint of withdrawal in [her]104-westmore tone . " [I]104-westmore have always understood that [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb did everything---- "[104-westmore] [Amherst]96-amherst flushed ; but [he]96-amherst was beyond caring for the personal rebuff . " Do [you]104-westmore leave it to [[your]104-westmore little girl 's nurses]3581-your little girl 's nurses to do everything for [her]556-the woman who is put to the trouble of defending her dignity ? "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst asked . [Her]104-westmore surprise seemed about to verge on annoyance : [he]96-amherst saw the preliminary ruffling of [the woman who is put to the trouble of defending [her]556-the woman who is put to the trouble of defending her dignity dignity]556-the woman who is put to the trouble of defending her dignity . " Really , [I]104-westmore do n't see-- "[104-westmore] [she]104-westmore began with distant politeness ; then [her]104-westmore face changed and melted , and again [her]104-westmore blood spoke for [her]104-westmore before [her]104-westmore lips . " [I]96-amherst am glad [you]96-amherst told [me]96-amherst that , [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst . Of course [I]96-amherst want to do whatever [I]96-amherst can . [I]96-amherst should like [you]96-amherst to point out everything---- "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst 's resolve had been taken while [she]104-westmore spoke . [He]96-amherst _ would _ point out everything , would stretch [his]96-amherst opportunity to its limit . All thoughts of personal prudence were flung to the winds -- [her]104-westmore blush and tone had routed the waiting policy . [He]96-amherst would declare war on [Truscomb]105-truscomb at once , and take the chance of dismissal . At least , before [he]96-amherst went [he]96-amherst would have brought [this exquisite creature]557-this exquisite creature face to face with the wrongs from which [her]557-this exquisite creature luxuries were drawn , and set in motion the regenerating impulses of indignation and pity . [He]96-amherst did not stop to weigh the permanent advantage of this course . [His]96-amherst only feeling was that the chance would never again be given [him]96-amherst -- that if [he]96-amherst let [her]557-this exquisite creature go away , back to [her]557-this exquisite creature usual life , with eyes unopened and heart untouched , there would be no hope of [her]557-this exquisite creature ever returning . It was far better that [he]96-amherst should leave for good , and that [she]557-this exquisite creature should come back , as come back [she]557-this exquisite creature must , more and more often , if once [she]557-this exquisite creature could be made to feel the crying need of [her]557-this exquisite creature presence . But where was [he]96-amherst to begin ? How give [her]557-this exquisite creature even a glimpse of the packed and intricate situation ? " [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said , " there 's no time to say much now , but before [we]3582-we get to [the mills]3324-the mills [I]96-amherst want to ask [you]557-this exquisite creature a favour . If , as [you]557-this exquisite creature go through [them]3324-the mills , [you]557-this exquisite creature see anything that seems to need explaining , will [you]557-this exquisite creature let [me]96-amherst come and tell [you]557-this exquisite creature about it tonight ? [I]96-amherst say tonight , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst added , meeting [her]557-this exquisite creature look of enquiry , " because later -- tomorrow even -- [I]96-amherst might not have the chance . There are some things -- a good many -- in the management of [the mills]3324-the mills that [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb does n't see as [I]96-amherst do . [I]96-amherst do n't mean business questions : wages and dividends and so on -- those are out of [[my]96-amherst province]3585-my province . [I]96-amherst speak merely in the line of [my]96-amherst own work -- [my]96-amherst care of the hands , and what [I]96-amherst believe [they]3586-they need and do n't get under the present system . Naturally , if [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb were well , [I]96-amherst should n't have had this chance of putting the case to [you]3587-you ; but since it 's come [my]96-amherst way , [I]96-amherst must seize it and take the consequences . "[96-amherst] Even as [he]96-amherst spoke , by a swift reaction of thought , those consequences rose before [him]96-amherst in all their seriousness . It was not only , or chiefly , that [he]96-amherst feared to lose [his]96-amherst place ; though [he]96-amherst knew [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother had not spoken lightly in instancing the case of [the foreman whom [Truscomb]105-truscomb , to gratify a personal spite , had for months kept out of a job in [his]105-truscomb trade]559-the foreman whom truscomb , to gratify a personal spite , had for months kept out of a job in his trade . And there were special reasons why [Amherst]96-amherst should heed [her]396-his mother warning . In adopting a manual trade , instead of one of the gentlemanly professions which [the men of [[her]396-his mother family]561-her family had always followed]560-the men of her family had always followed , [he]96-amherst had not only disappointed [her]396-his mother hopes , and to a great extent thrown away the benefits of the education [she]396-his mother had pinched [herself]396-his mother to give [him]96-amherst , but had disturbed all the habits of [her]396-his mother life by removing [her]396-his mother from [her]396-his mother normal surroundings to the depressing exile of [a factory - settlement]562-a factory - settlement . However much [he]96-amherst blamed [himself]96-amherst for exacting this sacrifice , it had been made so cheerfully that the consciousness of it never clouded [his]96-amherst life with [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother ; but [her]396-his mother self - effacement made [him]96-amherst the more alive to [his]96-amherst own obligations , and having placed [her]396-his mother in a difficult situation [he]96-amherst had always been careful not to increase its difficulties by any imprudence in [his]96-amherst conduct toward [[his]96-amherst employers]3403-his employers . Yet , grave as these considerations were , they were really less potent than [his]96-amherst personal desire to remain at [Westmore]104-westmore . Lightly as [he]96-amherst had just resolved to risk the chance of dismissal , all [his]96-amherst future was bound up in the hope of retaining [his]96-amherst place . [His]96-amherst heart was in the work at [Westmore]104-westmore , and the fear of not being able to get other employment was a small factor in [his]96-amherst intense desire to keep [his]96-amherst post . What [he]96-amherst really wanted was to speak out , and yet escape the consequences : by some miraculous reversal of probability to retain [his]96-amherst position and yet effect [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's removal . The idea was so fantastic that [he]96-amherst felt it merely as a quickening of all [his]96-amherst activities , a tremendous pressure of will along undetermined lines . [He]96-amherst had no wish to take [[the manager]3346-the manager 's place]566-the manager 's place ; but [his]96-amherst dream was to see [Truscomb]105-truscomb superseded by [a man of [the new school]568-the new school]567-a man of the new school , in sympathy with [the awakening social movement]569-the awakening social movement -- [a man sufficiently practical to " run "[115-duplain] [the mills]3324-the mills successfully , yet imaginative enough to regard that task as the least of [his]96-amherst duties]570-a man sufficiently practical to " run " the mills successfully , yet imaginative enough to regard that task as the least of his duties . [He]96-amherst saw the promise of [such a man in [Louis Duplain]115-duplain]572-such a man in louis duplain , [the overseer who boarded with [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst]573-the overseer who boarded with mrs. amherst : [a young fellow of Alsatian extraction , [a mill - hand from childhood]575-a mill - hand from childhood , who had worked at [his]96-amherst trade in [Europe]17-europe as well as in [America]18-america , and who united with more manual skill , and a greater nearness to [the workman]576-the workman 's standpoint]574-a young fellow of alsatian extraction , a mill - hand from childhood , who had worked at his trade in europe as well as in america , and who united with more manual skill , and a greater nearness to the workman 's standpoint , all [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst 's enthusiasm for the experiments in social betterment that were making in [some of [the English]578-the english and [continental factories]579-continental factories]577-some of the english and continental factories . [His]96-amherst strongest wish was to see [such a man as [Duplain]115-duplain in control at [Westmore]104-westmore]580-such a man as duplain in control at westmore before [he]96-amherst [himself]96-amherst turned to the larger work which [he]96-amherst had begun to see before [him]96-amherst as the sequel to [[his]96-amherst factory]581-his factory - training . All these thoughts swept through [him]96-amherst in the instant 's pause before [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore , responding to [his]96-amherst last appeal , said with a graceful eagerness : " Yes , [you]96-amherst must come tonight . [I]104-westmore want to hear all [you]96-amherst can tell [me]104-westmore -- and if there is anything wrong [you]96-amherst must show [me]104-westmore how [I]104-westmore can make it better . "[104-westmore] " [I]96-amherst 'll show [her]104-westmore , and [Truscomb]105-truscomb sha n't turn [me]96-amherst out for it , "[96-amherst] was the vow [he]96-amherst passionately registered as [the carriage]547-the carriage drew up at [the office - door of [the main building]584-the main building]583-the office - door of the main building . How this impossible result was to be achieved [he]96-amherst had no farther time to consider , for in another moment [the rest of [the party]586-the party]585-the rest of the party had entered [the factory]3376-the factory with [them]586-the party , and speech was followed up in the roar of the machinery . [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst 's zeal for [his]96-amherst cause was always quickened by the sight of [the mills]3324-the mills in action . [He]96-amherst loved the work itself as much as [he]96-amherst hated the conditions under which it was done ; and [he]96-amherst longed to see on [the operatives]3426-the operatives ' faces something of the ardour that lit up [his]96-amherst own when [he]96-amherst entered [the work - rooms]590-the work - rooms . It was this passion for machinery that at school had turned [him]96-amherst from [his]96-amherst books , at college had drawn [him]96-amherst to the courses least in the line of [his]96-amherst destined profession ; and it always seized on [him]96-amherst afresh when [he]96-amherst was face to face with the monstrous energies of [the mills]3324-the mills . It was not only the sense of power that thrilled [him]96-amherst -- [he]96-amherst felt a beauty in the ordered activity of the whole intricate organism , in the rhythm of dancing bobbins and revolving cards , the swift continuous outpour of doublers and ribbon - laps , the steady ripple of the long ply - frames , the terrible gnashing play of the looms -- all these varying subordinate motions , gathered up into the throb of the great engines which fed the giant 's arteries , and were in turn ruled by the invisible action of quick thought and obedient hands , always produced in Amherst a responsive rush of life . [He]96-amherst knew this sensation was too specialized to affect [[his]96-amherst companions]592-his companions ; but [he]96-amherst expected [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore to be all the more alive to the other side -- the dark side of [monotonous human toil]593-monotonous human toil , of the banquet of flesh and blood and brain perpetually served up to the monster whose insatiable jaws the looms so grimly typified . [Truscomb]105-truscomb , as [he]105-truscomb had told [her]104-westmore , was [a good manager]594-a good manager from the profit - taking standpoint . Since it was profitable to keep the machinery in order , [he]105-truscomb maintained throughout [the factory]3376-the factory a high standard of mechanical supervision , except where one or two favoured overseers -- for [Truscomb]105-truscomb was given to favoritism -- shirked the duties of [[their]596-their departments]597-their departments . But it was of the essence of [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's policy -- and not the least of the qualities which made [him]105-truscomb [a " paying "[598-a " paying " manager] manager]598-a " paying " manager -- that [he]105-truscomb saved money scrupulously where its outlay would not have resulted in larger earnings . To keep the floors scrubbed , the cotton - dust swept up , [the rooms]3364-the rooms freshly whitewashed and well - ventilated , far from adding the smallest fraction to the quarterly dividends , would have deducted from [them]600-them the slight cost of this additional labour ; and [Truscomb]105-truscomb therefore economized on scrubbers , sweepers and window - washers , and on all expenses connected with improved ventilation and other hygienic precautions . Though [the whole factory]601-the whole factory was over - crowded , [the newest buildings]602-the newest buildings were more carefully planned , and had the usual sanitary improvements ; but [the old mills]603-the old mills had been left in [their]603-the old mills original state , and even those most recently built were fast lapsing into squalor . It was no wonder , therefore , that [workers imprisoned within such walls]604-workers imprisoned within such walls should reflect [their]604-workers imprisoned within such walls long hours of deadening toil in dull eyes and anaemic skins , and in the dreary lassitude with which [they]604-workers imprisoned within such walls bent to [their]604-workers imprisoned within such walls tasks . Surely , [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst argued , [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore must feel this ; must feel it all the more keenly , coming from an atmosphere so different , from a life where , as [he]105-truscomb instinctively divined , all was in harmony with [[her]104-westmore own graceful person]605-her own graceful person . But a deep disappointment awaited [him]105-truscomb . [He]105-truscomb was still under the spell of [their]606-their last moments in [the carriage]547-the carriage , when [her]104-westmore face and voice had promised so much , when [she]104-westmore had seemed so deeply , if vaguely , stirred by [his]105-truscomb appeal . But as [they]606-their passed from [one resounding room]608-one resounding room to the other -- from the dull throb of [the carding - room]3357-the carding - room , the groan of the ply - frames , the long steady pound of the slashers , back to the angry shriek of the fierce unappeasable looms -- the light faded from [her]104-westmore eyes and [she]104-westmore looked merely bewildered and stunned . [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst , hardened to the din of [the factory]3376-the factory , could not measure its effect on nerves accustomed to the subdued sounds and spacious stillnesses which are the last refinement of luxury . [Habit]136-habit had made [him]105-truscomb unconscious of that malicious multiplication and subdivision of noise that kept every point of consciousness vibrating to a different note , so that while one set of nerves was torn as with pincers by the dominant scream of the looms , [others]3447-others were thrilled with a separate pain by the ceaseless accompaniment of drumming , hissing , grating and crashing that shook [the great building]612-the great building . [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst felt this tumult only as part of the atmosphere of [the mills]3324-the mills ; and to ears trained like [his]105-truscomb own [he]105-truscomb could make [his]105-truscomb voice heard without difficulty . But [his]105-truscomb attempts at speech were unintelligible to [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore and [[her]104-westmore companions]614-her companions , and after vainly trying to communicate with [him]105-truscomb by signs [they]615-they hurried on as if to escape as quickly as possible from the pursuing whirlwind . [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst could not allow for the depressing effect of this enforced silence . [He]105-truscomb did not see that if [Bessy]125-bessy could have questioned [him]105-truscomb the currents of sympathy might have remained open between [them]615-they , whereas , compelled to walk in silence through interminable ranks of meaningless machines , to which [the human workers]616-the human workers seemed mere automatic appendages , [she]104-westmore lost all perception of what the scene meant . [He]105-truscomb had forgotten , too , that the swift apprehension of suffering in [others]3447-others is as much the result of training as the immediate perception of beauty . Both perceptions may be inborn , but if they are not they can be developed only through the discipline of experience . " [That girl in [the hospital]3333-the hospital]3588-that girl in the hospital would have seen it all , "[105-truscomb] [he]105-truscomb reflected , as the vision of [Miss Brent]97-miss brent 's small incisive profile rose before [him]105-truscomb ; but the next moment [he]105-truscomb caught the light on [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's hair , as [she]104-westmore bent above a card , and the paler image faded like a late moon in the sunrise . Meanwhile [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , seeing that the detailed inspection of [the buildings]618-the buildings was as trying to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's lameness as to [[his]120-mr. langhope daughter]514-his daughter 's nerves , had proposed to turn back with [him]105-truscomb and drive to [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst 's , where [he]105-truscomb might leave [her]104-westmore to call while [the others]620-the others were completing [their]620-the others rounds . It was one of [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's gifts to detect the first symptoms of _ ennui _ in [[her]178-mrs. ansell companions]614-her companions , and produce a remedy as patly as [old ladies]622-old ladies whisk out a scent - bottle or a cough - lozenge ; and [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's look of relief showed the timeliness of [her]178-mrs. ansell suggestion . [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst was too preoccupied to wonder how [[his]105-truscomb mother]396-his mother would take this visit ; but [he]105-truscomb welcomed [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's departure , hoping that the withdrawal of [his]105-truscomb ironic smile would leave [[his]105-truscomb daughter]514-his daughter open to gentler influences . [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy , meanwhile , was projecting [his]125-bessy dry glance over the scene , trying to converse by signs with [the overseers of [the different rooms]626-the different rooms]625-the overseers of the different rooms , and pausing now and then to contemplate , not so much [the workers]349-the workers [themselves]349-the workers as the special tasks which engaged [them]349-the workers . How [these spectators of the party]628-these spectators of the party 's progress were affected by [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's appearance , even [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst , for all [his]105-truscomb sympathy with [their]628-these spectators of the party views , could not detect . [They]628-these spectators of the party knew that [she]104-westmore was [the new owner]629-the new owner , that a disproportionate amount of the result of [their]628-these spectators of the party toil would in future pass through [her]104-westmore hands , spread carpets for [her]104-westmore steps , and hang a setting of beauty about [her]104-westmore eyes ; but the knowledge seemed to produce no special interest in [her]104-westmore personality . A change of [employer]528-employer was not likely to make any change in [their]628-these spectators of the party lot : [their]628-these spectators of the party welfare would probably continue to depend on [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's favour . [The men]474-the men hardly raised [their]474-the men heads as [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore passed ; [the women]632-the women stared , but with curiosity rather than interest ; and [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst could not tell whether [their]628-these spectators of the party sullenness reacted on [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore , or whether [they]628-these spectators of the party were unconsciously chilled by [her]104-westmore indifference . The result was the same : the distance between [them]628-these spectators of the party seemed to increase instead of diminishing ; and [he]633-he smiled ironically to think of the form [his]633-he appeal had taken--"If [you]3590-you see anything that seems to need explaining . "[633-he] Why , [she]104-westmore saw nothing -- nothing but the greasy floor under [her]104-westmore feet , the cotton - dust in [her]104-westmore eyes , the dizzy incomprehensible whirring of innumerable belts and wheels ! Once out of it all , [she]104-westmore would make haste to forget the dreary scene without pausing to ask for any explanation of its dreariness . In the intensity of [his]633-he disappointment [he]633-he sought a pretext to cut short the tour of [the buildings]618-the buildings , that [he]633-he might remove [his]633-he eyes from the face [he]633-he had so vainly watched for any sign of awakening . And then , as [he]633-he despaired of it , the change came . [They]635-they had entered [the principal carding - room]636-the principal carding - room , and were half - way down [its]636-the principal carding - room long central passage , when [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy , who led [the procession]637-the procession , paused before one of the cards . " What in hell ... ? It 's the first [I]633-he seen of it , "[633-he] [he]633-he exclaimed , making an ineffectual attempt to snatch the mourning emblem from its place . [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst had reddened to the roots of [his]633-he hair . [He]3594-the man will lose [his]3594-the man hand , and probably the whole arm . "[117-mrs. amherst] [He]125-bessy had not meant to add this last phrase . But [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's face was close to [his]125-bessy : [he]125-bessy saw the pity in [her]104-westmore eyes , and feared , if [he]125-bessy checked its expression , that [he]125-bessy might never again have the chance of calling it forth . " [His]125-bessy right arm ? How terrible ! But then [he]125-bessy will never be able to work again ! "[104-westmore] [she]104-westmore exclaimed , in all the horror of a first confrontation with the inexorable fate of [the poor]307-the poor . [Her]104-westmore eyes turned from [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst and rested on the faces pressing about [her]104-westmore . There were [many women]659-many women 's faces among [them]659-many women -- the faces of fagged middle - age , and of sallow sedentary girlhood . For the first time [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore seemed to feel the bond of blood between [herself]104-westmore and [these dim creatures of [the underworld]661-the underworld]660-these dim creatures of the underworld : as [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst watched [her]104-westmore the lovely miracle was wrought . " Oh , why was n't [I]104-westmore told ? Is [he]3597-he married ? Has [he]3597-he [children]3598-children ? What does it matter whose fault it was ? [Duplain]115-duplain , too , would be coming in for dinner ; and [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst , in spite of [his]682-he liking for [the young overseer]688-the young overseer , became conscious of a rather overbearing freedom in [his]682-he manner , the kind of misplaced ease which [the new - made American]689-the new - made american affects as the readiest sign of equality . All these trifles , usually non - existent or supremely indifferent to [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst , now assumed a sudden importance , behind which [he]682-he detected the uneasy desire that [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore should not regard [him]682-he as less of [[her]104-westmore own class]690-her own class than [his]682-he connections and [his]682-he bringing - up entitled [him]682-he to be thought . " [I]99-amherst wish to heaven [a yellow reporter]3625-a yellow reporter _ would _ go through [these mills]3627-these mills , and show them up in head - lines a yard high ! "[99-amherst] [He]99-amherst regretted not having seen [the nurse]260-the nurse again : [he]99-amherst felt sure [she]260-the nurse would have been interested in the working of [the mills]3324-the mills , and quick to notice the signs of discouragement and ill - health in [the workers]349-the workers ' faces ; but a moment later [his]99-amherst regret was dispelled by the thought of [his]99-amherst visit to [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore . The afternoon hours dragged slowly by in [the office]3467-the office , where [he]99-amherst was bound to [his]99-amherst desk by [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's continued absence ; but at length the evening whistle blew , [the clerks in [the outer room]719-the outer room]718-the clerks in the outer room caught [their]718-the clerks in the outer room hats from the rack , [Duplain]138-duplain presented [himself]138-duplain with the day 's report , and [the two men]712-the two men were free to walk [home]3405-home . Two hours later [Amherst]99-amherst was mounting [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's steps ; and [his]99-amherst hand was on the bell when the door opened and [Dr. Disbrow]101-dr. disbrow came out . [The physician]422-the physician drew back , as if surprised and slightly disconcerted ; but [his]422-the physician smile promptly effaced all signs of vexation , and [he]422-the physician held [his]422-the physician hand out affably . " A fine evening , [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst . [I]422-the physician 'm glad to say [I]422-the physician have been able to bring [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore an excellent report of [both patients]3628-both patients -- [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb , [I]422-the physician mean , and poor [Dillon]98-dillon . This mild weather is all in [their]3628-both patients favour , and [I]422-the physician hope [[my]422-the physician brother - in - law]3629-my brother - in - law will be about in a day or two . "[422-the physician] [He]422-the physician passed on with a nod . [Amherst]96-amherst was once more shown into [the library]483-the library where [he]96-amherst had found [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore that morning ; but on this occasion it was [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy who rose to meet [him]96-amherst , and curtly waved [him]96-amherst to a seat at a respectful distance from [his]125-bessy own . [Amherst]96-amherst at once felt a change of atmosphere , and it was easy to guess that the lowering of temperature was due to [Dr. Disbrow]101-dr. disbrow 's recent visit . The thought roused [the young man]426-the young man 's combative instincts , and caused [him]96-amherst to say , as [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy continued to survey [him]96-amherst in silence from the depths of a capacious easy - chair : " [I]125-bessy understood from [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore that [she]104-westmore wished to see [me]125-bessy this evening . "[125-bessy] It was the wrong note , and [he]96-amherst knew it ; but [he]96-amherst had been unable to conceal [his]96-amherst sense of the vague current of opposition in the air . " Quite so : [I]125-bessy believe [she]104-westmore asked [you]96-amherst to come , "[125-bessy] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy assented , laying [his]125-bessy hands together vertically , and surveying [Amherst]96-amherst above the acute angle formed by [his]125-bessy parched finger - tips . As [he]96-amherst leaned back , small , dry , dictatorial , in the careless finish of [his]96-amherst evening dress and pearl - studded shirt - front , [his]96-amherst appearance put the finishing touch to [Amherst]96-amherst 's irritation . [He]96-amherst felt the incongruousness of [his]96-amherst rough clothes in this atmosphere of after - dinner ease , the mud on [his]96-amherst walking - boots , the clinging cotton - dust which seemed to have entered into the very pores of the skin ; and again [his]96-amherst annoyance escaped in [his]96-amherst voice . " Perhaps [I]96-amherst have come too early-- "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst began ; but [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy interposed with glacial amenity : " No , [I]125-bessy believe [you]96-amherst are exactly on time ; but [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore is unexpectedly detained . The fact is , [Mr.]3630-mr. and [Mrs. Halford Gaines]140-mrs. gaines are dining with [her]104-westmore , and [she]104-westmore has delegated to [me]125-bessy the duty of hearing what [you]96-amherst have to say . "[125-bessy] [Amherst]96-amherst hesitated . [His]96-amherst impulse was to exclaim : " There is no duty about it ! "[96-amherst] but a moment 's thought showed the folly of thus throwing up the game . With the prospect of [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's being about again in a day or two , it might well be that this was [his]96-amherst last chance of reaching [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's ear ; and [he]96-amherst was bound to put [his]96-amherst case while [he]96-amherst could , irrespective of personal feeling . But [his]96-amherst disappointment was too keen to be denied , and after a pause [he]96-amherst said : " Could [I]96-amherst not speak with [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore later ? "[96-amherst] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's cool survey deepened to a frown . [The young man]426-the young man 's importunity was really out of proportion to what [he]426-the young man signified . " [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore has asked [me]96-amherst to replace [her]104-westmore , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said , putting [his]96-amherst previous statement more concisely . " Then [I]96-amherst am not to see [her]104-westmore at all ? "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst exclaimed ; and [the lawyer]520-the lawyer replied indifferently : " [I]520-the lawyer am afraid not , as [she]104-westmore leaves tomorrow . "[520-the lawyer] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy was in [his]125-bessy element when refusing a favour . Not that [he]125-bessy was by nature unkind ; [he]125-bessy was , indeed , capable of a cold beneficence ; but to deny what it was in [his]125-bessy power to accord was the readiest way of proclaiming [his]125-bessy authority , that power of loosing and binding which made [him]125-bessy regard [himself]125-bessy as almost consecrated to [[his]125-bessy office]727-his office . Having sacrificed to this principle , [he]96-amherst felt free to add as a gratuitous concession to politeness : " [You]520-the lawyer are perhaps not aware that [I]96-amherst am [[Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's lawyer]3631-mrs. westmore 's lawyer , and [one of the executors under [[her]104-westmore husband]3393-her husband 's will]3632-one of the executors under her husband 's will . "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst dropped this negligently , as though conscious of the absurdity of presenting [his]96-amherst credentials to [a subordinate]728-a subordinate ; but [his]96-amherst manner no longer incensed [Amherst]96-amherst : it merely strengthened [his]96-amherst resolve to sink all sense of affront in the supreme effort of obtaining a hearing . " With that stuffed canary to advise [her]104-westmore , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst reflected , " there 's no hope for [her]104-westmore unless [I]96-amherst can assert [myself]96-amherst now "[96-amherst] ; and the unconscious wording of [his]96-amherst thought expressed [his]96-amherst inward sense that [Bessy Westmore]122-bessy stood in greater need of help than [[her]122-bessy work - people]729-her work - people . Still [he]96-amherst hesitated , hardly knowing how to begin . To [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy [he]96-amherst was no more than [an underling]730-an underling , without authority to speak in [[his]96-amherst superior]431-his superior 's absence ; and the lack of an official warrant , which [he]96-amherst could have disregarded in appealing to [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore , made it hard for [him]96-amherst to find a good opening in addressing [[her]104-westmore representative]732-her representative . [He]96-amherst saw , too , from [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's protracted silence , that [the latter]673-the latter counted on the effect of this embarrassment , and was resolved not to minimize it by giving [him]96-amherst a lead ; and this had the effect of increasing [his]96-amherst caution . [He]96-amherst looked up and met [the lawyer]520-the lawyer 's eye . " [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst began , " asked [me]96-amherst to let [her]104-westmore know something about the condition of [the people at [the mills----]3635-the mills----]3634-the people at the mills---- "[96-amherst] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy raised [his]125-bessy hand . " Excuse [me]125-bessy , "[125-bessy] [he]125-bessy said . "[125-bessy] [Amherst]96-amherst reddened . " [I]96-amherst did ask [her]104-westmore -- yes . But [I]96-amherst do n't in any sense represent [the operatives]3426-the operatives . " Does [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb know of [your]96-amherst intention ? "[125-bessy] [he]125-bessy then enquired . " No , [sir]3495-sir , "[125-bessy] [Amherst]96-amherst answered energetically , glad that [he]96-amherst had forced [the lawyer]520-the lawyer out of [his]96-amherst passive tactics . " [I]125-bessy am here on [my]125-bessy own responsibility -- and in direct opposition to [my]125-bessy own interests , "[125-bessy] [he]125-bessy continued with a slight smile . " [I]125-bessy know that [my]125-bessy proceeding is quite out of order , and that [I]125-bessy have , personally , everything to lose by it , and in a larger way probably very little to gain ; but [I]125-bessy thought [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's attention ought to be called to certain conditions at [the mills]3324-the mills , and [no one else]3640-no one else seemed likely to speak of them . "[125-bessy] " May [I]96-amherst ask why [you]3495-sir assume that [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb will not do so when [he]105-truscomb has the opportunity ? "[125-bessy] " The real object of [your]96-amherst visit then , "[125-bessy] said [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy , speaking with deliberation , " is -- er -- an underhand attack on [[your]96-amherst manager]3409-your manager 's methods ? "[125-bessy] [Amherst]96-amherst 's face darkened , but [he]96-amherst kept [his]96-amherst temper . " [I]96-amherst see nothing especially underhand in [my]96-amherst course---- "[96-amherst] " Except , "[736-the other] [the other]736-the other interposed ironically , " that [you]96-amherst have waited to speak till [Mr. Truscomb]105-truscomb was not in a position to defend [himself]105-truscomb . "[736-the other] " [I]125-bessy never had the chance before .
