" Oh , a number of things , evidently -- but though [I]117-mrs. amherst 'm in the heart of them , [I]117-mrs. amherst ca n't yet make out how they are going to affect [me]117-mrs. amherst . "[117-mrs. amherst] [[His]426-the young man mother]396-his mother 's glance twinkled in time with the flash of [her]396-his mother needles . " There 's always a safe place in the heart of a storm , "[117-mrs. amherst] [she]117-mrs. amherst said shrewdly ; and [Amherst]96-amherst rejoined with a laugh : " Well , if it 's [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's heart , [I]96-amherst do n't know that it 's particularly safe for [me]96-amherst . "[96-amherst] " Tell [me]117-mrs. amherst just what [he]105-truscomb said , [John]99-amherst , "[117-mrs. amherst] [she]117-mrs. amherst begged , making no attempt to carry the pleasantry farther , though its possibilities still seemed to flicker about [her]117-mrs. amherst lip ; and [Amherst]96-amherst proceeded to recount [his]96-amherst talk with [the manager]3346-the manager . [Truscomb]105-truscomb , it appeared , had made no allusion to [Dillon]98-dillon ; [his]105-truscomb avowed purpose in summoning [[his]105-truscomb assistant]436-his assistant had been to discuss with [the latter]673-the latter the question of [the proposed nursery]897-the proposed nursery and [schools]898-schools . [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore , at [Amherst]96-amherst 's suggestion , had presented these projects as [her]104-westmore own ; but the question of [a site]899-a site having come up , [she]104-westmore had mentioned to [Truscomb]105-truscomb [[his]105-truscomb assistant]436-his assistant 's proposal that [the company]3366-the company should buy for the purpose [the notorious Eldorado]902-the notorious eldorado . [The road - house in question]903-the road - house in question had always been one of the most destructive influences in [the mill - colony]846-the mill - colony , and [Amherst]96-amherst had made one or two indirect attempts to have [the building]308-the building converted to other uses ; but the persistent opposition [he]96-amherst encountered gave colour to the popular report that [the manager]3346-the manager took a high toll from [the landlord]907-the landlord . It therefore at once occurred to [Amherst]96-amherst to suggest the purchase of [the property]908-the property to [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore ; and [he]96-amherst was not surprised to find that [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's opposition to the scheme centred in the choice of [the building]308-the building . But even at this point [the manager]3346-the manager betrayed no open resistance ; [he]3346-the manager seemed tacitly to admit [Amherst]96-amherst 's right to discuss the proposed plans , and even to be consulted concerning the choice of [a site]899-a site . [He]96-amherst was ready with a dozen good reasons against the purchase of [the road - house]912-the road - house ; but here also [he]96-amherst proceeded with a discretion unexampled in [his]96-amherst dealings with [[his]96-amherst subordinates]913-his subordinates . [He]96-amherst acknowledged the harm done by [the dance - hall]914-the dance - hall , but objected that [he]96-amherst could not conscientiously advise [the company]3366-the company to pay the extortionate price at which it was held , and reminded [Amherst]96-amherst that , if that particular source of offense were removed , [others]3447-others would inevitably spring up to replace it ; marshalling the usual temporizing arguments of tolerance and expediency , with no marked change from [his]96-amherst usual tone , till , just as the interview was ending , [he]96-amherst asked , with a sudden drop to conciliation , if [the assistant manager]917-the assistant manager had anything to complain of in the treatment [he]917-the assistant manager received . This came as such a surprise to [Amherst]96-amherst that before [he]96-amherst had collected [himself]96-amherst [he]96-amherst found [Truscomb]105-truscomb ambiguously but unmistakably offering [him]96-amherst -- with the practised indirection of [the man accustomed to cover [his]105-truscomb share in such transactions]918-the man accustomed to cover his share in such transactions -- a substantial " consideration "[105-truscomb] for dropping the matter of [the road - house]912-the road - house . It was incredible , yet it had really happened : the all - powerful [Truscomb]105-truscomb , who held [Westmore]104-westmore in the hollow of [his]105-truscomb hand , had stooped to bribing [[his]105-truscomb assistant]436-his assistant because [he]105-truscomb was afraid to deal with [him]105-truscomb in a more summary manner . [Amherst]96-amherst 's leap of anger at the offer was curbed by the instant perception of its cause . [He]96-amherst had no time to search for a reason ; [he]96-amherst could only rally [himself]96-amherst to meet the unintelligible with a composure as abysmal as [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's ; and [his]96-amherst voice still rang with the wonder of the incident as [he]96-amherst retailed it to [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother . " Think of what it means , [mother]3466-mother , for [a young woman like [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore]3829-a young woman like mrs. westmore , without any experience or any habit of authority , to come here , and at the first glimpse of injustice , to be so revolted that [she]3829-a young woman like mrs. westmore finds the courage and cleverness to put [her]3829-a young woman like mrs. westmore little hand to the machine and reverse the engines -- for it 's nothing less that [she]3829-a young woman like mrs. westmore 's done ! Oh , [I]96-amherst know there 'll be a reaction -- the pendulum 's sure to swing back : but [you]3466-mother 'll see it wo n't swing _ as far _ . Of course [I]96-amherst shall go in the end -- but [Truscomb]105-truscomb may go too : [Jove]153-jove , if [I]96-amherst could pull [him]105-truscomb down on [me]96-amherst , like what's - [his]105-truscomb - name and the pillars of [the temple]3830-the temple ! "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst had risen and was measuring [the little sitting - room]922-the little sitting - room with [his]96-amherst long strides , [his]96-amherst head flung back and [his]96-amherst eyes dark with the inward look [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother had not always cared to see there . But now [her]396-his mother own glance seemed to have caught a ray from [his]96-amherst , and the knitting flowed from [her]396-his mother hands like the thread of fate , as [she]396-his mother sat silent , letting [him]96-amherst exhale [his]96-amherst hopes and [his]96-amherst wonder , and murmuring only , when [he]96-amherst dropped again to the chair at [her]396-his mother side : " [You]104-westmore wo n't go , [Johnny]132-johnny -- [you]104-westmore wo n't go . "[396-his mother] * * * * * [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore lingered on for over two weeks , and during that time [Amherst]96-amherst was able , in various directions , to develop [her]104-westmore interest in [the mill - workers]924-the mill - workers . [His]96-amherst own schemes involved a complete readjustment of the relation between [the company]3366-the company and the hands : the suppression of [the obsolete company " store]3831-the obsolete company " store "[96-amherst] and [tenements]926-tenements , which had so long sapped the thrift and ambition of [the workers]349-the workers ; the transformation of [the Hopewood grounds]928-the hopewood grounds into [a park and athletic field]929-a park and athletic field , and the division of [[its]928-the hopewood grounds remaining acres]930-its remaining acres into [building lots for [the mill - hands]3347-the mill - hands]931-building lots for the mill - hands ; the establishing of [a library]933-a library , [a dispensary]934-a dispensary and [emergency hospital]935-emergency hospital , and various other centres of humanizing influence ; but [he]96-amherst refrained from letting [her]104-westmore see that [his]96-amherst present suggestion was only a part of this larger plan , lest [her]104-westmore growing sympathy should be checked . [He]96-amherst had in [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother an example of the mind accessible only to concrete impressions : the mind which could die for the particular instance , yet remain serenely indifferent to its causes . To [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst , [[her]117-mrs. amherst son]393-her son 's work had been interesting simply because it _ was _ [his]96-amherst work : remove [his]96-amherst presence from [Westmore]104-westmore , and the whole industrial problem became to [her]104-westmore as non - existent as star - dust to the naked eye . And in [Bessy Westmore]122-bessy [he]96-amherst divined a nature of the same quality -- divined , but no longer criticized it . Was not that concentration on the personal issue just the compensating grace of [her]104-westmore sex ? Did it not offer a warm tint of human inconsistency to eyes chilled by contemplating life in the mass ? It pleased [Amherst]96-amherst for the moment to class [himself]96-amherst with [the impersonal student of social problems]938-the impersonal student of social problems , though in truth [his]96-amherst interest in them had its source in an imagination as open as [Bessy]122-bessy 's to the pathos of the personal appeal . But if [he]96-amherst had the same sensitiveness , how inferior were [his]96-amherst means of expressing it ! Again and again , during [their]939-their talks , [he]96-amherst had the feeling which had come to [him]96-amherst when [she]104-westmore bent over [Dillon]98-dillon 's bed -- that [her]104-westmore exquisite lines were , in some mystical sense , the visible flowering of [her]104-westmore nature , that they had taken shape in response to the inward motions of the heart . To [a young man ruled by high enthusiasms]940-a young man ruled by high enthusiasms there can be no more dazzling adventure than to work this miracle in the tender creature who yields [her]104-westmore mind to [his]96-amherst -- to see , as it were , the blossoming of the spiritual seed in forms of heightened loveliness , the bluer beam of the eye , the richer curve of the lip , all the physical currents of life quickening under the breath of a kindled thought . It did not occur to [him]96-amherst that any other emotion had effected the change [he]96-amherst perceived . [Bessy Westmore]122-bessy had in full measure that gift of unconscious hypocrisy which enables [a woman]3817-a woman to make [the man in whom [she]3817-a woman is interested believe that [she]3817-a woman enters into all [his]96-amherst thoughts]942-the man in whom she is interested believe that she enters into all his thoughts . [She]104-westmore had -- more than this -- the gift of self - deception , supreme happiness of the unreflecting nature , whereby [she]104-westmore was able to believe [herself]104-westmore solely engrossed in the subjects [they]943-they discussed , to regard [him]96-amherst as [the mere spokesman of important ideas]944-the mere spokesman of important ideas , thus saving [their]943-they intercourse from present constraint , and from the awkward contemplation of future contingencies . So , in obedience to the ancient sorcery of life , [these two]945-these two groped for and found each other in regions seemingly so remote from [the accredited domain of romance]946-the accredited domain of romance that it would have been as a great surprise to [them]945-these two to learn whither [they]945-these two had strayed as to see [the arid streets of [Westmore]104-westmore]947-the arid streets of westmore suddenly bursting into leaf . With [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's departure [Amherst]96-amherst , for the first time , became aware of a certain flatness in [his]96-amherst life . [His]96-amherst daily task seemed dull and purposeless , and [he]96-amherst was galled by [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's studied forbearance , under which [he]96-amherst suspected a quickly accumulating store of animosity . [He]96-amherst almost longed for some collision which would release [the manager]3346-the manager 's pent - up resentment ; yet [he]96-amherst dreaded increasingly any accident that might make [his]96-amherst stay at [Westmore]104-westmore impossible . It was on Sundays , when [he]96-amherst was freed from [his]96-amherst weekly task , that [he]96-amherst was most at the mercy of these opposing feelings . [They]949-they drove [him]96-amherst forth on long solitary walks beyond [the town]329-the town , walks ending most often in [the deserted grounds of [Hopewood]11-hopewood]951-the deserted grounds of hopewood , beautiful now in [the ruined gold of October]952-the ruined gold of october . As [he]96-amherst sat under the beech - limbs above [the river]353-the river , watching its brown current sweep the willow - roots of the banks , [he]96-amherst thought how this same current , within [its]353-the river next short reach , passed from wooded seclusion to the noise and pollution of [the mills]3324-the mills . So [his]96-amherst own life seemed to have passed once more from the tranced flow of the last weeks into its old channel of unillumined labour . But other thoughts came to [him]96-amherst too : the vision of converting that melancholy pleasure - ground into an outlet for the cramped lives of [the mill - workers]924-the mill - workers ; and [he]96-amherst pictured the weed - grown lawns and paths thronged with [holiday - makers]956-holiday - makers , and the slopes nearer [the factories]346-the factories dotted with [houses and gardens]958-houses and gardens . An unexpected event revived these hopes . A few days before Christmas it became known to [Hanaford]116-hanaford that [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore would return for the holidays . [Cicely]130-cicely was drooping in town air , and [Bessy]122-bessy had persuaded [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope that the bracing cold of [Hanaford]1-hanaford would be better for [the child]3698-the child than the milder atmosphere of [Long Island]8-long island . [They]960-they reappeared , and brought with [them]960-they a breath of holiday cheerfulness such as [Westmore]104-westmore had never known . It had always been the rule at [the mills]3324-the mills to let [the operatives]3426-the operatives take [their]3426-the operatives pleasure as [they]3426-the operatives saw fit , and [the Eldorado]154-the eldorado and [the Hanaford saloons]963-the hanaford saloons throve on this policy . But [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore arrived full of festal projects . There was to be a giant Christmas tree for [the mill - children]964-the mill - children , a supper on the same scale for [the operatives]3426-the operatives , and a bout of skating and coasting at [Hopewood]11-hopewood for [the older lads]966-the older lads -- [the " band "]3832-the " band "[3832-the " band "] and [" bobbin "[3832-the " band "] boys in whom [Amherst]96-amherst had always felt a special interest]3833-" bobbin " boys in whom amherst had always felt a special interest . [The Gaines ladies]967-the gaines ladies , resolved to show [themselves]967-the gaines ladies at [home]3405-home in the latest philanthropic fashions , actively seconded [Bessy]122-bessy 's endeavours , and for a week [Westmore]104-westmore basked under a sudden heat - wave of beneficence . The time had passed when [Amherst]96-amherst might have made light of such efforts . With [Bessy Westmore]122-bessy smiling up , holly - laden , from the foot of the ladder on which [she]104-westmore kept [him]969-him perched , how could [he]969-him question the efficacy of hanging the opening - room with Christmas wreaths , or the ultimate benefit of gorging [the operatives]3426-the operatives with turkey and sheathing [[their]3426-the operatives offspring]971-their offspring in red mittens ? It was just like the end of a story - book with a pretty moral , and [Amherst]96-amherst was in the mood to be as much taken by the tinsel as [the youngest mill - baby]972-the youngest mill - baby held up to gape at the tree . At the New Year , when [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore left , the negotiations for the purchase of [the Eldorado]154-the eldorado were well advanced , and it was understood that on [their]973-their completion [she]104-westmore was to return for the opening of [the night - school and nursery]974-the night - school and nursery . Suddenly , however , it became known that [the proprietor of [the road - house]912-the road - house]975-the proprietor of the road - house had decided not to sell . [Amherst]96-amherst heard of the decision from [Duplain]138-duplain , and at once foresaw the inevitable result -- that [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's plan would be given up owing to the difficulty of finding [another site]977-another site . [Mr. Gaines]110-mr. gaines and [Truscomb]105-truscomb had both discountenanced the erection of [a special building]978-a special building for what was , after all , only a tentative enterprise . Among [the purchasable houses in [Westmore]104-westmore]979-the purchasable houses in westmore no other was suited to the purpose , and [they]979-the purchasable houses in westmore had , therefore , a good excuse for advising [Bessy]122-bessy to defer [her]104-westmore experiment . Almost at the same time , however , another piece of news changed the aspect of affairs . A scandalous occurrence at [the Eldorado]154-the eldorado , [witnesses to which were unexpectedly forthcoming]980-witnesses to which were unexpectedly forthcoming , put it in [Amherst]96-amherst 's power to threaten [the landlord]907-the landlord with exposure unless [he]907-the landlord should at once accept [the company]3366-the company 's offer and withdraw from [Westmore]104-westmore . [Amherst]96-amherst had no long time to consider the best means of putting this threat into effect . [He]96-amherst knew it was not only idle to appeal to [Truscomb]105-truscomb , but essential to keep the facts from [him]105-truscomb till the deed was done ; yet how obtain the authority to act without [him]105-truscomb ? The seemingly insuperable difficulties of the situation whetted [Amherst]96-amherst 's craving for a struggle . [He]96-amherst thought first of writing to [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore ; , but now that the spell of [her]104-westmore presence was withdrawn [he]96-amherst felt how hard it would be to make [her]104-westmore understand the need of prompt and secret action ; and besides , was it likely that , at such short notice , [she]104-westmore could command the needful funds ? [Prudence]155-prudence opposed the attempt , and on reflection [he]96-amherst decided to appeal to [Mr. Gaines]110-mr. gaines , hoping that the flagrancy of the case would rouse [the President]789-the president from [his]789-the president usual attitude of indifference . [Mr. Gaines]110-mr. gaines was roused to the extent of showing a profound resentment against the cause of [his]110-mr. gaines disturbance . [He]110-mr. gaines relieved [his]110-mr. gaines sense of responsibility by some didactic remarks on the vicious tendencies of [the working - classes]984-the working - classes , and concluded with the reflection that the more [you]985-you did for [them]984-the working - classes the less thanks [you]985-you got . But when [Amherst]96-amherst showed an unwillingness to let the matter rest on this time - honoured aphorism , [the President]789-the president retrenched [himself]789-the president behind ambiguities , suggestions that [they]984-the working - classes should await [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's return , and general considerations of a pessimistic nature , tapering off into a gloomy view of the weather . " By [God]156-god , [I]96-amherst 'll write to [her]104-westmore ! "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst exclaimed , as [the Gaines]110-mr. gaines portals closed on [him]96-amherst ; and all the way back to [Westmore]104-westmore [he]96-amherst was busy marshalling [his]96-amherst arguments and entreaties . [He]96-amherst wrote the letter that night , but did not post it . Some unavowed distrust of [her]104-westmore restrained [him]96-amherst -- a distrust not of [her]104-westmore heart but of [her]104-westmore intelligence . [He]96-amherst felt that the whole future of [Westmore]104-westmore was at stake , and decided to await the development of the next twenty - four hours . The letter was still in [his]96-amherst pocket when , after dinner , [he]96-amherst was summoned to [the office]3467-the office by [Truscomb]105-truscomb . That evening , when [he]96-amherst returned [home]3405-home , [he]96-amherst entered [the little sitting - room]922-the little sitting - room without speaking . [[His]96-amherst mother]396-his mother sat there alone , in [her]396-his mother usual place -- how many nights [he]96-amherst had seen the lamplight slant at that particular angle across [her]396-his mother fresh cheek and the fine wrinkles about [her]396-his mother eyes ! [He]96-amherst was going to add another wrinkle to the number now -- soon they would creep down and encroach upon the smoothness of the cheek . [She]396-his mother looked up and saw that [his]96-amherst glance was turned to the crowded bookshelves behind [her]396-his mother . " There must be nearly a thousand of [them]3834-them , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said as [their]991-their eyes met . " Books ? Yes -- with [[your]396-his mother father]3481-your father 's . Why -- were [you]96-amherst thinking ... ? "[96-amherst] [She]396-his mother started up suddenly and crossed over to [him]96-amherst . " Too many for [wanderers]3836-wanderers , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst continued , drawing [her]396-his mother hands to [his]96-amherst breast ; then , as [she]396-his mother clung to [him]96-amherst , weeping and trembling a little : " It had to be , [mother]3466-mother , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said , kissing [her]396-his mother penitently where the fine wrinkles died into the cheek . [VIII AMHERST]96-amherst 'S dismissal was not to take effect for a month ; and in the interval [he]96-amherst addressed [himself]96-amherst steadily to [his]96-amherst task . [He]96-amherst went through the routine of the work numbly ; but [his]96-amherst intercourse with the hands tugged at deep fibres of feelings . [He]96-amherst had always shared , as far as [his]96-amherst duties allowed , in the cares and interests of [their]992-their few free hours : the hours when the automatic appendages of the giant machine became [men]265-men and [women]497-women again , with desires and passions of [their]992-their own . Under [Amherst]96-amherst 's influence the mixed elements of [the mill - community]995-the mill - community had begun to crystallize into [social groups]996-social groups : [his]96-amherst books had served as an improvised lending - library , [he]96-amherst had organized a club , a rudimentary orchestra , and various other means of binding together the better spirits of [the community]3685-the community . With [the older men]998-the older men , the attractions of the Eldorado , and kindred inducements , often worked against [him]96-amherst ; but among [the younger hands]999-the younger hands , and especially [the boys]1000-the boys , [he]96-amherst had gained a personal ascendency that it was bitter to relinquish . It was the severing of this tie that cost [him]96-amherst most pain in the final days at [Westmore]104-westmore ; and after [he]96-amherst had done what [he]96-amherst could to console [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother , and to put [himself]96-amherst in the way of getting work elsewhere , [he]96-amherst tried to see what might be saved out of the ruins of [the little polity [he]96-amherst had built up]1002-the little polity he had built up . [He]96-amherst hoped [his]96-amherst influence might at least persist in the form of an awakened instinct of fellowship ; and [he]96-amherst gave every spare hour to strengthening the links [he]96-amherst had tried to form . [The boys]1000-the boys , at any rate , would be honestly sorry to have [him]96-amherst go : not , indeed , from the profounder reasons that affected [him]96-amherst , but because [he]96-amherst had not only stood persistently between [the overseers]3767-the overseers and [themselves]3767-the overseers , but had recognized [their]3767-the overseers right to fun after work - hours as well as [their]3767-the overseers right to protection while [they]3767-the overseers worked . In the glow of [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's Christmas visitation an [athletic club]1005-athletic club had been formed , and leave obtained to use [the Hopewood grounds]928-the hopewood grounds for Saturday afternoon sports ; and [thither Amherst]96-amherst continued to conduct [the boys]1000-the boys after [the mills]3324-the mills closed at the week - end . [His]96-amherst last Saturday had now come : a shining afternoon of late February , with a red sunset bending above frozen river and [slopes of unruffled snow]1009-slopes of unruffled snow . For an hour or more [he]96-amherst had led the usual sports , coasting down the steep descent from [the house]311-the house to [the edge of [the woods]1012-the woods]1011-the edge of the woods , and skating and playing hockey on [the rough river]1013-the rough river - ice which eager hands kept clear after every snow - storm . [He]96-amherst always felt the contagion of these sports : the glow of movement , the tumult of young voices , the sting of the winter air , roused all the boyhood in [his]96-amherst blood . But today [he]96-amherst had to force [himself]96-amherst through [his]96-amherst part in the performance . To the very last , as [he]96-amherst now saw , [he]96-amherst had hoped for a sign in the heavens : not the reversal of [his]96-amherst own sentence -- for , merely on disciplinary grounds , [he]96-amherst perceived that to be impossible -- but something pointing to a change in the management of [the mills]3324-the mills , some proof that [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore 's intervention had betokened more than a passing impulse of compassion . Surely [she]104-westmore would not accept without question the abandonment of [her]104-westmore favourite scheme ; and if [she]104-westmore came back to put the question , the answer would lay bare the whole situation .... So [Amherst]96-amherst 's hopes had persuaded [him]96-amherst ; but the day before [he]96-amherst had heard that [she]104-westmore was to sail for [Europe]17-europe . The report , first announced in the papers , had been confirmed by [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother , who brought back from a visit to [Hanaford]1-hanaford the news that [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore was leaving at once for an indefinite period , and that [the Hanaford house]1016-the hanaford house was to be closed . Irony would have been the readiest caustic for the wound inflicted ; but [Amherst]96-amherst , for that very reason , disdained it . [He]96-amherst would not taint [his]96-amherst disappointment with mockery , but would leave it among the unspoiled sadnesses of life .... [He]96-amherst flung [himself]96-amherst into [the boys]1000-the boys ' sports with [his]96-amherst usual energy , meaning that [their]1000-the boys last Saturday with [him]96-amherst should be [their]1000-the boys merriest ; but [he]96-amherst went through [his]96-amherst part mechanically , and was glad when the sun began to dip toward [the rim of [the woods]1012-the woods]1018-the rim of the woods . [He]96-amherst was standing on the ice , where [the river]353-the river widened just below [the house]311-the house , when a jingle of bells broke on the still air , and [he]96-amherst saw [a sleigh]1022-a sleigh driven rapidly up [the avenue]1023-the avenue . [Amherst]96-amherst watched it in surprise . Who , at that hour , could be invading [the winter solitude of [Hopewood]11-hopewood]1024-the winter solitude of hopewood ? [The sleigh]1025-the sleigh halted near [the closed house]1026-the closed house , and [a muffled figure , alighting alone]1027-a muffled figure , alighting alone , began to move down [the snowy slope]1028-the snowy slope toward [the skaters]1029-the skaters . In an instant [he]1027-a muffled figure , alighting alone had torn off [his]1027-a muffled figure , alighting alone skates and was bounding up [the bank]1030-the bank . [He]96-amherst would have known [the figure]1031-the figure anywhere -- known that lovely poise of the head , the mixture of hesitancy and quickness in the light tread which even the snow could not impede . Half - way up the slope to [the house]311-the house [they]1033-they met , and [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore held out [her]104-westmore hand . Face and lips , as [she]104-westmore stood above [him]96-amherst , glowed with [her]104-westmore swift passage through the evening air , and in the blaze of the sunset [she]104-westmore seemed saturated with heavenly fires . " [I]104-westmore drove out to find [you]104-westmore -- [they]3838-they told [me]104-westmore [you]104-westmore were here -- [I]104-westmore arrived this morning , quite suddenly .... "[104-westmore] [She]104-westmore broke off , as though the encounter had checked [her]104-westmore ardour instead of kindling it ; but [he]96-amherst drew no discouragement from [her]104-westmore tone . " [I]96-amherst hoped [you]104-westmore would come before [I]96-amherst left -- [I]96-amherst knew [you]104-westmore would ! "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst exclaimed ; and at [his]96-amherst last words [her]104-westmore face clouded anxiously . " [I]104-westmore did n't know [you]104-westmore were leaving [Westmore]104-westmore till yesterday -- the day before -- [I]104-westmore got a letter .... "[104-westmore] Again [she]104-westmore wavered , perceptibly trusting [her]104-westmore difficulty to [him]96-amherst , in the sweet way [he]96-amherst had been trying to forget ; and [he]96-amherst answered with recovered energy : " The great thing is that [you]104-westmore should be [here]3415-here . "[96-amherst] [She]104-westmore shook [her]104-westmore head at [his]96-amherst optimism . " What can [I]104-westmore do if [you]96-amherst go ? "[104-westmore] " [You]96-amherst can give [me]104-westmore a chance , before [I]104-westmore go , to tell [you]104-westmore a little about some of the loose ends [I]104-westmore am leaving . "[104-westmore] " But why are [you]96-amherst leaving [them]3840-them ? [I]104-westmore do n't understand . Is it inevitable ? "[104-westmore] " Inevitable , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst returned , with an odd glow of satisfaction in the word ; and as [her]104-westmore eyes besought [him]96-amherst , [he]96-amherst added , smiling : " [I]96-amherst 've been dismissed , [you]104-westmore see ; and from [the manager]3346-the manager 's standpoint [I]96-amherst think [I]96-amherst deserved it . But the best part of [my]96-amherst work need n't go with [me]96-amherst -- and that is what [I]96-amherst should like to speak to [you]104-westmore about . As assistant manager [I]96-amherst can easily be replaced -- have been , [I]96-amherst understand , already ; but among [these boys]3842-these boys [here]3415-here [I]96-amherst should like to think that a little of [me]96-amherst stayed -- and it will , if [you]104-westmore 'll let [me]96-amherst tell [you]104-westmore what [I]96-amherst 've been doing . "[96-amherst] [ Illustration : Half - way up the slope to [the house]311-the house [they]1035-they met . ] [She]1036-she glanced away from [him]1037-he at [the busy throng on the ice]1038-the busy throng on the ice and at the other black cluster above [the coasting - slide]1039-the coasting - slide . " How [they]3842-these boys 're enjoying it ! "[1036-she] [she]1036-she murmured . " What a pity it was never done before ! And who will keep it up when [you]1037-he 're gone ? "[1036-she] " [You]1036-she , "[1037-he] [he]1037-he answered , meeting [her]1036-she eyes again ; and as [she]1036-she coloured a little under [his]1037-he look [he]1037-he went on quickly : " Will [you]1036-she come over and look at [the coasting]3844-the coasting ? The time is almost up . One more slide and [they]1035-they 'll be packing off to supper . "[1037-he] [She]1036-she nodded " yes , "[1036-she] and [they]1035-they walked in silence over [the white lawn]1040-the white lawn , criss - crossed with tramplings of happy feet , to the ridge from which the coasters started on [their]1035-they run . [Amherst]96-amherst 's object in turning the talk had been to gain a moment 's respite . [He]96-amherst could not bear to waste [his]96-amherst perfect hour in futile explanations : [he]96-amherst wanted to keep it undisturbed by any thought of the future . And the same feeling seemed to possess [[his]96-amherst companion]284-his companion , for [she]1036-she did not speak again till [they]1035-they reached [the knoll]1042-the knoll where [the boys]1000-the boys were gathered . [A sled packed with]1044-a sled packed with [them]1000-the boys hung on the brink : with a last shout it was off , dipping down the incline with the long curved flight of a swallow , flashing across [the wide meadow at the base of [the hill]1046-the hill]1045-the wide meadow at the base of the hill , and tossed upward again by its own impetus , till it vanished in [the dark rim of wood on the opposite height]1047-the dark rim of wood on the opposite height . [The lads]1048-the lads waiting on [the knoll]1042-the knoll sang out for joy , and [Bessy]122-bessy clapped [her]122-bessy hands and joined with [them]1048-the lads . " What fun ! [I]122-bessy wish [I]122-bessy 'd brought [Cicely]130-cicely ! [I]122-bessy 've not coasted for years , "[122-bessy] [she]122-bessy laughed out , as [the second detachment of [boys]1051-boys]1050-the second detachment of boys heaped [themselves]1050-the second detachment of boys on [another sled]1052-another sled and shot down . [Amherst]96-amherst looked at [her]122-bessy with a smile . [He]96-amherst saw that every other feeling had vanished in the exhilaration of watching the flight of [the sleds]1053-the sleds . [She]122-bessy had forgotten why [she]122-bessy had come -- forgotten [her]122-bessy distress at [his]96-amherst dismissal -- forgotten everything but the spell of [the long white slope]1054-the long white slope , and the tingle of cold in [her]122-bessy veins . " Shall [we]3845-we go down ? Should [you]122-bessy like it ? "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst asked , feeling no resentment under the heightened glow of [his]96-amherst pulses . " Oh , do take [me]96-amherst -- [I]96-amherst shall love it ! "[96-amherst] [Her]122-bessy eyes shone like a child's -- [she]122-bessy might have been [a lovelier embodiment of the shouting boyhood about [them]1056-them]1055-a lovelier embodiment of the shouting boyhood about them . [The first band of coasters , sled at heels]1057-the first band of coasters , sled at heels , had by this time already covered a third of the homeward stretch ; but [Amherst]96-amherst was too impatient to wait . Plunging down to [the meadow]1058-the meadow [he]96-amherst caught up the sled - rope , and raced back with the pack of [rejoicing youth]1059-rejoicing youth in [his]96-amherst wake . The sharp climb up [the hill]1046-the hill seemed to fill [his]96-amherst lungs with flame : [his]96-amherst whole body burned with a strange intensity of life . As [he]96-amherst reached the top , a distant bell rang across [the fields]1061-the fields from [Westmore]104-westmore , and [the boys]1000-the boys began to snatch up [their]1000-the boys coats and mufflers . " Be off with [you]1000-the boys -- [I'll]96-amherst look after the sleds , "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst called to [them]1000-the boys as [they]1000-the boys dispersed ; then [he]96-amherst turned for a moment to see that [the skaters below]1063-the skaters below were also heeding the summons . A cold pallor lay on [the river - banks]1064-the river - banks and on [the low meadow beneath [the knoll]1042-the knoll]1065-the low meadow beneath the knoll ; but [the woodland opposite]1067-the woodland opposite stood black against scarlet vapours that ravelled off in sheer light toward a sky hung with an icy moon . [Amherst]96-amherst drew up the sled and held it steady while [Bessy]122-bessy , seating [herself]122-bessy , tucked [her]122-bessy furs close with little breaks of laughter ; then [he]96-amherst placed [himself]96-amherst in front . " Ready ? "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst cried over [his]96-amherst shoulder , and " Ready ! "[122-bessy] [she]122-bessy called back . [[Their]1000-the boys craft]1068-their craft quivered under [them]1000-the boys , hanging an instant over the long stretch of whiteness below ; the level sun dazzled [their]1000-the boys eyes , and the first plunge seemed to dash [them]1000-the boys down into darkness . [Amherst]96-amherst heard a cry of glee behind [him]96-amherst ; then all sounds were lost in the whistle of air humming by like the flight of a million arrows . [They]1000-the boys had dropped below the sunset and were tearing through the clear nether twilight of the descent ; then , with a bound , [the sled]1069-the sled met the level , and shot away across [the meadow]1058-the meadow toward the opposite height . It seemed to [Amherst]96-amherst as though [his]96-amherst body had been left behind , and only the spirit in [him]96-amherst rode the wild blue currents of galloping air ; but as the sled 's rush began to slacken with the strain of the last ascent [he]96-amherst was recalled to [himself]96-amherst by the touch of the breathing warmth at [his]96-amherst back . [Bessy]122-bessy had put out a hand to steady [herself]122-bessy , and as [she]122-bessy leaned forward , gripping [his]96-amherst arm , a flying end of [her]122-bessy furs swept [his]96-amherst face . There was a delicious pang in being thus caught back to life ; and as [the sled]1069-the sled stopped , and [he]96-amherst sprang to [his]96-amherst feet , [he]96-amherst still glowed with the sensation . [Bessy]122-bessy too was under the spell . In the dusk of the beech - grove where [they]1000-the boys had landed , [he]96-amherst could barely distinguish [her]122-bessy features ; but [her]122-bessy eyes shone on [him]96-amherst , and [he]96-amherst heard [her]122-bessy quick breathing as [he]96-amherst stooped to help [her]122-bessy to [her]122-bessy feet . " Oh , how beautiful -- it 's the only thing better than a good gallop ! "[122-bessy] [She]122-bessy leaned against a tree - bole , panting a little , and loosening [her]122-bessy furs . " What a pity it 's too dark to begin again ! "[122-bessy] [she]122-bessy sighed , looking about [her]122-bessy through the dim weaving of leafless boughs . " It 's not so dark in the open -- [we]3846-we might have one more , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst proposed ; but [she]122-bessy shook [her]122-bessy head , seized by a new whim . " It 's so still and delicious in here -- did [you]96-amherst hear the snow fall when that squirrel jumped across to the pine ? "[122-bessy] [She]122-bessy tilted [her]122-bessy head , narrowing [her]122-bessy lids as [she]122-bessy peered upward . " There [he]96-amherst is ! [One]3402-one gets used to the light .... Look ! See [his]96-amherst little eyes shining down at [us]1072-they ! "[122-bessy] As [Amherst]96-amherst looked where [she]122-bessy pointed , the squirrel leapt to another tree , and [they]1072-they stole on after [him]96-amherst through the hushed wood , guided by [his]96-amherst grey flashes in the dimness . Here and there , in a break of the snow , [they]1072-they trod on a bed of wet leaves that gave out a breath of hidden life , or a hemlock twig dashed its spicy scent into [their]1072-they faces . As [they]1072-they grew used to the twilight [their]1072-they eyes began to distinguish countless delicate gradations of tint : cold mottlings of grey - black boles against the snow , wet russets of drifted beech - leaves , a distant network of mauve twigs melting into the woodland haze . And in the silence just such fine gradations of sound became audible : the soft drop of loosened snow - lumps , a stir of startled wings , the creak of a dead branch , somewhere far off in darkness . [They]1072-they walked on , still in silence , as though [they]1072-they had entered [the glade of an enchanted forest]1073-the glade of an enchanted forest and were powerless to turn back or to break the hush with a word . [They]1072-they made no pretense of following the squirrel any longer ; [he]96-amherst had flashed away to a high tree - top , from which [his]96-amherst ironical chatter pattered down on [their]1072-they unheeding ears . [Amherst]96-amherst 's sensations were not of that highest order of happiness where mind and heart mingle their elements in the strong draught of life : it was a languid fume that stole through [him]96-amherst from the cup at [his]96-amherst lips . But after the sense of defeat and failure which the last weeks had brought , the reaction was too exquisite to be analyzed . All [he]96-amherst asked of the moment was its immediate sweetness .... [They]1072-they had reached the brink of [a rocky glen]1074-a rocky glen where [a little brook]1075-a little brook still sent its thread of sound through mufflings of ice and huddled branches . [Bessy]122-bessy stood still a moment , bending [her]122-bessy head to the sweet cold tinkle ; then [she]122-bessy moved away and said slowly : " [We]1072-they must go back . "[122-bessy] As [they]1072-they turned to retrace [their]1072-they steps a yellow line of light through the tree - trunks showed [them]1072-they that [they]1072-they had not , after all , gone very deep into the wood . A few minutes ' walk would restore [them]1072-they to the lingering daylight , and on the farther side of [the meadow]1058-the meadow stood the sleigh which was to carry [Bessy]122-bessy back to [Hanaford]1-hanaford . A sudden sense of the evanescence of the moment roused [Amherst]96-amherst from [his]96-amherst absorption . Before the next change in the fading light [he]96-amherst would be back again among the ugly realities of life . Did [she]122-bessy , too , hate to return to [them]1072-they ? Or why else did [she]122-bessy walk so slowly -- why did [she]122-bessy seem as much afraid as [himself]96-amherst to break the silence that held [them]1072-they in its magic circle ? A dead pine - branch caught in the edge of [her]122-bessy skirt , and [she]122-bessy stood still while [Amherst]96-amherst bent down to release [her]122-bessy . As [she]122-bessy turned to help [him]96-amherst [he]96-amherst looked up with a smile . " The wood does n't want to let [you]122-bessy go , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said . [She]122-bessy made no reply , and [he]96-amherst added , rising : " But [you]122-bessy 'll come back to it -- [you'll]122-bessy come back often , [I]96-amherst hope . "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst could not see [her]122-bessy face in the dimness , but [her]122-bessy voice trembled a little as [she]122-bessy answered : " [I]122-bessy will do what [you]96-amherst tell [me]122-bessy -- but [I]122-bessy shall be alone -- against [all the others]3848-all the others : [they]3848-all the others do n't understand . "[122-bessy] The simplicity , the helplessness , of [the avowal]1077-the avowal , appealed to [him]96-amherst not as a weakness but as a grace . [He]96-amherst understood what [she]122-bessy was really saying : " How can [you]96-amherst desert [me]122-bessy ? How can [you]96-amherst put this great responsibility on [me]122-bessy , and then leave [me]122-bessy to bear it alone ? "[122-bessy] and in the light of [her]122-bessy unuttered appeal [his]96-amherst action seemed almost like cruelty . Why had [he]96-amherst opened [her]122-bessy eyes to wrongs [she]122-bessy had no strength to redress without [his]96-amherst aid ? [He]96-amherst could only answer , as [he]96-amherst walked beside [her]122-bessy toward the edge of the wood : " [You]122-bessy will not be alone -- in time [you]122-bessy will make [the others]620-the others understand ; in time [they]620-the others will be with [you]122-bessy . "[96-amherst] " Ah , [you]96-amherst do n't believe that ! "[122-bessy] [she]122-bessy exclaimed , pausing suddenly , and speaking with an intensity of reproach that amazed [him]96-amherst . " [I]96-amherst hope it , at any rate , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst rejoined , pausing also . " And [I]96-amherst 'm sure that if [you]122-bessy will come here oftener -- if [you]122-bessy 'll really live among [your]122-bessy people---- "[96-amherst] " How can [you]96-amherst say that , when [you]96-amherst 're deserting [them]620-the others ? "[122-bessy] [she]122-bessy broke in , with a feminine excess of inconsequence that fairly dashed the words from [his]96-amherst lips . " Deserting [them]620-the others ? Do n't [you]96-amherst understand---- ? "[122-bessy] " [I]96-amherst understand that [you]96-amherst 've made [Mr. Gaines]110-mr. gaines and [Truscomb]105-truscomb angry -- yes ; but if [I]96-amherst should insist on [your]96-amherst staying---- "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst felt the blood rush to [his]96-amherst forehead . " No -- no , it 's not possible ! "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst exclaimed , with a vehemence addressed more to [himself]96-amherst than to [her]122-bessy . " Then what will happen at [the mills]3324-the mills ? "[96-amherst] " Oh , [some one else]457-some one else will be found -- the new ideas are stirring everywhere . And if [you]122-bessy 'll only come back here , and help [my]96-amherst successor---- "[96-amherst] " Do [you]96-amherst think [they]3852-they are likely to choose [any one else]3853-any one else with [your]96-amherst ideas ? "[122-bessy] [she]122-bessy interposed with unexpected acuteness ; and after a short silence [he]96-amherst answered : " Not immediately , perhaps ; but in time -- in time there will be improvements . "[96-amherst] " As if [the poor people]3854-the poor people could wait ! Oh , it 's cruel , cruel of [you]96-amherst to go ! "[122-bessy] [Her]122-bessy voice broke in a throb of entreaty that went to [his]96-amherst inmost fibres . " [You]96-amherst do n't understand . It 's impossible in the present state of things that [I]122-bessy should do any good by staying . "[122-bessy] " Then [you]96-amherst refuse ? " Yes -- [I]122-bessy should still refuse . "[122-bessy] [She]122-bessy made no answer , but moved a few steps nearer to the edge of [the wood]1078-the wood . [The meadow]1058-the meadow was just below [them]1080-them now , and the sleigh in plain sight on the height beyond . [Their]1080-them steps made no sound on the sodden drifts underfoot , and in the silence [he]96-amherst thought [he]96-amherst heard a catch in [her]122-bessy breathing . It was enough to make the brimming moment overflow . [He]96-amherst stood still before [her]122-bessy and bent [his]96-amherst head to [hers]122-bessy . " [Bessy]122-bessy ! "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said , with sudden vehemence . [She]122-bessy did not speak or move , but in the quickened state of [his]96-amherst perceptions [he]96-amherst became aware that [she]122-bessy was silently weeping . It absorbed [her]122-bessy outline into the shadowy background of [the wood]1078-the wood , from which [her]122-bessy face emerged in a faint spot of pallor ; and the same obscurity seemed to envelop [his]96-amherst faculties , merging the hard facts of life in a blur of feeling in which the distinctest impression was the sweet sense of [her]122-bessy tears . " [Bessy]122-bessy ! "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst exclaimed again ; and as [he]96-amherst drew a step nearer [he]96-amherst felt [her]122-bessy yield to [him]96-amherst , and bury [her]122-bessy sobs against [his]96-amherst arm . BOOK II IX " BUT , [Justine----]157-justine---- "[118-mrs. dressel] [Mrs. Harry Dressel]118-mrs. dressel , seated in the June freshness of [[her]118-mrs. dressel Oak Street drawing - room]1082-her oak street drawing - room , and harmonizing by [her]118-mrs. dressel high lights and hard edges with the white - and - gold angularities of the best furniture , cast a rebuking eye on [[her]118-mrs. dressel friend [Miss Brent]97-miss brent , who stood arranging in a glass bowl the handful of roses [she]118-mrs. dressel had just brought in from [the garden]1084-the garden]1083-her friend miss brent , who stood arranging in a glass bowl the handful of roses she had just brought in from the garden . " When [you]157-justine---- were [here]3415-here three years ago , [Justine]100-justine , [I]118-mrs. dressel could understand [your]157-justine---- not wanting to go out , because [you]157-justine---- were in mourning for [[your]157-justine---- mother]3856-your mother -- and besides , [you]157-justine---- 'd volunteered for that bad surgical case in [the Hope Hospital]253-the hope hospital . "[118-mrs. dressel] " [I]118-mrs. dressel 'm sure of it , [dear]3468-dear ; so sure that [my]118-mrs. dressel horrid pride rather resents being floated in on the high tide of such overwhelming credentials . It was absurd , of course , given the relative situations of [the two]271-the two ; and [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel , behind [[her]118-mrs. dressel friend]706-her friend 's back , was quickly reassured by the thought that [Justine]100-justine was only [a hospital nurse]3795-a hospital nurse , who had to work for [her]100-justine living , and had really never " been [anywhere "]3863-anywhere "[118-mrs. dressel] ; but when [Miss Brent]97-miss brent 's verbal arrows were flying , it seemed somehow of more immediate consequence that [she]118-mrs. dressel was fairly well - connected , and lived in [New York]7-new york . [No one]3425-no one placed a higher value on the abstract qualities of wit and irony than [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel ; the difficulty was that [she]118-mrs. dressel never quite knew when [Justine]100-justine 's retorts were loaded , or when [her]118-mrs. dressel own susceptibilities were the target aimed at ; and between [her]118-mrs. dressel desire to appear to take the joke , and the fear of being ridiculed without knowing it , [her]118-mrs. dressel pretty face often presented an interesting study in perplexity . As usual , [she]118-mrs. dressel now took refuge in bringing the talk back to a personal issue . " [I]118-mrs. dressel ca n't imagine , "[118-mrs. dressel] [she]118-mrs. dressel said , " why [you]3864-you wo n't go to [[the Gaines]110-mr. gaines 's garden - party]3865-the gaines 's garden - party . "[118-mrs. dressel] [Miss Brent]97-miss brent smiled . " As far as [I]97-miss brent can remember , [Effie]158-effie , it is always [you]3864-you who accuse [others]3447-others of bringing that charge against [Hanaford]116-hanaford . "[97-miss brent] [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel rose impatiently . " How absurdly [you]3864-you talk ! "[97-miss brent] As [she]97-miss brent spoke , [she]97-miss brent stretched [her]97-miss brent arms above [her]97-miss brent head , with a gesture revealing the suppleness of [her]97-miss brent slim young frame , but also its tenuity of structure -- the frailness of throat and shoulders , and the play of bones in the delicate neck . [Justine Brent]100-justine had one of those imponderable bodies that seem a mere pinch of matter shot through with light and colour . Though [she]100-justine did not flush easily , auroral lights ran under [her]100-justine clear skin , were lost in the shadows of [her]100-justine hair , and broke again in [her]100-justine eyes ; and [her]100-justine voice seemed to shoot light too , as though [her]100-justine smile flashed back from [her]100-justine words as they fell -- all [her]100-justine features being so fluid and changeful that the one solid thing about [her]100-justine was the massing of dense black hair which clasped [her]100-justine face like the noble metal of some antique bust . [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's face softened at the note of weariness in [the girl]403-the girl 's voice . " Are [you]403-the girl very tired , [dear]3468-dear ? "[118-mrs. dressel] [she]118-mrs. dressel asked drawing [her]403-the girl down to a seat on the sofa . " Yes , and no -- not so much bodily , perhaps , as in spirit . "[118-mrs. dressel] [Justine Brent]100-justine drew [her]100-justine brows together , and stared moodily at the thin brown hands interwoven between [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's plump fingers . Seated thus , with hollowed shoulders and brooding head , [she]118-mrs. dressel might have figured [a young sibyl]1098-a young sibyl bowed above some mystery of fate ; but the next moment [her]118-mrs. dressel face , inclining toward [[her]118-mrs. dressel friend]706-her friend 's , cast off its shadows and resumed the look of [a plaintive child]1100-a plaintive child . " The worst of it is that [I]118-mrs. dressel do n't look forward with any interest to taking up the old drudgery again . Of course that loss of interest may be merely physical -- [I]118-mrs. dressel should call it so in [a nervous patient]3875-a nervous patient , no doubt . But in [myself]118-mrs. dressel it seems different -- it seems to go to the roots of [the world]259-the world . [You]3877-you know it was always the imaginative side of [my]118-mrs. dressel work that helped [me]118-mrs. dressel over the ugly details -- the pity and beauty that disinfected the physical horror ; but now that feeling is lost , and only the mortal disgust remains . "[118-mrs. dressel] * * * * * Before [her]118-mrs. dressel toilet mirror , an hour later , [Justine Brent]100-justine seemed in a way to fulfill [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's prediction . So mirror - like [herself]118-mrs. dressel , [she]118-mrs. dressel could no more help reflecting the happy effect of a bow or a feather than the subtler influence of word and look ; and [her]118-mrs. dressel face and figure were so new to the advantages of dress that , at four - and - twenty , [she]118-mrs. dressel still produced the effect of [a young girl]1102-a young girl in [her]118-mrs. dressel first " good "[118-mrs. dressel] frock . In [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's festal raiment , which [her]118-mrs. dressel dark tints subdued to a quiet elegance , [she]118-mrs. dressel was like the golden core of a pale rose illuminating and scenting its petals . Three years of solitary life , following on a youth of confidential intimacy with [the mother [she]118-mrs. dressel had lost]1103-the mother she had lost , had produced in [her]118-mrs. dressel the quaint habit of half - loud soliloquy . " Fine feathers , [Justine]100-justine ! "[118-mrs. dressel] [she]118-mrs. dressel laughed back at [her]118-mrs. dressel laughing image . " [You]100-justine look like a phoenix risen from [your]100-justine ashes . But slip back into [your]100-justine own plumage , and [you]100-justine 'll be no more than a little brown bird without a song ! "[118-mrs. dressel] The luxurious suggestions of [her]118-mrs. dressel dress , and the way [her]118-mrs. dressel warm youth became it , drew [her]118-mrs. dressel back to memories of a childhood nestled in beauty and gentle ways , before [[her]118-mrs. dressel handsome prodigal father]1104-her handsome prodigal father had died , and [[her]118-mrs. dressel mother]1105-her mother 's face had grown pinched in the long struggle with poverty . But those memories were after all less dear to [Justine]100-justine than the grey years following , when , growing up , [she]100-justine had helped to clear a space in [the wilderness]1106-the wilderness for [their]1107-their tiny hearth - fire , when [her]100-justine own efforts had fed the flame and roofed it in from the weather . A great heat , kindled at that hearth , had burned in [her]100-justine veins , making [her]100-justine devour [her]100-justine work , lighting and warming the long cold days , and reddening the horizon through dark passages of revolt and failure ; and [she]100-justine felt all the more deeply the chill of reaction that set in with [[her]118-mrs. dressel mother]1105-her mother 's death . [She]100-justine thought [she]100-justine had chosen [her]100-justine work as [a nurse]254-a nurse in a spirit of high disinterestedness ; but in the first hours of [her]100-justine bereavement it seemed as though only the personal aim had sustained [her]100-justine . For a while , after this , [[her]100-justine sick people]1110-her sick people became to [her]100-justine mere bundles of disintegrating matter , and [she]100-justine shrank from physical pain with a distaste the deeper because , mechanically , [she]100-justine could not help working on to relieve it . Gradually [her]100-justine sound nature passed out of this morbid phase , and [she]100-justine took up [her]100-justine task with deeper pity if less exalted ardour ; glad to do [her]100-justine part in the vast impersonal labour of easing [the world]259-the world 's misery , but longing with all the warm instincts of youth for a special load to lift , a single hand to clasp . Ah , it was cruel to be alive , to be young , to bubble with springs of mirth and tenderness and folly , and to live in perpetual contact with decay and pain -- to look persistently into the grey face of death without having lifted even a corner of life 's veil ! Now and then , when [she]100-justine felt [her]100-justine youth flame through the sheath of dullness which was gradually enclosing it , [she]100-justine rebelled at the conditions that tied a spirit like [hers]100-justine to its monotonous task , while others , without a quiver of wings on [their]1112-their dull shoulders , or a note of music in [their]1112-their hearts , had [the whole wide world]1113-the whole wide world to range through , and saw in it no more than a frightful emptiness to be shut out with tight walls of habit .... * * * * * A tap on the door announced [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel , garbed for conquest , and bestowing on [[her]118-mrs. dressel brilliant person]1114-her brilliant person the last anxious touches of [the artist]1115-the artist reluctant to part from a masterpiece . In the course of [her]100-justine hospital work [Justine]100-justine had of necessity run across far different types ; but from the connections thus offered [she]100-justine was often held back by the subtler shades of taste that civilize human intercourse . [[Her]100-justine world]1145-her world , in short , had been chiefly peopled by the dull or the crude , and , hemmed in between the two , [she]100-justine had created for [herself]100-justine [an inner kingdom where the fastidiousness [she]100-justine had to set aside in [her]100-justine outward relations recovered its full sway]1146-an inner kingdom where the fastidiousness she had to set aside in her outward relations recovered its full sway . Certainly , [[Mrs. Gaines]140-mrs. gaines 's garden - party]1149-mrs. gaines 's garden - party seemed an unlikely field for the exercise of such curiosity : [Justine]100-justine 's few glimpses of [Hanaford]1-hanaford society had revealed it as rather a dull thick body , with a surface stimulated only by ill - advised references to the life of [larger capitals]1150-larger capitals ; and the concentrated essence of social [Hanaford]1-hanaford was of course to be found at [the Gaines]110-mr. gaines entertainments . It presented itself , however , in the rich June afternoon , on the long shadows of the well - kept lawn , and among the paths of [the rose - garden]1151-the rose - garden , in its most amiable aspect ; and to [Justine]100-justine , wearied by habitual contact with ugliness and suffering , there was pure delight in the verdant setting of the picture , and in the light harmonious tints of [the figures peopling it]1152-the figures peopling it . If the company was dull , it was at least decorative ; and poverty , misery and dirt were shut out by the placid unconsciousness of [the guests]1153-the guests as securely as by the leafy barriers of [the garden]1084-the garden . "[1208-he] The transition had been effected , at the expense of dramatic interest , but to the obvious triumph of social observances ; and to [Justine]100-justine , after all , regaining at [his]1208-he side the group about [the marquee]1199-the marquee , the interest was not so much diminished as shifted to the no less suggestive problem of studying [the friend of [her]100-justine youth]1211-the friend of her youth in the unexpected character of [[John Amherst]99-amherst 's wife]1212-john amherst 's wife . [She]100-justine had seen at once that the peculiar sense of intimacy reawakened by [their]1214-their meeting had been chilled and deflected by [her]100-justine first allusion to the topic which had previously brought [them]1214-their together : [Amherst]99-amherst had drawn back as soon as [she]100-justine named [the mills]3324-the mills . What could be the cause of [his]99-amherst reluctance ? When [they]1214-their had last met , the subject burned within [him]99-amherst : [her]100-justine being in actual fact [a stranger]1209-a stranger had not , then , been an obstacle to [his]99-amherst confidences . Now that [he]99-amherst was master at [Westmore]104-westmore it was plain that another tone became [him]99-amherst -- that [his]99-amherst situation necessitated a greater reserve ; but [her]100-justine enquiry did not imply the least wish to overstep this restriction : it merely showed [her]100-justine remembrance of [his]99-amherst frankly - avowed interest in the operatives . [Justine]100-justine was struck by the fact that so natural an allusion should put [him]99-amherst on the defensive . [She]100-justine did not for a moment believe that [he]99-amherst had lost [his]99-amherst interest in [the mills]3324-the mills ; and that [his]99-amherst point of view should have shifted with the fact of ownership [she]100-justine rejected as an equally superficial reading of [his]99-amherst character . [The man with whom [she]100-justine had talked at [Dillon]98-dillon 's bedside]1218-the man with whom she had talked at dillon 's bedside was one in whom the ruling purposes had already shaped [themselves]1219-themselves , and to whom life , in whatever form it came , must henceforth take [their]1219-themselves mould . As [she]100-justine reached this point in [her]100-justine analysis , it occurred to [her]100-justine that [his]99-amherst shrinking from the subject might well imply not indifference , but a deeper preoccupation : a preoccupation for some reason suppressed and almost disavowed , yet sustaining the more intensely its painful hidden life . From this inference it was but a leap of thought to the next -- that the cause of the change must be sought outside of [himself]99-amherst , in some external influence strong enough to modify the innate lines of [his]99-amherst character . And where could such an influence be more obviously sought than in the marriage which had transformed [the assistant manager of [the Westmore Mills]3336-the westmore mills]1220-the assistant manager of the westmore mills not , indeed , into [[their]3336-the westmore mills owner]1222-their owner -- that would rather have tended to simplify the problem -- but into [the husband of [Mrs. Westmore]104-westmore]1223-the husband of mrs. westmore ? After all , [the mills]3324-the mills were [Bessy's]169-bessy's -- and for a farther understanding of the case it remained to find out what manner of person [Bessy]160-bessy had become . [Justine]100-justine 's first impression , as [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend 's charming arms received [her]100-justine -- with an eagerness of welcome not lost on the suspended judgment of [feminine Hanaford]164-hanaford -- the immediate impression was of a gain of emphasis , of individuality , as though the fluid creature [she]100-justine remembered had belied [her]100-justine prediction , and run at last into a definite mould . Yes -- [Bessy]160-bessy had acquired an outline : a graceful one , as became [her]160-bessy early promise , though with , perhaps , a little more sharpness of edge than [her]160-bessy youthful texture had promised . But the side [she]100-justine turned to [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend was still all softness -- had in it a hint of the old pliancy , the impulse to lean and enlace , that at once woke in [Justine]100-justine the corresponding instinct of guidance and protection , so that [their]1227-their first kiss , before a word was spoken , carried [the two]271-the two back to the precise relation in which [their]1227-their school - days had left [them]1227-their . So easy a reversion to the past left no room for the sense of subsequent changes by which such reunions are sometimes embarrassed . [Justine]100-justine 's sympathies had , instinctively , and almost at once , transferred [themselves]1227-their to [Bessy]160-bessy 's side -- passing over at a leap the pained recognition that there _ were _ sides already -- and [Bessy]160-bessy had gathered up [Justine]100-justine into the circle of gentle self - absorption which left [her]100-justine very dimly aware of any distinctive characteristic in [[her]100-justine friends]1229-her friends except that of [their]1229-her friends affection for [herself]100-justine -- since [she]100-justine asked only , as [she]100-justine appealingly put it , that [they]1229-her friends should all be " dreadfully fond "[100-justine] of [her]100-justine . " And [I]100-justine 've wanted [you]100-justine so often , [Justine]100-justine : [you]100-justine 're [the only clever person [I]100-justine 'm not afraid of]3958-the only clever person i 'm not afraid of , because [your]100-justine cleverness always used to make things clear instead of confusing [them]3959-them . Certainly [Bessy Amherst]170-bessy had grown into the full loveliness which [her]170-bessy childhood promised . [She]170-bessy had the kind of finished prettiness that declares itself early , holds its own through the awkward transitions of girlhood , and resists the strain of all later vicissitudes , as though miraculously preserved in some clear medium impenetrable to the wear and tear of living . " [[You]170-bessy absurd child]3969-you absurd child ! [You]170-bessy 've not changed a bit except to grow more so ! "[170-bessy] [XI]171-xi AFTER conducting [Miss Brent]97-miss brent to [[his]1235-his wife]3350-his wife , [John Amherst]99-amherst , by the exercise of considerable strategic skill , had once more contrived to detach [himself]1235-his from the throng on [the lawn]1159-the lawn , and , regaining a path in the shrubbery , had taken refuge on [the verandah of [the house]311-the house]1238-the verandah of the house .
