"[170-bessy] * * * * * [Amherst]99-amherst had intended , on leaving [[his]99-amherst mother]396-his mother , to rejoin [Bessy]170-bessy , whom [he]99-amherst could still discern , on [the lawn]1159-the lawn , in absorbed communion with [Miss Brent]97-miss brent ; but after what had passed it seemed impossible , for the moment , to recover the garden - party tone , and [he]99-amherst made [his]99-amherst escape through [the house]311-the house while [a trio of Cuban singers , who formed the crowning number of the entertainment]1282-a trio of cuban singers , who formed the crowning number of the entertainment , gathered [the company]3366-the company in a denser circle about [their]1282-a trio of cuban singers , who formed the crowning number of the entertainment guitars . As [he]99-amherst walked on aimlessly under the deep June shadows of [Maplewood]31-maplewood Avenue [[his]99-amherst mother]396-his mother 's last words formed an ironical accompaniment to [his]99-amherst thoughts . " Now that things are comfortably settled-- "[99-amherst] [he]99-amherst knew so well what that elastic epithet covered ! [Himself]99-amherst , for instance , ensconced in the impenetrable prosperity of [his]99-amherst wonderful marriage ; [herself]170-bessy too ( unconsciously , [dear soul]1285-dear soul ! ) , so happily tucked away in a cranny of that new and spacious life , and no more able to conceive why existing conditions should be disturbed than the bird in the eaves understands why [the house]311-the house should be torn down . Well -- [he]99-amherst had learned at last what [his]99-amherst experience with [[his]99-amherst poor , valiant , puzzled mother]1287-his poor , valiant , puzzled mother might have taught [him]99-amherst : that [one]3402-one must never ask from [women]497-women any view but the personal one , any measure of conduct but that of [their]497-women own pains and pleasures . [She]396-his mother , indeed , had borne undauntedly enough the brunt of [their]1290-their earlier trials ; but that was merely because , as [she]396-his mother said , [the mother]1291-the mother 's instinct bade [her]396-his mother heap all [her]396-his mother private hopes on the great devouring altar of [[her]396-his mother son]393-her son 's ambition ; it was not because [she]396-his mother had ever , in the very least , understood or sympathized with [his]99-amherst aims . And [Bessy--]174-bessy-- ? Perhaps if [[their]1290-their little son]1293-their little son had lived [she]396-his mother might in turn have obeyed the world - old instinct of self - effacement -- but now ! [He]99-amherst remembered with an intenser self - derision that , not even in the first surprise of [his]99-amherst passion , had [he]99-amherst deluded [himself]99-amherst with the idea that [Bessy Westmore]122-bessy was an exception to [her]396-his mother sex . [He]99-amherst had argued rather that , being only a lovelier product of the common mould , [she]396-his mother would abound in the adaptabilities and pliancies which [the lords of]1294-the lords of [the earth]4009-the earth have seen fit to cultivate in [[their]1294-the lords of companions]1296-their companions . [She]396-his mother would care for [his]99-amherst aims because they were [his]99-amherst . During [their]1290-their precipitate wooing , and through the first brief months of marriage , this profound and original theory had been gratifyingly confirmed ; then its perfect surface had begun to show a flaw . [Amherst]170-bessy had always conveniently supposed that [the poet]1297-the poet 's line summed up [the good woman]1298-the good woman 's rule of ethics : _ [He]99-amherst for [God]156-god only , [she]396-his mother for [God]156-god in [him]99-amherst . _ It was for [the god in [him]99-amherst]1299-the god in him , surely , that [she]396-his mother had loved [him]99-amherst : for that first glimpse of an " ampler ether , a diviner air "[396-his mother] that [he]99-amherst had brought into [her]396-his mother cramped and curtained life . [He]99-amherst could never , now , evoke that earlier delusion without feeling on its still - tender surface the keen edge of [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's smile . [She]396-his mother , no doubt , could have told [him]99-amherst at any time why [Bessy]170-bessy had married [him]99-amherst : it was for [his]99-amherst _ beaux yeux _ , as [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell would have put it -- because [he]99-amherst was young , handsome , persecuted , [an ardent lover if not a subtle one]1300-an ardent lover if not a subtle one -- because [Bessy]170-bessy had met [him]99-amherst at the fatal moment , because [[her]170-bessy family]561-her family had opposed the marriage -- because , in brief , [the gods]3946-the gods , that day , may have been a little short of amusement . Well , [they]1303-they were having [their]1303-they laugh out now -- there were moments when high heaven seemed to ring with it .... With these thoughts at [his]99-amherst heels [Amherst]170-bessy strode on , overtaken now and again by the wheels of [departing guests from [the garden - party]1121-the garden - party]1304-departing guests from the garden - party , and knowing , as [they]1303-they passed [him]99-amherst , what was in [their]1303-they minds -- envy of [his]99-amherst success , admiration of [his]99-amherst cleverness in achieving it , and a little half - contemptuous pity for [[his]99-amherst wife]3350-his wife , who , with [her]3350-his wife wealth and looks , might have done so much better . Certainly , if the case could have been put to [Hanaford]164-hanaford -- [the Hanaford of [the Gaines garden - party]1125-the gaines garden - party]1307-the hanaford of the gaines garden - party -- it would have sided with [Bessy]170-bessy to a voice . And how much justice was there in what [he]99-amherst felt would have been the unanimous verdict of [[her]3350-his wife class]1309-her class ? Was [[his]99-amherst mother]396-his mother right in hinting that [he]99-amherst was sacrificing [Bessy]170-bessy to [the mills]3324-the mills ? But [the mills]3324-the mills _ were _ [Bessy]170-bessy -- at least [he]99-amherst had thought so when [he]99-amherst married [her]3350-his wife ! [They]3324-the mills were [her]3350-his wife particular form of contact with life , the expression of [her]3350-his wife relation to [[her]3350-his wife fellow - men]1313-her fellow - men , [her]3350-his wife pretext , [her]3350-his wife opportunity -- unless [they]3324-the mills were merely a vast purse in which to plunge for [her]3350-his wife pin - money ! [He]99-amherst had fancied it would rest with [him]99-amherst to determine from which of these stand - points [she]3350-his wife should view [Westmore]104-westmore ; and at the outset [she]3350-his wife had enthusiastically viewed it from [his]99-amherst . In [her]3350-his wife eager adoption of [his]99-amherst ideas [she]3350-his wife had made a pet of [the mills]3324-the mills , organizing [[the Mothers]1315-the mothers ' Club]1316-the mothers ' club , laying out [a recreation - ground on [the Hopewood property]1318-the hopewood property]1317-a recreation - ground on the hopewood property , and playing with pretty plans in water - colour for [the Emergency Hospital]1319-the emergency hospital and [the building which was to contain [the night - schools]1321-the night - schools , [library and gymnasium]1322-library and gymnasium]1320-the building which was to contain the night - schools , library and gymnasium ; but even these minor projects -- which [he]99-amherst had urged [her]3350-his wife to take up as a means of learning [their]1323-their essential dependence on [his]99-amherst larger scheme -- were soon to be set aside by obstacles of a material order . [Bessy]170-bessy always wanted money -- not a great deal , but , as [she]3350-his wife reasonably put it , " enough"--and[3350-his wife] who was to blame if [[her]170-bessy father]3496-her father and [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy , each in [his]99-amherst different capacity , felt obliged to point out that every philanthropic outlay at [Westmore]104-westmore must entail a corresponding reduction in [her]170-bessy income ? Perhaps if [she]3350-his wife could have been oftener at [Hanaford]1-hanaford these arguments would have been counteracted , for [she]3350-his wife was tender - hearted , and prompt to relieve such suffering as [she]3350-his wife saw about [her]3350-his wife ; but [her]3350-his wife imagination was not active , and it was easy for [her]3350-his wife to forget painful sights when they were not under [her]3350-his wife eye . This was perhaps -- half - consciously -- one of the reasons why [she]3350-his wife avoided [Hanaford]164-hanaford ; why , as [Amherst]170-bessy exclaimed , [they]1325-their had been everywhere since [their]1325-their marriage but to the place where [their]1325-their obligations called [them]1325-their . There had , at any rate , always been some good excuse for not returning [there]3361-there , and consequently for postponing the work of improvement which , it was generally felt , [[her]3350-his wife husband]3393-her husband could not fitly begin till [she]3350-his wife _ had _ returned and gone over the ground with [him]3393-her husband . After [their]1325-their marriage , and especially in view of the comment excited by that romantic incident , it was impossible not to yield to [her]3350-his wife wish that [they]1325-their should go abroad for a few months ; then , before [her]3350-his wife confinement , [the doctors]3800-the doctors had exacted that [she]3350-his wife should be spared all fatigue and worry ; and after [the baby]3523-the baby 's death [Amherst]170-bessy had felt with [her]3350-his wife too tenderly to venture an immediate return to unwelcome questions . For by this time it had become clear to [him]3393-her husband that such questions were , and always would be , unwelcome to [her]3350-his wife . As the easiest means of escaping [them]1330-them , [she]3350-his wife had once more dismissed the whole problem to the vague and tiresome sphere of " business , "[3350-his wife] whence [he]3393-her husband had succeeded in detaching it for a moment in the early days of [their]1325-their union . [[Her]3350-his wife first husband]1331-her first husband -- poor unappreciated [Westmore!--had]175-westmore!--had always spared [her]3350-his wife the boredom of " business , "[164-hanaford] and [Halford Gaines]164-hanaford and [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy were ready to show [her]3350-his wife the same consideration ; it was part of the modern code of chivalry that [lovely woman]1332-lovely woman should not be bothered about ways and means . But [Bessy]125-bessy was too much [the wife]3388-the wife -- and [the wife in love]1334-the wife in love -- to consent that [[her]3350-his wife husband]3393-her husband 's views on the management of [the mills]3324-the mills should be totally disregarded . Precisely because [[her]3350-his wife advisers]803-her advisers looked unfavourably on [his]3393-her husband intervention , [she]3350-his wife felt bound -- if only in defense of [her]3350-his wife illusions -- to maintain and emphasize it . [The mills]3324-the mills were , in fact , the official " platform "[3350-his wife] on which [she]3350-his wife had married : [Amherst]170-bessy 's devoted _ role _ at [Westmore]122-bessy had justified the unconventionality of the step . And so [she]3350-his wife was committed -- the more helplessly for [her]3350-his wife dense misintelligence of both sides of the question -- to the policy of conciliating the opposing influences which had so uncomfortably chosen to fight out [their]1339-their case on the field of [her]3350-his wife poor little existence : theoretically siding with [[her]3350-his wife husband]3393-her husband , but surreptitiously , as [he]3393-her husband well knew , giving aid and comfort to [the enemy]1341-the enemy , who were really defending [her]3350-his wife own cause . All this [Amherst]170-bessy saw with that cruel insight which had replaced [his]3393-her husband former blindness . [He]3393-her husband was , in truth , more ashamed of the insight than of the blindness : it seemed to [him]3393-her husband horribly cold - blooded to be thus analyzing , after two years of marriage , the source of [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife 's inconsistencies . And , partly for this reason , [he]3393-her husband had put off from month to month the final question of the future management of [the mills]3324-the mills , and of the radical changes to be made there if [his]3393-her husband system were to prevail . But the time had come when , if [Bessy]170-bessy had to turn to [Westmore]122-bessy for the justification of [her]170-bessy marriage , [he]3393-her husband had even more need of calling upon it for the same service . [He]3393-her husband had not , assuredly , married [her]170-bessy because of [Westmore]122-bessy ; but [he]3393-her husband would scarcely have contemplated marriage with [a rich woman]1344-a rich woman unless the source of [her]170-bessy wealth had offered [him]3393-her husband some such opportunity as [Westmore]122-bessy presented . [His]3393-her husband special training , and the natural bent of [his]3393-her husband mind , qualified [him]3393-her husband , in what had once seemed a predestined manner , to help [Bessy]122-bessy to use [her]122-bessy power nobly , for [her]122-bessy own uplifting as well as for that of [Westmore]122-bessy ; and so [the mills]3324-the mills became , incongruously enough , the plank of safety to which both clung in [their]1346-their sense of impending disaster . It was not that [Amherst]170-bessy feared the temptation to idleness if this outlet for [his]3393-her husband activity were cut off . [He]3393-her husband had long since found that the luxury with which [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife surrounded [him]3393-her husband merely quickened [his]3393-her husband natural bent for hard work and hard fare . [He]3393-her husband recalled with a touch of bitterness how [he]3393-her husband had once regretted having separated [himself]3393-her husband from [[his]3393-her husband mother]396-his mother 's class , and how seductive for a moment , to both mind and senses , that other life had appeared . Well -- [he]3393-her husband knew it now , and it had neither charm nor peril for [him]3393-her husband . [Capua]32-capua must have been a dull place to one who had once drunk the joy of battle . What [he]3393-her husband dreaded was not that [he]3393-her husband should learn to love the life of ease , but that [he]3393-her husband should grow to loathe it uncontrollably , as the symbol of [his]3393-her husband mental and spiritual bondage . And [Westmore]122-bessy was [his]3393-her husband safety - valve , [[his]3393-her husband refuge]1349-his refuge -- if [he]3393-her husband were cut off from [Westmore]122-bessy what remained to [him]3393-her husband ? It was not only the work [he]3393-her husband had found to [his]3393-her husband hand , but the one work for which [his]3393-her husband hand was fitted . It was [his]3393-her husband life that [he]3393-her husband was fighting for in insisting that now at last , before the close of this long - deferred visit to [Hanaford]1-hanaford , the question of [the mills]3324-the mills should be faced and settled . [He]3393-her husband had made that clear to [Bessy]122-bessy , in a scene [he]3393-her husband still shrank from recalling ; for it was of the essence of [his]3393-her husband somewhat unbending integrity that [he]3393-her husband would not trick [her]122-bessy into a confused surrender to the personal influence [he]3393-her husband still possessed over [her]122-bessy , but must seek to convince [her]122-bessy by the tedious process of argument and exposition , against which [she]122-bessy knew no defense but tears and petulance . But [he]3393-her husband had , at any rate , gained [her]122-bessy consent to [his]3393-her husband setting forth [his]3393-her husband views at the meeting of [directors]1351-directors the next morning ; and meanwhile [he]3393-her husband had meant to be extraordinarily patient and reasonable with [her]122-bessy , till the hint of [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's stratagem produced in [him]3393-her husband a fresh reaction of distrust . [XII]176-xii THAT evening when dinner ended , [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , with a glance through the tall dining - room windows , had suggested to [Bessy]122-bessy that it would be pleasanter to take coffee on [the verandah]1352-the verandah ; but [Amherst]170-bessy detained [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife with a glance . " [I]3393-her husband should like [Bessy]170-bessy to stay , "[3393-her husband] [he]3393-her husband said . [The dining - room]1354-the dining - room being on the cool side [the house]311-the house , with a refreshing outlook on [the garden]1084-the garden , [the men]474-the men preferred to smoke there rather than in [the stuffily - draped Oriental apartment destined to such rites]1358-the stuffily - draped oriental apartment destined to such rites ; and [Bessy Amherst]170-bessy , with a faint sigh , sank back into [her]170-bessy seat , while [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell drifted out through one of the open windows . [The men surrounding [Richard Westmore]109-westmore 's table]1359-the men surrounding richard westmore 's table were [the same who nearly three years earlier had gathered in [[his]3393-her husband house]694-his house for the same purpose : the discussion of conditions at [the mills]3324-the mills]1360-the same who nearly three years earlier had gathered in his house for the same purpose : the discussion of conditions at the mills . The only perceptible change in the relation to each other of [the persons composing this group]1363-the persons composing this group was that [John Amherst]99-amherst was now [the host of the other two]1364-the host of the other two , instead of being [a subordinate called in for cross - examination]1365-a subordinate called in for cross - examination ; but [he]99-amherst was so indifferent , or at least so heedless , [a host]1366-a host -- so forgetful , for instance , of [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's preference for a " light "[99-amherst] cigar , and of [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's feelings on the duty of making [the Westmore]109-westmore madeira circulate with the sun -- that the change was manifest only in [his]99-amherst evening - dress , and in the fact of [his]99-amherst sitting at the foot of the table . If [Amherst]99-amherst was conscious of the contrast thus implied , it was only as a restriction on [his]99-amherst freedom . As far as the welfare of [Westmore]109-westmore was concerned [he]99-amherst would rather have stood before [[his]99-amherst companions]592-his companions as [the assistant manager of [the mills]3324-the mills]1368-the assistant manager of the mills than as [the husband of [[their]592-his companions owner]1222-their owner]1370-the husband of their owner ; and it seemed to [him]99-amherst , as [he]99-amherst looked back , that [he]99-amherst had done very little with the opportunity which looked so great in the light of [his]99-amherst present restrictions . What [he]99-amherst _ had _ done with it -- the use to which , as [unfriendly critics]1372-unfriendly critics might insinuate , [he]99-amherst had so adroitly put it -- had landed [him]99-amherst , ironically enough , in the ugly _ impasse _ of a situation from which no issue seemed possible without some wasteful sacrifice of feeling . [[His]99-amherst wife]3350-his wife 's feelings , for example , were already revealing themselves in an impatient play of [her]3350-his wife fan that made [[her]3350-his wife father]3496-her father presently lean forward to suggest : " If [[we]4028-we [men]265-men]4029-we men are to talk shop , is it necessary to keep [Bessy]125-bessy in [this hot room]4031-this hot room ? "[99-amherst] [Amherst]99-amherst rose and opened the window behind [[his]99-amherst wife]3350-his wife 's chair . " There 's a breeze from [the west]4032-the west -- [the room]3355-the room will be cooler now , "[99-amherst] [he]99-amherst said , returning to [his]99-amherst seat . " Oh , [I]99-amherst do n't mind-- "[99-amherst] [Bessy]125-bessy murmured , in a tone intended to give [[her]3350-his wife companions]614-her companions the full measure of what [she]3350-his wife was being called on to endure . [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy coughed slightly . " May [I]125-bessy trouble [you]99-amherst for that other box of cigars , [Amherst]99-amherst ? No , _ not _ the Cabanas . "[125-bessy] [Bessy]125-bessy rose and handed [him]99-amherst the box on which [his]99-amherst glance significantly rested . " Ah , thank [you]99-amherst , [[my]99-amherst dear]3368-my dear . [I]99-amherst was about to ask , "[99-amherst] [he]99-amherst continued , looking about for the cigar - lighter , which flamed unheeded at [Amherst]99-amherst 's elbow , " what special purpose will be served by a preliminary review of the questions to be discussed tomorrow . "[99-amherst] " Ah -- exactly , "[120-mr. langhope] murmured [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope . " The madeira , [[my]99-amherst dear]3368-my dear [John]99-amherst ? No -- ah--_please_--to the left ! "[99-amherst] [Amherst]99-amherst impatiently reversed the direction in which [he]99-amherst had set [the precious vessel]1377-the precious vessel moving , and turned to [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy , who was conspicuously lighting [his]125-bessy cigar with a match extracted from [his]125-bessy waist - coat pocket . " The purpose is to define [my]125-bessy position in the matter ; and [I]125-bessy prefer that [Bessy]125-bessy should do this with [your]125-bessy help rather than with [mine]125-bessy . "[125-bessy] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy surveyed [his]125-bessy cigar through drooping lids , as though the question propounded by [Amherst]99-amherst were perched on its tip . " Is not [your]125-bessy position naturally involved in and defined by [hers]125-bessy ? [You]125-bessy will excuse [my]125-bessy saying that -- technically speaking , of course -- [I]125-bessy can not distinctly conceive of it as having any separate existence . "[125-bessy] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy spoke with the deliberate mildness that was regarded as [his]125-bessy most effective weapon at the bar , since it was likely to abash [those who were too intelligent to be propitiated by it]1378-those who were too intelligent to be propitiated by it . " Certainly it is involved in [hers]125-bessy , "[99-amherst] [Amherst]99-amherst agreed ; " but how far that defines it is just what [I]99-amherst have waited till now to find out . "[99-amherst] [Bessy]125-bessy at this point recalled [her]1379-her presence by a restless turn of [her]1379-her graceful person , and [[her]1379-her father]3496-her father , with an affectionate glance at [her]1379-her , interposed amicably : " But surely -- according to old - fashioned ideas -- it implies identity of interests ? "[3496-her father] " Yes ; but whose interests ? "[99-amherst] [Amherst]99-amherst asked . " Why -- [[your]125-bessy wife]4011-your wife 's , [man]533-man ! [She]4011-your wife owns [the mills]3324-the mills . "[99-amherst] [Amherst]99-amherst hesitated . " [I]99-amherst would rather talk of [[my]99-amherst wife]3819-my wife 's interest in [the mills]3324-the mills than of [her]3819-my wife interests [there]3361-there ; but [we]4042-we 'll keep to the plural if [you]125-bessy prefer it . Personally , [I]99-amherst believe the terms should be interchangeable in the conduct of such a business . "[99-amherst] " Ah -- [I'm]125-bessy glad to hear that , "[125-bessy] said [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy quickly , " since it 's precisely the view [we]4042-we all take . "[125-bessy] [Amherst]99-amherst 's colour rose . " Definitions are ambiguous , "[99-amherst] [he]99-amherst said . " Before [you]125-bessy adopt [mine]99-amherst , perhaps [I]99-amherst had better develop it a little farther . What [I]99-amherst mean is , that [Bessy]125-bessy 's interests in [Westmore]104-westmore should be regulated by [her]3350-his wife interest in it -- in [its]104-westmore welfare as a social body , aside from its success as a commercial enterprise . If [we]4042-we agree on this definition , [we]4042-we are at one as to the other : namely that [my]99-amherst relation to the matter is defined by [hers]3350-his wife . "[99-amherst] [He]99-amherst paused a moment , as if to give [[his]99-amherst wife]3350-his wife time to contribute some sign of assent and encouragement ; but [she]3350-his wife maintained a puzzled silence and [he]99-amherst went on : " There is nothing new in this . [I]99-amherst have tried to make [Bessy]125-bessy understand from the beginning what obligations [I]99-amherst thought the ownership of [Westmore]104-westmore entailed , and how [I]99-amherst hoped to help [her]3350-his wife fulfill them ; but ever since [our]4042-we marriage all definite discussion of the subject has been put off for one cause or another , and that is [my]99-amherst reason for urging that it should be brought up at [the directors]4043-the directors ' meeting tomorrow . "[99-amherst] There was another pause , during which [Bessy]125-bessy glanced tentatively at [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy , and then said , with a lovely rise of colour : " But , [John]99-amherst , [I]125-bessy sometimes think [you]99-amherst forget how much has been done at [Westmore]104-westmore -- [the Mothers ' Club]1316-the mothers ' club , and [the play - ground]4045-the play - ground , and all -- in the way of carrying out [your]99-amherst ideas . "[125-bessy] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy discreetly dropped [his]125-bessy glance to [his]125-bessy cigar , and [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope sounded an irrepressible note of approval and encouragement . [Amherst]99-amherst smiled . " No , [I]99-amherst have not forgotten ; and [I]99-amherst am grateful to [you]99-amherst for giving [my]99-amherst ideas a trial . But what has been done hitherto is purely superficial . "[99-amherst] [Bessy]125-bessy 's eyes clouded , and [he]99-amherst added hastily : " Do n't think [I]99-amherst undervalue it for that reason -- heaven knows the surface of life needs improving ! But it 's like picking flowers and sticking them in the ground to make [a garden]4046-a garden -- unless [you]99-amherst transplant the flower with its roots , and prepare the soil to receive it , [[your]99-amherst garden]4047-your garden will be faded tomorrow . No radical changes have yet been made at [Westmore]104-westmore ; and it is of radical changes that [I]99-amherst want to speak . "[99-amherst] [Bessy]125-bessy 's look grew more pained , and [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope exclaimed with unwonted irascibility : " Upon [my]120-mr. langhope soul , [Amherst]99-amherst , the tone [you]99-amherst take about what [[your]99-amherst wife]4011-your wife has done does n't strike [me]120-mr. langhope as the likeliest way of encouraging [her]4011-your wife to do more ! "[120-mr. langhope] " [I]120-mr. langhope do n't want to encourage [her]4011-your wife to do more on such a basis -- the sooner [she]4011-your wife sees the futility of it the better for [Westmore]104-westmore ! "[120-mr. langhope] " The futility-- ? "[125-bessy] [Bessy]125-bessy broke out , with a flutter of tears in [her]1382-her voice ; but before [[her]1382-her father]3496-her father could intervene [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy had raised [his]125-bessy hand with the gesture of [one accustomed to wield the gavel]1384-one accustomed to wield the gavel . " [[My]125-bessy dear child]3614-my dear child , [I]125-bessy see [Amherst]99-amherst 's point , and it is best , as [he]99-amherst says , that [you]3614-my dear child should see it too . What [he]99-amherst desires , as [I]125-bessy understand it , is the complete reconstruction of the present state of things at [Westmore]104-westmore ; and [he]99-amherst is right in saying that all [your]3614-my dear child good works [there]3361-there -- [night - schools]870-night - schools , and [nursery]871-nursery , and so forth -- leave that issue untouched . "[125-bessy] A smile quivered under [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's moustache . [He]3496-her father and [Amherst]99-amherst both knew that [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's feint of recognizing the justice of [[his]125-bessy adversary]1385-his adversary 's claim was merely the first step to annihilating it ; but [Bessy]125-bessy could never be made to understand this , and always felt [herself]125-bessy deserted and betrayed when any side but [her]1386-i own was given a hearing . " [I]1386-i 'm sorry if all [I]1386-i have tried to do at [Westmore]104-westmore is useless -- but [I]1386-i suppose [I]1386-i shall never understand business , "[1386-i] [she]1386-i murmured , vainly seeking consolation in [[her]1386-i father]3496-her father 's eye . "[99-amherst] [He]99-amherst had reddened under [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's thrust , but [his]99-amherst voice betrayed no irritation , and [Bessy]125-bessy rewarded [him]99-amherst with an unexpected beam of sympathy : [she]1388-she was always up in arms at the least sign of [his]99-amherst being treated as [an intruder]1389-an intruder . " [I]1388-she am sure , [papa]4059-papa , "[1388-she] [she]1388-she said , a little tremulously , " that poor [Richard]109-westmore , though [he]109-westmore knew [I]1388-she was not clever , felt [he]109-westmore could trust [me]1388-she to take the best advice---- "[1388-she] " Ah , that 's all [we]4060-we ask of [you]1388-she , [[my]3496-her father child]4061-my child ! "[3496-her father] [[her]1388-she father]3496-her father sighed , while [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy drily interposed : " [We]4060-we are merely losing time by this digression . "[125-bessy] [Amherst]99-amherst , as [he]99-amherst turned to answer , remembered with what ardent faith in [his]99-amherst powers of persuasion [he]99-amherst had responded to the same appeal three years earlier . [He]99-amherst had thought then that all [his]99-amherst cause needed was a hearing ; now [he]99-amherst knew that [the practical man]1391-the practical man 's readiness to let the idealist talk corresponds with [the busy parent]1392-the busy parent 's permission to destructive infancy to " run out and play . "[1393-they] [They]1393-they would let [him]99-amherst state [his]99-amherst case to [the four corners of [the earth]4009-the earth]1394-the four corners of the earth -- if only [he]99-amherst did not expect [them]1393-they to act on it ! It was [their]1393-they policy to let [him]99-amherst exhaust [himself]99-amherst in argument and exhortation , to listen to [him]99-amherst so politely and patiently that if [he]99-amherst failed to enforce [his]99-amherst ideas it should not be for lack of opportunity to expound them .... And the alternative struck [him]99-amherst as hardly less to be feared . Supposing that the incredible happened , that [his]99-amherst reasons prevailed with [[his]99-amherst wife]3350-his wife , and , through [her]3350-his wife , with [the others]620-the others -- at what cost would the victory be won ? Would [Bessy]125-bessy ever forgive [him]99-amherst for winning it ? And what would [his]99-amherst situation be , if it left [him]99-amherst in control of [Westmore]104-westmore but estranged from [[his]99-amherst wife]3350-his wife ? [He]99-amherst recalled suddenly a phrase [he]99-amherst had used that afternoon to [the dark - eyed girl at the garden - party]1399-the dark - eyed girl at the garden - party : " What risks [we]4062-we run when [we]4062-we scramble into the chariot of [the gods]3946-the gods ! "[99-amherst] And at the same instant [he]99-amherst heard [her]3350-his wife retort , and saw [her]3350-his wife fine gesture of defiance . How could [he]99-amherst ever have doubted that the thing was worth doing at whatever cost ? Something in [him]99-amherst -- some secret lurking element of weakness and evasion -- shrank out of sight in the light of [her]3350-his wife question : " Do _ [you]99-amherst _ act on that ? "[99-amherst] and the " God forbid ! "[99-amherst] [he]99-amherst had instantly flashed back to [her]3350-his wife . [He]99-amherst turned to [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy with [his]99-amherst answer . [Amherst]99-amherst knew that any large theoretical exposition of the case would be as much wasted on [the two men]712-the two men as on [[his]99-amherst wife]3350-his wife . To gain [his]99-amherst point [he]99-amherst must take only one step at a time , and it seemed to [him]99-amherst that the first thing needed at [Westmore]104-westmore was that [the hands]649-the hands should work and live under healthier conditions . To attain this , two important changes were necessary : the floor - space of [the mills]3324-the mills must be enlarged , and [the company]3366-the company must cease to rent out [tenements]926-tenements , and give [the operatives]3426-the operatives the opportunity to buy land for [themselves]3426-the operatives . Both these changes involved the upheaval of the existing order . Whenever [the Westmore mills]3336-the westmore mills had been enlarged , it had been for the sole purpose of increasing the revenues of [the company]3366-the company ; and now [Amherst]99-amherst asked that these revenues should be materially and permanently reduced . As to the suppression of the company tenement , such a measure struck at the roots of the baneful paternalism which was choking out every germ of initiative in [the workman]576-the workman . Once [the operatives]3426-the operatives had room to work in , and the hope of homes of [their]3426-the operatives own to go to when work was over , [Amherst]99-amherst was willing to trust to time for the satisfaction of [their]3426-the operatives other needs . [He]99-amherst believed that a sounder understanding of these needs would develop on both sides the moment [the employers]1411-the employers proved [their]1411-the employers good faith by the deliberate and permanent sacrifice of excessive gain to the well - being of [the employed]3417-the employed ; and once [the two]271-the two had learned to regard [each other]407-each other not as [antagonists]1415-antagonists but as [collaborators]1416-collaborators , a long step would have been taken toward a readjustment of the whole industrial relation . In regard to general and distant results , [Amherst]99-amherst tried not to be too sanguine , even in [his]99-amherst own thoughts . [His]99-amherst aim was to remedy the abuse nearest at hand , in the hope of thus getting gradually closer to the central evil ; and , had [his]99-amherst action been unhampered , [he]99-amherst would still have preferred the longer and more circuitous path of practical experiment to the sweeping adoption of a new industrial system . But [his]99-amherst demands , moderate as they were , assumed in [[his]99-amherst hearers]750-his hearers the consciousness of a moral claim superior to the obligation of making [one]3402-one 's business " pay "[99-amherst] ; and it was the futility of this assumption that chilled the arguments on [his]99-amherst lips , since in the orthodox creed of the business world it was a weakness and not a strength to be content with five per cent where ten was obtainable . Business was one thing , philanthropy another ; and [the enthusiasts who tried combining [them]1420-them]1419-the enthusiasts who tried combining them were usually reduced , after a brief flight , to paying fifty cents on the dollar , and handing over [their]1419-the enthusiasts who tried combining them stock to [a promoter presumably unhampered by humanitarian ideals]1421-a promoter presumably unhampered by humanitarian ideals . [Amherst]99-amherst knew that this was the answer with which [his]99-amherst plea would be met ; knew , moreover , that the plea was given a hearing simply because [[his]99-amherst judges]1422-his judges deemed it so pitiably easy to refute . But the knowledge , once [he]99-amherst had begun to speak , fanned [his]99-amherst argument to a white heat of pleading , since , with failure so plainly ahead , small concessions and compromises were not worth making . Reason would be wasted on all ; but eloquence might at least prevail with [Bessy]125-bessy .... * * * * * When , late that night , [he]99-amherst went [upstairs]1423-upstairs after long pacings of [the garden]1084-the garden , [he]99-amherst was surprised to see a light in [[her]1425-her room]1426-her room . [She]1425-her was not given to [midnight study]1427-midnight study , and fearing that [she]1425-her might be ill [he]99-amherst knocked at [her]1425-her door . There was no answer , and after a short pause [he]99-amherst turned the handle and entered . In [the great canopied Westmore couch]1428-the great canopied westmore couch , [her]1425-her arms flung upward and [her]1425-her hands clasped beneath [her]1425-her head , [she]1425-her lay staring fretfully at the globe of electric light which hung from the centre of the embossed and gilded ceiling . Seen thus , with the soft curves of throat and arms revealed , and [her]1425-her face childishly set in a cloud of loosened hair , [she]1425-her looked no older than [Cicely]167-cicely -- and , like [Cicely]167-cicely , inaccessible to grown - up arguments and the stronger logic of experience . It was a trick of [hers]1425-her , in such moods , to ignore any attempt to attract [her]1425-her notice ; and [Amherst]99-amherst was prepared for [her]1425-her remaining motionless as [he]99-amherst paused on the threshold and then advanced toward the middle of [the room]3355-the room . There had been a time when [he]99-amherst would have been exasperated by [her]1425-her pretense of not seeing [him]99-amherst , but a deep weariness of spirit now dulled [him]99-amherst to these surface pricks . " [I]99-amherst was afraid [you]1425-her were not well when [I]99-amherst saw the light burning , "[99-amherst] [he]99-amherst began . " Thank [you]99-amherst -- [I]1425-her am quite well , "[1425-her] [she]1425-her answered in a colourless voice , without turning [her]1425-her head . " Shall [I]1425-her put it out , then ? [You]1425-her ca n't sleep with such a glare in [your]1425-her eyes . "[1425-her] " [I]1425-her should not sleep at any rate ; and [I]1425-her hate to lie awake in the dark . "[1425-her] " Why should n't [you]1425-her sleep ? "[99-amherst] [He]99-amherst moved nearer , looking down compassionately on [her]1425-her perturbed face and struggling lips . [She]1425-her lay silent a moment ; then [she]1425-her faltered out : " B -- because [I]1425-her 'm so unhappy ! "[1425-her] The pretense of indifference was swept away by a gush of childish sobs as [she]1425-her flung over on [her]1425-her side and buried [her]1425-her face in the embroidered pillows . [Amherst]99-amherst , bending down , laid a quieting hand on [her]1425-her shoulder . " Bessy---- "[1425-her] [She]1425-her sobbed on . [He]99-amherst seated [himself]99-amherst silently in the arm - chair beside the bed , and kept [his]99-amherst soothing hold on [her]1425-her shoulder . The time had come when [he]99-amherst went through all these accustomed acts of pacification as mechanically as [a nurse]254-a nurse soothing [a fretful child]1431-a fretful child . And once [he]99-amherst had thought [her]1425-her weeping eloquent ! [He]99-amherst looked about [him]99-amherst at [the spacious room]1432-the spacious room , with [its]1432-the spacious room heavy hangings of damask and the thick velvet carpet which stifled [his]99-amherst steps . Everywhere were the graceful tokens of [her]1425-her presence -- the vast lace - draped toilet - table strewn with silver and crystal , the embroidered muslin cushions heaped on [the lounge]1433-the lounge , the little rose - lined slippers [she]1425-her had just put off , the lace wrapper , with a scent of violets in its folds , which [he]99-amherst had pushed aside when [he]99-amherst sat down beside [her]1425-her ; and [he]99-amherst remembered how full of a mysterious and intimate charm these things had once appeared to [him]99-amherst . It was characteristic that the remembrance made [him]99-amherst more patient with [her]1425-her now . Perhaps , after all , it was [his]99-amherst failure that [she]1425-her was crying over .... " Do n't be unhappy . [You]1425-her decided as seemed best to [you]1425-her , "[99-amherst] [he]99-amherst said . [She]1425-her pressed [her]1425-her handkerchief against [her]1425-her lips , still keeping [her]1425-her head averted . " But [I]1425-her hate all these arguments and disputes . "[1425-her] " Was that troubling [you]1425-her ? " [I]1440-a god _ do _ feel sure [you]1438-you know -- about the treatment of the hands and all that ; but [you]1438-you said [yourself]1438-you once -- the first time [we]4072-we ever talked about [Westmore]104-westmore -- that the business part was different---- "[1440-a god] Here it was again , the ancient ineradicable belief in the separable body and soul ! " [I]1446-her 'll do anything ... "[1446-her] [she]1446-her sobbed ; and in the darkness [he]99-amherst held [her]1446-her to [him]99-amherst and hated [his]99-amherst victory . [XIII MRS . ANSELL]178-mrs. ansell was engaged in what [she]178-mrs. ansell called picking up threads . [She]178-mrs. ansell had been abroad for the summer -- had , in , fact , transferred [herself]178-mrs. ansell but a few hours earlier from [her]178-mrs. ansell returning steamer to [the little station at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]1447-the little station at lynbrook -- and was now , in the bright September afternoon , which left [her]178-mrs. ansell in sole possession of [the terrace of [Lynbrook House]34-lynbrook house]1448-the terrace of lynbrook house , using that pleasant eminence as a point of observation from which to gather up some of the loose ends of history dropped at [her]178-mrs. ansell departure . It might have been thought that the actual scene out - spread below [her]178-mrs. ansell -- [the descending gardens]1449-the descending gardens , [the tennis - courts]1450-the tennis - courts , [the farm - lands]1451-the farm - lands sloping away to [the blue sea]1452-the blue sea - like shimmer of [the Hempstead plains]491-the hempstead plains -- offered , at the moment , little material for [her]178-mrs. ansell purpose ; but that was to view [them]1454-them with a superficial eye . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's trained gaze was , for example , greatly enlightened by the fact that [the tennis - courts]1450-the tennis - courts were fringed by [a group of people indolently watchful of the figures agitating [themselves]1456-a group of people indolently watchful of the figures agitating themselves about the nets about the nets]1456-a group of people indolently watchful of the figures agitating themselves about the nets ; and that , as [she]178-mrs. ansell turned [her]178-mrs. ansell head toward [the entrance avenue]1457-the entrance avenue , the receding view of [a station omnibus]1458-a station omnibus , followed by [a luggage - cart]1459-a luggage - cart , announced that [more guests]1460-more guests were to be added to [those who had almost taxed to its limits the expansibility of the luncheon]1461-those who had almost taxed to its limits the expansibility of the luncheon - table . All this , to the initiated eye , was full of suggestion ; but its significance was as nothing to that presented by the approach of two figures which , as [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell watched , detached [themselves]1462-themselves from the cluster about [the tennis - ground]1463-the tennis - ground and struck , obliquely and at a desultory pace , across [the lawn]1159-the lawn toward [the terrace]1465-the terrace . [The figures]1466-the figures -- those of [a slight young man with stooping shoulders]1467-a slight young man with stooping shoulders , and of [a lady equally youthful but slenderly erect]1468-a lady equally youthful but slenderly erect -- moved forward in absorbed communion , as if unconscious of [their]1466-the figures surroundings and indefinite as to [their]1466-the figures direction , till , on the brink of the wide grass terrace just below [[[their]1466-the figures observer]1469-their observer 's parapet]1470-their observer 's parapet , [they]1466-the figures paused a moment and faced [each other]407-each other in closer speech . This interchange of words , though brief in measure of time , lasted long enough to add a vivid strand to [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's thickening skein ; then , on a gesture of [the lady]3448-the lady 's , and without signs of formal leave - taking , [the young man]426-the young man struck into a path which regained [the entrance avenue]1457-the entrance avenue , while [[his]426-the young man companion]284-his companion , quickening [her]284-his companion pace , crossed [the grass terrace]1476-the grass terrace and mounted the wide stone steps sweeping up to [the house]311-the house . These brought [her]284-his companion out on [the upper terrace]1478-the upper terrace a few yards from [[Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's post]1479-mrs. ansell 's post , and exposed [her]284-his companion , unprepared , to the full beam of welcome which [that lady]1480-that lady 's rapid advance threw like a searchlight across [her]284-his companion path . " [Dear Miss Brent]97-miss brent ! [I]178-mrs. ansell was just wondering how it was that [I]178-mrs. ansell had n't seen [you]403-the girl before . "[178-mrs. ansell] [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , as [she]178-mrs. ansell spoke , drew [the girl]403-the girl 's hand into a long soft clasp which served to keep [them]1482-them confronted while [she]178-mrs. ansell delicately groped for whatever thread the encounter seemed to proffer . "[120-mr. langhope] [XIV JUSTINE BRENT]100-justine , [her]100-justine household duties discharged , had gone [upstairs]1423-upstairs to [[her]100-justine room]1426-her room , [a little turret chamber projecting above [the wide terrace below]1510-the wide terrace below , from which the sounds of lively intercourse now rose increasingly to [her]100-justine window]1509-a little turret chamber projecting above the wide terrace below , from which the sounds of lively intercourse now rose increasingly to her window . [Bessy]125-bessy , [she]100-justine knew , would have preferred to have [her]100-justine remain with the party from whom these evidences of gaiety proceeded . [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst had grown to depend on [[her]117-mrs. amherst friend]706-her friend 's nearness . [She]117-mrs. amherst liked to feel that [Justine]100-justine 's quick hand and eye were always in waiting on [her]100-justine impulses , prompt to interpret and execute them without any exertion of [her]100-justine own . [Bessy]125-bessy combined great zeal in the pursuit of sport -- a tireless passion for the saddle , the golf - course , the tennis - court -- with an almost oriental inertia within doors , an indolence of body and brain that made [her]100-justine shrink from the active obligations of hospitality , though [she]100-justine had grown to depend more and more on the distractions of [a crowded house]1512-a crowded house . But [Justine]100-justine , though grateful , and anxious to show [her]100-justine gratitude , was unwilling to add to [her]100-justine other duties that of joining in the amusements of the house - party . [She]100-justine made no pretense of effacing [herself]100-justine when [she]100-justine thought [her]100-justine presence might be useful -- but , even if [she]100-justine had cared for the diversions in favour at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , a certain unavowed pride would have kept [her]100-justine from participating in them on the same footing with [[Bessy]125-bessy 's guests]1513-bessy 's guests . [She]100-justine was not in the least ashamed of [her]100-justine position in [the household]1514-the household , but [she]100-justine chose that [every one else]4001-every one else should be aware of it , that [she]100-justine should not for an instant be taken for [one of [the nomadic damsels who form [the camp - followers of the great army of pleasure]1518-the camp - followers of the great army of pleasure]1517-the nomadic damsels who form the camp - followers of the great army of pleasure]1516-one of the nomadic damsels who form the camp - followers of the great army of pleasure . Yet even on this point [her]100-justine sensitiveness was not exaggerated . Adversity has a deft hand at gathering loose strands of impulse into character , and [Justine]100-justine 's early contact with different phases of experience had given [her]100-justine a fairly clear view of life in the round , what might be called a sound working topography of its relative heights and depths . [She]100-justine was not seriously afraid of being taken for anything but what [she]100-justine really was , and still less did [she]100-justine fear to become , by force of propinquity and suggestion , the kind of being for whom [she]100-justine might be temporarily taken . When , at [Bessy]125-bessy 's summons , [she]100-justine had joined [the latter at [[her]100-justine camp in [the Adirondacks]35-the adirondacks]1520-her camp in the adirondacks]1519-the latter at her camp in the adirondacks , the transition from a fatiguing " case "[125-bessy] at [Hanaford]1-hanaford to a life in which sylvan freedom was artfully blent with the most studied personal luxury , had come as a delicious refreshment to body and brain . [She]100-justine was weary , for the moment , of ugliness , pain and hard work , and life seemed to recover its meaning under the aspect of a graceful leisure . [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook also , whither [she]100-justine had been persuaded to go with [Bessy]125-bessy at the end of [[their]1521-their woodland cure]1522-their woodland cure , had at first amused and interested [her]100-justine . [The big house on [its]1523-the big house on its spreading terraces , with windows looking over bright gardens to the hazy distances of the plains spreading terraces , with windows looking over [bright gardens]1524-bright gardens to the hazy distances of [the plains]788-the plains]1523-the big house on its spreading terraces , with windows looking over bright gardens to the hazy distances of the plains , seemed a haven of harmless ease and gaiety . [Justine]100-justine was sensitive to the finer graces of luxurious living , to the warm lights on old pictures and bronzes , the soft mingling of tints in faded rugs and panellings of time - warmed oak . And the existence to which this background formed a setting seemed at first to have the same decorative qualities . It was pleasant , for once , to be among [people whose chief business was to look well and take life lightly]1526-people whose chief business was to look well and take life lightly , and [Justine]100-justine 's own buoyancy of nature won [her]100-justine immediate access among [the amiable persons who peopled [Bessy]125-bessy 's week - end parties]1527-the amiable persons who peopled bessy 's week - end parties . If [they]1527-the amiable persons who peopled bessy 's week - end parties had only abounded a little more in [their]1527-the amiable persons who peopled bessy 's week - end parties own line [she]100-justine might have succumbed to [their]1527-the amiable persons who peopled bessy 's week - end parties spell . But it seemed to [her]100-justine that [they]1527-the amiable persons who peopled bessy 's week - end parties missed the poetry of [their]1527-the amiable persons who peopled bessy 's week - end parties situation , transacting [their]1527-the amiable persons who peopled bessy 's week - end parties pleasures with the dreary method and shortness of view of a race tethered to the ledger . Even the verbal flexibility which had made [her]100-justine feel that [she]100-justine was in a world of freer ideas , soon revealed itself as a form of flight from them , in which the race was distinctly to the swift ; and [Justine]100-justine 's phase of passive enjoyment passed with the return of [her]100-justine physical and mental activity . [She]100-justine was [a creature tingling with energy]1528-a creature tingling with energy , a little fleeting particle of the power that moves the sun and the other stars , and the deadening influences of the life at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook roused these tendencies to greater intensity , as [a suffocated person]1529-a suffocated person will suddenly develop abnormal strength in the struggle for air . [She]100-justine did not , indeed , regret having come . [She]100-justine was glad to be with [Bessy]125-bessy , partly because of the childish friendship which had left such deep traces in [her]100-justine lonely heart , and partly because what [she]100-justine had seen of [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend 's situation stirred in [her]100-justine all the impulses of sympathy and service ; but the idea of continuing in such a life , of sinking into any of the positions of semi - dependence that [an adroit and handsome girl]1531-an adroit and handsome girl may create for [herself]1531-an adroit and handsome girl in [[a fashionable woman]1532-a fashionable woman 's train]1533-a fashionable woman 's train -- this possibility never presented itself to [Justine]100-justine till [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , that afternoon , had put it into words . And to hear it was to revolt from it with all the strength of [her]100-justine inmost nature . The thought of the future troubled [her]100-justine , not so much materially -- for [she]100-justine had a light bird - like trust in [the morrow]1534-the morrow 's fare -- but because [her]100-justine own tendencies seemed to have grown less clear , because [she]100-justine could not rest in them for guidance as [she]100-justine had once done . The renewal of bodily activity had not brought back [her]100-justine faith in [her]100-justine calling : [her]100-justine work had lost the light of consecration . [She]100-justine no longer felt [herself]100-justine predestined to nurse the sick for the rest of [her]100-justine life , and in [her]100-justine inexperience [she]100-justine reproached [herself]100-justine with this instability . Youth and womanhood were in fact crying out in [her]100-justine for [their]1535-they individual satisfaction ; but instincts as deep - seated protected [her]100-justine from even a momentary illusion as to the nature of this demand . [She]100-justine wanted happiness , and a life of [her]100-justine own , as passionately as young flesh - and - blood had ever wanted them ; but [they]1535-they must come bathed in the light of imagination and penetrated by the sense of larger affinities . [She]100-justine could not conceive of shutting [herself]100-justine into a little citadel of personal well - being while the great tides of existence rolled on unheeded outside . Whether [they]1535-they swept treasure to [her]100-justine feet , or strewed [her]100-justine life with wreckage , [she]100-justine felt , even now ; that [her]100-justine place was there , on [the banks]1536-the banks , in sound and sight of the great current ; and just in proportion as the scheme of life at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook succeeded in shutting out all sense of that vaster human consciousness , so did its voice speak more thrillingly within [her]100-justine . Somewhere , [she]100-justine felt -- but , alas ! still out of reach -- was the life [she]100-justine longed for , a life in which high chances of doing should be mated with the finer forms of enjoying . But what title had [she]100-justine to a share in such an existence ? Why , none but [her]100-justine sense of what it was worth -- and what did that count for , in a world which used all [its]1537-its resources to barricade itself against all its opportunities ? [She]100-justine knew there were [girls who sought , by what is called a " good "[1538-girls who sought , by what is called a " good " marriage] marriage]1538-girls who sought , by what is called a " good " marriage , an escape into [the outer world]1539-the outer world , of doing and thinking -- utilizing an empty brain and full pocket as the key to [these envied fields]1540-these envied fields . Some such chance the life at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook seemed likely enough to offer -- [one]3402-one is not , at [Justine]100-justine 's age and with [her]100-justine penetration , any more blind to the poise of [one]3402-one 's head than to the turn of one 's ideas ; but here the subtler obstacles of taste and pride intervened . Not even [Bessy]125-bessy 's transparent manoeuvrings , [her]100-justine tender solicitude for [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend 's happiness , could for a moment weaken [Justine]100-justine 's resistance . If [she]100-justine must marry without love -- and this was growing conceivable to [her]100-justine -- [she]100-justine must at least merge [her]100-justine craving for personal happiness in some view of life in harmony with [hers]100-justine . "[170-bessy] [She]170-bessy spoke with a bitterness that issued strangely from [her]170-bessy lips . [The girl]403-the girl , at first , had tried to defend [herself]403-the girl from these scarcely - veiled confidences , distasteful enough in [themselves]1549-themselves , and placing [her]403-the girl , if [she]403-the girl listened , in an attitude of implied disloyalty to [the man under whose roof they were spoken]1550-the man under whose roof they were spoken . But a precocious experience of life had taught [her]403-the girl that emotions too strong for the nature containing them turn , by some law of spiritual chemistry , into a rankling poison ; and [she]403-the girl had therefore resigned [herself]403-the girl to serving as a kind of outlet for [Bessy]170-bessy 's pent - up discontent . It was not that [[her]403-the girl friend]706-her friend 's grievance appealed to [her]403-the girl personal sympathies ; [she]403-the girl had learned enough of the situation to give [her]403-the girl moral assent unreservedly to the other side . But it was characteristic of [Justine]100-justine that where [she]100-justine sympathized least [she]100-justine sometimes pitied most . Like [all quick spirits]1552-all quick spirits [she]100-justine was often intolerant of dulness ; yet when the intolerance passed it left a residue of compassion for the very incapacity at which [she]100-justine chafed . It seemed to [her]100-justine that the tragic crises in wedded life usually turned on the stupidity of [one of [the two concerned]1554-the two concerned]1553-one of the two concerned ; and of [the two victims of such a catastrophe]1555-the two victims of such a catastrophe [she]100-justine felt most for [the one whose limitations had probably brought it about]1556-the one whose limitations had probably brought it about . After all , there could be no imprisonment as cruel as that of being bounded by a hard small nature . Not to be penetrable at all points to the shifting lights , the wandering music of [the world]259-the world -- [she]100-justine could imagine no physical disability as cramping as that . How the little parched soul , in solitary confinement for life , must pine and dwindle in its blind cranny of self - love ! To be one 's self wide open to the currents of life does not always contribute to an understanding of narrower natures ; but in [Justine]100-justine the personal emotions were enriched and deepened by a sense of participation in all that the world about [her]100-justine was doing , suffering and enjoying ; and this sense found expression in the instinct of ministry and solace . [She]100-justine was by nature [a redresser]1558-a redresser , [a restorer]1559-a restorer ; and in [her]100-justine work , as [she]100-justine had once told [Amherst]170-bessy , the longing to help and direct , to hasten on by personal intervention time 's slow and clumsy processes , had often been in conflict with the restrictions imposed by [her]100-justine profession . But [she]100-justine had no idle desire to probe the depths of other lives ; and where there seemed no hope of serving [she]100-justine shrank from fruitless confidences . [She]100-justine was beginning to feel this to be the case with [Bessy Amherst]170-bessy . To touch [the rock]1560-the rock was not enough , if there were but a few drops within it ; yet in [this barrenness]1561-this barrenness lay the pathos of the situation -- and after all , may not the scanty spring be fed from a fuller current ? " [I]100-justine 'm not sure about that , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said , answering [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend 's last words after a deep pause of deliberation . " [I]100-justine mean about its being so pleasant to be found interesting . [I]100-justine 'm sure the passive part is always the dull one : life has been a great deal more thrilling since [we]4172-we found out that [we]4172-we revolved about the sun , instead of sitting still and fancying that all the planets were dancing attendance on [us]4172-we . After all , they were _ not _ ; and it 's rather humiliating to think how the morning stars must have laughed together about it ! "[100-justine] There was no self - complacency in [Justine]100-justine 's eagerness to help . It was far easier for [her]100-justine to express it in action than in counsel , to grope for the path with [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend than to point the way to it ; and when [she]100-justine had to speak [she]100-justine took refuge in figures to escape the pedantry of appearing to advise . " [A great many people]4184-a great many people go through the craze for philanthropy-- "[117-mrs. amherst] [she]117-mrs. amherst began in the tone of mature experience ; but [Justine]100-justine interrupted [her]117-mrs. amherst with a laugh . " Philanthropy ? [I]117-mrs. amherst 'm not philanthropic . [I]117-mrs. amherst do n't think [I]117-mrs. amherst ever felt inclined to do good in the abstract -- any more than to do ill ! [I]117-mrs. amherst ca n't remember that [I]117-mrs. amherst ever planned out a course of conduct in [my]117-mrs. amherst life . It 's only , "[117-mrs. amherst] [she]117-mrs. amherst went on , with a puzzled frown , as if honestly trying to analyze [her]117-mrs. amherst motives , " it 's only that [I]117-mrs. amherst 'm so fatally interested in [people]3450-people that before [I]117-mrs. amherst know it [I]117-mrs. amherst 've slipped into [their]3450-people skins ; and then , of course , if anything goes wrong with [them]3450-people , it 's just as if it had gone wrong with [me]117-mrs. amherst ; and [I]117-mrs. amherst ca n't help trying to rescue [myself]117-mrs. amherst from _ [their]3450-people _ troubles ! [I]117-mrs. amherst suppose it 's what [you]4186-you 'd call meddling -- and so should [I]117-mrs. amherst , if [I]117-mrs. amherst could only remember that [the other people]4187-the other people were not [myself]117-mrs. amherst ! "[117-mrs. amherst] [Bessy]170-bessy received this with the mild tolerance of superior wisdom . Once safe on the tried ground of traditional authority , [she]170-bessy always felt [herself]170-bessy [Justine]100-justine 's superior . " That 's all very well now -- [you]4186-you see the romantic side of it , "[170-bessy] [she]170-bessy said , as if humouring [[her]170-bessy friend]706-her friend 's vagaries . " But in time [you]4186-you 'll want something else ; [you]4186-you 'll want [a husband]4188-a husband and [children]3598-children -- a life of [your]4186-you own . And then [you]4186-you 'll have to be more practical . It 's ridiculous to pretend that comfort and money do n't make a difference . And if [you]4186-you married [a rich man]4190-a rich man , just think what a lot of good [you]4186-you could do ! [Westy]113-westy will be very well off -- and [I]170-bessy 'm sure [he]113-westy 'd let [you]4186-you endow [hospitals]4191-hospitals and things . Think how interesting it would be to build [a ward in [the very hospital]4193-the very hospital where [you]4186-you 'd been [a nurse]254-a nurse]4192-a ward in the very hospital where you 'd been a nurse ! [I]170-bessy read something like that in a novel the other day -- it was beautifully described . [All the nurses and doctors that [the heroine]4196-the heroine had worked with]4195-all the nurses and doctors that the heroine had worked with were there to receive [her]4196-the heroine ... and [[her]4196-the heroine little boy]4197-her little boy went about and gave toys to [the crippled children]4198-the crippled children .... "[170-bessy] If [the speaker]1483-the speaker 's concluding instance hardly produced the effect [she]1483-the speaker had intended , it was perhaps only because [Justine]100-justine 's attention had been arrested by the earlier part of the argument . It was strange to have marriage urged on [her]100-justine by [a woman who had twice failed to find happiness in it]1568-a woman who had twice failed to find happiness in it -- strange , and yet how vivid a sign that , even to a nature absorbed in its personal demands , not happiness but completeness is the inmost craving ! " A life of [your]4199-your own"--that[170-bessy] was what even [Bessy]170-bessy , in [her]170-bessy obscure way , felt to be best worth suffering for . And how was a spirit like [Justine]100-justine 's , thrilling with youth and sympathy , to conceive of an isolated existence as the final answer to that craving ? A life circumscribed by [one]3402-one 's own poor personal consciousness would not be life at all -- far better the " adventure of [the diver]4200-the diver "[170-bessy] than the shivering alone on [the bank]1030-the bank ! [Bessy]170-bessy , reading encouragement in [her]170-bessy silence , returned [her]170-bessy hand - clasp with an affectionate pressure . XV WHEN the door closed on [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst a resolve which had taken shape in [Justine]100-justine 's mind during [their]1572-their talk together made [her]100-justine seat [herself]100-justine at [her]100-justine writing - table , where , after a moment 's musing over [her]100-justine suspended pen , [she]100-justine wrote and addressed a hurried note . This business despatched , [she]100-justine put on [her]100-justine hat and jacket , and letter in hand passed down [the corridor]1573-the corridor from [[her]100-justine room]1426-her room , and descended to [the entrance - hall below]1575-the entrance - hall below . [She]100-justine might have consigned [her]100-justine missive to the post - box which conspicuously tendered its services from a table near the door ; but to do so would delay the letter 's despatch till morning , and [she]100-justine felt a sudden impatience to see it start . The tumult on [the terrace]1465-the terrace had transferred itself within doors , and as [Justine]100-justine went down [the stairs]1577-the stairs [she]100-justine heard the click of cues from [the billiard - room]1578-the billiard - room , the talk and laughter of [belated bridge - players]1579-belated bridge - players , the movement of [servants]1580-servants gathering up tea - cups and mending fires . [She]100-justine had hoped to find [the hall]505-the hall empty , but the sight of [Westy Gaines]113-westy 's figure looming watchfully on the threshold of [the smoking - room]1582-the smoking - room gave [her]100-justine , at the last bend of the stairs , a little start of annoyance . [He]113-westy would want to know where [she]100-justine was going , [he]113-westy would offer to go with [her]100-justine , and it would take some time and not a little emphasis to make [him]113-westy understand that [his]113-westy society was not desired . This was the thought that flashed through [Justine]100-justine 's mind as [she]100-justine reached [the landing]1583-the landing ; but the next moment it gave way to a contradictory feeling . [Westy Gaines]113-westy was not alone in [the hall]505-the hall . From under [the stairway]1585-the stairway rose the voices of a group ensconced in that popular retreat about a chess - board ; and as [Justine]100-justine reached the last turn of the stairs [she]100-justine perceived that [Mason Winch]184-mason winch , [an earnest youth with advanced views on political economy]1586-an earnest youth with advanced views on political economy , was engaged , to the diversion of a circle of [spectators]1587-spectators , in teaching [the Telfer girls]185-the telfer girls chess . The futility of trying to fix the spasmodic attention of [this effervescent couple]1588-this effervescent couple , and [[their]1588-this effervescent couple instructor]1589-their instructor 's grave unconsciousness of the fact , constituted , for [the lookers - on , the peculiar diversion of the scene]1590-the lookers - on , the peculiar diversion of the scene . It was of course inevitable that [young Winch]184-mason winch , on [his]184-mason winch arrival at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , should have succumbed at once to the tumultuous charms of the Telfer manner , which was equally attractive to [inarticulate youth]1591-inarticulate youth and to tired and talked - out middle - age ; but that [he]184-mason winch should have perceived no resistance in [their]1588-this effervescent couple minds to the deliberative processes of the game of chess , was , even to [the Telfers]186-the telfers [themselves]186-the telfers , a source of unmitigated gaiety . Nothing seemed to [them]1588-this effervescent couple funnier than that [any one]3517-any one should credit [them]1588-this effervescent couple with any mental capacity ; and [they]1588-this effervescent couple had inexhaustibly amusing ways of drawing out and showing off [each other]407-each other 's ignorance . It was on this scene that [Westy]113-westy 's appreciative eyes had been fixed till [Justine]100-justine 's appearance drew them to [herself]100-justine . [He]113-westy pronounced [her]100-justine name joyfully , and moved forward to greet [her]100-justine ; but as [their]1588-this effervescent couple hands met [she]100-justine understood that [he]113-westy did not mean to press [his]113-westy company upon [her]100-justine . Under the eye of [the Lynbrook circle]1594-the lynbrook circle [he]113-westy was [chary of marked demonstrations]1595-chary of marked demonstrations , and even [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst 's approval could not , at such moments , bridge over the gap between [himself]113-westy and the object of [his]113-westy attentions . [A Gaines]113-westy was [a Gaines in the last analysis]1596-a gaines in the last analysis , and apart from any pleasing accident of personality ; but what was [Miss Brent]97-miss brent but the transient vehicle of those graces which [Providence]187-providence has provided for the delectation of [the privileged sex]1597-the privileged sex ? These influences were visible in the temperate warmth of [Westy]113-westy 's manner , and in [his]113-westy way of keeping a backward eye on the mute interchange of comment about the chess - board . At another time [his]113-westy embarrassment would have amused [Justine]100-justine ; but the feelings stirred by [her]100-justine talk with [Bessy]170-bessy had not subsided , and [she]100-justine recognized with a sting of mortification the resemblance between [her]100-justine view of [the Lynbrook set]1598-the lynbrook set and its estimate of [herself]100-justine . If [[Bessy]170-bessy 's friends]1599-bessy 's friends were negligible to [her]100-justine [she]100-justine was almost non - existent to [them]1599-bessy 's friends ; and , as against [herself]100-justine , [they]1599-bessy 's friends were overwhelmingly provided with tangible means of proving [their]1599-bessy 's friends case . Such considerations , at a given moment , may prevail decisively even with a nature armed against [them]1599-bessy 's friends by insight and irony ; and the mere fact that [Westy Gaines]113-westy did not mean to join [her]100-justine , and that [he]113-westy was withheld from doing so by the invisible pressure of the Lynbrook standards , had the effect of precipitating [Justine]100-justine 's floating intentions . If anything farther had been needed to hasten this result , it would have been accomplished by the sound of footsteps which , over - taking [her]100-justine a dozen yards from [the house]311-the house , announced [[her]100-justine admirer]1601-her admirer 's impetuous if tardy pursuit . The act of dismissing [him]113-westy , though it took but a word and was effected with a laugh , left [her]100-justine pride quivering with a hurt the more painful because [she]100-justine would not acknowledge it . That [she]100-justine should waste a moment 's resentment on the conduct of [a person so unimportant as poor [Westy]113-westy]1602-a person so unimportant as poor westy , showed [her]100-justine in a flash the intrinsic falseness of [her]100-justine position at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . [She]100-justine saw that to disdain the life about [her]100-justine had not kept [her]100-justine intact from it ; and the knowledge made [her]100-justine feel anew the need of some strong decentralizing influence , some purifying influx of emotion and activity . [She]100-justine had walked on quickly through the clear October twilight , which was still saturated with the after - glow of a vivid sunset ; and a few minutes brought [her]100-justine to [the village]1603-the village stretching along [the turnpike beyond the [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook gates]1604-the turnpike beyond the lynbrook gates . [The new post - office]1605-the new post - office dominated [the row of [shabby houses]1607-shabby houses and " stores "[100-justine] set disjointedly under reddening maples , and [its]1605-the new post - office arched doorway formed the centre of [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook 's evening intercourse]1606-the row of shabby houses and " stores " set disjointedly under reddening maples , and its arched doorway formed the centre of lynbrook 's evening intercourse . [Justine]100-justine , hastening toward the knot of loungers on the threshold , had no consciousness of anything outside of [her]100-justine own thoughts ; and as [she]100-justine mounted the steps [she]100-justine was surprised to see [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant detach [himself]165-wyant from [the group]666-the group and advance to meet [her]100-justine . " May [I]165-wyant post [your]100-justine letter ? "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant asked , lifting [his]165-wyant hat . [His]165-wyant gesture uncovered the close - curling hair of a small delicately - finished head just saved from effeminacy by the vigorous jut of heavy eye - brows meeting above full grey eyes . The eyes again , at first sight , might have struck one as too expressive , or as expressing things too purely decorative for the purposes of [a young country doctor with a growing practice]1609-a young country doctor with a growing practice ; but this estimate was corrected by an unexpected abruptness in [their owner]1222-their owner 's voice and manner . Perhaps the final impression produced on [a close observer]1611-a close observer by [Dr. Stephen Wyant]165-wyant would have been that the contradictory qualities of which [he]165-wyant was compounded had not yet been brought into equilibrium by the hand of time . [Justine]100-justine , in reply to [his]165-wyant question , had drawn back a step , slipping [her]100-justine letter into the breast of [her]100-justine jacket . " That is hardly worth while , since it was addressed to [you]165-wyant , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine answered with a slight smile as [she]100-justine turned to descend [the post - office steps]1612-the post - office steps . " [You]100-justine 've written to say that [I]165-wyant may come tomorrow ? "[165-wyant] [Justine]100-justine hesitated . " Yes , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said at length . " Good God ! "[1615-they] [They]1615-they had begun to walk onward as [they]1615-they talked , but at this [she]100-justine halted . " Please do n't take that tone . [I]100-justine dislike sentimentality ! "[100-justine] [she]100-justine exclaimed , with a tinge of imperiousness that was a surprise to [her]100-justine own ears . It was not the first time in the course of [her]100-justine friendship with [Stephen Wyant]165-wyant that [she]100-justine had been startled by this intervention of something within [her]100-justine that resisted and almost resented [his]165-wyant homage . When [they]1615-they were apart , [she]100-justine was conscious only of the community of interests and sympathies that had first drawn [them]1615-they together . Why was it then -- since [his]165-wyant looks were of the kind generally thought to stand [a suitor]1616-a suitor in good stead -- that whenever [they]1615-they had met of late [she]100-justine had been subject to these rushes of obscure hostility , the half - physical , half - moral shrinking from some indefinable element in [his]165-wyant nature against which [she]100-justine was constrained to defend [herself]100-justine by perpetual pleasantry and evasion ? To [Wyant]165-wyant , at any rate , the answer was not far to seek . "[165-wyant] " The key ? "[165-wyant] " [I]165-wyant have n't yet acquired the Lynbrook tone . [You]100-justine must make allowances for [my]165-wyant lack of opportunity . "[165-wyant] The retort on [Justine]100-justine 's lips dropped to silence , as though [his]165-wyant words had in fact brought an answer to [her]100-justine inward questioning . Could it be that [he]165-wyant was right -- that [her]100-justine shrinking from [him]165-wyant was the result of an increased sensitiveness to faults of taste that [she]100-justine would once have despised [herself]100-justine for noticing ? When [she]100-justine had first known [him]165-wyant , in [her]100-justine work at [St. Elizabeth]29-st. elizabeth 's some three years earlier , [his]165-wyant excesses of manner had seemed to [her]100-justine merely the boyish tokens of a richness of nature not yet controlled by experience . Though [Wyant]165-wyant was somewhat older than [herself]100-justine there had always been an element of protection in [her]100-justine feeling for [him]165-wyant , and it was perhaps this element which formed the real ground of [her]100-justine liking . It was , at any rate , uppermost as [she]100-justine returned , with a softened gleam of mockery : " Since [you]165-wyant are so sure of [my]100-justine answer [I]100-justine hardly know why [I]100-justine should see [you]165-wyant tomorrow . "[165-wyant] [They]1617-we had reached the point where , at [the farther edge of [the straggling settlement]1619-the straggling settlement]1618-the farther edge of the straggling settlement , [the tiled roof of [the railway - station]1621-the railway - station]1620-the tiled roof of the railway - station fronted [the post - office cupola]1622-the post - office cupola ; and the shriek of a whistle now reminded [Justine]100-justine that [the spot]1623-the spot was not propitious to private talk . "[100-justine] The words flashed a refracted light far down into the causes of [her]100-justine own uncertainty .
