" If [you]165-wyant do n't let [me]100-justine go [I]100-justine certainly am , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said ; and [he]165-wyant drew back , as if conscious of the uselessness of the struggle . [His]165-wyant submission , as usual , had a disarming effect on [her]100-justine irritation , and [she]100-justine held out [her]100-justine hand . " Come tomorrow at three , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said , [her]100-justine voice and manner suddenly seeming to give back the hope [she]100-justine had withheld from [him]165-wyant . [He]165-wyant seized on [her]100-justine hand with an inarticulate murmur ; but at the same moment a louder whistle and the thunder of [an approaching train]1624-an approaching train reminded [her]100-justine of the impossibility of prolonging the scene . [She]100-justine was ordinarily careless of appearances , but while [she]100-justine was [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst 's guest [she]100-justine did not care to be seen romantically loitering through the twilight with [Stephen Wyant]165-wyant ; and [she]100-justine freed [herself]100-justine with a quick goodbye . [He]165-wyant gave [her]100-justine a last look , hesitating and imploring ; then , in obedience to [her]100-justine gesture , [he]165-wyant turned away and strode off in the opposite direction . As soon as [he]165-wyant had left [her]100-justine [she]100-justine began to retrace [her]100-justine steps toward [Lynbrook House]34-lynbrook house ; but instead of traversing [the whole length of [the village]1603-the village]1625-the whole length of the village [she]100-justine passed through a turnstile in [the park fencing]1627-the park fencing , taking a more circuitous but quieter way [home]3405-home . [She]100-justine walked on slowly through the dusk , wishing to give [herself]100-justine time to think over [her]100-justine conversation with [Wyant]165-wyant . Now that [she]100-justine was alone again , it seemed to [her]100-justine that the part [she]100-justine had played had been both inconsistent and undignified . When [she]100-justine had written to [Wyant]165-wyant that [she]100-justine would see [him]165-wyant on the morrow [she]100-justine had done so with the clear understanding that [she]100-justine was to give , at that meeting , a definite answer to [his]165-wyant offer of marriage ; and during [her]100-justine talk with [Bessy]170-bessy [she]100-justine had suddenly , and , as it seemed to [her]100-justine , irrevocably , decided that the answer should be favourable . From the first days of [her]100-justine acquaintance with [Wyant]165-wyant [she]100-justine had appreciated [his]165-wyant intelligence and had been stimulated by [his]165-wyant zeal for [his]165-wyant work . [He]165-wyant had remained only six months at [Saint Elizabeth]58-saint elizabeth 's 's , and though [his]165-wyant feeling for [her]100-justine had even then been manifest , it had been kept from expression by the restraint of [their]1629-their professional relation , and by [her]100-justine absorption in [her]100-justine duties . It was only when [they]1629-their had met again at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook that [she]100-justine had begun to feel a personal interest in [him]165-wyant . [His]165-wyant youthful promise seemed nearer fulfillment than [she]100-justine had once thought possible , and the contrast [he]165-wyant presented to [the young men in [Bessy]170-bessy 's train]1630-the young men in bessy 's train was really all in [his]165-wyant favour . [He]165-wyant had gained in strength and steadiness without losing [his]165-wyant high flashes of enthusiasm ; and though , even now , [she]100-justine was not in love with [him]165-wyant , [she]100-justine began to feel that the union of [their]1629-their common interests might create a life full and useful enough to preclude the possibility of vague repinings . It would , at any rate , take [her]100-justine out of the stagnant circle of [her]100-justine present existence , and restore [her]100-justine to contact with the fruitful energies of life . All this had seemed quite clear when [she]100-justine wrote [her]100-justine letter ; why , then , had [she]100-justine not made use of [their]1629-their chance encounter to give [her]100-justine answer , instead of capriciously postponing it ? The act might have been that of [a self - conscious girl in [her]1631-a self - conscious girl in her teens teens]1631-a self - conscious girl in her teens ; but neither inexperience nor coquetry had prompted it . [She]100-justine had merely yielded to the spirit of resistance that [Wyant]165-wyant 's presence had of late aroused in [her]100-justine ; and the possibility that this resistance might be due to some sense of [his]165-wyant social defects , [his]165-wyant lack of measure and facility , was so humiliating that for a moment [she]100-justine stood still in the path , half - meaning to turn back and overtake him---- As [she]100-justine paused [she]100-justine was surprised to hear [a man]3349-a man 's step behind [her]100-justine ; and the thought that it might be [Wyant]165-wyant 's brought about another revulsion of feeling . What right had [he]165-wyant to pursue [her]100-justine in this way , to dog [her]100-justine steps even into [the Lynbrook grounds]1633-the lynbrook grounds ? [She]100-justine was sure that [his]165-wyant persistent attentions had already attracted the notice of [[Bessy]170-bessy 's visitors]1634-bessy 's visitors ; and that [he]165-wyant should thus force [himself]165-wyant on [her]100-justine after [her]100-justine dismissal seemed suddenly to make [their]1635-their whole relation ridiculous . [She]100-justine turned about to rebuke [him]165-wyant , and found [herself]100-justine face to face with [John Amherst]99-amherst . [XVI AMHERST]188-xvi amherst , on leaving [the train]1636-the train at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , had paused in doubt on [the empty platform]1637-the empty platform . [His]99-amherst return was unexpected , and [no carriage]1638-no carriage awaited [him]99-amherst ; but [he]99-amherst caught the signal of [the village cab - driver]1639-the village cab - driver 's ready whip . [Amherst]188-xvi amherst , however , felt a sudden desire to postpone the moment of arrival , and consigning [his]188-xvi amherst luggage to [the cab]1640-the cab [he]188-xvi amherst walked away toward the turnstile through which [Justine]100-justine had passed . In thus taking the longest way [home]3405-home [he]188-xvi amherst was yielding another point to [his]188-xvi amherst reluctance . [He]188-xvi amherst knew that at that hour [[his]188-xvi amherst wife]3350-his wife 's visitors might still be assembled in [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room , and [he]188-xvi amherst wished to avoid making [his]188-xvi amherst unannounced entrance among [them]1644-them . It was not till now that [he]188-xvi amherst felt the embarrassment of such an arrival . For some time past [he]188-xvi amherst had known that [he]188-xvi amherst ought to go back to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , but [he]188-xvi amherst had not known how to tell [Bessy]170-bessy that [he]188-xvi amherst was coming . Lack of habit made [him]188-xvi amherst inexpert in the art of easy transitions , and [his]188-xvi amherst inability to bridge over awkward gaps had often put [him]188-xvi amherst at a disadvantage with [[his]188-xvi amherst wife]3350-his wife and [[her]3350-his wife friends]1229-her friends . [He]188-xvi amherst had not yet learned the importance of observing the forms which made up the daily ceremonial of [their]1647-their lives , and at present there was just enough soreness between [himself]188-xvi amherst and [Bessy]170-bessy to make such observances more difficult than usual . There had been no open estrangement , but peace had been preserved at the cost of a slowly accumulated tale of grievances on both sides . Since [Amherst]170-bessy had won [his]188-xvi amherst point about the mills , the danger [he]188-xvi amherst had foreseen had been realized : [his]188-xvi amherst victory at [Westmore]104-westmore had been a defeat at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . It would be too crude to say that [[his]188-xvi amherst wife]3350-his wife had made [him]188-xvi amherst pay for [her]3350-his wife public concession by the private disregard of [his]188-xvi amherst wishes ; and if something of this sort had actually resulted , [his]188-xvi amherst sense of fairness told [him]188-xvi amherst that it was merely the natural reaction of a soft nature against the momentary strain of self - denial . At first [he]188-xvi amherst had been hardly aware of this consequence of [his]188-xvi amherst triumph . The joy of being able to work [his]188-xvi amherst will at [Westmore]104-westmore obscured all lesser emotions ; and [his]188-xvi amherst sentiment for [Bessy]170-bessy had long since shrunk into one of those shallow pools of feeling which a sudden tide might fill , but which could never again be the deep perennial spring from which [his]188-xvi amherst life was fed . The need of remaining continuously at [Hanaford]1-hanaford while the first changes were making had increased the strain of the situation . [He]188-xvi amherst had never expected that [Bessy]170-bessy would stay [there]3361-there with [him]188-xvi amherst -- had perhaps , at heart , hardly wished it -- and [her]170-bessy plan of going to [the Adirondacks]35-the adirondacks with [Miss Brent]97-miss brent seemed to [him]188-xvi amherst a satisfactory alternative to the European trip [she]170-bessy had renounced . [He]188-xvi amherst felt as relieved as though [some one]3457-some one had taken off [his]188-xvi amherst hands the task of amusing [a restless child]1651-a restless child , and [he]188-xvi amherst let [[his]188-xvi amherst wife]3350-his wife go without suspecting that the moment might be a decisive one between [them]1653-them . But it had not occurred to [Bessy]170-bessy that [any one]3517-any one could regard six weeks in [the Adirondacks]35-the adirondacks as an adequate substitute for a summer abroad . [She]170-bessy felt that [her]170-bessy sacrifice deserved recognition , and personal devotion was the only form of recognition which could satisfy [her]170-bessy . [She]170-bessy had expected [Amherst]170-bessy to join [her]170-bessy at [the camp]1655-the camp , but [he]188-xvi amherst did not come ; and when [she]170-bessy went back to [Long Island]8-long island [she]170-bessy did not stop to see [him]188-xvi amherst , though [Hanaford]164-hanaford lay in [her]170-bessy way . At the moment of [her]170-bessy return the work at [the mills]3324-the mills made it impossible for [him]188-xvi amherst to go to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ; and thus the weeks drifted on without [their]1657-their meeting . At last , urged by [[his]188-xvi amherst mother]396-his mother , [he]188-xvi amherst had gone down to [Long Island]8-long island for a night ; but though , on that occasion , [he]188-xvi amherst had announced [his]188-xvi amherst coming , [he]188-xvi amherst found [the house]311-the house full , and [the whole party]1660-the whole party except [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope in the act of starting off to a dinner in [the neighbourhood]1661-the neighbourhood . [He]188-xvi amherst was of course expected to go too , and [Bessy]170-bessy appeared hurt when [he]188-xvi amherst declared that [he]188-xvi amherst was too tired and preferred to remain with [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope ; but [she]170-bessy did not suggest staying at [home]3405-home [herself]170-bessy , and drove off in a mood of exuberant gaiety . [Amherst]170-bessy had been too busy all [his]188-xvi amherst life to know what intricacies of perversion a sentimental grievance may develop in an unoccupied mind , and [he]188-xvi amherst saw in [Bessy]170-bessy 's act only a sign of indifference . The next day [she]170-bessy complained to [him]188-xvi amherst of money difficulties , as though surprised that [her]170-bessy income had been suddenly cut down ; and when [he]188-xvi amherst reminded [her]170-bessy that [she]170-bessy had consented of [her]170-bessy own will to this temporary reduction , [she]170-bessy burst into tears and accused [him]188-xvi amherst of caring only for [Westmore]167-cicely . [He]188-xvi amherst went away exasperated by [her]170-bessy inconsequence , and bills from [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook continued to pour in on [him]188-xvi amherst . In the first days of [their]1663-their marriage , [Bessy]170-bessy had put [him]188-xvi amherst in charge of [[her]170-bessy exchequer]1664-her exchequer , and [she]170-bessy was too indolent -- and at heart perhaps too sensitive -- to ask [him]188-xvi amherst to renounce the charge . It was clear to [him]188-xvi amherst , therefore , how little [she]170-bessy was observing the spirit of [their]1663-their compact , and [his]188-xvi amherst mind was tormented by the anticipation of financial embarrassments . [He]188-xvi amherst wrote [her]170-bessy a letter of gentle expostulation , but in [her]170-bessy answer [she]170-bessy ignored [his]188-xvi amherst remonstrance ; and after that silence fell between [them]1663-their . The only way to break this silence was to return to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ; but now that [he]188-xvi amherst had come back , [he]188-xvi amherst did not know what step to take next . Something in the atmosphere of [[his]188-xvi amherst wife]3350-his wife 's existence seemed to paralyze [his]188-xvi amherst will - power . When all about [her]170-bessy spoke a language so different from [his]188-xvi amherst own , how could [he]188-xvi amherst hope to make [himself]188-xvi amherst heard ? [He]188-xvi amherst knew that [[her]170-bessy family]561-her family and [[her]170-bessy immediate friends]1667-her immediate friends -- [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , [the Gaineses]127-the gaineses , [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell and [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy -- far from being means of communication , were so many sentinels ready to raise the drawbridge and drop the portcullis at [his]188-xvi amherst approach . [They]1668-they were all in league to stifle the incipient feelings [he]188-xvi amherst had roused in [Bessy]125-bessy , to push [her]170-bessy back into the deadening routine of [her]170-bessy former life , and the only voice that might conceivably speak for [him]188-xvi amherst was [Miss Brent]97-miss brent 's . The " case "[97-miss brent] which , unexpectedly presented to [her]170-bessy by [one of [the Hope Hospital physicians]1670-the hope hospital physicians]1669-one of the hope hospital physicians , had detained [Justine]100-justine at [Hanaford]1-hanaford during the month of June , was the means of establishing a friendship between [herself]100-justine and [Amherst]170-bessy . [They]1671-they did not meet often , or get to know [each other]407-each other very well ; but [he]188-xvi amherst saw [her]100-justine occasionally at [[his]188-xvi amherst mother]396-his mother 's and at [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's , and once [he]188-xvi amherst took [her]100-justine out to [Westmore]104-westmore , to consult [her]100-justine about [the emergency hospital]1319-the emergency hospital which was to be included among the first improvements [there]3361-there . The expedition had been memorable to [both]502-both ; and when , some two weeks later , [Bessy]170-bessy wrote suggesting that [she]100-justine should take [Miss Brent]97-miss brent to [the Adirondacks]35-the adirondacks , it seemed to [Amherst]170-bessy that there was [no one whom [he]188-xvi amherst would rather have [[his]188-xvi amherst wife]3350-his wife choose as [[her]3350-his wife companion]296-her companion]1677-no one whom he would rather have his wife choose as her companion . [He]188-xvi amherst was much too busy at the time to cultivate or analyze [his]188-xvi amherst feeling for [Miss Brent]97-miss brent ; [he]188-xvi amherst rested vaguely in the thought of [her]97-miss brent , as of [the " nicest "[1680-the " nicest " girl he had ever met] girl [he]188-xvi amherst had ever met]1680-the " nicest " girl he had ever met , and was frankly pleased when accident brought [them]502-both together ; but the seeds left in both [their]502-both minds by these chance encounters had not yet begun to germinate . So unperceived had been [their]502-both gradual growth in intimacy that it was a surprise to [Amherst]170-bessy to find [himself]188-xvi amherst suddenly thinking of [her]97-miss brent as a means of communication with [[his]188-xvi amherst wife]3350-his wife ; but the thought gave [him]188-xvi amherst such encouragement that , when [he]188-xvi amherst saw [Justine]100-justine in the path before [him]188-xvi amherst [he]188-xvi amherst went toward [her]100-justine with unusual eagerness . [Justine]100-justine , on [her]100-justine part , felt an equal pleasure . [She]100-justine knew that [Bessy]170-bessy did not expect [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband , and that [his]188-xvi amherst prolonged absence had already been the cause of malicious comment at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ; and [she]100-justine caught at the hope that this sudden return might betoken a more favourable turn of affairs . " Oh , [I]100-justine am so glad to see [you]188-xvi amherst ! "[100-justine] [she]100-justine exclaimed ; and [her]100-justine tone had the effect of completing [his]188-xvi amherst reassurance , [his]188-xvi amherst happy sense that [she]100-justine would understand and help [him]188-xvi amherst . " [I]188-xvi amherst wanted to see [you]100-justine too , "[188-xvi amherst] [he]188-xvi amherst began confusedly ; then , conscious of the intimacy of the phrase , [he]188-xvi amherst added with a slight laugh : " The fact is , [I]188-xvi amherst 'm [a culprit]4207-a culprit looking for [a peace - maker]4208-a peace - maker . "[188-xvi amherst] " [A culprit]4207-a culprit ? "[188-xvi amherst] " [I]188-xvi amherst 've been so tied down at [the mills]3324-the mills that [I]188-xvi amherst did n't know , till yesterday , just when [I]188-xvi amherst could break away ; and in the hurry of leaving-- "[188-xvi amherst] [He]188-xvi amherst paused again , checked by the impossibility of uttering , to [the girl before [him]188-xvi amherst]1683-the girl before him , the little conventional falsehoods which formed the small currency of [Bessy]170-bessy 's circle . Not that any scruple of probity restrained [him]188-xvi amherst : in trifling matters [he]188-xvi amherst recognized the usefulness of such counters in the social game ; but when [he]188-xvi amherst was with [Justine]100-justine [he]188-xvi amherst always felt the obscure need of letting [his]188-xvi amherst real self be seen . " [I]188-xvi amherst was stupid enough not to telegraph , "[188-xvi amherst] [he]188-xvi amherst said , " and [I]188-xvi amherst am afraid [[my]188-xvi amherst wife]3819-my wife will think [me]188-xvi amherst negligent : [she]3819-my wife often has to reproach [me]188-xvi amherst for [my]188-xvi amherst sins of omission , and this time [I]188-xvi amherst know they are many . "[188-xvi amherst] [The girl]403-the girl received this in silence , less from embarrassment than from surprise ; for [she]403-the girl had already guessed that it was as difficult for [Amherst]170-bessy to touch , even lightly , on [his]188-xvi amherst private affairs , as it was instinctive with [[his]188-xvi amherst wife]3350-his wife to pour [her]3350-his wife grievances into any willing ear . [Justine]100-justine 's first thought was one of gratification that [he]188-xvi amherst should have spoken , and of eagerness to facilitate the saying of whatever [he]188-xvi amherst wished to say ; but before [she]100-justine could answer [he]188-xvi amherst went on hastily : " The fact is , [Bessy]170-bessy does not know how complicated the work at [Westmore]104-westmore is ; and when [I]188-xvi amherst caught sight of [you]403-the girl just now [I]188-xvi amherst was thinking that [you]403-the girl are [the only one of [[her]170-bessy friends]1229-her friends who has any technical understanding of what [I]188-xvi amherst am trying to do , and who might consequently help [her]170-bessy to see how hard it is for [me]188-xvi amherst to take [my]188-xvi amherst hand from the plough]4212-the only one of her friends who has any technical understanding of what i am trying to do , and who might consequently help her to see how hard it is for me to take my hand from the plough . "[188-xvi amherst] [Justine]100-justine listened gravely , longing to cry out [her]100-justine comprehension and sympathy , but restrained by the sense that the moment was a critical one , where impulse must not be trusted too far . It was quite possible that a reaction of pride might cause [Amherst]170-bessy to repent even so guarded an avowal ; and if that happened , [he]188-xvi amherst might never forgive [her]100-justine for having encouraged [him]188-xvi amherst to speak . [She]100-justine looked up at [him]188-xvi amherst with a smile . " Why not tell [Bessy]170-bessy [yourself]188-xvi amherst ? [Your]188-xvi amherst understanding of the case is a good deal clearer than [mine]188-xvi amherst or [any one else]3853-any one else 's . "[100-justine] " Oh , [Bessy]170-bessy is tired of hearing about it from [me]100-justine ; and besides-- "[100-justine] [She]100-justine detected a shade of disappointment in [his]188-xvi amherst tone , and was sorry [she]100-justine had said anything which might seem meant to discourage [his]188-xvi amherst confidence . It occurred to [her]100-justine also that [she]100-justine had been insincere in not telling [him]188-xvi amherst at once that [she]100-justine had already been let into the secret of [his]188-xvi amherst domestic differences : [she]100-justine felt the same craving as [Amherst]170-bessy for absolute openness between [them]1686-them . " [I]100-justine know , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said , almost timidly , " that [Bessy]170-bessy has not been quite content of late to have [you]188-xvi amherst give so much time to [Westmore]167-cicely , and perhaps [she]170-bessy [herself]170-bessy thinks it is because the work there does not interest [her]170-bessy ; but [I]100-justine believe it is for a different reason . "[100-justine] " What reason ? "[188-xvi amherst] [he]188-xvi amherst asked with a look of surprise . " Because [Westmore]167-cicely takes [you]188-xvi amherst from [her]170-bessy ; because [she]170-bessy thinks [you]188-xvi amherst are happier [there]3361-there than at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . "[100-justine] The day had faded so rapidly that it was no longer possible for [the speakers]1687-the speakers to see [each other]407-each other 's faces , and it was easier for both to communicate through the veil of deepening obscurity . " But , good heavens , [she]170-bessy might be there with [me]170-bessy -- [she]170-bessy 's as much needed [there]3361-there as [I]170-bessy am ! "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy exclaimed . " Yes ; but [you]170-bessy must remember that it 's against all [her]170-bessy habits -- and against the point of view of every one about [her]170-bessy -- that [she]170-bessy should lead that kind of life ; and meanwhile---- "[170-bessy] " Well ? "[1689-his] " Meanwhile , is n't it expedient that [you]170-bessy should , a little more , lead [hers]170-bessy ? "[170-bessy] Always the same answer to [his]1689-his restless questioning ! [[His]1689-his mother]396-his mother 's answer , the answer of [Bessy]170-bessy and [[her]170-bessy friends]1229-her friends . [He]1689-his had somehow hoped that [the girl at [his]1689-his side]1692-the girl at his side would find a different solution to the problem , and [his]1689-his disappointment escaped in a bitter exclamation . " But [Westmore]167-cicely is [my]1689-his life -- [hers]170-bessy too , if [she]170-bessy knew it ! [I]1689-his ca n't desert it now without being as false to [her]170-bessy as to [myself]1689-his ! "[1689-his] As [he]1689-his spoke , [he]1689-his was overcome once more by the hopelessness of trying to put [his]1689-his case clearly . How could [Justine]100-justine , for all [her]100-justine quickness and sympathy , understand a situation of which the deeper elements were necessarily unknown to [her]100-justine ? The advice [she]100-justine gave [him]1689-his was natural enough , and on [her]100-justine lips it seemed not the counsel of a shallow expediency , but the plea of compassion and understanding . But [she]100-justine knew nothing of the long struggle for mutual adjustment which had culminated in this crisis between [himself]1689-his and [[his]1689-his wife]3350-his wife , and [she]100-justine could therefore not see that , if [he]1689-his yielded [his]1689-his point , and gave up [his]1689-his work at [Westmore]104-westmore , the concession would mean not renewal but destruction . [He]1689-his felt that [he]1689-his should hate [Bessy]170-bessy if [he]1689-his won [her]170-bessy back at that price ; and the violence of [his]1689-his feeling frightened [him]1689-his . It was , in truth , as [he]1689-his had said , [his]1689-his own life that [he]1689-his was fighting for . If [he]1689-his gave up [Westmore]167-cicely [he]1689-his could not fall back on the futile activities of [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , and fate might yet have some lower alternative to offer . [He]1689-his could trust to [his]1689-his own strength and self - command while [his]1689-his energies had a normal outlet ; but idleness and self - indulgence might work in [him]1689-his like a dangerous drug . [Justine]100-justine kept steadily to [her]100-justine point . " [Westmore]167-cicely must be foremost to both of [you]4217-you in time ; [I]100-justine do n't see how either of [you]4217-you can escape that . But the realization of it must come to [Bessy]170-bessy through _ [you]4217-you _ , and for that reason [I]100-justine think that [you]4217-you ought to be more patient -- that [you]4217-you ought even to put the question aside for a time and enter a little more into [her]170-bessy life while [she]170-bessy is learning to understand [yours]4217-you . "[100-justine] As [she]100-justine ended , it seemed to [her]100-justine that what [she]100-justine had said was trite and ineffectual , and yet that it might have passed the measure of discretion ; and , torn between two doubts , [she]100-justine added hastily : " But [you]4217-you have done just that in coming back now -- that is the real solution of the problem . "[100-justine] While [she]100-justine spoke [they]1694-they passed out of the wood - path [they]1694-they had been following , and rounding a mass of shrubbery emerged on [the lawn below [the terraces]1696-the terraces]1695-the lawn below the terraces . [The long bulk of [the house]311-the house]1697-the long bulk of the house lay above [them]1694-they , dark against the lingering gleam of the west , with brightly - lit windows marking [its]311-the house irregular outline ; and the sight produced in [Amherst]96-amherst and [Justine]100-justine a vague sense of helplessness and constraint . It was impossible to speak with the same freedom , confronted by that substantial symbol of the accepted order , which seemed to glare down on [them]1694-they in massive disdain of [their]1694-they puny efforts to deflect the course of events : and [Amherst]170-bessy , without reverting to [her]100-justine last words , asked after a moment if [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife had [many guests]1700-many guests . [He]96-amherst listened in silence while [Justine]100-justine ran over the list of names -- [the Telfer girls]1701-the telfer girls and [[their]1701-the telfer girls brother]1702-their brother , [Mason Winch]184-mason winch and [Westy Gaines]113-westy , [a cluster of [young bridge - playing couples]1704-young bridge - playing couples]1703-a cluster of young bridge - playing couples , and , among [the last arrivals]1705-the last arrivals , [the Fenton Carburys]179-the fenton carburys and [Ned Bowfort]181-ned bowfort . The names were all familiar to [Amherst]170-bessy -- [he]96-amherst knew they represented the flower of week - end fashion ; but [he]96-amherst did not remember having seen [the Carburys]179-the fenton carburys among [[his]96-amherst wife 's guests]1706-his wife 's guests , and [his]96-amherst mind paused on the name , seeking to regain some lost impression connected with it . But it evoked , like the others , merely the confused sense of stridency and unrest which [he]96-amherst had brought away from [his]96-amherst last Lynbrook visit ; and this reminiscence made [him]96-amherst ask [Miss Brent]97-miss brent , when [her]97-miss brent list was ended , if [she]97-miss brent did not think that so continuous a succession of [visitors]1158-visitors was too tiring for [Bessy]170-bessy . " [I]170-bessy sometimes think it tires [her]97-miss brent more than [she]97-miss brent knows ; but [I]170-bessy hope [she]97-miss brent can be persuaded to take better care of [herself]97-miss brent now that [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell has come back . "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy halted abruptly . " Is [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell [here]3415-here ? "[170-bessy] " [She]178-mrs. ansell arrived from [Europe]17-europe today . "[170-bessy] " And [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope too , [I]170-bessy suppose ? "[170-bessy] " Yes . [He]120-mr. langhope came from [Newport]39-newport about ten days ago . "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy checked [himself]170-bessy , conscious that [his]1708-his questions betrayed the fact that [he]1708-his and [[his]1708-his wife]3350-his wife no longer wrote to [each other]407-each other . The same thought appeared to strike [Justine]100-justine , and [they]1711-their walked across [the lawn]1159-the lawn in silence , hastening [their]1711-their steps involuntarily , as though to escape the oppressive weight of the words which had passed between [them]1711-their . But [Justine]100-justine was unwilling that this fruitless sense of oppression should be the final outcome of [their]1711-their talk ; and when [they]1711-their reached [the upper terrace]1478-the upper terrace [she]100-justine paused and turned impulsively to [Amherst]170-bessy . As [she]100-justine did so , the light from an uncurtained window fell on [her]100-justine face , which glowed with the inner brightness kindled in it by moments of strong feeling . " [I]100-justine am sure of one thing -- [Bessy]170-bessy will be very , very glad that [you]170-bessy have come , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine exclaimed . " Thank [you]100-justine , "[1714-he] [he]1714-he answered . [Their]1711-their hands met mechanically , and [she]100-justine turned away and entered [the house]311-the house . XVII [BESSY]170-bessy had not seen [[her]170-bessy little girl]489-her little girl that day , and filled with compunction by [Justine]100-justine 's reminder , [she]170-bessy hastened directly to [the school - room]1717-the school - room . Of late , in certain moods , [her]170-bessy maternal tenderness had been clouded by a sense of uneasiness in [the child]3698-the child 's presence , for [Cicely]167-cicely was the argument most effectually used by [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope and [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy in [their]1711-their efforts to check the triumph of [Amherst]170-bessy 's ideas . [Bessy]170-bessy , still unable to form an independent opinion on the harassing question of the mills , continued to oscillate between the views of [the contending parties]1719-the contending parties , now regarding [Cicely]167-cicely as [an innocent victim]1720-an innocent victim and [herself]170-bessy as [an unnatural mother]1721-an unnatural mother , sacrificing [[her]170-bessy child]1722-her child 's prospects to further [Amherst]170-bessy 's enterprise , and now conscious of a vague animosity against [the little girl]1723-the little girl , as the chief cause of the dissensions which had so soon clouded the skies of [her]170-bessy second marriage . Then again , there were moments when [Cicely]167-cicely 's rosy bloom reminded [her]170-bessy bitterly of [the child [she]170-bessy had lost]1724-the child she had lost -- [the son on whom [her]170-bessy ambitions had been fixed]1725-the son on whom her ambitions had been fixed . It seemed to [her]170-bessy now that if [[their]1711-their boy]1726-their boy had lived [she]170-bessy might have kept [Amherst]170-bessy 's love and have played a more important part in [his]1726-their boy life ; and brooding on the tragedy of [the child]3698-the child 's sickly existence [she]170-bessy resented the contrast of [Cicely]167-cicely 's brightness and vigour . The result was that in [her]170-bessy treatment of [[her]170-bessy daughter]1728-her daughter [she]170-bessy alternated between moments of exaggerated devotion and days of neglect , never long happy away from [the little girl]1723-the little girl , yet restless and self - tormenting in [her]170-bessy presence . After [her]170-bessy talk with [Justine]100-justine [she]170-bessy felt more than usually disturbed , as [she]170-bessy always did when [her]170-bessy unprofitable impulses of self - exposure had subsided . [Bessy]170-bessy 's mind was not made for introspection , and chance had burdened it with unintelligible problems . [She]170-bessy felt [herself]170-bessy the victim of circumstances to which [her]170-bessy imagination attributed the deliberate malice that [children]3598-children ascribe to the furniture [they]3598-children run against in playing . This helped [her]170-bessy to cultivate a sense of helpless injury and to disdain in advance the advice [she]170-bessy was perpetually seeking . How absurd it was , for instance , to suppose that [a girl]408-a girl could understand the feelings of [a married woman]1732-a married woman ! [Justine]100-justine 's suggestion that [she]170-bessy should humble [herself]170-bessy still farther to [Amherst]170-bessy merely left in [Bessy]170-bessy 's mind a rankling sense of being misunderstood and undervalued by those to whom [she]170-bessy turned in [her]170-bessy extremity , and [she]170-bessy said to [herself]170-bessy , in a phrase that sounded well in [her]170-bessy own ears , that sooner or later [every woman]1733-every woman must learn to fight [her]1733-every woman battles alone . In this mood [she]170-bessy entered [the room where [Cicely]167-cicely was at supper]1734-the room where cicely was at supper with [[her]167-cicely governess]1735-her governess , and enveloped [the child]3698-the child in a whirl of passionate caresses . But [Cicely]167-cicely had inherited [the soberer Westmore]167-cicely temper , and [[her]167-cicely mother]1105-her mother 's spasmodic endearments always had a repressive effect on [her]167-cicely . [She]170-bessy dutifully returned a small fraction of [Bessy]170-bessy 's kisses , and then , with an air of relief , addressed [herself]170-bessy once more to [her]170-bessy bread and marmalade . " [You]170-bessy do n't seem a bit glad to see [me]170-bessy ! "[170-bessy] [Bessy]170-bessy exclaimed , while [the little governess]1738-the little governess made a nervous pretence of being greatly amused at this prodigious paradox , and [Cicely]167-cicely , setting down [her]167-cicely silver mug , asked judicially : " Why should [I]167-cicely be gladder than other days ? It is n't a birthday . "[167-cicely] This [Cordelia]189-cordelia - like answer cut [Bessy]170-bessy to the quick . " [[You]170-bessy horrid child]4219-you horrid child to say such a cruel thing when [you]170-bessy know [I]189-cordelia love [you]170-bessy better and better every minute ! But [you]170-bessy do n't care for [me]189-cordelia any longer because [Justine]100-justine has taken [you]170-bessy away from [me]189-cordelia ! "[189-cordelia] This last charge had sprung into [her]170-bessy mind in the act of uttering it , but now that it was spoken it instantly assumed the proportions of a fact , and seemed to furnish another justification for [her]170-bessy wretchedness . [Bessy]170-bessy was not naturally jealous , but [her]170-bessy imagination was thrall to the spoken word , and it gave [her]170-bessy a sudden incomprehensible relief to associate [Justine]100-justine with the obscure causes of [her]170-bessy suffering . " [I]170-bessy know [she]100-justine 's cleverer than [I]170-bessy am , and more amusing , and can tell [you]170-bessy about plants and animals and things ... and [I]170-bessy daresay [she]100-justine tells [you]170-bessy how tiresome and stupid [I]170-bessy am .... "[170-bessy] [She]170-bessy sprang up suddenly , abashed by [Cicely]167-cicely 's astonished gaze , and by [the governess]3694-the governess 's tremulous attempt to continue to treat the scene as one of " [Mamma]190-mamma 's "[170-bessy] most successful pleasantries . " Do n't mind [me]170-bessy -- [my]170-bessy head aches horribly . [I]170-bessy think [I]170-bessy 'll rush off for a gallop on Impulse before dinner . [Miss Dill]191-miss dill , [Cicely]167-cicely 's nails are a sight -- [I]170-bessy suppose that comes of grubbing up wild - flowers . "[170-bessy] And with this parting shot at [Justine]100-justine 's pursuits [she]170-bessy swept out of [the school - room]1717-the school - room , leaving [pupil]1741-pupil and [teacher]1742-teacher plunged in a stricken silence from which [Cicely]167-cicely at length emerged to say , with the candour that [Miss Dill]191-miss dill dreaded more than any punishable offense : " [Mother]173-mother 's prettiest -- but [I]191-miss dill do like [Justine]100-justine the best . "[191-miss dill] * * * * * It was nearly dark when [Bessy]170-bessy mounted the horse which had been hastily saddled in response to [her]170-bessy order ; but it was [her]170-bessy habit to ride out alone at all hours , and of late nothing but a hard gallop had availed to quiet [her]170-bessy nerves . [Her]170-bessy craving for occupation had increased as [her]170-bessy life became more dispersed and agitated , and the need to fill every hour drove [her]170-bessy to excesses of bodily exertion , since other forms of activity were unknown to [her]170-bessy . As [she]170-bessy cantered along under the twilight sky , with a strong sea - breeze in [her]170-bessy face , the rush of air and the effort of steadying [her]170-bessy nervous thoroughbred filled [her]170-bessy with a glow of bodily energy from which [her]170-bessy thoughts emerged somewhat cleansed of their bitterness . [She]170-bessy had been odious to poor [little Cicely]167-cicely , for whom [she]170-bessy now felt a sudden remorseful yearning which almost made [her]170-bessy turn [her]170-bessy horse 's head homeward , that [she]170-bessy might dash [upstairs]1423-upstairs and do penance beside [the child]3698-the child 's bed . And that [she]170-bessy should have accused [Justine]100-justine of taking [Cicely]167-cicely from [her]170-bessy ! It frightened [her]170-bessy to find [herself]170-bessy thinking evil of [Justine]100-justine . [Bessy , whose perceptions were keen enough in certain directions]1745-bessy , whose perceptions were keen enough in certain directions , knew that [her]170-bessy second marriage had changed [her]170-bessy relation to [all [her]170-bessy former circle of [friends]1747-friends]1746-all her former circle of friends . Though [they]1746-all her former circle of friends still rallied about [her]170-bessy , keeping up the convenient habit of familiar intercourse , [she]170-bessy had begun to be aware that [their]1746-all her former circle of friends view of [her]170-bessy had in it an element of criticism and compassion . [She]170-bessy had once fancied that [Amherst]170-bessy 's good looks , and the other qualities [she]170-bessy had seen in [him]1748-his , would immediately make [him]1748-his free of the charmed circle in which [she]170-bessy moved ; but [she]170-bessy was discouraged by [his]1748-his disregard of [his]1748-his opportunities , and above all by the fundamental differences in [his]1748-his view of life . [He]1748-his was never common or ridiculous , but [she]170-bessy saw that [he]1748-his would never acquire the small social facilities . [He]1748-his was fond of exercise , but it bored [him]1748-his to talk of it . [The men]474-the men 's smoking - room anecdotes did not amuse [him]1748-his , [he]1748-his was unmoved by the fluctuations of the stock - market , [he]1748-his could not tell one card from another , and [his]1748-his perfunctory attempts at billiards had once caused [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope to murmur , in [[his]120-mr. langhope daughter]514-his daughter 's hearing : " Ah , that 's the test -- [I]120-mr. langhope always said so ! "[120-mr. langhope] Thus debarred from what seemed to [Bessy]170-bessy the chief points of contact with life , how could [Amherst]170-bessy hope to impose [himself]170-bessy on minds versed in these larger relations ? As the sense of [his]1748-his social insufficiency grew on [her]170-bessy , [Bessy]170-bessy became more sensitive to that latent criticism of [her]170-bessy marriage which -- intolerable thought!--involved a judgment on [herself]170-bessy . [She]170-bessy was increasingly eager for the approval and applause of [[her]170-bessy little audience]1751-her little audience , yet increasingly distrustful of [their]1751-her little audience sincerity , and more miserably persuaded that [she]170-bessy and [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband were the butt of some of [their]1751-her little audience most effective stories . [She]170-bessy knew also that rumours of the disagreement about [Westmore]167-cicely were abroad , and the suspicion that [Amherst]170-bessy 's conduct was the subject of unfriendly comment provoked in [her]170-bessy a reaction of loyalty to [his]1748-his ideas .... From this turmoil of conflicting influences only [her]170-bessy friendship with [Justine Brent]100-justine remained secure . Though [Justine]100-justine 's adaptability made it easy for [her]100-justine to fit into the [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook life , [Bessy]170-bessy knew that [she]170-bessy stood as much outside of it as [Amherst]170-bessy . [She]170-bessy could never , for instance , be influenced by what [Maria Ansell]123-maria and [the Gaineses]127-the gaineses and [the Telfers]186-the telfers thought . [She]170-bessy had [her]170-bessy own criteria of conduct , unintelligible to [Bessy]170-bessy , but giving [her]170-bessy an independence of mind on which [[her]170-bessy friend]706-her friend leaned in a kind of blind security . And that even [her]170-bessy faith in [Justine]100-justine should suddenly be poisoned by a jealous thought seemed to prove that the consequences of [her]170-bessy marriage were gradually infecting [her]170-bessy whole life . [Bessy]170-bessy could conceive of masculine devotion only as subservient to [its]1754-its divinity 's least wish , and [she]170-bessy argued that if [Amherst]170-bessy had really loved [her]170-bessy [he]1755-he could not so lightly have disturbed the foundations of [[her]170-bessy world]1145-her world . And so [her]170-bessy tormented thoughts , perpetually circling on themselves , reverted once more to [their]1757-their central grievance -- the failure of [her]170-bessy marriage . If [her]170-bessy own love had died out it would have been much simpler -- [she]170-bessy was surrounded by examples of the mutual evasion of a troublesome tie . There was [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury , for instance , with whom [she]170-bessy had lately struck up an absorbing friendship ... it was perfectly clear that [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury wondered how much more [she]170-bessy was going to stand ! But it was the torment of [Bessy]170-bessy 's situation that it involved a radical contradiction , that [she]170-bessy still loved [Amherst]170-bessy though [she]170-bessy could not forgive [him]1755-he for having married [her]170-bessy . Perhaps what [she]170-bessy most suffered from was [his]1755-he too - prompt acceptance of the semi - estrangement between [them]1758-them . After nearly three years of marriage [she]170-bessy had still to learn that it was [Amherst]170-bessy 's way to wrestle with [the angel]1759-the angel till dawn , and then to go about [his]1755-he other business . [Her]170-bessy own mind could revolve in the same grievance as interminably as a squirrel in its wheel , and [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband 's habit of casting off the accepted fact seemed to betoken poverty of feeling . If only [he]1755-he had striven a little harder to keep [her]170-bessy -- if , even now , [he]1755-he would come back to [her]170-bessy , and make [her]170-bessy feel that [she]170-bessy was more to [him]1755-he than those wretched mills ! When [she]170-bessy turned [her]170-bessy mare toward [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , the longing to see [Amherst]170-bessy was again uppermost . [He]1755-he had not written for weeks -- [she]170-bessy had been obliged to tell [Maria Ansell]123-maria that [she]170-bessy knew nothing of [his]1755-he plans , and it mortified [her]170-bessy to think that [every one]1761-every one was aware of [his]1755-he neglect . Yet , even now , if on reaching [the house]311-the house [she]170-bessy should find a telegram to say that [he]1755-he was coming , the weight of loneliness would be lifted , and everything in life would seem different .... [Her]170-bessy high - strung mare , scenting [the homeward road]1763-the homeward road , and excited by the fantastic play of wayside lights and shadows , swept [her]170-bessy along at a wild gallop with which the fevered rush of [her]170-bessy thoughts kept pace , and when [she]170-bessy reached [the house]311-the house [she]170-bessy dropped from the saddle with aching wrists and brain benumbed . [She]170-bessy entered by a side door , to avoid meeting [any one]3517-any one , and ran [upstairs]1423-upstairs at once , knowing that [she]170-bessy had barely time to dress for dinner . As [she]170-bessy opened the door of [[her]170-bessy sitting - room]1767-her sitting - room some one rose from the chair by the fire , and [she]170-bessy stood still , facing [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband .... It was the moment [both]502-both had desired , yet when it came it found [them]502-both tongue - tied and helpless . [Bessy]170-bessy was the first to speak . " When did [you]170-bessy get [here]3415-here ? [You]170-bessy never wrote [me]170-bessy [you]170-bessy were coming ! "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy advanced toward [her]170-bessy , holding out [his]3393-her husband hand . " No ; [you]170-bessy must forgive [me]3393-her husband . [I]3393-her husband have been very busy , "[3393-her husband] [he]3393-her husband said . Always the same excuse ! The same thrusting at [her]170-bessy of the hateful fact that [Westmore]167-cicely came first , and that [she]170-bessy must put up with whatever was left of [his]3393-her husband time and thoughts ! " [You]3393-her husband are always too busy to let [me]170-bessy hear from [you]3393-her husband , "[170-bessy] [she]170-bessy said coldly , and the hand which had sprung toward [his]3393-her husband fell back to [her]170-bessy side . Even then , if [he]3393-her husband had only said frankly : " It was too difficult -- [I]3393-her husband did n't know how , "[3393-her husband] the note of truth would have reached and moved [her]170-bessy ; but [he]3393-her husband had striven for the tone of ease and self - restraint that was habitual among [[her]170-bessy friends]1229-her friends , and as usual [his]3393-her husband attempt had been a failure . " [I]3393-her husband am sorry -- I'm a bad hand at writing , "[3393-her husband] [he]3393-her husband rejoined ; and [his]3393-her husband evil genius prompted [him]3393-her husband to add : " [I]3393-her husband hope [my]3393-her husband coming is not inconvenient ? "[3393-her husband] The colour rose to [Bessy]170-bessy 's face . " Of course not . But it must seem rather odd to [[our]4221-our visitors]4222-our visitors that [I]3393-her husband should know so little of [your]170-bessy plans . "[3393-her husband] At this [he]3393-her husband humbled [himself]3393-her husband still farther . " [I]3393-her husband know [I]3393-her husband do n't think enough about appearances -- [I'll]3393-her husband try to do better the next time . "[3393-her husband] Appearances ! [He]3393-her husband spoke as if [she]170-bessy had been reproaching [him]3393-her husband for a breach of etiquette ... it never occurred to [him]3393-her husband that the cry came from [her]170-bessy humiliated heart ! The tide of warmth that always enveloped [her]170-bessy in [his]3393-her husband presence was receding , and in its place a chill fluid seemed to creep up slowly to [her]170-bessy throat and lips . In [Amherst]170-bessy , meanwhile , the opposite process was taking place . [[His]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife was still to [him]3393-her husband [the most beautiful woman in [the world]259-the world]1772-the most beautiful woman in the world , or rather , perhaps , [the only woman to whose beauty [his]3393-her husband eyes had been opened]1774-the only woman to whose beauty his eyes had been opened . That beauty could never again penetrate to [his]3393-her husband heart , but it still touched [his]3393-her husband senses , not with passion but with a caressing kindliness , such as one might feel for the bright movements of a bird or a kitten . It seemed to plead with [him]3393-her husband not to ask of [her]170-bessy more than [she]170-bessy could give -- to be content with the outward grace and not seek in it an inner meaning . [He]3393-her husband moved toward [her]170-bessy again , and took [her]170-bessy passive hands in [his]3393-her husband . " [You]170-bessy look tired . Why do [you]3393-her husband ride so late ? "[3393-her husband] " Oh , [I]170-bessy just wanted to give [Impulse]192-impulse a gallop . [I]170-bessy had n't time to take [her]192-impulse out earlier , and if [I]170-bessy let [the grooms]4223-the grooms exercise [her]192-impulse [they]4223-the grooms 'll spoil [her]192-impulse mouth . "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy frowned . " [You]170-bessy ought not to ride that mare alone at night . [She]192-impulse shies at everything after dark . "[170-bessy] " [She]192-impulse 's the only horse [I]170-bessy care for -- [the others]620-the others are all cows , "[170-bessy] [she]170-bessy murmured , releasing [her]170-bessy hands impatiently . " Well , [you]1775-he must take [me]170-bessy with [you]1775-he the next time [you]1775-he ride [her]192-impulse . "[170-bessy] [She]170-bessy softened a little , in spite of [herself]170-bessy . Riding was the only amusement [he]1775-he cared to share with [her]170-bessy , and the thought of a long gallop across [the plains]788-the plains at [his]1775-he side brought back the warmth to [her]170-bessy veins . " Yes , [we]4225-we 'll go tomorrow . How long do [you]1775-he mean to stay ? "[170-bessy] [she]170-bessy asked , looking up at [him]1775-he eagerly . [He]1775-he was pleased that [she]170-bessy should wish to know , yet the question embarrassed [him]1775-he , for it was necessary that [he]1775-he should be back at [Westmore]104-westmore within three days , and [he]1775-he could not put [her]170-bessy off with an evasion . [Bessy]170-bessy saw [his]1775-he hesitation , and [her]170-bessy colour rose again . " [I]170-bessy only asked , "[170-bessy] [she]170-bessy explained , " because there is to be a fancy ball at [the Hunt Club]4226-the hunt club on the twentieth , and [I]170-bessy thought of giving a big dinner [here]3415-here first . "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy did not understand that [she]170-bessy too had [her]170-bessy inarticulate moments , and that the allusion to the fancy ball was improvised to hide an eagerness to which [he]1775-he had been too slow in responding . [He]1775-he thought [she]170-bessy had enquired about [his]1775-he plans only that [he]1775-he might not again interfere with the arrangements of [her]170-bessy dinner - table . If that was all [she]170-bessy cared about , it became suddenly easy to tell [her]170-bessy that [he]1775-he could not stay , and [he]1775-he answered lightly : " Fancy balls are a little out of [my]1775-he line ; but at any rate [I]1775-he shall have to be back at [the mills]3324-the mills the day after tomorrow . "[1775-he] The disappointment brought a rush of bitterness to [her]170-bessy lips . " The day after tomorrow ? It seems hardly worth while to have come so far for two days ! "[1775-he] " Oh , [I]170-bessy do n't mind the journey -- and there are one or two matters [I]170-bessy must consult [you]170-bessy about . "[170-bessy] There could hardly have been a more ill - advised answer , but [Amherst]170-bessy was reckless now . If [she]170-bessy cared for [his]1775-he coming only that [he]1775-he might fill a place at a fancy - dress dinner , [he]1775-he would let [her]170-bessy see that [he]1775-he had come only because [he]1775-he had to go through the form of submitting to [her]170-bessy certain measures to be taken at [Westmore]104-westmore . [Bessy]170-bessy was beginning to feel the physical reaction of [her]170-bessy struggle with the mare . The fatigue which at first had deadened [her]170-bessy nerves now woke [them]1777-them to acuter sensibility , and an appealing word from [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband would have drawn [her]170-bessy to [his]1775-he arms . But [his]1775-he answer seemed to drive all the blood back to [her]170-bessy heart . " [I]170-bessy do n't see why [you]170-bessy still go through the form of consulting [me]170-bessy about [Westmore]104-westmore , when [you]170-bessy have always done just as [you]170-bessy pleased [there]3361-there , without regard to [me]170-bessy or [Cicely]167-cicely . "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy made no answer , silenced by the discouragement of hearing the same old grievance on [her]170-bessy lips ; and [she]170-bessy too seemed struck , after [she]170-bessy had spoken , by the unprofitableness of such retorts . " It does n't matter -- of course [I]170-bessy 'll do whatever [you]170-bessy wish , "[170-bessy] [she]170-bessy went on listlessly . " But [I]170-bessy could have sent [my]170-bessy signature , if that is all [you]170-bessy came for---- "[170-bessy] " Thanks , "[170-bessy] said [Amherst]170-bessy coldly . " [I]170-bessy shall remember that the next time . "[170-bessy] [They]1779-they stood silent for a moment , [he]1780-he with [his]1780-he eyes fixed on [her]170-bessy , [she]170-bessy with averted head , twisting [her]170-bessy riding - whip between [her]170-bessy fingers ; then [she]170-bessy said suddenly : " [We]1779-they shall be late for dinner , "[170-bessy] and passing into [[her]170-bessy dressing - room]1781-her dressing - room [she]170-bessy closed the door . [Amherst]170-bessy roused [himself]170-bessy as [she]170-bessy disappeared . " [Bessy]170-bessy ! "[1780-he] [he]1780-he exclaimed , moving toward [her]170-bessy ; but as [he]1780-he approached the door [he]1780-he heard [[her]170-bessy maid]320-her maid 's voice within , and turning away [he]1780-he went to [[his]1780-he own room]1783-his own room . * * * * * [Bessy]170-bessy came down late to dinner , with vivid cheeks and an air of improvised ease ; and the manner of [her]170-bessy entrance , combined with [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband 's unannounced arrival , produced in [[their]1785-their observant guests]1786-their observant guests the sense of latent complications . [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , though evidently unaware of [[his]120-mr. langhope son - in - law]1787-his son - in - law 's return till [they]1785-their greeted [each other]407-each other in [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room , was too good [a card - player]1790-a card - player to betray surprise , and [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell outdid [herself]178-mrs. ansell in the delicate art of taking everything for granted ; but these very dissimulations sharpened the perception of [the other guests]1791-the other guests , whom long practice had rendered expert in interpreting such signs . Of all this [Justine Brent]100-justine was aware ; and conscious also that , by every one but [herself]100-justine , the suspected estrangement between [the Amhersts]159-john was regarded as turning merely on the question of money . To the greater number of [persons present]1792-persons present there was , in fact , no other conceivable source of conjugal discord , since every known complication could be adjusted by means of the universal lubricant . It was this unanimity of view which bound together in the compactness of a new feudalism [the members of [[Bessy Amherst]170-bessy 's world]1794-bessy amherst 's world]1793-the members of bessy amherst 's world ; which supplied [them]1793-the members of bessy amherst 's world with [their]1793-the members of bessy amherst 's world pass - words and social tests , and defended [them]1793-the members of bessy amherst 's world securely against the insidious attack of ideas . * * * * * [The Genius of History]1795-the genius of history , capriciously directing the antics of its marionettes , sometimes lets the drama languish through a series of unrelated episodes , and then , suddenly quickening the pace , packs into one scene the stuff of a dozen . The chance meeting of [Amherst]170-bessy and [Justine]100-justine , seemingly of no significance to either , contained the germ of developments of which both had begun to be aware before the evening was over . [Their]1785-their short talk -- the first really intimate exchange of words between [them]1785-their -- had the effect of creating a sense of solidarity that grew apace in the atmosphere of the [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook dinner - table . [Justine]100-justine was always reluctant to take part in [Bessy]170-bessy 's week - end dinners , but as [she]100-justine descended the stairs that evening [she]100-justine did not regret having promised to be present . [She]100-justine frankly wanted to see [Amherst]170-bessy again -- [his]1796-his tone , [his]1796-his view of life , reinforced [her]100-justine own convictions , restored [her]100-justine faith in the reality and importance of all that [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ignored and excluded . [Her]100-justine extreme sensitiveness to surrounding vibrations of thought and feeling told [her]100-justine , as [she]100-justine glanced at [him]1796-his between the flowers and candles of the long dinner - table , that [he]1796-his too was obscurely aware of the same effect ; and it flashed across [her]100-justine that [they]1785-their were unconsciously drawn together by the fact that [they]1785-their were [the only two strangers in [the room]3355-the room]1797-the only two strangers in the room . [Every one else]4001-every one else had the same standpoint , spoke the same language , drew on the same stock of allusions , used the same weights and measures in estimating [persons]1800-persons and actions . Between [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's indolent acuteness of mind and the rudimentary processes of [the rosy Telfers]186-the telfers there was a difference of degree but not of kind . If [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope viewed the spectacle more objectively , it was not because [he]120-mr. langhope had outlived the sense of its importance , but because years of experience had familiarized [him]120-mr. langhope with its minutest details ; and this familiarity with [the world [he]120-mr. langhope lived in]1801-the world he lived in had bred a profound contempt for any other . In no way could the points of contact between [Amherst]170-bessy and [Justine Brent]100-justine have been more vividly brought out than by [their]1785-their tacit exclusion from the currents of opinion about [them]1785-their . [Amherst]170-bessy , seated in [unsmiling endurance at the foot of the table]1802-unsmiling endurance at the foot of the table , between [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , with [her]178-mrs. ansell carefully - distributed affabilities , and [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury , with [her]180-blanche carbury reckless hurling of conversational pebbles , seemed to [Justine]100-justine as much of a stranger as [herself]100-justine among [the people to whom [his]120-mr. langhope marriage had introduced [him]120-mr. langhope]1803-the people to whom his marriage had introduced him . So strongly did [she]100-justine feel the sense of [their]1785-their common isolation that it was no surprise to [her]100-justine , when [the men]474-the men reappeared in [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room after dinner , to have [[her]100-justine host]1806-her host thread [his]120-mr. langhope way , between the unfolding bridge - tables , straight to the corner where [she]100-justine sat . [Amherst]170-bessy 's methods in [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room were still as direct as in [the cotton - mill]1808-the cotton - mill . [He]120-mr. langhope always went up at once to [the person [he]120-mr. langhope sought]1809-the person he sought , without preliminary waste of tactics ; and on this occasion [Justine]100-justine , without knowing what had passed between [himself]120-mr. langhope and [Bessy]170-bessy , suspected from the appearance of both that [their]1785-their talk had resulted in increasing [Amherst]170-bessy 's desire to be with [some one to whom [he]120-mr. langhope could speak freely and naturally on the subject nearest [his]120-mr. langhope heart]1810-some one to whom he could speak freely and naturally on the subject nearest his heart . [She]100-justine began at once to question [him]120-mr. langhope about [Westmore]167-cicely , and the change in [his]120-mr. langhope face showed that [his]120-mr. langhope work was still a refuge from all that made life disheartening and unintelligible . Whatever convictions had been thwarted or impaired in [him]120-mr. langhope , [his]120-mr. langhope faith in the importance of [his]120-mr. langhope task remained unshaken ; and the firmness with which [he]120-mr. langhope held to it filled [Justine]100-justine with a sense of [his]120-mr. langhope strength . The feeling kindled [her]100-justine own desire to escape again into the world of deeds , yet by a sudden reaction it checked the growing inclination for [Stephen Wyant]165-wyant that had resulted from [her]100-justine revolt against [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . Here was [a man as careless as [Wyant of the minor forms]1812-wyant of the minor forms]1811-a man as careless as wyant of the minor forms , yet [her]100-justine appreciation of [him]120-mr. langhope was not affected by the lack of adaptability that [she]100-justine accused [herself]100-justine of criticizing in [[her]100-justine suitor]1813-her suitor . [She]100-justine began to see that it was not the sense of [Wyant]165-wyant 's social deficiencies that had held [her]100-justine back ; and the discovery at once set free [her]100-justine judgment of [him]120-mr. langhope , enabling [her]100-justine to penetrate to the real causes of [her]100-justine reluctance . [She]100-justine understood now that the flaw [she]100-justine felt was far deeper than any defect of manner . It was the sense in [him]120-mr. langhope of something unstable and incalculable , something at once weak and violent , that was brought to light by the contrast of [Amherst]170-bessy 's quiet resolution . Here was [a man whom no gusts of chance]1814-a man whom no gusts of chance could deflect from [his]120-mr. langhope purpose ; while [she]100-justine felt that the career to which [Wyant]165-wyant had so ardently given [himself]165-wyant would always be at the mercy of [his]165-wyant passing emotions . As the distinction grew clearer , [Justine]100-justine trembled to think that [she]100-justine had so nearly pledged [herself]100-justine , without the excuse of love , to [a man whose failings [she]100-justine could judge so lucidly ....]1815-a man whose failings she could judge so lucidly .... But had [she]100-justine ever really thought of marrying [Wyant]165-wyant ? While [she]100-justine continued to talk with [Amherst]170-bessy such a possibility became more and more remote , till [she]100-justine began to feel it was no more than a haunting dream . But [her]100-justine promise to see [Wyant]165-wyant the next day reminded [her]100-justine of the nearness of [her]100-justine peril . How could [she]100-justine have played with [her]100-justine fate so lightly -- [she]100-justine , who held [her]100-justine life so dear because [she]100-justine felt in it such untried powers of action and emotion ? [She]100-justine continued to listen to [Amherst]170-bessy 's account of [his]165-wyant work , with enough outward self - possession to place the right comment and put the right question , yet conscious only of the quiet strength [she]100-justine was absorbing from [his]165-wyant presence , of the way in which [his]165-wyant words , [his]165-wyant voice , [his]165-wyant mere nearness were slowly steadying and clarifying [her]100-justine will . In [the smoking - room]1582-the smoking - room , after [the ladies]1817-the ladies had gone [upstairs]1423-upstairs , [Amherst]170-bessy continued to acquit [himself]170-bessy mechanically of [his]165-wyant duties , against the incongruous back - ground of [[his]165-wyant predecessor]1819-his predecessor 's remarkable sporting - prints -- for it was characteristic of [his]165-wyant relation to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook that [his]165-wyant life there was carried on in the setting of foils and boxing - gloves , firearms and racing - trophies , which had expressed [Dick Westmore]126-dick 's ideals . Never very keenly alive to [his]165-wyant material surroundings , and quite unconscious of the irony of this proximity , [Amherst]170-bessy had come to accept [[[his]165-wyant wife]3350-his wife 's guests]1706-his wife 's guests as unquestioningly as [their]1706-his wife 's guests background , and with the same sense of [their]1706-his wife 's guests being an inevitable part of [his]165-wyant new life . [Their]1706-his wife 's guests talk was no more intelligible to [him]165-wyant than the red and yellow hieroglyphics of the racing - prints , and [he]165-wyant smoked in silence while [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope discoursed to [Westy Gaines]113-westy on the recent sale of Chinese porcelains at which [he]165-wyant had been lucky enough to pick up the set of [Ming]182-ming for [[his]165-wyant daughter]514-his daughter , and [Mason Winch]184-mason winch expounded to [a group of languid listeners]1823-a group of languid listeners the essential dependence of [the labouring - man]1824-the labouring - man on the prosperity of [Wall Street]40-wall street . [He]165-wyant had left [[his]165-wyant wife]3350-his wife 's presence in that state of moral lassitude when the strongest hopes droop under the infection of indifference and hostility , and the effort of attainment seems out of all proportion to the end in view ; but as [he]165-wyant listened to [Justine]100-justine all [his]165-wyant energies sprang to life again . [Those observers who had been struck by the length and animation of [Miss Brent]97-miss brent 's talk with [her]97-miss brent host]1832-those observers who had been struck by the length and animation of miss brent 's talk with her host -- and among whom [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell and [Westy Gaines]113-westy were foremost -- would hardly have believed how small a part [her]100-justine personal charms had played in attracting [him]165-wyant .
