[You]178-mrs. ansell 've given [her]170-bessy just acuteness enough to question , without consecutiveness enough to explain . But if [she]170-bessy must perish in the struggle -- and [I]178-mrs. ansell see no hope for [her--]170-bessy "[178-mrs. ansell] cried [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , starting suddenly and dramatically to [her]178-mrs. ansell feet , " at least let [her]170-bessy perish defending [her]170-bessy ideals and not denying them -- even if [she]170-bessy has to sell [the New York house]4236-the new york house and all [your]178-mrs. ansell china pots into the bargain ! "[178-mrs. ansell] [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , rising also , deprecatingly lifted [his]120-mr. langhope hands , " If that 's what [you]178-mrs. ansell call saving [me]120-mr. langhope from [her]170-bessy vengeance -- sending the crockery crashing round [my]120-mr. langhope ears ! "[120-mr. langhope] And , as [she]178-mrs. ansell turned away without any pretense of capping [his]120-mr. langhope pleasantry , [he]120-mr. langhope added , with a gleam of friendly malice : " [I]120-mr. langhope suppose [you]178-mrs. ansell 're going to the Hunt ball as [Cassandra]194-cassandra ? "[120-mr. langhope] * * * * * [Amherst]170-bessy , that morning , had sought out [[his]120-mr. langhope wife]3350-his wife with the definite resolve to efface the unhappy impression of [their]1845-their previous talk . [He]120-mr. langhope blamed [himself]120-mr. langhope for having been too easily repelled by [her]3350-his wife impatience . As the stronger of the two , with the power of a fixed purpose to sustain [him]120-mr. langhope , [he]120-mr. langhope should have allowed for the instability of [her]3350-his wife impulses , and above all for the automatic influences of habit . Knowing that [she]3350-his wife did not keep early hours [he]120-mr. langhope delayed till ten o'clock to present [himself]120-mr. langhope at [her]3350-his wife sitting - room door , but [the maid who answered [his]120-mr. langhope knock]1846-the maid who answered his knock informed [him]120-mr. langhope that [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst was not yet up . [His]120-mr. langhope reply that [he]120-mr. langhope would wait did not appear to hasten the leisurely process of [her]3350-his wife toilet , and [he]120-mr. langhope had [the room]3355-the room to [himself]120-mr. langhope for a full half - hour . Many months had passed since [he]120-mr. langhope had spent so long a time in it , and though habitually unobservant of external details , [he]120-mr. langhope now found an outlet for [his]120-mr. langhope restlessness in mechanically noting the intimate appurtenances of [Bessy]170-bessy 's life . [He]120-mr. langhope was at first merely conscious of a soothing harmony of line and colour , extending from the blurred tints of the rug to the subdued gleam of light on old picture - frames and on the slender flanks of porcelain vases ; but gradually [he]120-mr. langhope began to notice how every chair and screen and cushion , and even every trifling utensil on the inlaid writing - desk , had been chosen with reference to the whole composition , and to the minutest requirements of a fastidious leisure . A few months ago this studied setting , if [he]120-mr. langhope had thought of it at all , would have justified itself as expressing [the pretty woman]1848-the pretty woman 's natural affinity with pretty toys ; but now it was the cost of it that struck [him]120-mr. langhope . [He]120-mr. langhope was beginning to learn from [Bessy]170-bessy 's bills that no commodity is taxed as high as beauty , and the beauty about [him]120-mr. langhope filled [him]120-mr. langhope with sudden repugnance , as the disguise of the evil influences that were separating [[his]120-mr. langhope wife]3350-his wife 's life from [his]120-mr. langhope . But with [her]3350-his wife entrance [he]120-mr. langhope dismissed the thought , and tried to meet [her]3350-his wife as if nothing stood in the way of [their]1850-their full communion . [Her]3350-his wife hair , still wet from the bath , broke from its dryad - like knot in dusky rings and spirals threaded with gold , and from [her]3350-his wife loose flexible draperies , and [[her]3350-his wife whole person]1851-her whole person as [she]3350-his wife moved , there came a scent of youth and morning freshness . [Her]3350-his wife beauty touched [him]120-mr. langhope , and made it easier for [him]120-mr. langhope to humble [himself]120-mr. langhope . " [I]120-mr. langhope was stupid and disagreeable last night . [I]120-mr. langhope can never say what [I]120-mr. langhope want when [I]120-mr. langhope have to count the minutes , and [I]120-mr. langhope 've come back now for a quiet talk , "[120-mr. langhope] [he]120-mr. langhope began . A shade of distrust passed over [Bessy]170-bessy 's face . " About business ? "[3350-his wife] [she]3350-his wife asked , pausing a few feet away from [him]120-mr. langhope . " Do n't let [us]4253-us give it that name ! "[3350-his wife] [He]120-mr. langhope went up to [her]3350-his wife and drew [her]3350-his wife two hands into [his]120-mr. langhope . " [You]3350-his wife used to call it [our]4253-us work -- won't [you]3350-his wife go back to that way of looking at it ? "[120-mr. langhope] [Her]3350-his wife hands resisted [his]120-mr. langhope pressure . " [I]120-mr. langhope did n't know , then , that it was going to be the only thing [you]3350-his wife cared for---- "[120-mr. langhope] But for [her]3350-his wife own sake [he]120-mr. langhope would not let [her]3350-his wife go on . " Some day [I]120-mr. langhope shall make [you]3350-his wife see how much [my]120-mr. langhope caring for it means [my]120-mr. langhope caring for [you]3350-his wife . But meanwhile , "[120-mr. langhope] [he]120-mr. langhope urged , " wo n't [you]3350-his wife overcome [your]3350-his wife aversion to the subject , and bear with it as [my]120-mr. langhope work , if [you]3350-his wife no longer care to think of it as [yours]3350-his wife ? "[120-mr. langhope] [Bessy]170-bessy , freeing [herself]170-bessy , sat down on the edge of the straight - backed chair near the desk , as though to mark the parenthetical nature of the interview . " [I]170-bessy know [you]3350-his wife think [me]170-bessy stupid -- but [wives]4254-wives are not usually expected to go into all the details of [[their]4254-wives husband]4255-their husband 's business . [I]170-bessy have told [you]3350-his wife to do whatever [you]3350-his wife wish at [Westmore]104-westmore , and [I]170-bessy ca n't see why that is not enough . "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy looked at [her]170-bessy in surprise . Something in [her]170-bessy quick mechanical utterance suggested that not only the thought but the actual words [she]170-bessy spoke had been inspired , and [he]1852-he fancied [he]1852-he heard in them an echo of [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury 's tones . Though [Bessy]170-bessy 's intimacy with [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury was of such recent date , fragments of unheeded smoking - room gossip now recurred to confirm the vague antipathy which [Amherst]170-bessy had felt for [her]170-bessy the previous evening . " [I]170-bessy know that , among [[your]3350-his wife friends]4256-your friends , [wives]4254-wives are not expected to interest [themselves]4254-wives in [[their]4254-wives husbands]4258-their husbands ' work , and if [the mills]3324-the mills were mine [I]170-bessy should try to conform to the custom , though [I]170-bessy should always think it a pity that the questions that fill [a man]3349-a man 's thoughts should be ruled out of [his]3349-a man talk with [[his]3349-a man wife]3350-his wife ; but as it is , [I]170-bessy am only [[your]3350-his wife representative at [Westmore]104-westmore]4262-your representative at westmore , and [I]170-bessy do n't see how [we]4263-we can help having the subject come up between [us]4263-we . "[170-bessy] [Bessy]170-bessy remained silent , not as if acquiescing in [his]1853-he plea , but as though [her]170-bessy own small stock of arguments had temporarily failed [her]170-bessy ; and [he]1853-he went on , enlarging on [his]1853-he theme with a careful avoidance of technical terms , and with the constant effort to keep the human and personal side of the question before [her]170-bessy . [She]170-bessy listened without comment , [her]170-bessy eyes fixed on a little jewelled letter - opener which [she]170-bessy had picked up from the writing - table , and which [she]170-bessy continued to turn in [her]170-bessy fingers while [he]1853-he spoke . The full development of [Amherst]170-bessy 's plans at [Westmore]104-westmore , besides resulting , as [he]1853-he had foreseen , in [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's resignation , and in [Halford Gaines]164-hanaford 's outspoken resistance to the new policy , had necessitated a larger immediate outlay of capital than the first estimates demanded , and [Amherst]170-bessy , in putting [his]1853-he case to [Bessy]170-bessy , was prepared to have [her]170-bessy meet it on the old ground of the disapproval of [all [her]170-bessy advisers]1854-all her advisers . But when [he]1853-he had ended [she]170-bessy merely said , without looking up from the toy in [her]170-bessy hand : " [I]170-bessy always expected that [you]1853-he would need a great deal more money than [you]1853-he thought . "[170-bessy] The comment touched [him]1853-he at [his]1853-he most vulnerable point . " But [you]1853-he see why ? [You]1853-he understand how the work has gone on growing-- ? "[170-bessy] [[His]1853-he wife]3350-his wife lifted [her]3350-his wife head to glance at [him]1853-he for a moment . " [I]3350-his wife am not sure that [I]3350-his wife understand , "[3350-his wife] [she]3350-his wife said indifferently ; " but if another loan is necessary , of course [I]3350-his wife will sign the note for it . "[3350-his wife] The words checked [his]1853-he reply by bringing up , before [he]1853-he was prepared to deal with it , the other and more embarrassing aspect of the question . [He]1853-he had hoped to reawaken in [Bessy]170-bessy some feeling for the urgency of [his]1853-he task before having to take up the subject of its cost ; but [her]3350-his wife cold anticipation of [his]1853-he demands as part of a disagreeable business to be despatched and put out of mind , doubled the difficulty of what [he]1853-he had left to say ; and it occurred to [him]1853-he that [she]3350-his wife had perhaps foreseen and reckoned on this result . [He]1853-he met [her]3350-his wife eyes gravely . " Another loan _ is _ necessary ; but if any proper provision is to be made for paying it back , [your]170-bessy expenses will have to be cut down a good deal for the next few months . "[1853-he] The blood leapt to [Bessy]170-bessy 's face . " [My]1853-he expenses ? [You]1853-he seem to forget how much [I]1853-he 've had to cut them down already . "[1853-he] " The household bills certainly do n't show it . They are increasing steadily , and there have been some very heavy incidental payments lately . "[3350-his wife] " What do [you]1853-he mean by incidental payments ? "[1853-he] " Well , there was the pair of cobs [you]170-bessy bought last month---- "[3350-his wife] [She]3350-his wife returned to a resigned contemplation of the letter - opener . " With only one motor , one must have more horses , of course . "[3350-his wife] " [The stables]4264-the stables seemed to [me]170-bessy fairly full before . But if [you]170-bessy required more horses , [I]170-bessy do n't see why , at this particular moment , it was also necessary to buy a set of Chinese vases for twenty - five hundred dollars . "[170-bessy] [Bessy]170-bessy , at this , lifted [her]3350-his wife head with an air of decision that surprised [him]1853-he . [Her]3350-his wife blush had faded as quickly as it came , and [he]1853-he noticed that [she]3350-his wife was pale to the lips . " [I]3350-his wife know [you]170-bessy do n't care about such things ; but [I]3350-his wife had an exceptional chance of securing the vases at a low price -- they are really worth twice as much -- and [Dick]126-dick always wanted a set of Ming for the drawing - room mantelpiece . "[3350-his wife] [Richard Westmore]109-westmore 's name was always tacitly avoided between [them]1856-them , for in [Amherst]170-bessy 's case the disagreeable sense of dependence on [a dead man]1857-a dead man 's bounty increased that feeling of obscure constraint and repugnance which any reminder of [the first husband]1858-the first husband 's existence is wo nt to produce in [[his]1858-the first husband successor]1859-his successor . [He]1853-he reddened at the reply , and [Bessy]170-bessy , profiting by an embarrassment which [she]170-bessy had perhaps consciously provoked , went on hastily , and as if by rote : " [I]170-bessy have left [you]170-bessy perfectly free to do as [you]170-bessy think best at [the mills]3324-the mills , but this perpetual discussion of [my]170-bessy personal expenses is very unpleasant to [me]170-bessy , as [I]170-bessy am sure it must be to [you]170-bessy , and in future [I]170-bessy think it would be much better for [us]1856-them to have separate accounts . "[170-bessy] " Separate accounts ? "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy echoed in genuine astonishment . " [I]170-bessy should like [my]170-bessy personal expenses to be under [my]170-bessy own control again -- [I]170-bessy have never been used to accounting for every penny [I]170-bessy spend . "[170-bessy] The vertical lines deepened between [Amherst]170-bessy 's brows . " [You]170-bessy are of course free to spend [your]170-bessy money as [you]170-bessy like -- and [I]1860-her thought [you]170-bessy were doing so when [you]170-bessy authorized [me]1860-her , last spring , to begin the changes at [Westmore]104-westmore . "[1860-her] [Her]1860-her lip trembled . " Do [you]170-bessy reproach [me]1860-her for that ? [I]1860-her did n't understand ... [you]170-bessy took advantage .... "[1860-her] " Oh ! "[1861-he] [he]1861-he exclaimed . At [his]1861-he tone the blood rushed back to [her]1860-her face . " It was [my]170-bessy fault , of course -- [I]170-bessy only wanted to please [you----]1861-he "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy was silent , confronted by the sudden sense of [his]1861-he own responsibility . What [she]1860-her said was true -- [he]1861-he had known , when [he]1861-he exacted the sacrifice , that [she]1860-her made it only to please [him]1861-he , on an impulse of reawakened feeling , and not from any real recognition of a larger duty . The perception of this made [him]1861-he answer gently : " [I]1861-he am willing to take any blame [you]1860-her think [I]1861-he deserve ; but it wo n't help [us]4266-us now to go back to the past . It is more important that [we]4266-us should come to an understanding about the future . If by keeping [your]1860-her personal account separate , [you]1860-her mean that [you]1860-her wish to resume control of [your]1860-her whole income , then [you]1860-her ought to understand that the improvements at [the mills]3324-the mills will have to be dropped at once , and things there go back to [their]3324-the mills old state . "[1861-he] [She]1860-her started up with an impatient gesture . " Oh , [I]1860-her should like never to hear of [the mills]3324-the mills again ! "[1860-her] [He]1861-he looked at [her]1860-her a moment in silence . " Am [I]1860-her to take that as [your]1860-her answer ? "[1860-her] [She]1860-her walked toward [her]1860-her door without returning [his]1861-he look . " Of course , "[1860-her] [she]1860-her murmured , " [you]1861-he will end by doing as [you]1861-he please . "[1860-her] The retort moved [him]1861-he , for [he]1861-he heard in it the cry of [her]1860-her wounded pride . [He]1861-he longed to be able to cry out in return that [Westmore]109-westmore was nothing to [him]1861-he , that all [he]1861-he asked was to see [her]1860-her happy .... But it was not true , and [his]1861-he manhood revolted from the deception . Besides , its effect would be only temporary -- would wear no better than [her]1860-her vain efforts to simulate an interest in [his]1861-he work . Between [them]1862-them , forever , were the insurmountable barriers of character , of education , of habit -- and yet it was not in [him]1861-he to believe that any barrier was insurmountable . " [Bessy]170-bessy , "[1861-he] [he]1861-he exclaimed , following [her]1860-her , " do n't let [us]1862-them part in this way---- "[1861-he] [She]1860-her paused with [her]1860-her hand on [her]1860-her dressing - room door . " It is time to dress for [church]4269-church , "[1860-her] [she]1860-her objected , turning to glance at the little gilt clock on the chimney - piece . " For [church]4269-church ? "[1860-her] [Amherst]170-bessy stared , wondering that at such a crisis [she]1860-her should have remained detached enough to take note of the hour . " [You]170-bessy forget , "[1860-her] [she]1860-her replied , with an air of gentle reproof , " that before [we]1862-them married [I]1860-her was in the habit of going to [church]4269-church every Sunday . "[1860-her] " Yes -- to be sure . Would [you]170-bessy not like [me]1861-he to go with [you]170-bessy ? "[1861-he] [he]1861-he rejoined gently , as if roused to the consciousness of another omission in the long list of [his]1861-he social shortcomings ; for church - going , at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , had always struck [him]1861-he as a purely social observance . But [Bessy]170-bessy had opened the door of [[her]170-bessy dressing - room]1781-her dressing - room . " [I]170-bessy much prefer that [you]170-bessy should do what [you]170-bessy like , "[170-bessy] [she]170-bessy said as [she]170-bessy passed from [the room]3355-the room . " That 's the end of it ! "[1861-he] [he]1861-he murmured , picking up the letter - opener [she]170-bessy had been playing with , and twirling it absently in [his]1861-he fingers . But nothing in life ever ends , and the next moment a new question confronted [him]1861-he -- how was the next chapter to open ? BOOK III XIX IT was late in October when [Amherst]170-bessy returned to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . [He]1861-he had begun to learn , in the interval , the lesson most difficult to [his]1861-he direct and trenchant nature : that compromise is the law of married life . On the afternoon of [his]1861-he talk with [[his]1861-he wife]3350-his wife [he]1861-he had sought [her]3350-his wife out , determined to make a final effort to clear up the situation between [them]1865-their ; but [he]1861-he learned that , immediately after luncheon , [she]3350-his wife had gone off in [the motor]1867-the motor with [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury and [two men of the party]1868-two men of the party , leaving word that [they]1865-their would probably not be back till evening . It cost [Amherst]170-bessy a struggle , when [he]1861-he had humbled [himself]1861-he to receive this information from [the butler]753-the butler , not to pack [his]1861-he portmanteau and take [the first train]1870-the first train for [Hanaford]1-hanaford ; but [he]1861-he was still under the influence of [Justine Brent]100-justine 's words , and also of [his]1861-he own feeling that , at this juncture , a break between [himself]1861-he and [Bessy]170-bessy would be final . [He]1861-he stayed on accordingly , enduring as best [he]1861-he might the mute observation of [the household]1514-the household , and the gentle irony of [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's attentions ; and before [he]1861-he left [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , two days later , a provisional understanding had been reached . [[His]1861-he wife]3350-his wife proved more firm than [he]1861-he had foreseen in [her]3350-his wife resolve to regain control of [her]3350-his wife income , and the talk between [them]1873-them ended in reciprocal concessions , [Bessy]170-bessy consenting to let [the town house]1874-the town house for the winter and remain at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , while [Amherst]170-bessy agreed to restrict [his]1861-he improvements at [Westmore]104-westmore to such alterations as had already been begun , and to reduce the expenditure on these as much as possible . It was virtually the defeat of [his]1861-he policy , and [he]1861-he had to suffer the decent triumph of [the Gaineses]127-the gaineses , as well as the bitterer pang of [his]1861-he foiled aspirations . In spite of the opposition of [the directors]4043-the directors , [he]1861-he had taken advantage of [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's resignation to put [Duplain]138-duplain at the head of [the mills]3324-the mills ; but [the new manager]1877-the new manager 's outspoken disgust at [the company]3366-the company 's change of plan made it clear that [he]1861-he would not remain long at [Westmore]104-westmore , and it was one of the miseries of [Amherst]170-bessy 's situation that [he]1861-he could not give the reasons for [his]1861-he defection , but must bear to figure in [Duplain]138-duplain 's terse vocabulary as [a " quitter]4272-a " quitter . "[4272-a " quitter] The difficulty of finding [a new manager]1879-a new manager expert enough to satisfy [the directors]4043-the directors , yet in sympathy with [his]1861-he own social theories , made [Amherst]170-bessy fear that [Duplain]138-duplain 's withdrawal would open the way for [Truscomb]105-truscomb 's reinstatement , an outcome on which [he]1861-he suspected [Halford Gaines]164-hanaford had always counted ; and this possibility loomed before [him]1861-he as the final defeat of [his]1861-he hopes . Meanwhile the issues ahead had at least the merit of keeping [him]1861-he busy . The task of modifying and retrenching [his]1861-he plans contrasted drearily with the hopeful activity of the past months , but [he]1861-he had an iron capacity for hard work under adverse conditions , and the fact of being too busy for thought helped [him]1861-he to wear through the days . This pressure of work relieved [him]1861-he , at first , from too close consideration of [his]1861-he relation to [Bessy]170-bessy . [He]1861-he had yielded up [his]1861-he dearest hopes at [her]170-bessy wish , and for the moment [his]1861-he renunciation had set a chasm between [them]1881-them ; but gradually [he]1861-he saw that , as [he]1861-he was patching together the ruins of [his]1861-he Westmore plans , so [he]1861-he must presently apply [himself]1861-he to the reconstruction of [his]1861-he married life . Before leaving [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook [he]1861-he had had a last word with [Miss Brent]97-miss brent ; not a word of confidence -- for the same sense of reserve kept both from any explicit renewal of [their]1881-them moment 's intimacy -- but one of those exchanges of commonplace phrase that circumstances may be left to charge with special meaning . [Justine]100-justine had merely asked if [he]1861-he were really leaving and , on [his]1861-he assenting , had exclaimed quickly : " But [you]1861-he will come back soon ? "[100-justine] " [I]1861-he shall certainly come back , "[1861-he] [he]1861-he answered ; and after a pause [he]1861-he added : " [I]1861-he shall find [you]100-justine here ? [You]100-justine will remain at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ? "[1861-he] On [her]100-justine part also there was a shade of hesitation ; then [she]100-justine said with a smile : " Yes , [I]100-justine shall stay . "[100-justine] [His]1861-he look brightened . " And [you]100-justine 'll write [me]100-justine if anything -- if [Bessy]170-bessy should not be well ? "[100-justine] " [I]100-justine will write [you]1861-he , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine promised ; and a few weeks after [his]1861-he return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford [he]1861-he had , in fact , received a short note from [her]100-justine . Its ostensible purpose was to reassure [him]1861-he as to [Bessy]170-bessy 's health , which had certainly grown stronger since [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant had persuaded [her]100-justine , at the close of the last house - party , to accord [herself]100-justine a period of quiet ; but ( [the writer]1882-the writer added ) now that [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope and [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell had also left , the quiet was perhaps too complete , and [Bessy]170-bessy 's nerves were beginning to suffer from the reaction . [Amherst]170-bessy had no difficulty in interpreting this brief communication . " [I]170-bessy have succeeded in dispersing [the people who are always keeping [you]170-bessy and [[your]170-bessy wife]4011-your wife apart]4273-the people who are always keeping you and your wife apart ; now is [your]170-bessy chance : come and take it . "[170-bessy] That was what [Miss Brent]97-miss brent 's letter meant ; and [his]1861-he answer was a telegram to [Bessy]170-bessy , announcing [his]1861-he return to [Long Island]8-long island . The step was not an easy one ; but decisive action , however hard , was always easier to [Amherst]170-bessy than the ensuing interval of readjustment . To come to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook had required a strong effort of will ; but the effort of remaining there called into play less disciplined faculties . [Amherst]170-bessy had always been used to doing things ; now [he]1861-he had to resign [himself]1861-he to enduring a state of things . The material facilities of the life about [him]1861-he , the way in which the machinery of [the great empty house]1883-the great empty house ran on like some complex apparatus working in the void , increased the exasperation of [his]1861-he nerves . [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant 's suggestion -- which [Amherst]170-bessy suspected [Justine]100-justine of having prompted -- that [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst should cancel [her]117-mrs. amherst autumn engagements , and give [herself]117-mrs. amherst up to a quiet outdoor life with [[her]117-mrs. amherst husband]3393-her husband , seemed to present the very opportunity [these two distracted spirits]1885-these two distracted spirits needed to find and repossess [each other]407-each other . But , though [Amherst]170-bessy was grateful to [Bessy]170-bessy for having dismissed [[her]170-bessy visitors]1887-her visitors -- partly to please [him]1861-he , as [he]1861-he guessed -- yet [he]1861-he found the routine of [the establishment]1888-the establishment more oppressive than when [the house]311-the house was full . If [he]1861-he could have been alone with [her]170-bessy in a quiet corner -- [the despised cottage at [Westmore]104-westmore]1890-the despised cottage at westmore , [even!--he]1891-even!--he fancied [they]1892-they might still have been brought together by restricted space and the familiar exigencies of life . All the primitive necessities which bind together , through [their]1892-they recurring daily wants , natures fated to find no higher point of union , had been carefully eliminated from the life at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , where material needs were not only provided for but anticipated by a hidden mechanism that filled [the house]311-the house with the perpetual sense of invisible attendance . Though [Amherst]170-bessy knew that [he]1861-he and [Bessy]170-bessy could never meet in [the region of great issues]1894-the region of great issues , [he]1861-he thought [he]1861-he might have regained the way to [her]170-bessy heart , and found relief from [his]1861-he own inaction , in the small ministrations of daily life ; but the next moment [he]1861-he smiled to picture [Bessy]170-bessy in surroundings where the clocks were not wound of themselves and the doors did not fly open at [her]170-bessy approach . Those thick - crowding cares and drudgeries which serve as merciful screens between so many discordant natures would have been as intolerable to [her]170-bessy as was to [Amherst]170-bessy the great glare of leisure in which [he]1861-he and [she]170-bessy were now confronted . [He]1861-he saw that [Bessy]170-bessy was in the state of propitiatory eagerness which always followed on [her]170-bessy gaining a point in [their]1895-their long duel ; and [he]1861-he could guess that [she]170-bessy was tremulously anxious not only to make up to [him]1861-he , by all the arts [she]170-bessy knew , for the sacrifice [she]170-bessy had exacted , but also to conceal from every one the fact that , as [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope bluntly put it , [he]1861-he had been " brought to terms . "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy was touched by [her]170-bessy efforts , and half - ashamed of [his]1861-he own inability to respond to [them]1896-them . But [his]1861-he mind , released from its normal preoccupations , had become a dangerous instrument of analysis and disintegration , and conditions which , a few months before , [he]1861-he might have accepted with the wholesome tolerance of [the busy man]1897-the busy man , now pressed on [him]1861-he unendurably . [He]1861-he saw that [he]1861-he and [[his]1861-he wife]3350-his wife were really face to face for the first time since [their]1895-their marriage . Hitherto something had always intervened between [them]1895-their -- first the spell of [her]170-bessy grace and beauty , and the brief joy of [her]170-bessy participation in [his]1861-he work ; then the sorrow of [[their]1895-their child]1899-their child 's death , and after that the temporary exhilaration of carrying out [his]1861-he ideas at [Westmore]104-westmore -- but now that the last of these veils had been torn away [they]1895-their faced [each other]407-each other as [strangers]810-strangers . * * * * * The habit of keeping factory hours always drove [Amherst]170-bessy forth long before [[his]1861-he wife]3350-his wife 's day began , and in the course of one of [his]1861-he early tramps [he]1861-he met [Miss Brent]97-miss brent and [Cicely]167-cicely setting out for [a distant swamp where rumour]1903-a distant swamp where rumour had it that a rare native orchid might be found . [Justine]100-justine 's sylvan tastes had developed in [the little girl]1723-the little girl a passion for such pillaging expeditions , and [Cicely]167-cicely , who had discovered that [[her]167-cicely step - father]1905-her step - father knew almost as much about birds and squirrels as [Miss Brent]97-miss brent did about flowers , was not to be appeased till [Amherst]170-bessy had scrambled into [the pony - cart]1906-the pony - cart , wedging [his]1861-he long legs between a fern - box and a lunch - basket , and balancing [a Scotch terrier]1907-a scotch terrier 's telescopic body across [his]1861-he knees . The season was so mild that only one or two light windless frosts had singed the foliage of oaks and beeches , and gilded the roadsides with a smooth carpeting of maple leaves . The morning haze rose like smoke from burnt - out pyres of sumach and sugar - maple ; a silver bloom lay on the furrows of [the ploughed fields]1908-the ploughed fields ; and now and then , as [they]1909-they drove on , [the wooded road]1910-the wooded road showed at [its]1910-the wooded road end a tarnished disk of light , where [sea and sky]1911-sea and sky were merged . At length [they]1909-they left [the road]1912-the road for a winding track through scrub - oaks and glossy thickets of mountain - laurel ; the track died out at the foot of [a wooded knoll]1913-a wooded knoll , and clambering along [its]1910-the wooded road base [they]1909-they came upon [the swamp]1914-the swamp . [There]3361-there [it]1914-the swamp lay in charmed solitude , shut in by a tawny growth of larch and swamp - maple , [its]1914-the swamp edges burnt out to smouldering shades of russet , ember - red and ashen - grey , while the quaking centre still preserved a jewel - like green , where hidden lanes of moisture wound between islets tufted with swamp - cranberry and with the charred browns of fern and wild rose and bay . Sodden earth and decaying branches gave forth a strange sweet odour , as of the aromatic essences embalming a dead summer ; and the air charged with this scent was so still that the snapping of witch - hazel pods , the drop of a nut , the leap of a startled frog , pricked the silence with separate points of sound . The pony made fast , [the terrier]1916-the terrier released , and fern - box and lunch - basket slung over [Amherst]170-bessy 's shoulder , [the three explorers]1917-the three explorers set forth on [their]1917-the three explorers journey . [Amherst]170-bessy , as became [his]1861-he sex , went first ; but after a few absent - minded plunges into [the sedgy depths between [the islets]1919-the islets]1918-the sedgy depths between the islets , [he]1861-he was ordered to relinquish [his]1861-he command and fall to the rear , where [he]1861-he might perform the humbler service of occasionally lifting [Cicely]167-cicely over unspannable gulfs of moisture . [Justine]100-justine , leading the way , guided [them]1917-the three explorers across the treacherous surface as fearlessly as [a king - fisher]1920-a king - fisher , lighting instinctively on [every grass - tussock and submerged tree - stump of the uncertain path]1921-every grass - tussock and submerged tree - stump of the uncertain path . Now and then [she]100-justine paused , [her]100-justine feet drawn close on [their]1917-the three explorers narrow perch , and [her]100-justine slender body swaying over as [she]100-justine reached down for some rare growth detected among the withered reeds and grasses ; then [she]100-justine would right [herself]100-justine again by a backward movement as natural as the upward spring of a branch -- so free and flexible in all [her]100-justine motions that [she]100-justine seemed akin to the swaying reeds and curving brambles which caught at [her]100-justine as [she]100-justine passed . At length [the explorers]1922-the explorers reached the mossy corner where the orchids grew , and [Cicely]167-cicely , securely balanced on a fallen tree - trunk , was allowed to dig the coveted roots . When [they]1917-the three explorers had been packed away , it was felt that this culminating moment must be celebrated with immediate libations of jam and milk ; and having climbed to a dry slope among the pepper - bushes , [the party]586-the party fell on the contents of the lunch - basket . It was just the hour when [[Bessy]170-bessy 's maid]1924-bessy 's maid was carrying [her]1924-bessy 's maid breakfast - tray , with its delicate service of old silver and porcelain , into [the darkened bed - room at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]1925-the darkened bed - room at lynbrook ; but early rising and hard scrambling had whetted the appetites of [the naturalists]1926-the naturalists , and the nursery fare which [Cicely]167-cicely spread before [them]1926-the naturalists seemed a sumptuous reward for [their]1926-the naturalists toil . " [I]167-cicely do like this kind of picnic much better than the ones where [mother]3466-mother takes [all the footmen]4276-all the footmen , and the mayonnaise has to be scraped off things before [I]167-cicely can eat them , "[167-cicely] [Cicely]167-cicely declared , lifting [her]167-cicely foaming mouth from a beaker of milk . [Amherst]170-bessy , lighting [his]1927-his pipe , stretched [himself]1927-his contentedly among the pepper - bushes , steeped in that unreflecting peace which is shed into some hearts by communion with trees and sky . [He]1927-his too was glad to get away from [the footmen]1928-the footmen and the mayonnaise , and [he]1927-his imagined that [[his]1927-his stepdaughter]1929-his stepdaughter 's exclamation summed up all the reasons for [his]1927-his happiness . The boyish wood - craft which [he]1927-his had cultivated in order to encourage the same taste in [[his]1927-his factory lads]1930-his factory lads came to life in this sudden return to nature , and [he]1927-his redeemed [his]1927-his clumsiness in crossing [the swamp]1914-the swamp by spying a marsh - wren 's nest that had escaped [Justine]100-justine , and detecting in a swiftly - flitting olive - brown bird a belated tanager in autumn incognito . [Cicely]167-cicely sat rapt while [he]1927-his pictured the bird 's winter pilgrimage , with glimpses of [the seas]1932-the seas and islands that fled beneath [him]1927-his till [his]1927-his long southern flight ended in [the dim glades of [the equatorial forests]1934-the equatorial forests]1933-the dim glades of the equatorial forests . " Oh , what a good life -- how [I]100-justine should like to be a wander - bird , and look down [[people]3450-people 's chimneys]4278-people 's chimneys twice a year ! "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine laughed , tilting [her]100-justine head back to catch a last glimpse of [the tanager]1935-the tanager . The sun beamed full on [their]1936-their ledge from a sky of misty blue , and [she]100-justine had thrown aside [her]100-justine hat , uncovering [her]100-justine thick waves of hair , blue - black in the hollows , with warm rusty edges where they took the light . [Cicely]167-cicely dragged down a plumy spray of [traveller]1937-traveller 's joy and wound it above [[her]167-cicely friend]706-her friend 's forehead ; and thus wreathed , with [her]100-justine bright pallour relieved against the dusky autumn tints , [Justine]100-justine looked like a wood - spirit who had absorbed into [herself]100-justine the last golden juices of the year . [She]100-justine leaned back laughing against a tree - trunk , pelting [Cicely]167-cicely with witch - hazel pods , making the terrier waltz for scraps of ginger - bread , and breaking off now and then to imitate , with [her]100-justine clear full notes , the call of some hidden marsh - bird , or the scolding chatter of a squirrel in the scrub - oaks . " Is that what [you]170-bessy 'd like most about the journey -- looking down the chimneys ? "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy asked with a smile . " Oh , [I]170-bessy do n't know -- [I]170-bessy should love it all ! Think of the joy of skimming over half [the earth]4009-the earth -- seeing it born again out of darkness every morning ! Sometimes , when [I]170-bessy 've been up all night with [a patient]4280-a patient , and have seen [the world]259-the world _ come back to [me]170-bessy _ like that , [I]170-bessy 've been almost mad with its beauty ; and then the thought that [I]170-bessy 've never seen more than a little corner of it makes [me]170-bessy feel as if [I]170-bessy were chained . But [I]170-bessy think if [I]170-bessy had wings [I]170-bessy should choose to be a house - swallow ; and then , after [I]170-bessy 'd had [my]170-bessy fill of wonders , [I]170-bessy should come back to [[my]170-bessy familiar corner]4282-my familiar corner , and [[my]170-bessy house]4283-my house full of [busy humdrum people]4284-busy humdrum people , and fly low to warn [them]4284-busy humdrum people of rain , and wheel up high to show [them]4284-busy humdrum people it was good haying weather , and know what was going on in [every room in [the house]311-the house]4285-every room in the house , and [every house in [the village]1603-the village]4287-every house in the village ; and all the while [I]170-bessy should be hugging [my]170-bessy wonderful big secret -- the secret of snow - plains and [burning deserts]4289-burning deserts , and [coral islands]4290-coral islands and [buried cities]4291-buried cities -- and should put it all into [my]170-bessy chatter under the eaves , that [the people in [the house]311-the house]4292-the people in the house were always too busy to stop and listen to -- and when winter came [I]170-bessy 'm sure [I]170-bessy should hate to leave [them]4284-busy humdrum people , even to go back to [[my]170-bessy great Brazilian forests full of orchids and monkeys]4294-my great brazilian forests full of orchids and monkeys ! " Yes -- and that would remind [me]100-justine of [home]3405-home ! "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine cried , swinging about to pinch [the little girl]1723-the little girl 's chin . [She]100-justine was in one of the buoyant moods when the spirit of life caught [her]100-justine in its grip , and shook and tossed [her]100-justine on its mighty waves as a sea - bird is tossed through the spray of flying rollers . At such moments all the light and music of [the world]259-the world seemed distilled into [her]100-justine veins , and forced up in bubbles of laughter to [her]100-justine lips and eyes . [Amherst]170-bessy had never seen [her]100-justine thus , and [he]1941-he watched [her]100-justine with the sense of relaxation which the contact of limpid gaiety brings to a mind obscured by failure and self - distrust . [The world]259-the world was not so dark [a place]1943-a place after all , if such springs of merriment could well up in a heart as sensitive as [hers]100-justine to the burden and toil of existence . [XX AMHERST]196-xx amherst 'S morning excursions with [[his]1945-his step - daughter]1946-his step - daughter and [Miss Brent]97-miss brent renewed [themselves]1947-their more than once . [Bessy]170-bessy , as if in acknowledgment of [his]3393-her husband renunciation , rose earlier in order to prolong [their]1957-their rides together . [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant had counselled [her]3350-his wife against the fatigue of following the hounds , and [she]3350-his wife instinctively turned [their]1957-their horses away from the course the hunt was likely to take ; but now and then the cry of the pack , or the flash of red on a distant slope , sent the blood to [her]3350-his wife face and made [her]3350-his wife press [her]3350-his wife mare to a gallop . When [they]1957-their escaped such encounters [she]3350-his wife showed no great zest in the exercise , and [their]1957-their rides resolved [themselves]1957-their into a spiritless middle - aged jog along [the autumn lanes]1958-the autumn lanes . In the early days of [their]1957-their marriage the joy of a canter side by side had merged [them]1957-their in a community of sensation beyond need of speech ; but now that the physical spell had passed [they]1957-their felt the burden of a silence that [neither]1959-neither knew how to break . Once only , a moment 's friction galvanized these lifeless rides . It was one morning when [[Bessy]170-bessy 's wild mare Impulse]1960-bessy 's wild mare impulse , under - exercised and over - fed , suddenly broke from [her]170-bessy control , and would have unseated [her]170-bessy but for [Amherst]170-bessy 's grasp on the bridle . "[170-bessy] " If [you]1963-he like---- "[170-bessy] * * * * * [Amherst]170-bessy had made an attempt to occupy [himself]170-bessy with the condition of [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , [one of [those slovenly villages]1965-those slovenly villages , without individual character or the tradition of self - respect , which spring up in [America]18-america on the skirts of [the rich summer colonies]1966-the rich summer colonies]1964-one of those slovenly villages , without individual character or the tradition of self - respect , which spring up in america on the skirts of the rich summer colonies . [He]1963-he could even conceive that , under certain conditions , there might be compensations in the passive attitude ; but unfortunately these conditions were not such as the life at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook presented . The temporary cessation of [Bessy]170-bessy 's week - end parties had naturally not closed [her]170-bessy doors to [occasional visitors]1973-occasional visitors , and glimpses of the autumnal animation of [Long Island]8-long island passed now and then across [the Amhersts]159-john ' horizon . Throughout an existence which [one]3402-one divined to have been both dependent and desultory , [he]1963-he had preserved a sense of wider relations and acquired a smattering of information to which [he]1963-he applied [his]1963-he only independent faculty , that of clear thought . [He]1963-he could talk intelligently and not too inaccurately of the larger questions which [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ignored , and a gay indifference to the importance of money seemed the crowning grace of [his]1963-he nature , till [Amherst]170-bessy suddenly learned that this attitude of detachment was generally ascribed to the liberality of [Mrs. Fenton Carbury]193-mrs. carbury . " [Everybody]3896-everybody knows [she]193-mrs. carbury married [Fenton]193-mrs. carbury to provide for [Ned]181-ned bowfort , "[3457-some one] [some one]3457-some one let fall in the course of one of the smoking - room dissertations on which [the host of [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]1984-the host of lynbrook had such difficulty in fixing [his]1984-the host of lynbrook attention ; and [the speaker]1483-the speaker 's matter - of - course tone , and the careless acquiescence of [[his]1483-the speaker hearers]750-his hearers , were more offensive to [Amherst]170-bessy than the fact itself . In the first flush of [his]1963-he disgust [he]1963-he classed the story as one of the lies bred in the malarious air of after - dinner gossip ; but gradually [he]1963-he saw that , whether true or not , it had sufficient circulation to cast a shade of ambiguity on [the persons concerned]1987-the persons concerned . [Bessy]170-bessy alone seemed deaf to the rumours about [[her]170-bessy friend]706-her friend . There was something captivating to [her]170-bessy in [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury 's slang and noise , in [her]170-bessy defiance of decorum and contempt of criticism . " [I]170-bessy like [Blanche]180-blanche carbury because [she]170-bessy does n't pretend , "[170-bessy] was [Bessy]170-bessy 's vague justification of [the lady]3448-the lady ; but in reality [she]170-bessy was under the mysterious spell which such natures cast over the less venturesome imaginations of [their]1990-their own sex . [Amherst]170-bessy at first tried to deaden [himself]170-bessy to the situation , as part of the larger coil of miseries in which [he]1963-he found [himself]170-bessy ; but all [his]1963-he traditions were against such tolerance , and [they]1991-they were roused to revolt by the receipt of a newspaper clipping , sent by an anonymous hand , enlarging on the fact that the clandestine meetings of [a fashionable couple]1992-a fashionable couple were being facilitated by the connivance of [a Long Island _ chatelaine _]1993-a long island _ chatelaine _ . [Amherst]170-bessy , hot from the perusal of this paragraph , sprang into [the first train]1870-the first train , and laid the clipping before [[his]1963-he father - in - law , who chanced to be passing through [town]3932-town on [his]1963-he way from [the Hudson]14-the hudson to [the Hot Springs]1997-the hot springs]1995-his father - in - law , who chanced to be passing through town on his way from the hudson to the hot springs . [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , ensconced in the cushioned privacy of the reading - room at [the Amsterdam Club]1998-the amsterdam club , where [he]120-mr. langhope had invited [[his]120-mr. langhope son - in - law]1787-his son - in - law to meet [him]120-mr. langhope , perused the article with the cool eye of the collector to whom a new curiosity is offered . " [I]120-mr. langhope suppose , "[120-mr. langhope] [he]120-mr. langhope mused , " that in the time of [the Pharaohs the Morning Papyrus]4305-the pharaohs the morning papyrus used to serve up this kind of thing"--and[120-mr. langhope] then , as the nervous tension of [[his]120-mr. langhope hearer]738-his hearer expressed itself in an abrupt movement , [he]120-mr. langhope added , handing back the clipping with a smile : " What do [you]738-his hearer propose to do ? Kill [the editor]4306-the editor , and forbid [Blanche]180-blanche carbury and Bowfort [the house]311-the house ? "[120-mr. langhope] " [I]170-bessy mean to do something , "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy began , suddenly chilled by the realization that [his]120-mr. langhope wrath had not yet shaped itself into a definite plan of action . " Well , it must be that or nothing , "[120-mr. langhope] said [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , drawing [his]120-mr. langhope stick meditatively across [his]120-mr. langhope knee . " And , of course , if it 's _ that _ , [you]170-bessy 'll land [Bessy]170-bessy in a devil of a mess . "[120-mr. langhope] Without giving [[his]120-mr. langhope son - in - law]1787-his son - in - law time to protest , [he]120-mr. langhope touched rapidly but vividly on the inutility and embarrassment of libel suits , and on the devices whereby the legal means of vindication from such attacks may be turned against [those who have recourse to [them]2003-them]2002-those who have recourse to them ; and [Amherst]170-bessy listened with a sickened sense of the incompatibility between abstract standards of honour and their practical application . " What should [you]120-mr. langhope do , then ? "[120-mr. langhope] [he]120-mr. langhope murmured , as [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope ended with [his]120-mr. langhope light shrug and a " See [Tredegar]125-bessy , if [you]170-bessy do n't believe [me"--]4308-me"--[120-mr. langhope] ; and [[his]120-mr. langhope father - in - law]2004-his father - in - law replied with an evasive gesture : " Why , leave the responsibility where it belongs ! "[2004-his father - in - law] " Where it belongs ? "[120-mr. langhope] " To [Fenton Carbury]193-mrs. carbury , of course . Luckily it 's [nobody]3939-nobody 's business but [his]2004-his father - in - law , and if [he]2004-his father - in - law does n't mind what is said about [[his]2004-his father - in - law wife]3350-his wife [I]170-bessy do n't see how [you]170-bessy can take up the cudgels for [her]3350-his wife without casting another shade on [her]3350-his wife somewhat chequered reputation . "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy stared . " [[His]2004-his father - in - law wife]3350-his wife ? What do [I]170-bessy care what 's said of [her]3350-his wife ? [I]170-bessy 'm thinking of [mine]170-bessy ! "[170-bessy] " Well , if [Carbury]193-mrs. carbury has no objection to [[his]2004-his father - in - law wife]3350-his wife 's meeting [Bowfort]181-ned bowfort , [I]120-mr. langhope do n't see how [you]170-bessy can object to [her]3350-his wife meeting [him]2004-his father - in - law at [[your]170-bessy house]4313-your house . In such matters , as [you]170-bessy know , it has mercifully been decided that [the husband]3397-the husband 's attitude shall determine [other people]3861-other people 's ; otherwise [we]4316-we should be deprived of the legitimate pleasure of slandering [[our]4316-we neighbours]4317-our neighbours . "[120-mr. langhope] [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope was always careful to temper [his]120-mr. langhope explanations with an " as [you]170-bessy know "[120-mr. langhope] : [he]120-mr. langhope would have thought it ill - bred to omit this parenthesis in elucidating the social code to [[his]120-mr. langhope son - in - law]1787-his son - in - law . " Then [you]120-mr. langhope mean that [I]170-bessy can do nothing ? "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy exclaimed . [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope smiled . " What applies to [Carbury]193-mrs. carbury applies to [you]170-bessy -- by doing nothing [you]170-bessy establish the fact that there 's nothing to do ; just as [you]170-bessy create the difficulty by recognizing it . "[120-mr. langhope] And [he]120-mr. langhope added , as [Amherst]170-bessy sat silent : " Take [Bessy]170-bessy away , and [they]4318-they 'll have to see [each other]407-each other elsewhere . "[120-mr. langhope] * * * * * [Amherst]170-bessy returned to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook with the echoes of this casuistry in [his]2006-his brain . It seemed to [him]2006-his but a part of the ingenious system of evasion whereby a society bent on the undisturbed pursuit of amusement had contrived to protect itself from the intrusion of the disagreeable : a policy summed up in [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's concluding advice that [Amherst]170-bessy should take [[his]2006-his wife]3350-his wife away . Yes -- that was wealth 's contemptuous answer to every challenge of responsibility : duty , sorrow and disgrace were equally to be evaded by a change of residence , and nothing in life need be faced and fought out while [one]3402-one could pay for a passage to [Europe]17-europe ! In a calmer mood [Amherst]170-bessy 's sense of humour would have preserved [him]2006-his from such a view of [[his]2006-his father - in - law]2004-his father - in - law 's advice ; but just then it fell like a spark on [his]2006-his smouldering prejudices . [He]2006-his was clear - sighted enough to recognize the obstacles to legal retaliation ; but this only made [him]2006-his the more resolved to assert [his]2006-his will in [[his]2006-his own house]2010-his own house . [He]2006-his no longer paused to consider the possible effect of such a course on [his]2006-his already strained relations with [[his]2006-his wife]3350-his wife : [the man]3594-the man 's will rose in [him]2006-his and spoke . The scene between [Bessy]170-bessy and [himself]2006-his was short and sharp ; and it ended in a way that left [him]2006-his more than ever perplexed at the ways of [her]170-bessy sex . Impatient of preamble , [he]2006-his had opened the attack with [his]2006-his ultimatum : [the suspected couple]2013-the suspected couple were to be denied [the house]311-the house . [Bessy]170-bessy flamed into immediate defence of [[her]170-bessy friend]706-her friend ; but to [Amherst]170-bessy 's surprise [she]170-bessy no longer sounded the note of [her]170-bessy own rights . [Husband]2016-husband and [wife]2017-wife were animated by emotions deeper - seated and more instinctive than had ever before confronted [them]2013-the suspected couple ; yet while [Amherst]170-bessy 's resistance was gathering strength from the conflict , [Bessy]170-bessy unexpectedly collapsed in tears and submission . [She]2017-wife would do as [he]2006-his wished , of course -- give up seeing [Blanche]180-blanche carbury , dismiss [Bowfort]181-ned bowfort , wash [her]2017-wife hands , in short , of [the imprudent pair]2018-the imprudent pair -- in such matters [a woman]3817-a woman needed [a man]3349-a man 's guidance , [a wife]4020-a wife must of necessity see with [[her]4020-a wife husband]3393-her husband 's eyes ; and [she]2017-wife looked up into [his]2006-his through a mist of penitence and admiration .... XXI IN the first reaction from [her]2017-wife brief delusion about [Stephen Wyant]165-wyant , [Justine]100-justine accepted with a good grace the necessity of staying on at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . Though [she]2017-wife was now well enough to return to [her]2017-wife regular work , [her]2017-wife talk with [Amherst]170-bessy had made [her]2017-wife feel that , for the present , [she]2017-wife could be of more use by remaining with [Bessy]170-bessy ; and [she]2017-wife was not sorry to have a farther period of delay and reflection before taking the next step in [her]2017-wife life . These at least were the reasons [she]2017-wife gave [herself]2017-wife for deciding not to leave ; and if any less ostensible lurked beneath , they were not as yet visible even to [her]2017-wife searching self - scrutiny . At first [she]2017-wife was embarrassed by the obligation of meeting [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant , on whom [her]2017-wife definite refusal had produced an effect for which [she]2017-wife could not hold [herself]2017-wife blameless . [She]2017-wife had not kept [her]2017-wife promise of seeing [him]165-wyant on the day after [their]2023-their encounter at [the post - office]2024-the post - office , but had written , instead , in terms which obviously made such a meeting unnecessary . But all [her]2017-wife efforts to soften the abruptness of [her]2017-wife answer could not conceal , from either [herself]2017-wife or [[her]2017-wife suitor]1813-her suitor , that it was not the one [she]2017-wife had led [him]165-wyant to expect ; and [she]2017-wife foresaw that if [she]2017-wife remained at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook [she]2017-wife could not escape a scene of recrimination . When the scene took place , [Wyant]165-wyant 's part in it went far toward justifying [her]2017-wife decision ; yet [his]165-wyant vehement reproaches contained a sufficient core of truth to humble [her]2017-wife pride . It was lucky for [her]2017-wife somewhat exaggerated sense of fairness that [he]165-wyant overshot the mark by charging [her]2017-wife with a coquetry of which [she]2017-wife knew [herself]2017-wife innocent , and laying on [her]2017-wife the responsibility for any follies to which [her]2017-wife rejection might drive [him]165-wyant . Such threats , as a rule , no longer move the feminine imagination ; yet [Justine]100-justine 's pity for all forms of weakness made [her]100-justine recognize , in the very heat of [her]100-justine contempt for [Wyant]165-wyant , that [his]165-wyant reproaches were not the mere cry of wounded vanity but the appeal of a nature conscious of its lack of recuperative power . It seemed to [her]100-justine as though [she]100-justine had done [him]165-wyant irreparable harm , and the feeling might have betrayed [her]100-justine into too great a show of compassion had [she]100-justine not been restrained by a salutary fear of the result . The state of [Bessy]170-bessy 's nerves necessitated frequent visits from [[her]100-justine physician]2026-her physician , but [Justine]100-justine , on these occasions , could usually shelter [herself]100-justine behind the professional reserve which kept even [Wyant]165-wyant from any open expression of feeling . One day , however , [they]2027-they chanced to find [themselves]2027-they alone before [Bessy]170-bessy 's return from [her]170-bessy ride . [The servant]2028-the servant had ushered [Wyant]165-wyant into [the library]483-the library where [Justine]100-justine was writing , and when [she]100-justine had replied to [his]165-wyant enquiries about [[his]165-wyant patient]2030-his patient [they]2027-they found [themselves]2027-they face to face with an awkward period of waiting . [Justine]100-justine was too proud to cut it short by leaving [the room]3355-the room ; but [Wyant]165-wyant answered [her]100-justine commonplaces at random , stirring uneasily to and fro between window and fireside , and at length halting behind the table at which [she]100-justine sat . " May [I]165-wyant ask how much longer [you]100-justine mean to stay [here]3415-here ? "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant said in a low voice , [his]165-wyant eyes darkening under the sullen jut of the brows . As [she]100-justine glanced up in surprise [she]100-justine noticed for the first time an odd contraction of [his]165-wyant pupils , and the discovery , familiar enough in [her]100-justine professional experience , made [her]100-justine disregard the abruptness of [his]165-wyant question and softened the tone in which [she]100-justine answered . " [I]165-wyant hardly know -- [I]165-wyant suppose as long as [I]165-wyant am needed . "[165-wyant] [Wyant]165-wyant laughed . " Needed by whom ? By [John Amherst]99-amherst ? "[165-wyant] A moment passed before [Justine]100-justine took in the full significance of the retort ; then the blood rushed to [her]100-justine face . " Yes -- [I]100-justine believe both [Mr.]4321-mr. and [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst need [me]100-justine , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine answered , keeping [her]100-justine eyes on [his]165-wyant ; and [Wyant]165-wyant laughed again . " [You]100-justine did n't think so till [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst came back from [Hanaford]1-hanaford . [His]99-amherst return seems to have changed [your]100-justine plans in several respects . "[165-wyant] [She]100-justine looked away from [him]165-wyant , for even now [his]165-wyant eyes moved [her]100-justine to pity and self - reproach . " [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant , [you]165-wyant are not well ; why do [you]165-wyant wait to see [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst ? "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said . [He]165-wyant stared at [her]100-justine and then [his]165-wyant glance fell . " [I]165-wyant 'm much obliged -- [I'm]165-wyant as well as usual , "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant muttered , pushing the hair from [his]165-wyant forehead with a shaking hand ; and at that moment the sound of [Bessy]170-bessy 's voice gave [Justine]100-justine a pretext for escape . In [[her]100-justine own room]2032-her own room [she]100-justine sank for a moment under a rush of self - disgust ; but it soon receded before the saner forces of [her]100-justine nature , leaving only a residue of pity for [the poor creature whose secret [she]100-justine had surprised]2033-the poor creature whose secret she had surprised . [She]100-justine had never before suspected [Wyant]165-wyant of taking a drug , nor did [she]100-justine now suppose that [he]165-wyant did so habitually ; but to see [him]165-wyant even momentarily under such an influence explained [her]100-justine instinctive sense of [his]165-wyant weakness . [She]100-justine felt now that what would have been an insult on other lips was only a cry of distress from [his]165-wyant ; and once more [she]100-justine blamed [herself]100-justine and forgave [him]165-wyant . But if [she]100-justine had been inclined to any morbidness of self - reproach [she]100-justine would have been saved from it by other cares . For the moment [she]100-justine was more concerned with [Bessy]170-bessy 's fate than with [her]100-justine own -- [[her]100-justine poor friend]2034-her poor friend seemed to have so much more at stake , and so much less strength to bring to the defence of [her]100-justine happiness . [Justine]100-justine was always saved from any excess of self - compassion by the sense , within [herself]100-justine , of abounding forces of growth and self - renewal , as though from every lopped aspiration a fresh shoot of energy must spring ; but [she]100-justine felt that [Bessy]170-bessy had no such sources of renovation , and that every disappointment left an arid spot in [her]100-justine soul . Even without [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend 's confidences , [Justine]100-justine would have had no difficulty in following the successive stages of [the Amhersts]159-john ' inner history . [She]100-justine knew that [Amherst]170-bessy had virtually resigned [his]165-wyant rule at [Westmore]104-westmore , and that [[his]165-wyant wife]3350-his wife , in return for the sacrifice , was trying to conform to the way of life [she]3350-his wife thought [he]165-wyant preferred ; and the futility of both attempts was more visible to [Justine]100-justine than to either of [the two concerned]1554-the two concerned . [She]100-justine saw that the failure of [the Amhersts]159-john ' marriage lay not in any accident of outward circumstances but in the lack of all natural points of contact . As [she]100-justine put it to [herself]100-justine , [they]1554-the two concerned met neither underfoot nor overhead : practical necessities united [them]1554-the two concerned no more than imaginative joys . There were moments when [Justine]100-justine thought [Amherst]170-bessy hard to [Bessy]170-bessy , as [she]100-justine suspected that [he]165-wyant had once been hard to [[his]165-wyant mother]396-his mother -- as [the leader of [men]265-men]2039-the leader of men must perhaps always be hard to the hampering sex . Yet [she]100-justine did justice to [his]165-wyant efforts to accept the irretrievable , and to waken in [[his]165-wyant wife]3350-his wife some capacity for sharing in [his]165-wyant minor interests , since [she]100-justine had none of [her]100-justine own with which to fill [their]1554-the two concerned days . [Amherst]170-bessy had always been [a reader]2042-a reader ; not , like [Justine]100-justine [herself]100-justine , [a flame - like devourer of the page]2043-a flame - like devourer of the page , but [a slow absorber of its essence]2044-a slow absorber of its essence ; and in the early days of [his]165-wyant marriage [he]165-wyant had fancied it would be easy to make [Bessy]170-bessy share this taste . Though [[his]165-wyant mother]396-his mother was not [a bookish woman]2046-a bookish woman , [he]165-wyant had breathed at [her]396-his mother side an air rich in allusion and filled with the bright presences of romance ; and [he]165-wyant had always regarded this commerce of the imagination as one of the normal conditions of life . The discovery that there were no books at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook save a few morocco " sets "[165-wyant] imprisoned behind the brass trellisings of [the library]483-the library had been one of the many surprises of [his]165-wyant new state . But in [his]165-wyant first months with [Bessy]170-bessy there was no room for books , and if [he]165-wyant thought of the matter it was only in a glancing vision of future evenings , when [he]165-wyant and [she]170-bessy , in the calm afterglow of happiness , should lean together over some cherished page . [Her]170-bessy lack of response to any reference outside the small circle of daily facts had long since dispelled that vision ; but now that [his]165-wyant own mind felt the need of inner sustenance [he]165-wyant began to ask [himself]165-wyant whether [he]165-wyant might not have done more to rouse [her]170-bessy imagination . During the long evenings over [the library]483-the library fire [he]165-wyant tried to lead the talk to books , with a parenthesis , now and again , from the page beneath [his]165-wyant eye ; and [Bessy]170-bessy met the experiment with conciliatory eagerness . [She]170-bessy showed , in especial , a hopeful but misleading preference for poetry , leaning back with dreaming lids and lovely parted lips while [he]165-wyant rolled out the immortal measures ; but [her]170-bessy outward signs of attention never ripened into any expression of opinion , or any after - allusion to what [she]170-bessy heard , and before long [he]165-wyant discovered that [Justine Brent]100-justine was [[his]165-wyant only listener]2049-his only listener . It was to [her]100-justine that the words [he]165-wyant read began to be unconsciously addressed ; [her]170-bessy comments directed [him]165-wyant in [his]165-wyant choice of subjects , and the ensuing discussions restored [him]165-wyant to some semblance of mental activity . [Bessy]170-bessy , true to [her]170-bessy new role of acquiescence , shone silently on this interchange of ideas ; [Amherst]170-bessy even detected in [her]170-bessy a vague admiration for [his]165-wyant power of conversing on subjects which [she]170-bessy regarded as abstruse ; and this childlike approval , combined with [her]170-bessy submission to [his]165-wyant will , deluded [him]165-wyant with a sense of recovered power over [her]170-bessy . [He]165-wyant could not but note that the new phase in [their]2050-their relations had coincided with [his]165-wyant first assertion of mastery ; and [he]165-wyant rashly concluded that , with the removal of the influences tending to separate [them]2050-their , [[his]165-wyant wife]3350-his wife might gradually be won back to [her]3350-his wife earlier sympathy with [his]165-wyant views . To accept this theory was to apply it ; for nothing could long divert [Amherst]170-bessy from [his]165-wyant main purpose , and all the thwarted strength of [his]165-wyant will was only gathering to itself fresh stores of energy . [He]165-wyant had never been [a skilful lover]2052-a skilful lover , for [no woman]2053-no woman had as yet stirred in [him]165-wyant those feelings which call the finer perceptions into play ; and there was no instinct to tell [him]165-wyant that [Bessy]170-bessy 's sudden conformity to [his]165-wyant wishes was as unreasoning as [her]170-bessy surrender to [his]165-wyant first kiss . [He]165-wyant fancied that [he]165-wyant and [she]170-bessy were at length reaching some semblance of that moral harmony which should grow out of the physical accord , and that , poor and incomplete as the understanding was , it must lift and strengthen [their]2050-their relation . [He]165-wyant waited till early winter had brought solitude to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , dispersing [the hunting colony]2054-the hunting colony to various points of the compass , and sending [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope to [Egypt]44-egypt and [the Riviera]45-the riviera , while [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , as usual , took up [her]178-mrs. ansell annual tour of [a social circuit whose extreme points were marked by [Boston]46-boston and [Baltimore]47-baltimore]2055-a social circuit whose extreme points were marked by boston and baltimore -- and then [he]165-wyant made [his]165-wyant final appeal to [[his]165-wyant wife]3350-his wife . [His]165-wyant pretext for speaking was a letter from [Duplain]138-duplain , definitely announcing [his]165-wyant resolve not to remain at [Westmore]104-westmore . A year earlier [Amherst]170-bessy , deeply moved by the letter , would have given it to [[his]165-wyant wife]3350-his wife in the hope of its producing the same effect on [her]3350-his wife . [He]165-wyant knew better now -- [he]165-wyant had learned [her]3350-his wife instinct for detecting " business "[3350-his wife] under every serious call on [her]3350-his wife attention . [His]165-wyant only hope , as always , was to reach [her]3350-his wife through the personal appeal ; and [he]165-wyant put before [her]3350-his wife the fact of [Duplain]138-duplain 's withdrawal as the open victory of [[his]165-wyant antagonists]2058-his antagonists . But [he]165-wyant saw at once that even this could not infuse new life into the question . " If [I]165-wyant go back [he]165-wyant 'll stay -- [I]165-wyant can hold [him]165-wyant , can gain time till things take a turn , "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant urged . " Another ? [I]3350-his wife thought they were definitely settled , "[3350-his wife] [she]3350-his wife objected languidly . " No -- [they're]4322-they're not ; [they]4322-they're ca n't be , on such a basis , "[3350-his wife] [Amherst]170-bessy broke out with sudden emphasis . [He]165-wyant walked across [the room]3355-the room , and came back to [her]3350-his wife side with a determined face . " It 's a delusion , a deception , "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant exclaimed , " to think [I]165-wyant can stand by any longer and see things going to ruin at [Westmore]104-westmore ! If [I]165-wyant 've made [you]3350-his wife think so , [I]165-wyant 've unconsciously deceived [[us]4323-us both]4324-us both . As long as [you]3350-his wife 're [[my]165-wyant wife]3819-my wife [we]4323-us 've only one honour between [us]4323-us , and that honour is [mine]165-wyant to take care of . "[165-wyant] " Honour ? What an odd expression ! "[3350-his wife] [she]3350-his wife said with a forced laugh , and a little tinge of pink in [her]3350-his wife cheek . " [You]170-bessy speak as if [I]3350-his wife had -- had made [myself]3350-his wife talked about --when [you]170-bessy know [I]3350-his wife 've never even looked at [another man]4326-another man ! "[3350-his wife] " [Another man]4326-another man ? "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy looked at [her]3350-his wife in wonder . " [Good God]156-god ! [Heaven]197-heaven knows [I]170-bessy 've never looked at [another woman]4330-another woman -- but , by [my]170-bessy reading of [our]4331-our compact , [I]170-bessy should n't be keeping faith with [you]3350-his wife if [I]170-bessy did n't help [you]3350-his wife to keep faith with better things . "[170-bessy] [She]2060-she had drawn back , turning pale again , and shrinking a little at the sound of words which , except when heard in [church]4269-church , [she]2060-she vaguely associated with oaths , slammed doors , and other evidences of ill - breeding ; but [Amherst]170-bessy had been swept too far on the flood of [his]2062-his indignation to be checked by such small signs of disapproval . " [You]3350-his wife 'll say that what [I]2063-he 'm asking [you]3350-his wife is to give [me]2063-he back the free use of [your]3350-his wife money . Well ! Why not ? "[2063-he] [He]2063-he had come close again , facing [her]2064-you with outstretched hands , half - commanding , half in appeal . "[2063-he] [Bessy]170-bessy was looking at [him]2063-he coldly , under the half - dropped lids of indifference . " [I]170-bessy hardly know what [you]2063-he mean -- [you]2063-he use such peculiar words ; but [I]170-bessy do n't see why [you]2064-you should expect [me]170-bessy to give up all the ideas [I]170-bessy was brought up in . [Our]4340-our standards _ are _ different -- but why should [yours]2064-you always be right ? "[170-bessy] " [You]2063-he believed they were right when [you]2063-he married [me]2063-he -- have they changed since then ? "[2063-he] " No ; but---- "[170-bessy] [Her]170-bessy face seemed to harden and contract into a small expressionless mask , in which [he]2063-he could no longer read anything but blank opposition to [his]2063-he will .
