"[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy interrupted [her]170-bessy with a laugh . " Thank [you]2063-he for telling [me]170-bessy [your]2063-he real reasons . [I]170-bessy was fool enough to think [you]170-bessy acted from conviction -- not that [you]170-bessy were simply striking a bargain---- "[170-bessy] [He]2065-he broke off , and [they]2066-they looked at [each other]407-each other with a kind of fear , each hearing between [them]2066-they the echo of irreparable words . [Amherst]170-bessy 's only clear feeling was that [he]2065-he must not speak again till [he]2065-he had beaten down the horrible sensation in [his]2065-he breast -- the rage of hate which had [him]2065-he in its grip , and which made [him]2065-he almost afraid , while it lasted , to let [his]2065-he eyes rest on the fair weak creature before [him]2065-he . [Bessy]170-bessy , too , was in the clutch of a mute anger which slowly poured its benumbing current around [her]170-bessy heart . Strong waves of passion did not quicken [her]170-bessy vitality : [she]170-bessy grew inert and cold under [their]2066-they shock . Only one little pulse of self - pity continued to beat in [her]170-bessy , trembling out at last on the cry : " Ah , [I]170-bessy know it 's not because [you]170-bessy care so much for [Westmore]167-cicely -- it 's only because [you]170-bessy want to get away from [me]170-bessy ! "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy stared as if [her]170-bessy words had flashed a light into the darkest windings of [his]2065-he misery . " Yes -- [I]2065-he want to get away ... "[2065-he] [he]2065-he said ; and [he]2065-he turned and walked out of [the room]3355-the room . [He]2065-he went down to [the smoking - room]1582-the smoking - room , and ringing for [a servant]2070-a servant , ordered [his]2065-he horse to be saddled . [The foot - man who answered [his]2065-he summons]2071-the foot - man who answered his summons brought the afternoon 's mail , and [Amherst]170-bessy , throwing [himself]170-bessy down on the sofa , began to tear open [his]2065-he letters while [he]2065-he waited . [He]2065-he ran through the first few without knowing what [he]2065-he read ; but presently [his]2065-he attention was arrested by the hand - writing of [a man [he]2065-he had known well in college , and who had lately come into possession of [a large cotton - mill]2073-a large cotton - mill in [the South]48-the south]2072-a man he had known well in college , and who had lately come into possession of a large cotton - mill in the south . [He]2072-a man he had known well in college , and who had lately come into possession of a large cotton - mill in the south wrote now to ask if [Amherst]170-bessy could recommend [a good manager--"not one of [[your]170-bessy old routine men]4342-your old routine men]4341-a good manager--"not one of your old routine men , but [a young fellow with the new ideas]4343-a young fellow with the new ideas . Things have been in pretty bad shape down here , "[2072-a man he had known well in college , and who had lately come into possession of a large cotton - mill in the south] [the writer]1882-the writer added , " and now that [I]1882-the writer 'm in possession [I]1882-the writer want to see what can be done to civilize [the place]3515-the place "[1882-the writer] ; and [he]2072-a man he had known well in college , and who had lately come into possession of a large cotton - mill in the south went on to urge that [Amherst]170-bessy should come down [himself]170-bessy to inspect [the mills]3324-the mills , and propose such improvements as [his]2065-he experience suggested . " [We]4345-we 've all heard of the great things [you]170-bessy 're doing at [Westmore]104-westmore , "[2072-a man he had known well in college , and who had lately come into possession of a large cotton - mill in the south] the letter ended ; and [Amherst]170-bessy cast it from [him]2072-a man he had known well in college , and who had lately come into possession of a large cotton - mill in the south with a groan .... It was [Duplain]138-duplain 's chance , of course ... that was [his]2065-he first thought . [He]2065-he took up the letter and read it over . [He]2065-he knew the man who wrote -- [no sentimentalist seeking emotional variety from vague philanthropic experiments]2076-no sentimentalist seeking emotional variety from vague philanthropic experiments , but [a serious student of social conditions]2077-a serious student of social conditions , now unexpectedly provided with the opportunity to apply [his]2065-he ideas . Yes , it was [Duplain]138-duplain 's chance -- if indeed it might not be [his]138-duplain own ! ... [Amherst]170-bessy sat upright , dazzled by the thought . Why [Duplain]138-duplain -- why not [himself]170-bessy ? [Bessy]170-bessy had spoken the illuminating word -- what [he]2065-he wanted was to get away -- to get away at any cost ! Escape had become [his]2065-he one thought : escape from the bondage of [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , from the bitter memory of [his]2065-he failure at [Westmore]104-westmore ; and here was the chance to escape back into life -- into independence , activity and usefulness ! Every atrophied faculty in [him]2065-he suddenly started from its torpor , and [his]2065-he brain throbbed with the pain of the awakening .... [The servant]2028-the servant came to tell [him]2065-he that [his]2065-he horse waited , and [he]2065-he sprang up , took [his]2065-he riding - whip from the rack , stared a moment , absently , after [the man]3594-the man 's retreating back , and then dropped down again on the sofa .... What was there to keep [him]2065-he from accepting ? [[His]2065-he wife]3350-his wife 's affection was dead -- if [her]3350-his wife sentimental fancy for [him]2065-he had ever deserved the name ! And [his]2065-he passing mastery over [her]3350-his wife was gone too -- [he]2065-he smiled to remember that , hardly two hours earlier , [he]2065-he had been fatuous enough to think [he]2065-he could still regain it ! Now [he]2065-he said to [himself]2065-he that [she]3350-his wife would sooner desert [a friend]4121-a friend to please [him]2065-he than sacrifice a fraction of [her]3350-his wife income ; and the discovery cast a stain of sordidness on [their]2082-their whole relation . [He]2065-he could still imagine struggling to win [her]3350-his wife back from [another man]4326-another man , or even to save [her]3350-his wife from some folly into which mistaken judgment or perverted enthusiasm might have hurried [her]3350-his wife ; but to go on battling against the dull unimaginative subservience to personal luxury -- the slavery to [houses]2084-houses and [servants]1580-servants and clothes -- ah , no , while [he]2065-he had any fight left in [him]2065-he it was worth spending in a better cause than that ! Through the open window [he]2065-he could hear , in the mild December stillness , [his]2065-he horse 's feet coming and going on the gravel . _ [Her]3350-his wife _ horse , led up and down by _ [[her]3350-his wife _ servant]2086-her _ servant , at the door of [_ [her]3350-his wife _ house]2087-_ her _ house ! ... The sound symbolized [his]2065-he whole future ... the situation [his]2065-he marriage had made for [him]2065-he , and to which [he]2065-he must henceforth bend , unless [he]2065-he broke with it then and there .... [He]2065-he tried to look ahead , to follow up , one by one , the consequences of such a break . That it would be final [he]2065-he had no doubt . There are natures which seem to be drawn closer by dissension , to depend , for the renewal of understanding , on the spark of generosity and compunction that anger strikes out of both ; but [Amherst]170-bessy knew that between [himself]170-bessy and [[his]2065-he wife]3350-his wife no such clearing of the moral atmosphere was possible . The indignation which left [him]2065-he with tingling nerves and a burning need of some immediate escape into action , crystallized in [Bessy]170-bessy into a hard kernel of obstinacy , into which , after each fresh collision , [he]2065-he felt that a little more of [herself]3350-his wife had been absorbed .... No , the break between [them]2089-them would be final -- if [he]2065-he went now [he]2065-he would not come back . And it flashed across [him]2065-he that this solution might have been foreseen by [[his]2065-he wife]3350-his wife -- might even have been deliberately planned and led up to by [those about [her]3350-his wife]2091-those about her . [[His]2065-he father - in - law]2004-his father - in - law had never liked [him]2065-he -- the disturbing waves of [his]2065-he activity had rippled even the sheltered surface of [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's existence . [He]2065-he must have been horribly in [their]2089-them way ! Well -- it was not too late to take [himself]2065-he out of it . In [[Bessy]170-bessy 's circle]2093-bessy 's circle the severing of such ties was regarded as an expensive but unhazardous piece of surgery -- [nobody bled to death of the wound]2094-nobody bled to death of the wound .... [The footman]2095-the footman came back to remind [him]2065-he that [his]2065-he horse was waiting , and [Amherst]170-bessy rose to [his]2065-he feet . " Send [him]2065-he back to [the stable]4346-the stable , "[2065-he] [he]2065-he said with a glance at [his]2065-he watch , " and order a trap to take [me]2065-he to [the next train]4347-the next train . "[2065-he] XXII WHEN [Amherst]170-bessy woke , the next morning , in [the hotel to which [he]2065-he had gone up from [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]2096-the hotel to which he had gone up from lynbrook , [he]2065-he was oppressed by the sense that the hardest step [he]2065-he had to take still lay before [him]2065-he . It had been almost easy to decide that the moment of separation had come , for circumstances seemed to have closed every other issue from [his]2065-he unhappy situation ; but how tell [[his]2065-he wife]3350-his wife of [his]2065-he decision ? [Amherst]170-bessy , to [whom action was the first necessity of being]2098-whom action was the first necessity of being , became [a weak procrastinator]2099-a weak procrastinator when [he]2065-he was confronted by the need of writing instead of speaking . To account for [his]2065-he abrupt departure from [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook [he]2065-he had left word that [he]2065-he was called to [town]3932-town on business ; but , since [he]2065-he did not mean to return , some farther explanation was now necessary , and [he]2065-he was paralyzed by the difficulty of writing . [He]2065-he had already telegraphed to [[his]2065-he friend]754-his friend that [he]2065-he would be at [the mills]3324-the mills the next day ; but [the southern express]2103-the southern express did not leave till the afternoon , and [he]2065-he still had several hours in which to consider what [he]2065-he should say to [[his]2065-he wife]3350-his wife . To postpone the dreaded task , [he]2065-he invented the pretext of some business to be despatched , and taking the Subway to [Wall Street]40-wall street consumed the morning in futile activities . But since the renunciation of [his]2065-he work at [Westmore]104-westmore [he]2065-he had no active concern with the financial world , and by twelve o'clock [he]2065-he had exhausted [his]2065-he imaginary affairs and was journeying up [town]3932-town again . [He]2065-he left [the train]1636-the train at [Union Square]49-union square , and walked along [Fourth Avenue]50-fourth avenue , now definitely resolved to go back to [the hotel]2107-the hotel and write [his]2065-he letter before lunching . At [Twenty - sixth Street]2108-twenty - sixth street [he]2065-he had struck into [Madison Avenue]51-madison avenue , and was striding onward with the fixed eye and aimless haste of [the man who has empty hours to fill]2109-the man who has empty hours to fill , when a hansom drew up ahead of [him]2065-he and [Justine Brent]100-justine sprang out . [She]100-justine was trimly dressed , as if for travel , with a small bag in [her]100-justine hand ; but at sight of [him]2065-he [she]100-justine paused with a cry of pleasure . " Oh , [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst , [I]100-justine 'm so glad ! [I]100-justine was afraid [I]100-justine might not see [you]96-amherst for goodbye . "[100-justine] " For goodbye ? "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst paused , embarrassed . How had [she]100-justine guessed that [he]96-amherst did not mean to return to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ? " [I]100-justine had no idea , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine continued , " that [you]96-amherst were coming up to [town]3932-town yesterday , or [I]100-justine should have tried to see [you]96-amherst before [you]96-amherst left . [I]100-justine wanted to ask [you]96-amherst to send [me]100-justine a line if [Bessy]170-bessy needs [me]100-justine -- [I'll]100-justine come back at once if [she]170-bessy does . "[100-justine] [Amherst]96-amherst continued to listen blankly , as if making a painful effort to regain some consciousness of what was being said to [him]96-amherst , and [she]100-justine went on : " [She]170-bessy seemed so nervous and poorly yesterday evening that [I]100-justine was sorry [I]100-justine had decided to go---- "[100-justine] [Her]100-justine intent gaze reminded [him]96-amherst that the emotions of the last twenty - four hours must still be visible in [his]96-amherst face ; and the thought of what [she]100-justine might detect helped to restore [his]96-amherst self - possession . " [You]100-justine must not think of giving up [your]100-justine visit , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst began hurriedly -- [he]96-amherst had meant to add " on account of [Bessy]170-bessy , "[96-amherst] but [he]96-amherst found [himself]96-amherst unable to utter [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife 's name . "[96-amherst] [Justine]100-justine 's face had grown as grave as [his]96-amherst . "[100-justine] " And [Bessy----]146-bessy---- ? "[96-amherst] [His]96-amherst glance dropped for the first time , but [Justine]100-justine pressed [her]100-justine point . " [Bessy]170-bessy approves ? "[100-justine] " [She]170-bessy -- [she]170-bessy will , [I]100-justine think -- when [she]170-bessy knows---- "[100-justine] " When [she]170-bessy knows ? "[100-justine] [Her]100-justine emotion sprang into [her]100-justine face . " When [she]170-bessy knows ? Then [she]170-bessy does not -- yet ? "[100-justine] " No . The offer came suddenly . " [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst , [you]96-amherst ca n't do this -- [you]96-amherst wo n't do it ! [You]96-amherst will not go away without seeing [Bessy]170-bessy ! "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said . [Her]100-justine eyes sought [his]96-amherst and drew them upward , constraining them to meet the full beam of [her]100-justine rebuking gaze . " [I]96-amherst must do what seems best under the circumstances , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst answered hesitatingly . " [She]170-bessy will hear from [me]96-amherst , of course ; [I]96-amherst shall write today -- and later---- "[96-amherst] " Not later ! _ [Now_--you]4353-now_--you will go back now to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ! Such things ca n't be told in writing -- if they must be said at all , they must be spoken . Do n't tell [me]2119-i that [I]2119-i do n't understand -- or that [I]2119-i 'm meddling in what does n't concern [me]2119-i . [I]2119-i do n't care a fig for that ! [I]2119-i 've always meddled in what did n't concern [me]2119-i -- [I]2119-i always shall , [I]2119-i suppose , till [I]2119-i die ! And [I]2119-i understand enough to know that [Bessy]170-bessy is very unhappy -- and that [you]96-amherst 're the wiser and stronger of the two . [I]2119-i know what it 's been to [you]96-amherst to give up [your]96-amherst work -- to feel [yourself]96-amherst useless , "[2119-i] [she]2119-i interrupted [herself]2119-i , with softening eyes , " and [I]2119-i know how [you]96-amherst 've tried ... [I've]2119-i watched [you]96-amherst ... but [Bessy]170-bessy has tried too ; and even if [you]96-amherst 've both failed -- if [you]96-amherst 've come to the end of [your]96-amherst resources -- it 's for [you]96-amherst to face the fact , and help [her]170-bessy face it -- not to run away from it like this ! "[2119-i] [Amherst]96-amherst sat silent under the assault of [her]2119-i eloquence . [He]96-amherst was conscious of no instinctive resentment , no sense that [she]2119-i was , as [she]2119-i confessed , meddling in matters which did not concern [her]2119-i . [His]96-amherst ebbing spirit was revived by the shock of an ardour like [his]96-amherst own . [She]2119-i had not shrunk from calling [him]96-amherst [a coward]2120-a coward -- and it did [him]96-amherst good to hear [her]2119-i call [him]96-amherst so ! [Her]2119-i words put life back into its true perspective , restored their meaning to obsolete terms : to truth and manliness and courage . [He]96-amherst had lived so long among equivocations that [he]96-amherst had forgotten how to look a fact in the face ; but here was [a woman who judged life by [his]96-amherst own standards]2121-a woman who judged life by his own standards -- and by those standards [she]2119-i had found [him]96-amherst wanting ! Still , [he]96-amherst could not forget the last bitter hours , or change [his]96-amherst opinion as to the futility of attempting to remain at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . [He]96-amherst felt as strongly as ever the need of moral and mental liberation -- the right to begin life again on [his]96-amherst own terms . But [Justine Brent]100-justine had made [him]96-amherst see that [his]96-amherst first step toward self - assertion had been the inconsistent one of trying to evade its results . " [You]100-justine are right -- [I]96-amherst will go back , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said . [She]100-justine thanked [him]96-amherst with [her]100-justine eyes , as [she]100-justine had thanked [him]96-amherst on [the terrace at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]2122-the terrace at lynbrook , on the autumn evening which had witnessed [their]2123-their first broken exchange of confidences ; and [he]96-amherst was struck once more with the change that feeling produced in [her]100-justine . Emotions flashed across [her]100-justine face like the sweep of sun - rent clouds over [a quiet landscape]2124-a quiet landscape , bringing out the gleam of [hidden waters]2125-hidden waters , the fervour of smouldering colours , all the subtle delicacies of modelling that are lost under the light of an open sky . And it was extraordinary how [she]100-justine could infuse into a principle the warmth and colour of a passion ! If conduct , to [most people]2126-most people , seemed a cold matter of social prudence or inherited habit , to [her]100-justine it was always the newly - discovered question of [her]100-justine own relation to life -- as [most women]4067-most women see the great issues only through [their]4067-most women own wants and prejudices , so [she]100-justine seemed always to see [her]100-justine personal desires in the light of the larger claims . " But [I]96-amherst do n't think , "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst went on , " that anything can be said to convince [me]96-amherst that [I]96-amherst ought to alter [my]96-amherst decision . These months of idleness have shown [me]96-amherst that [I]96-amherst 'm one of [the members of society who are a danger to [the community]3685-the community]4354-the members of society who are a danger to the community if [their]4354-the members of society who are a danger to the community noses are not kept to the grindstone---- "[96-amherst] [Justine]100-justine lowered [her]100-justine eyes musingly , and [he]96-amherst saw [she]100-justine was undergoing the reaction of constraint which always followed on [her]100-justine bursts of unpremeditated frankness . " That is not for [me]100-justine to judge , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine answered after a moment . " But if [you]100-justine decide to go away for a time -- surely it ought to be in such a way that [your]100-justine going does not seem to cast any reflection on [Bessy]170-bessy , or subject [her]170-bessy to any unkind criticism . "[100-justine] [Amherst]96-amherst , reddening slightly , glanced at [her]100-justine in surprise . " [I]96-amherst do n't think [you]100-justine need fear that -- [I]96-amherst shall be the only one criticized , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said drily . " Are [you]100-justine sure -- if [you]100-justine take such a position as [you]100-justine spoke of ? So [few people]4356-few people understand the love of hard work for [its]4357-its own sake . [They]4356-few people will say that [your]100-justine quarrel with [[your]100-justine wife]4011-your wife has driven [you]100-justine to support [yourself]100-justine -- and that will be cruel to [Bessy]170-bessy . "[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst shrugged [his]96-amherst shoulders . " [They]4356-few people 'll be more likely to say [I]96-amherst tried to play [the gentleman]4359-the gentleman and failed , and was n't happy till [I]96-amherst got back to [my]96-amherst own place in life -- which is true enough , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst added with a touch of irony . " [They]4356-few people may say that too ; but [they]4356-few people will make [Bessy]170-bessy suffer first -- and it will be [your]100-justine fault if [she]170-bessy is humiliated in that way . If [you]100-justine decide to take up [your]100-justine factory work for a time , ca n't [you]100-justine do so without -- without accepting a salary ? Oh , [you]100-justine see [I]2128-her stick at nothing , "[2128-her] [she]2128-her broke in upon [herself]2128-her with a laugh , " and [Bessy]170-bessy has said things which make [me]2128-her see that [she]170-bessy would suffer horribly if -- if [you]100-justine put such a slight on [her]170-bessy . "[2128-her] [He]96-amherst remained silent , and [she]2128-her went on urgently : " From [Bessy]170-bessy 's standpoint it would mean a decisive break -- the repudiating of [your]100-justine whole past . And it is a question on which [you]100-justine can afford to be generous , because [I]2128-her know ... [I]2128-her think ... it 's less important in [your]100-justine eyes than [hers]170-bessy .... "[2128-her] [Amherst]96-amherst glanced at [her]2128-her quickly . " That particular form of indebtedness , [you]2128-her mean ? "[96-amherst] [She]2128-her smiled . " The easiest to cancel , and therefore the least galling ; is n't that the way [you]100-justine regard it ? "[2128-her] " [I]96-amherst used to -- yes ; but-- "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst was about to add : " [No one at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]4360-no one at lynbrook does , "[96-amherst] but the flash of intelligence in [her]2128-her eyes restrained [him]96-amherst , while at the same time it seemed to answer : " There 's [my]2128-her point ! To see [their]4361-their limitation is to allow for it , since every enlightenment brings a corresponding obligation . "[2128-her] [She]2128-her made no attempt to put into words the argument [her]2128-her look conveyed , but rose from [her]2128-her seat with a rapid glance at [her]2128-her watch . " And now [I]2128-her must go , or [I]2128-her shall miss [my]2128-her train . "[2128-her] [She]2128-her held out [her]2128-her hand , and as [Amherst]96-amherst 's met it , [he]96-amherst said in a low tone , as if in reply to [her]2128-her unspoken appeal : " [I]96-amherst shall remember all [you]2128-her have said . "[96-amherst] * * * * * It was a new experience for [Amherst]96-amherst to be acting under the pressure of another will ; but during [his]96-amherst return journey to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook that afternoon it was pure relief to surrender [himself]96-amherst to this pressure , and the surrender brought not a sense of weakness but of recovered energy . It was not in [his]96-amherst nature to analyze [his]96-amherst motives , or spend [his]96-amherst strength in weighing closely balanced alternatives of conduct ; and though , during the last purposeless months , [he]96-amherst had grown to brood over every spring of action in [himself]96-amherst and [others]3447-others , this tendency disappeared at once in contact with the deed to be done . It was as though [a tributary stream]2130-a tributary stream , gathering its crystal speed among [the hills]2131-the hills , had been suddenly poured into the stagnant waters of [his]96-amherst will ; and [he]96-amherst saw now how thick and turbid those waters had become -- how full of the slime - bred life that chokes the springs of courage . [His]96-amherst whole desire now was to be generous to [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife : to bear the full brunt of whatever pain [their]2133-their parting brought . [Justine]100-justine had said that [Bessy]170-bessy seemed nervous and unhappy : it was clear , therefore , that [she]170-bessy also had suffered from the wounds [they]2133-their had dealt each other , though [she]170-bessy kept [her]170-bessy unmoved front to the last . [Poor child]2134-poor child ! Perhaps that insensible exterior was the only way [she]170-bessy knew of expressing courage ! It seemed to [Amherst]96-amherst that all means of manifesting the finer impulses must slowly wither in [the Lynbrook]27-lynbrook air . As [he]96-amherst approached [his]96-amherst destination , [his]96-amherst thoughts of [her]3350-his wife were all pitiful : nothing remained of the personal resentment which had debased [their]2133-their parting . [He]96-amherst had telephoned from [town]3932-town to announce the hour of [his]96-amherst return , and when [he]96-amherst emerged from [the station]4112-the station [he]96-amherst half - expected to find [her]3350-his wife seated in the brougham whose lamps signalled [him]96-amherst through the early dusk . It would be like [her]3350-his wife to undergo such a reaction of feeling , and to express it , not in words , but by taking up [their]2133-their relation as if there had been no break in it . [He]96-amherst had once condemned this facility of renewal as a sign of lightness , a result of that continual evasion of serious issues which made the life of [Bessy]170-bessy 's world a thin crust of custom above a void of thought . But [he]96-amherst now saw that , if [she]3350-his wife was the product of [her]3350-his wife environment , that constituted but another claim on [his]96-amherst charity , and made the more precious any impulses of natural feeling that had survived the unifying pressure of [her]3350-his wife life . As [he]96-amherst approached [the brougham]2137-the brougham , [he]96-amherst murmured mentally : " What if [I]96-amherst were to try once more ? "[96-amherst] [Bessy]170-bessy had not come to meet [him]96-amherst ; but [he]96-amherst said to [himself]96-amherst that [he]96-amherst should find [her]3350-his wife alone at [the house]311-the house , and that [he]96-amherst would make [his]96-amherst confession at once . As [the carriage]547-the carriage passed between the lights on the tall stone gate - posts , and rolled through the bare shrubberies of [the avenue]1023-the avenue , [he]96-amherst felt a momentary tightening of the heart -- a sense of stepping back into the trap from which [he]96-amherst had just wrenched [himself]96-amherst free -- a premonition of the way in which the smooth systematized routine of [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife 's existence might draw [him]96-amherst back into its revolutions as [he]96-amherst had once seen [a careless factory hand]2142-a careless factory hand seized and dragged into a flying belt .... But it was only for a moment ; then [his]96-amherst thoughts reverted to [Bessy]170-bessy . It was [she]170-bessy who was to be considered -- this time [he]96-amherst must be strong enough for [both]502-both . [The butler]753-the butler met [him]96-amherst on the threshold , flanked by [the usual array of footmen]2145-the usual array of footmen ; and as [he]753-the butler saw [his]753-the butler portmanteau ceremoniously passed from hand to hand , [Amherst]170-bessy once more felt the steel of the springe on [his]96-amherst neck . " Is [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst in [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room , [Knowles]199-knowles ? "[753-the butler] [he]753-the butler asked . " No , [sir]3495-sir , "[199-knowles] said [Knowles]199-knowles , who had too high a sense of fitness to volunteer any information beyond the immediate fact required of [him]96-amherst . " [She]117-mrs. amherst has gone up to [[her]117-mrs. amherst sitting - room]1767-her sitting - room , then ? "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy continued , turning toward the broad sweep of [the stairway]1585-the stairway . " No , [sir]3495-sir , "[753-the butler] said [the butler]753-the butler slowly ; " [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst has gone away . "[753-the butler] " Gone away ? "[170-bessy] [Amherst]170-bessy stopped short , staring blankly at [the man]3594-the man 's smooth official mask . " This afternoon , [sir]3495-sir ; to [Mapleside]42-mapleside . "[170-bessy] " To [Mapleside]42-mapleside ? "[753-the butler] " Yes , [sir]3495-sir , by motor -- to stay with [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury . "[753-the butler] There was a moment 's silence . It had all happened so quickly that [Amherst]170-bessy , with the dual vision which comes at such moments , noticed that [the third footman]2149-the third footman -- or was it [the fourth?--was]2150-the fourth?--was just passing [his]2149-the third footman portmanteau on to a shirt - sleeved arm behind the door which led to [the servant]2028-the servant 's wing .... [He]2149-the third footman roused [himself]2149-the third footman to look at the tall clock . It was just six . [He]2149-the third footman had telephoned from [town]3932-town at two . " At what time did [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst leave ? "[753-the butler] [The butler]753-the butler meditated . " [Sharp]200-sharp at four , [sir]3495-sir . [The maid]4369-the maid took the three - forty with the luggage . "[753-the butler] With the luggage ! So it was not a mere one - night visit . The blood rose slowly to [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst 's face . [The footmen]1928-the footmen had disappeared , but presently the door at the back of [the hall]505-the hall reopened , and [one of [them]1928-the footmen]2156-one of them came out , carrying an elaborately - appointed tea - tray toward [the smoking - room]1582-the smoking - room . The routine of [the house]311-the house was going on as if nothing had happened .... [The butler]753-the butler looked at [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst with respectful -- too respectful -- interrogation , and [he]2149-the third footman was suddenly conscious that [he]2149-the third footman was standing motionless in the middle of [the hall]505-the hall , with one last intolerable question on [his]2149-the third footman lips . Well -- it had to be spoken ! " Did [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst receive [my]753-the butler telephone message ? "[753-the butler] " Yes , [sir]3495-sir . [I]2161-a well - bred man gave it to [her]117-mrs. amherst [myself]2161-a well - bred man . "[2161-a well - bred man] It occurred confusedly to [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst that [a well - bred man]2161-a well - bred man -- as [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook understood the phrase -- would , at this point , have made some tardy feint of being in [[his]2161-a well - bred man wife]3350-his wife 's confidence , of having , on second thoughts , no reason to be surprised at [her]3350-his wife departure . It was humiliating , [he]2149-the third footman supposed , to be thus laying bare [his]2149-the third footman discomfiture to [[his]2149-the third footman dependents]2163-his dependents -- [he]2149-the third footman could see that even [Knowles]199-knowles was affected by the manifest impropriety of the situation -- but no pretext presented itself to [his]2149-the third footman mind , and after another interval of silence [he]2149-the third footman turned slowly toward the door of [the smoking - room]1582-the smoking - room . " [My]2149-the third footman letters are here , [I]2149-the third footman suppose ? "[2149-the third footman] [he]2149-the third footman paused on the threshold to enquire ; and on [the butler]753-the butler 's answering in the affirmative , [he]2149-the third footman said to [himself]2149-the third footman , with a last effort to suspend [his]2149-the third footman judgment : " [She]3350-his wife has left a line -- there will be some explanation---- "[2149-the third footman] But there was nothing -- neither word nor message ; nothing but the reverberating retort of [her]3350-his wife departure in the face of [his]2149-the third footman return -- [her]3350-his wife flight to [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury as the final answer to [his]2149-the third footman final appeal . XXIII [JUSTINE]100-justine was coming back to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . [She]100-justine had been , after all , unable to stay out the ten days of [her]100-justine visit : the undefinable sense of being needed , so often the determining motive of [her]100-justine actions , drew [her]100-justine back to [Long Island]8-long island at the end of the week . [She]100-justine had received no word from [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst or [Bessy]170-bessy ; only [Cicely]167-cicely had told [her]100-justine , in a big round hand , that [mother]3466-mother had been away three days , and that it had been very lonely , and that [the housekeeper]2167-the housekeeper 's cat had kittens , and [she]100-justine was to have one ; and were kittens christened , or how did [they]2168-they get [their]2168-they names?--because [she]167-cicely wanted to call [hers]167-cicely [Justine]100-justine ; and [she]167-cicely had found in [her]167-cicely book a bird like the one [father]3502-father had shown [them]2170-they in [the swamp]1914-the swamp ; and [they]2170-they were not alone now , because [the Telfers]186-the telfers were there , and [they]2170-they had all been out sleighing ; but it would be much nicer when [Justine]100-justine came back .... It was as difficult to extract any sequence of facts from [Cicely]167-cicely 's letter as from an early chronicle . [She]100-justine made no reference to [Amherst]170-bessy 's return , which was odd , since [she]100-justine was fond of [[her]100-justine step - father]1905-her step - father , yet not significant , since the fact of [his]1905-her step - father arrival might have been crowded out by the birth of the kittens , or some incident equally prominent in [her]100-justine perspectiveless grouping of events ; nor did [she]100-justine name the date of [[her]100-justine mother]1105-her mother 's departure , so that [Justine]100-justine could not guess whether it had been contingent on [Amherst]170-bessy 's return , or wholly unconnected with it . What puzzled [her]100-justine most was [Bessy]170-bessy 's own silence -- yet that too , in a sense , was reassuring , for [Bessy]170-bessy thought of [others]3447-others chiefly when it was painful to think of [herself]170-bessy , and [her]170-bessy not writing implied that [she]170-bessy had felt no present need of [[her]170-bessy friend]706-her friend 's sympathy . [Justine]100-justine did not expect to find [Amherst]170-bessy at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . [She]100-justine had felt convinced , when [they]2176-they parted , that [he]706-her friend would persist in [his]706-her friend plan of going [south]2177-south ; and the fact that [the Telfer girls]1701-the telfer girls were again in possession made it seem probable that [he]706-her friend had already left . Under the circumstances , [Justine]100-justine thought the separation advisable ; but [she]100-justine was eager to be assured that it had been effected amicably , and without open affront to [Bessy]170-bessy 's pride . [She]100-justine arrived on a Saturday afternoon , and when [she]100-justine entered [the house]311-the house the sound of voices from [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room , and the prevailing sense of bustle and movement amid which [her]100-justine own coming was evidently an unconsidered detail , showed that the normal life of [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook had resumed its course . [The Telfers]186-the telfers , as usual , had brought a lively throng in [[their]186-the telfers train]2181-their train ; and amid the bursts of merriment about the drawing - room tea - table [she]100-justine caught [Westy Gaines]113-westy 's impressive accents , and the screaming laughter of [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury .... So [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury was back at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ! The discovery gave [Justine]100-justine fresh cause for conjecture . Whatever reciprocal concessions might have resulted from [Amherst]170-bessy 's return to [[his]706-her friend wife]3350-his wife , it seemed hardly probable that [they]2183-they included a renewal of relations with [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury . Had [his]706-her friend mission failed then -- had [he]706-her friend and [Bessy]170-bessy parted in anger , and was [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury 's presence at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook [Bessy]170-bessy 's retort to [his]706-her friend assertion of independence ? In [the school - room]1717-the school - room , where [Justine]100-justine was received with the eager outpouring of [Cicely]167-cicely 's minutest experiences , [she]100-justine dared not put the question that would have solved these doubts ; and [she]100-justine left to dress for dinner without knowing whether [Amherst]170-bessy had returned to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . Yet in [her]100-justine heart [she]100-justine never questioned that [he]706-her friend had done so ; all [her]100-justine fears revolved about what had since taken place . [She]100-justine saw [Bessy]170-bessy first in [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room , surrounded by [[her]100-justine guests]2186-her guests ; and [their]2186-her guests brief embrace told [her]100-justine nothing , except that [she]100-justine had never beheld [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend more brilliant , more triumphantly in possession of recovered spirits and health . That [Amherst]170-bessy was absent was now made evident by [Bessy]170-bessy 's requesting [Westy Gaines]113-westy to lead the way to [the dining - room]1354-the dining - room with [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , who was [one of [the reassembled visitors]2190-the reassembled visitors]2189-one of the reassembled visitors ; and [the only one]2191-the only one , as [Justine]100-justine presently observed , not in key with the prevailing gaiety . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , usually so tinged with the colours of [her]178-mrs. ansell environment , preserved on this occasion a grey neutrality of tone which was the only break in the general brightness . It was not in [[her]178-mrs. ansell graceful person]2192-her graceful person to express anything as gross as disapproval , yet that sentiment was manifest , to [the nice observer]2193-the nice observer , in a delicate aloofness which made the waves of laughter fall back from [her]178-mrs. ansell , and spread a circle of cloudy calm about [her]178-mrs. ansell end of the table . [Justine]100-justine had never been greatly drawn to [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell . [Her]100-justine own adaptability was not in the least akin to [the older woman]1491-the older woman 's studied self - effacement ; and the independence of judgment which [Justine]100-justine preserved in spite of [her]100-justine perception of divergent standpoints made [her]100-justine a little contemptuous of an excess of charity that seemed to have been acquired at the cost of all individual convictions . To - night for the first time [she]100-justine felt in [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell a secret sympathy with [her]100-justine own fears ; and a sense of this tacit understanding made [her]100-justine examine with sudden interest the face of [[her]100-justine unexpected ally]2195-her unexpected ally .... After all , what did [she]100-justine know of [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's history -- of the hidden processes which had gradually subdued [her]178-mrs. ansell own passions and desires , making of [her]178-mrs. ansell , as it were , a mere decorative background , a connecting link between [other personalities]2196-other personalities ? Perhaps , for [a woman]3817-a woman alone in [the world]259-the world , without the power and opportunity that money gives , there was no alternative between letting one 's individuality harden into a small dry nucleus of egoism , or diffuse itself thus in the interstices of other lives -- and there fell upon [Justine]100-justine the chill thought that just such a future might await [her]100-justine if [she]100-justine missed the liberating gift of personal happiness .... * * * * * Neither that night nor the next day had [she]100-justine a private word with [Bessy]170-bessy -- and it became evident , as the hours passed , that [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst was deliberately postponing the moment when [they]2199-they should find [themselves]2199-they alone . But [the Lynbrook party]2200-the lynbrook party was to disperse on the Monday ; and [Bessy]170-bessy , who hated early rising , and all the details of housekeeping , tapped at [Justine]100-justine 's door late on Sunday night to ask [her]100-justine to speed [the departing visitors]2201-the departing visitors . [She]100-justine pleaded this necessity as an excuse for [her]100-justine intrusion , and the playful haste of [her]100-justine manner showed a nervous shrinking from any renewal of confidence ; but as [she]100-justine leaned in the doorway , fingering the diamond chain about [her]100-justine neck , while one satin - tipped foot emerged restlessly from the edge of [her]100-justine lace gown , [her]100-justine face lost the bloom of animation which talk and laughter always produced in it , and [she]100-justine looked so pale and weary that [Justine]100-justine needed no better pretext for drawing [her]100-justine into [the room]3355-the room . It was not in [Bessy]170-bessy to resist a soothing touch in [her]100-justine moments of nervous reaction . [She]100-justine sank into the chair by the fire and let [her]100-justine head rest wearily against the cushion which [Justine]100-justine slipped behind it . [Justine]100-justine dropped into the low seat beside [her]100-justine , and laid a hand on [hers]100-justine . " [You]170-bessy do n't look as well as when [I]100-justine went away , [Bessy]170-bessy . Are [you]170-bessy sure [you]170-bessy 've done wisely in beginning [[your]170-bessy house]4313-your house - parties so soon ? "[100-justine] [Bessy]170-bessy 's smile dropped , and [she]170-bessy turned a grave glance on [[her]170-bessy friend]706-her friend . "[117-mrs. amherst] [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst sighed compassionately . " There _ is _ [no right man]4379-no right man ! As [Blanche]180-blanche carbury says , matrimony 's as uncomfortable as a ready - made shoe . How can one and the same institution fit every individual case ? And why should [we]4380-we all have to go lame because marriage was once invented to suit an imaginary case ? "[117-mrs. amherst] [Justine]100-justine gave a slight shrug . " [You]706-her friend talk of walking lame -- how else do [we]4380-we all walk ? It seems to [me]100-justine that life 's the tight boot , and marriage the crutch that may help one to hobble along ! "[100-justine] [She]100-justine dropped the last phrase carelessly , glancing away as [she]100-justine spoke ; but the stiffening of the fingers in [her]100-justine clasp sent a little tremor through [her]100-justine hand . " Thanks for [your]706-her friend advice . It would be excellent but for one thing -- [[my]100-justine husband]3575-my husband is not coming back ! "[100-justine] The mockery in [Bessy]170-bessy 's voice seemed to pass into [her]100-justine features , hardening and contracting them as frost shrivels a flower . "[180-blanche carbury] Again the piteous echo of [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury 's phrases ! The laboured mimicry of [her]180-blanche carbury ideas ! [Justine]100-justine looked anxiously at [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend . "[170-bessy] XXIV [JUSTINE]100-justine was pacing [the long library at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]2208-the long library at lynbrook , between the caged sets of [standard authors]2209-standard authors . [She]100-justine felt as much caged as [they]2210-they : as much a part of a conventional stage - setting totally unrelated to the action going on before it . Two weeks had passed since [her]100-justine return from [Philadelphia]52-philadelphia ; and during that time [she]100-justine had learned that [her]100-justine usefulness at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook was over . Though not unwelcome , [she]100-justine might almost call [herself]100-justine unwanted ; life swept by , leaving [her]100-justine tethered to the stake of inaction ; a bitter lot for one who chose to measure existence by deeds instead of days . [She]100-justine had found [Bessy]170-bessy ostensibly busy with [a succession of [guests]1177-guests]2211-a succession of guests ; [no one in [the house]311-the house]2213-no one in the house needed [her]170-bessy but [Cicely]167-cicely , and even [Cicely]167-cicely , at times , was caught up into the whirl of [[her]167-cicely mother]1105-her mother 's life , swept off on sleighing parties and motor - trips , or carried to [town]3932-town for a dancing - class or an opera matinee . [Mrs. Fenton Carbury]193-mrs. carbury was not among [the visitors who left [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook on the Monday after [Justine]100-justine 's return]2217-the visitors who left lynbrook on the monday after justine 's return . [Mr. Carbury]201-mr. carbury , with [the other bread - winners of the party]2218-the other bread - winners of the party , had hastened back to [his]201-mr. carbury treadmill in [Wall Street]40-wall street after a Sunday spent in silently studying the files of the Financial Record ; but [[his]201-mr. carbury wife]3350-his wife stayed on , somewhat aggressively in possession , criticizing and rearranging the furniture , ringing for [the servants]746-the servants , making sudden demands on [the stable]4346-the stable , telegraphing , telephoning , ordering fires lighted or windows opened , and leaving everywhere in [her]3350-his wife wake a trail of cigarette ashes and cocktail glasses . [Ned Bowfort]181-ned bowfort had not been included in the house - party ; but on the day of its dispersal [he]181-ned bowfort rode over unannounced for luncheon , put up [his]181-ned bowfort horse in [the stable]4346-the stable , threaded [his]181-ned bowfort way familiarly among the dozing dogs in [the hall]505-the hall , greeted [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell and [Justine]100-justine with just the right shade of quiet deference , produced from [his]181-ned bowfort pocket a new puzzle - game for [Cicely]167-cicely , and sat down beside [[her]100-justine mother]1105-her mother with the quiet urbanity of [the family friend who knows [his]181-ned bowfort privileges but is too discreet to abuse [them]2226-them]2225-the family friend who knows his privileges but is too discreet to abuse them . After that [he]181-ned bowfort came every day , sometimes riding [home]3405-home late to [the Hunt Club]55-the hunt club , sometimes accompanying [Bessy]170-bessy and [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury to [town]3932-town for dinner and [the theatre]2229-the theatre ; but always with [his]181-ned bowfort deprecating air of having dropped in by accident , and modestly hoping that [his]181-ned bowfort intrusion was not unwelcome . The following Sunday brought another influx of [visitors]1158-visitors , and [Bessy]170-bessy seemed to fling [herself]170-bessy with renewed enthusiasm into the cares of hospitality . [She]170-bessy had avoided [Justine]100-justine since [their]2231-their midnight talk , contriving to see [her]100-justine in [Cicely]167-cicely 's presence , or pleading haste when [they]2231-their found [themselves]2231-their alone . The winter was unusually open , and [she]170-bessy spent long hours in the saddle when [her]170-bessy time was not taken up with [[her]170-bessy visitors]1887-her visitors . For a while [she]170-bessy took [Cicely]167-cicely on [her]170-bessy daily rides ; but [she]170-bessy soon wearied of adapting [[her]170-bessy hunter]2233-her hunter 's stride to the pace of [the little girl]1723-the little girl 's pony , and [Cicely]167-cicely was once more given over to [the coachman]2235-the coachman 's care . Then came snow and a long frost , and [Bessy]170-bessy grew restless at [her]170-bessy imprisonment , and grumbled that there was no way of keeping well in a winter climate which made regular exercise impossible . " Why not build [a squash - court]4391-a squash - court ? "[180-blanche carbury] [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury proposed ; and [the two]271-the two fell instantly to making plans under the guidance of [Ned Bowfort]181-ned bowfort and [Westy Gaines]113-westy . As the scheme developed , [various advisers]2237-various advisers suggested that it was a pity not to add [a bowling - alley]2238-a bowling - alley , [a swimming - tank]2239-a swimming - tank and [a gymnasium]2240-a gymnasium ; [a fashionable architect]2241-a fashionable architect was summoned from [town]3932-town , measurements were taken , sites discussed , sketches compared , and [engineers]2243-engineers consulted as to the cost of artesian wells and the best system for heating the tank . [Bessy]170-bessy seemed filled with a feverish desire to carry out the plan as quickly as possible , and on as large a scale as even [the architect]2244-the architect 's invention soared to ; but it was finally decided that , before signing the contracts , [she]170-bessy should run over to [New Jersey]56-new jersey to see [a building of the same kind on which [a sporting friend of [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury 's]2246-a sporting friend of mrs. carbury 's had recently lavished a fortune]2245-a building of the same kind on which a sporting friend of mrs. carbury 's had recently lavished a fortune . It was on this errand that [the two ladies]319-the two ladies , in company with [Westy Gaines]113-westy and [Bowfort]181-ned bowfort , had departed on the day which found [Justine]100-justine restlessly measuring the length of [the library]483-the library . [She]100-justine and [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell had [the house]311-the house to [themselves]319-the two ladies ; and it was hardly a surprise to [her]100-justine when , in the course of the afternoon , [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , after a discreet pause on the threshold , advanced toward [her]100-justine down [the long room]2250-the long room . Since the night of [her]100-justine return [Justine]100-justine had felt sure that [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell would speak ; but [the elder lady]2251-the elder lady was given to hawk - like circlings about [her]2251-the elder lady subject , to hanging over it and contemplating it before [her]2251-the elder lady wings dropped for the descent . Now , however , it was plain that [she]2251-the elder lady had resolved to strike ; and [Justine]100-justine had a sense of relief at the thought . [She]100-justine had been too long isolated in [her]100-justine anxiety , [her]100-justine powerlessness to help ; and [she]100-justine had a vague hope that [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's worldly wisdom might accomplish what [her]100-justine inexperience had failed to achieve . " Shall [we]4392-we sit by the fire ? [I]178-mrs. ansell am glad to find [you]100-justine alone , "[178-mrs. ansell] [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell began , with the pleasant abruptness that was one of the subtlest instruments of [her]178-mrs. ansell indirection ; and as [Justine]100-justine acquiesced , [she]178-mrs. ansell added , yielding [her]178-mrs. ansell slight lines to the luxurious depths of an arm - chair : " [I]178-mrs. ansell have been rather suddenly asked by [an invalid cousin]4393-an invalid cousin to go to [Europe]17-europe with [her]4393-an invalid cousin next week , and [I]178-mrs. ansell ca n't go contentedly without being at peace about [[our]4394-our friends]4395-our friends . "[178-mrs. ansell] [She]178-mrs. ansell paused , but [Justine]100-justine made no answer . In spite of [her]100-justine growing sympathy for [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell [she]100-justine could not overcome an inherent distrust , not of [her]100-justine methods , but of [her]100-justine ultimate object . What , for instance , was [her]100-justine conception of being at peace about [the Amhersts]159-john ? [Justine]100-justine 's own conviction was that , as far as [their]2252-their final welfare was concerned , any terms were better between [them]2252-their than the external harmony which had prevailed during [Amherst]170-bessy 's stay at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . The subtle emanation of [her]100-justine distrust may have been felt by [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell ; for [the latter]673-the latter presently continued , with a certain nobleness : " [I]673-the latter am the more concerned because [I]673-the latter believe [I]673-the latter must hold [myself]673-the latter , in a small degree , responsible for [Bessy]170-bessy 's marriage-- "[673-the latter] and , as [Justine]100-justine looked at [her]178-mrs. ansell in surprise , [she]100-justine added : " [I]100-justine thought [she]170-bessy could never be happy unless [her]170-bessy affections were satisfied -- and even now [I]100-justine believe so . "[100-justine] " [I]100-justine believe so too , "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine said , surprised into assent by the simplicity of [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's declaration . " Well , then -- since [we]4396-we are agreed in [our]4396-we diagnosis , "[1491-the older woman] [the older woman]1491-the older woman went on , smiling , " what remedy do [you]100-justine suggest ? Or rather , how can [we]4396-we administer it ? "[1491-the older woman] " What remedy ? "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine hesitated . " Oh , [I]100-justine believe [we]4396-we are agreed on that too . [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst must be brought back -- but how to bring [him]96-amherst ? "[100-justine] [She]100-justine paused , and then added , with a singular effect of appealing frankness : " [I]100-justine ask [you]100-justine , because [I]100-justine believe [you]100-justine to be [the only one of [[Bessy]170-bessy 's friends]1599-bessy 's friends who is in the least in [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband 's confidence]4397-the only one of bessy 's friends who is in the least in her husband 's confidence . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine 's embarrassment increased . Would it not be disloyal both to [Bessy]170-bessy and [Amherst]96-amherst to acknowledge to [a third person]2255-a third person a fact of which [Bessy]170-bessy [herself]170-bessy was unaware ? Yet to betray embarrassment under [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's eyes was to risk giving it a dangerous significance . " [Bessy]170-bessy has spoken to [me]100-justine once or twice -- but [I]100-justine know very little of [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst 's point of view ; except , "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine added , after another moment 's weighing of alternatives , " that [I]100-justine believe [he]96-amherst suffers most from being cut off from [his]96-amherst work at [Westmore]104-westmore . "[100-justine] " Yes -- so [I]100-justine think ; but that is a difficulty that time and expediency must adjust . All _ [we]4400-we _ can do -- [[their]4401-their friends]4402-their friends , [I]100-justine mean -- is to get [them]4401-their together again before the breach is too wide . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine pondered . [She]100-justine was perhaps more ignorant of the situation than [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell imagined , for since [her]100-justine talk with [Bessy]170-bessy [the latter]673-the latter had not again alluded to [Amherst]96-amherst 's absence , and [Justine]100-justine could merely conjecture that [he]96-amherst had carried out [his]96-amherst plan of taking the management of [the mill]2257-the mill [he]96-amherst had spoken of . What [she]100-justine most wished to know was whether [he]96-amherst had listened to [her]100-justine entreaty , and taken the position temporarily , without binding [himself]96-amherst by the acceptance of a salary ; or whether , wounded by the outrage of [Bessy]170-bessy 's flight , [he]96-amherst had freed [himself]96-amherst from financial dependence by engaging [himself]96-amherst definitely as [manager]2258-manager . " [I]100-justine really know very little of the present situation , "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine said , looking at [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell . " [Bessy]170-bessy merely told [me]100-justine that [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst had taken up [his]96-amherst old work in [a cotton mill in [the south]4404-the south]4403-a cotton mill in the south . "[100-justine] As [her]100-justine eyes met [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's it flashed across [her]100-justine that [the latter]673-the latter did not believe what [she]100-justine said , and the perception made [her]100-justine instantly shrink back into [herself]100-justine . But there was nothing in [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's tone to confirm the doubt which [her]100-justine look betrayed . " Ah -- [I]100-justine hoped [you]100-justine knew more , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said simply ; " for , like [you]100-justine , [I]100-justine have only heard from [Bessy]170-bessy that [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband went away suddenly to help [a friend who is reorganizing [some mills in [Georgia]57-georgia]4407-some mills in georgia]4406-a friend who is reorganizing some mills in georgia . Of course , under the circumstances , such a temporary break is natural enough -- perhaps inevitable -- only [he]96-amherst must not stay away too long . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine was silent . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's momentary self - betrayal had checked all farther possibility of frank communion , and [the discerning lady]2260-the discerning lady had seen [her]2260-the discerning lady error too late to remedy it . But [[her]100-justine hearer]2261-her hearer 's heart gave a leap of joy . It was clear from what [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell said that [Amherst]96-amherst had not bound [himself]96-amherst definitely , since [he]96-amherst would not have done so without informing [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife . And with a secret thrill of happiness [Justine]100-justine recalled [his]96-amherst last word to [her]2260-the discerning lady : " [I]96-amherst will remember all [you]2260-the discerning lady have said . "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst had kept that word and acted on it ; in spite of [Bessy]170-bessy 's last assault on [his]96-amherst pride [he]96-amherst had borne with [her]2260-the discerning lady , and deferred the day of final rupture ; and the sense that [she]2260-the discerning lady had had a part in [his]96-amherst decision filled [Justine]100-justine with a glow of hope . The consciousness of [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's suspicions faded to insignificance -- [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell and [[her]178-mrs. ansell kind]2263-her kind might think what [they]2264-they chose , since all that mattered now was that [she]178-mrs. ansell [herself]178-mrs. ansell should act bravely and circumspectly in [her]178-mrs. ansell last attempt to save [[her]178-mrs. ansell friends]1229-her friends . [A glazed " sun - room]4417-a glazed " sun - room , "[2271-the returning party in the hall] mosaic pavements , a marble fountain to feed the marble tank -- and outside [a water - garden]2273-a water - garden , descending in successive terraces , to take up and utilize -- [one]3402-one could see how practically!--the overflow from the tank . [She]1491-the older woman had given up [her]1491-the older woman new motor , had let [[her]1491-the older woman town house]2276-her town house , had pinched and stinted [herself]1491-the older woman in a hundred ways -- if ever [woman]4240-woman was entitled to a little compensating pleasure , surely [she]1491-the older woman was [that woman]2278-that woman ! The days were crowded with consultations . [Architect]2279-architect , [contractors]2280-contractors , [engineers]2243-engineers , [a landscape gardener]2282-a landscape gardener , and [a dozen minor craftsmen]2283-a dozen minor craftsmen , came and went , unrolled plans , moistened pencils , sketched , figured , argued , persuaded , and filled [Bessy]170-bessy with the dread of appearing , under [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury 's eyes , subject to any restraining influences of economy . What ! [She]1491-the older woman was [a young woman]2284-a young woman , with an independent fortune , and [she]1491-the older woman was always wavering , considering , secretly referring back to the mute criticism of [an invisible judge]2285-an invisible judge -- of [the husband who had been first to shake [himself]2286-the husband who had been first to shake himself free of any mutual subjection free of any mutual subjection]2286-the husband who had been first to shake himself free of any mutual subjection ? [The accomplished Blanche]180-blanche carbury did not have to say this -- [she]1491-the older woman conveyed it by the raising of painted brows , by a smile of mocking interrogation , a judiciously placed silence or a resigned glance at [the architect]2244-the architect . So the estimates poured in , were studied , resisted -- then yielded to and signed ; then the hour of advance payments struck , and an imperious appeal was despatched to [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy , to whom the management of [Bessy]125-bessy 's affairs had been transferred . [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy , to [[his]125-bessy client]2288-his client 's surprise , answered the appeal in person . [He]125-bessy had not been lately to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , dreading the cold and damp of [the country]3812-the country in winter ; and [his]125-bessy sudden arrival had therefore an ominous significance . [He]125-bessy came for an evening in mid - week , when even [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury was absent , and [Bessy]125-bessy and [Justine]100-justine had [the house]311-the house to [themselves]2291-themselves . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell had sailed the week before with [[her]178-mrs. ansell invalid cousin]2292-her invalid cousin . No farther words had passed between [herself]178-mrs. ansell and [Justine]100-justine -- but [the latter]673-the latter was conscious that [their]2291-themselves talk had increased instead of lessened the distance between [them]2291-themselves . [Justine]100-justine [herself]100-justine meant to leave soon . [Her]100-justine hope of regaining [Bessy]125-bessy 's confidence had been deceived , and seeing [herself]100-justine definitely superseded , [she]100-justine chafed anew at [her]100-justine purposeless inactivity . [She]100-justine had already written to [one or two doctors in [New York]7-new york]2294-one or two doctors in new york , and to [the matron of [Saint Elizabeth 's]58-saint elizabeth 's]2295-the matron of saint elizabeth 's . [She]100-justine had made [herself]100-justine a name in surgical cases , and it could not be long before a summons came .... Meanwhile [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy arrived , and [the three]2296-the three dined together , [the two women]808-the two women bending meekly to [his]125-bessy discourse , which was never more oracular and authoritative than when delivered to the gentler sex alone . [Amherst]170-bessy 's absence , in particular , seemed to loose the thin current of [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's eloquence . [He]125-bessy was never quite at ease in the presence of an independent mind , and [Justine]100-justine often reflected that , even had [the two men]712-the two men known nothing of [each other]407-each other 's views , there would have been between [them]712-the two men an instinctive and irreducible hostility -- [they]712-the two men would have disliked [each other]407-each other if [they]712-the two men had merely jostled elbows in [the street]3968-the street . Yet even freed from [Amherst]170-bessy 's presence [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy showed a darkling brow , and as [Justine]100-justine slipped away after dinner [she]100-justine felt that [she]100-justine left [Bessy]170-bessy to something more serious than the usual business conference . How serious , [she]100-justine was to learn that very night , when , in the small hours , [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend burst in on [her]100-justine tearfully . [Bessy]170-bessy was ruined -- ruined -- that was what [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy had come to tell [her]100-justine ! [She]100-justine might have known [he]125-bessy would not have travelled to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook for a trifle .... [She]100-justine had expected to find [herself]100-justine cramped , restricted -- to be warned that [she]100-justine must " manage , "[100-justine] hateful word ! ... But this ! This was incredible ! Unendurable ! There was no money to build [the gymnasium]2303-the gymnasium -- none at all ! And all because [it]2304-it had been swallowed up at [Westmore]104-westmore -- because the ridiculous changes there , the changes that [nobody]3939-nobody wanted , [nobody]3939-nobody approved of -- that [Truscomb]105-truscomb and all [the other experts]2307-the other experts had opposed and derided from the first -- these changes , even modified and arrested , had already involved so much of [her]100-justine income , that it might be years -- yes , [he]125-bessy said _ years_!--before [she]100-justine would feel [herself]100-justine free again -- free of [her]100-justine own fortune , of [Cicely]167-cicely 's fortune ... of the money poor [Dick Westmore]126-dick had meant [[his]126-dick wife]3350-his wife and [child]2309-child to enjoy ! [Justine]100-justine listened anxiously to this confused outpouring of resentments . [Bessy]170-bessy 's born incapacity for [figures]2310-figures made it indeed possible that the facts came on [her]100-justine as a surprise -- that [she]100-justine had quite forgotten the temporary reduction of [her]100-justine income , and had begun to imagine that what [she]100-justine had saved in one direction was [hers]100-justine to spend in another . All this was conceivable . But why had [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy drawn so dark a picture of the future ? Or was it only that , thwarted of [her]100-justine immediate desire , [Bessy]125-bessy 's disappointment blackened the farthest verge of [her]100-justine horizon ? [Justine]100-justine , though aware of [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend 's lack of perspective , suspected that a conniving hand had helped to throw the prospect out of drawing .... Could it be possible , then , that [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy was among [those who desired a divorce]2312-those who desired a divorce ? That the influences at which [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell had hinted proceeded not only from [Blanche Carbury]180-blanche carbury and [[her]180-blanche carbury group]2313-her group ? Helpless amid this rush of forebodings , [Justine]100-justine could do no more than soothe and restrain -- to reason would have been idle . [She]100-justine had never till now realized how completely [she]100-justine had lost ground with [Bessy]125-bessy . " The humiliation -- before [[my]100-justine friends]3404-my friends ! Oh , [I]100-justine was warned ... [[my]100-justine father]3479-my father , [every one]1761-every one ... for [Cicely]167-cicely 's sake [I]100-justine was warned ... but [I]100-justine would n't listen -- and _ now _ ! From the first it was all [he]3479-my father cared for -- in [Europe]17-europe , even , [he]3479-my father was always dragging [me]100-justine to [factories]4421-factories . _ [Me?_--I]3479-my father was only [the owner of [Westmore]104-westmore]4422-the owner of westmore ! [He]3479-my father wanted power -- power , that 's all -- when [he]3479-my father lost it [he]3479-my father left [me]100-justine ... oh , [I]100-justine 'm glad now [[my]100-justine baby]4423-my baby is dead ! Glad there 's nothing between [us]4424-us -- nothing , nothing in [the world]259-the world to tie [us]4424-us together any longer ! "[100-justine] The disproportion between this violent grief and its trivial cause would have struck [Justine]100-justine as simply grotesque , had [she]100-justine not understood that the incident of [the gymnasium]2303-the gymnasium , which followed with cumulative pressure on a series of similar episodes , seemed to [Bessy]125-bessy like the reaching out of a retaliatory hand -- a mocking reminder that [she]100-justine was still imprisoned in the consequences of [her]100-justine unhappy marriage . Such folly seemed past weeping for -- it froze [Justine]100-justine 's compassion into disdain , till [she]100-justine remembered that the sources of [our]2315-our sorrow are sometimes nobler than their means of expression , and that a baffled unappeased love was perhaps the real cause of [Bessy]125-bessy 's anger against [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband . At any rate , the moment was a critical one , and [Justine]100-justine remembered with a pang that [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell had foreseen such a contingency , and implored [her]100-justine to take measures against it . [She]100-justine had refused , from a sincere dread of precipitating a definite estrangement -- but had [she]100-justine been right in judging the situation so logically ? With a creature of [Bessy]125-bessy 's emotional uncertainties the result of contending influences was really incalculable -- it might still be that , at this juncture , [Amherst]170-bessy 's return would bring about a reaction of better feelings .... [Justine]100-justine sat and mused on these things after leaving [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend exhausted upon a tearful pillow . [She]100-justine felt that [she]100-justine had perhaps taken too large a survey of the situation -- that the question whether there could ever be happiness between [this tormented pair]2318-this tormented pair was not one to concern those who struggled for [their]2318-this tormented pair welfare . Most marriages are a patch - work of jarring tastes and ill - assorted ambitions -- if here and there , for a moment , two colours blend , two textures are the same , so much the better for the pattern ! [Justine]100-justine , certainly , could foresee in reunion no positive happiness for [either of [[her]100-justine friends]1229-her friends]2319-either of her friends ; but [she]100-justine saw positive disaster for [Bessy]170-bessy in separation from [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband .... Suddenly [she]100-justine rose from [her]100-justine chair by the falling fire , and crossed over to the writing - table . [She]100-justine would write to [Amherst]170-bessy [herself]100-justine -- [she]100-justine would tell [him]706-her friend to come . The decision once reached , hope flowed back to [her]100-justine heart -- the joy of action so often deceived [her]100-justine into immediate faith in its results ! " [Dear Mr. Amherst]96-amherst , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine wrote , " the last time [I]2322-i saw [you]96-amherst , [you]96-amherst told [me]2322-i [you]96-amherst would remember what [I]2322-i said . [I]2322-i ask [you]96-amherst to do so now -- to remember that [I]2322-i urged [you]96-amherst not to be away too long . [I]2322-i believe [you]96-amherst ought to come back now , though [I]2322-i know [Bessy]170-bessy will not ask [you]96-amherst to . [I]2322-i am writing without [her]170-bessy knowledge , but with the conviction that [she]170-bessy needs [you]96-amherst , though perhaps without knowing it [herself]170-bessy .... "[2322-i] [She]2322-i paused , and laid down [her]2322-i pen . Why did it make [her]2322-i so happy to write to [him]2323-him ? Was it merely the sense of recovered helpfulness , or something warmer , more personal , that made it a joy to trace [his]2323-him name , and to remind [him]2323-him of [their]2324-their last intimate exchange of words ? Well -- perhaps it was that too . There were moments when [she]2322-i was so mortally lonely that any sympathetic contact with another life sent a glow into [her]2322-i veins -- that [she]2322-i was thankful to warm [herself]2322-i at any fire . XXV [BESSY]170-bessy , languidly glancing through [her]170-bessy midday mail some five days later , uttered a slight exclamation as [she]170-bessy withdrew [her]170-bessy finger - tip from the flap of the envelope [she]170-bessy had begun to open . It was a black sleety day , with an east wind bowing the trees beyond the drenched window - panes , and [the two friends]1232-the two friends , after luncheon , had withdrawn to [the library]483-the library , where [Justine]100-justine sat writing notes for [Bessy]170-bessy , while [the latter]673-the latter lay back in [her]170-bessy arm - chair , in the state of dreamy listlessness into which [she]170-bessy always sank when not under the stimulus of amusement or exercise . [She]170-bessy sat suddenly upright as [her]170-bessy eyes fell on the letter . " [I]170-bessy beg [your]100-justine pardon ! [I]170-bessy thought it was for [me]170-bessy , "[170-bessy] [she]170-bessy said , holding it out to [Justine]100-justine . [The latter]673-the latter reddened as [she]170-bessy glanced at the superscription . It had not occurred to [her]170-bessy that [Amherst]96-amherst would reply to [her]170-bessy appeal : [she]170-bessy had pictured [him]96-amherst springing on [the first north - bound train]2329-the first north - bound train , perhaps not even pausing to announce [his]96-amherst return to [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife .... And to receive [his]96-amherst letter under [Bessy]170-bessy 's eye was undeniably embarrassing , since [Justine]100-justine felt the necessity of keeping [her]100-justine intervention secret . But under [Bessy]170-bessy 's eye [she]170-bessy certainly was -- it continued to rest on [her]100-justine curiously , speculatively , with an under - gleam of malicious significance . " So stupid of [me]170-bessy -- [I]170-bessy ca n't imagine why [I]170-bessy should have expected [[my]170-bessy husband]3575-my husband to write to [me]170-bessy ! "[170-bessy] [Bessy]170-bessy went on , leaning back in lazy contemplation of [her]170-bessy other letters , but still obliquely including [Justine]100-justine in [her]100-justine angle of vision . The latter , after a moment 's pause , broke the seal and read . " [Millfield]59-millfield , [Georgia]57-georgia . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]3368-my dear [Miss Brent]97-miss brent , " [Your]97-miss brent letter reached [me]97-miss brent yesterday and [I]97-miss brent have thought it over carefully . [I]97-miss brent appreciate the feeling that prompted it -- but [I]97-miss brent do n't know that [any friend]4427-any friend , however kind and discerning , can give the final advice in such matters . [You]3368-my dear tell [me]97-miss brent [you]3368-my dear are sure [[my]97-miss brent wife]3819-my wife will not ask [me]97-miss brent to return -- well , under present conditions that seems to [me]97-miss brent a sufficient reason for staying away . "[97-miss brent] Meanwhile , [I]0-i assure [you]3368-my dear that [I]0-i have remembered all [you]3368-my dear said to [me]0-i that day . [I]0-i have made no binding arrangement here -- nothing to involve [my]0-i future action -- and [I]0-i have done this solely because [you]3368-my dear asked it . This will tell [you]3368-my dear better than words how much [I]0-i value [your]3368-my dear advice , and what strong reasons [I]0-i must have for not following it now . " [I]3368-my dear suppose there are no more exploring parties in this weather . [I]3368-my dear wish [I]3368-my dear could show [Cicely]167-cicely some of the birds down here . "[3368-my dear] [Yours]3368-my dear faithfully , " [John Amherst]99-amherst . "[3368-my dear] Please do n't let [[my]0-i wife]3819-my wife ride Impulse . " Latent under [Justine]100-justine 's acute consciousness of what this letter meant , was the sense of [Bessy]170-bessy 's inferences and conjectures . [She]100-justine could feel them actually piercing the page in [her]100-justine hand like some hypersensitive visual organ to which matter offers no obstruction . Or rather , baffled in [their]4429-their endeavour , [they]4429-their were evoking out of the unseen , heaven knew what fantastic structure of intrigue -- scrawling over the innocent page with burning evidences of perfidy and collusion .... One thing became instantly clear to [her]100-justine : [she]100-justine must show the letter to [Bessy]170-bessy . [She]100-justine ran [her]100-justine eyes over it again , trying to disentangle the consequences . There was the allusion to [their]4429-their talk in [town]3932-town -- well , [she]100-justine had told [Bessy]170-bessy of that ! But the careless reference to [their]4429-their woodland excursions -- what might not [Bessy]170-bessy , in [her]170-bessy present mood , make of it ? [Justine]100-justine 's uppermost thought was of distress at the failure of [her]100-justine plan . Perhaps [she]100-justine might still have induced [Amherst]170-bessy to come back , had it not been for this accident ; but now that hope was destroyed . [She]100-justine raised [her]100-justine eyes and met [Bessy]170-bessy 's . "[3819-my wife] Will [you]2333-you read it ? " [she]100-justine said , holding out the letter . [Bessy]170-bessy received it with lifted brows , and a protesting murmur -- but as [she]170-bessy read , [Justine]100-justine saw the blood mount under [her]170-bessy clear skin , invade the temples , the nape , even the little flower - like ears ; then it receded as suddenly , ebbing at last from the very lips , so that the smile with which [she]170-bessy looked up from [her]170-bessy reading was as white as if [she]170-bessy had been under the stress of physical pain . "[2333-you] So [you]2333-you have written [[my]0-i husband]3575-my husband to come back ? " "[2333-you] As [you]2333-you see . " [Bessy]170-bessy looked [her]2333-you straight in the eyes . "[2333-you] [I]0-i am very much obliged to [you]2333-you -- extremely obliged ! " [Justine]100-justine met the look quietly . "[0-i] Which means that [you]2333-you resent [my]0-i interference---- " "[2333-you] Oh , [I]0-i leave [you]2333-you to call it that ! " [Justine]100-justine , as [she]100-justine spoke , had drawn near [Bessy]170-bessy , laying a hand on [her]170-bessy arm , and shedding on [her]170-bessy the radiance of a face all charity and sweet compassion . For a moment [Bessy]170-bessy seemed to waver . The colour flickered faintly up [her]170-bessy cheek , [her]170-bessy long lashes drooped -- [she]170-bessy had the tenderest lids!--and all [her]170-bessy face seemed melting under the beams of [Justine]100-justine 's ardour . ' " After such a tribute to [your]2347-you influence [I]0-i do n't wonder [you]2347-you feel competent to set [everybody]3896-everybody 's affairs in order !
