" [I]100-justine did n't mean that , [Justine]100-justine ... but let [us]808-the two women not talk now -- [I]100-justine ca n't ! "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine did not move : the reaction could not come as quickly in [her]100-justine case . But [she]100-justine turned on [Bessy]170-bessy two eyes full of pardon , full of speechless pity ... and [Bessy]170-bessy received the look silently before [she]170-bessy moved to the door and went out . " Oh , [poor thing]4436-poor thing -- poor thing ! "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine gasped as the door closed . [She]100-justine had already forgotten [her]100-justine own hurt -- [she]100-justine was alone again with [Bessy]170-bessy 's sterile pain . [She]100-justine stood staring before [her]100-justine for a moment -- then [her]100-justine eyes fell on [Amherst]170-bessy 's letter , which had fluttered to the floor between [them]2350-them . The fatal letter ! If it had not come at that unlucky moment perhaps [she]100-justine might still have gained [her]100-justine end .... [She]100-justine picked it up and re - read it . Yes -- there were phrases in it that a wounded suspicious heart might misconstrue .... Yet [Bessy]170-bessy 's last words had absolved [her]100-justine .... Why had [she]100-justine not answered them ? Why had [she]100-justine stood there dumb ? The blow to [her]100-justine pride had been too deep , had been dealt too unexpectedly -- for one miserable moment [she]100-justine had thought first of [herself]100-justine ! Ah , that importunate , irrepressible self -- the _ moi haissable _ of the Christian -- if only one could tear it from one 's breast ! [She]100-justine had missed an opportunity -- [her]100-justine last opportunity perhaps ! By this time , even , a hundred hostile influences , cold whispers of vanity , of selfishness , of worldly pride , might have drawn [their]2351-their freezing ring about [Bessy]170-bessy 's heart .... [Justine]100-justine started up to follow [her]170-bessy ... then paused , recalling [her]100-justine last words . " Let [us]4437-us not talk now -- [I]100-justine ca n't ! "[100-justine] [She]100-justine had no right to intrude on that bleeding privacy -- if the chance had been [hers]100-justine [she]100-justine had lost it . [She]100-justine dropped back into [her]100-justine seat at the desk , hiding [her]100-justine face in [her]100-justine hands . Presently [she]100-justine heard the clock strike , and true to [her]100-justine tireless instinct of activity , [she]100-justine lifted [her]100-justine head , took up [her]100-justine pen , and went on with the correspondence [she]100-justine had dropped .... It was hard at first to collect [her]100-justine thoughts , or even to summon to [her]100-justine pen the conventional phrases that sufficed for most of the notes . Groping for a word , [she]100-justine pushed aside [her]100-justine writing and stared out at the sallow frozen landscape framed by the window at which [she]100-justine sat . The sleet had ceased , and hollows of sunless blue showed through the driving wind - clouds . A hard sky and a hard ground -- frost - bound ringing earth under rigid ice - mailed trees . As [Justine]100-justine looked out , shivering a little , [she]100-justine saw [a woman]3817-a woman 's figure riding down [the avenue]1023-the avenue toward the gate . [The figure]1031-the figure disappeared behind a clump of evergreens -- showed again farther down , through the boughs of a skeleton beech -- and revealed itself in the next open space as [Bessy]170-bessy -- [Bessy]170-bessy in the saddle on a day of glaring frost , when no horse could keep [his]2355-his footing out of a walk ! [Justine]100-justine went to the window and strained [her]100-justine eyes for a confirming glimpse . Yes -- it was [Bessy]170-bessy ! There was no mistaking [that light flexible figure]2356-that light flexible figure , every line swaying true to the beat of the horse 's stride . But [Justine]100-justine remembered that [Bessy]170-bessy had not meant to ride -- had countermanded [her]100-justine horse because of the bad going .... Well , [she]100-justine was [a perfect horsewoman]2357-a perfect horsewoman and had no doubt chosen [her]100-justine surest - footed mount ... probably the brown cob , [Tony Lumpkin]202-tony lumpkin . But when did [Tony]202-tony lumpkin 's sides shine so bright through the leafless branches ? And when did [he]202-tony lumpkin sweep [[his]202-tony lumpkin rider]2358-his rider on with such long free play of the hind - quarters ? Horse and [rider]2359-rider shot into sight again , rounding the curve of [the avenue]1023-the avenue near the gates , and in a break of sunlight [Justine]100-justine saw the glitter of chestnut flanks -- and remembered that [Impulse]192-impulse was the only chestnut in [the stables]4264-the stables .... * * * * * [She]100-justine went back to [her]100-justine seat and continued writing . [Bessy]170-bessy had left a formidable heap of bills and letters ; and when this was demolished , [Justine]100-justine had [her]100-justine own correspondence to despatch . [She]100-justine had heard that morning from [the matron of [Saint Elizabeth 's]58-saint elizabeth 's]2295-the matron of saint elizabeth 's : an interesting " case "[100-justine] was offered [her]100-justine , but [she]100-justine must come within two days . For the first few hours [she]100-justine had wavered , loath to leave [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook without some definite light on [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend 's future ; but now [Amherst]170-bessy 's letter had shed that light -- or rather , had deepened the obscurity -- and [she]100-justine had no pretext for lingering on where [her]100-justine uselessness had been so amply demonstrated . [She]100-justine wrote to [the matron]261-the matron accepting the engagement ; and the acceptance involved the writing of other letters , the general reorganizing of that minute polity , the life of [Justine Brent]100-justine . [She]100-justine smiled a little to think how easily [she]100-justine could be displaced and transplanted -- how slender were [her]100-justine material impedimenta , how few [her]100-justine invisible bonds ! [She]100-justine was as light and detachable as a dead leaf on the autumn breeze -- yet [she]100-justine was in the season of sap and flower , when there is life and song in the trees ! But [she]100-justine did not think long of [herself]100-justine , for an undefinable anxiety ran through [her]100-justine thoughts like a black thread . It found expression , now and then , in the long glances [she]100-justine threw through the window -- in [her]100-justine rising to consult the clock and compare [her]100-justine watch with it -- in a nervous snatch of humming as [she]100-justine paced [the room]3355-the room once or twice before going back to [her]100-justine desk .... Why was [Bessy]170-bessy so late ? Dusk was falling already -- the early end of the cold slate - hued day . But [Bessy]170-bessy always rode late -- there was always a rational answer to [Justine]100-justine 's irrational conjectures .... It was the sight of those chestnut flanks that tormented [her]100-justine -- [she]100-justine knew of [Bessy]170-bessy 's previous struggles with the mare . But the indulging of idle apprehensions was not in [her]100-justine nature , and when the tea - tray came , and with it [Cicely]167-cicely , sparkling from a gusty walk , and coral - pink in [her]167-cicely cloud of crinkled hair , [Justine]100-justine sprang up and cast off [her]100-justine cares . It cost [her]100-justine a pang , again , to see the lamps lit and the curtains drawn -- shutting in the warmth and brightness of [the house]311-the house from that wind - swept frozen twilight through which [Bessy]170-bessy rode alone . But the icy touch of the thought slipped from [Justine]100-justine 's mind as [she]100-justine bent above the tea - tray , gravely measuring [Cicely]167-cicely 's milk into a " grown - up "[100-justine] teacup , hearing the confidential details of [the child]3698-the child 's day , and capping them with banter and fantastic narrative . [She]100-justine was not sorry to go -- ah , no ! [The house]311-the house had become [a prison to [her]100-justine , with ghosts walking [its]311-the house dreary floors]2369-a prison to her , with ghosts walking its dreary floors . But to lose [Cicely]167-cicely would be bitter -- [she]100-justine had not felt how bitter till [the child]3698-the child pressed against [her]100-justine in the firelight , insisting raptly , with little sharp elbows stabbing [her]100-justine knee : " And _ then _ what happened , [Justine]100-justine ? "[3698-the child] The door opened , and [some one]3457-some one came in to look at the fire . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine went back to [Cicely]167-cicely and the fairy - tale.--As [she]100-justine took up the thread of [the Princess]2377-the princess 's adventures , [she]100-justine asked [herself]100-justine why [she]100-justine had ever had any hope of helping [Bessy]170-bessy . The seeds of disaster were in [the poor creature]2378-the poor creature 's soul .... Even when [she]100-justine appeared to be moved , lifted out of [herself]100-justine , [her]100-justine escaping impulses were always dragged back to the magnetic centre of hard distrust and resistance that sometimes forms the core of soft - fibred natures . As [she]100-justine had answered [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband 's previous appeal by [her]100-justine flight to [the woman [he]3393-her husband disliked]2380-the woman he disliked , so [she]100-justine answered this one by riding the horse [he]3393-her husband feared .... [Justine]100-justine 's last illusions crumbled . The distance between two such natures was unspannable . [Amherst]96-amherst had done well to remain away ... and with a tidal rush [her]100-justine sympathies swept back to [his]96-amherst side .... * * * * * [The governess]3694-the governess came to claim [Cicely]167-cicely . [One of [the footmen]1928-the footmen]2382-one of the footmen came to put another log on the fire . Then the rite of removing the tea - table was majestically performed -- the ceremonial that had so often jarred on [Amherst]96-amherst 's nerves . As [she]100-justine watched it , [Justine]100-justine had a vague sense of the immutability of the household routine -- a queer awed feeling that , whatever happened , a machine so perfectly adjusted would work on inexorably , like a natural law .... [She]100-justine rose to look out of the window , staring vainly into blackness between the parted curtains . As [she]100-justine turned back , passing the writing - table , [she]100-justine noticed that [Cicely]167-cicely 's irruption had made [her]100-justine forget to post [her]100-justine letters -- an unusual oversight . A glance at the clock told [her]100-justine that [she]100-justine was not too late for the mail -- reminding [her]100-justine , at the same time , that it was scarcely three hours since [Bessy]170-bessy had started on [her]170-bessy ride .... [She]100-justine saw the foolishness of [her]100-justine fears . Even in winter , [Bessy]170-bessy often rode for more than three hours ; and now that the days were growing longer---- Suddenly reassured , [Justine]100-justine went out into [the hall]505-the hall , intending to carry [her]100-justine batch of letters to the red pillar - box by the door . As [she]100-justine did so , a cold blast struck [her]100-justine . Could it be that for once the faultless routine of [the house]311-the house had been relaxed , that [one of [the servants]746-the servants]2386-one of the servants had left the outer door ajar ? [She]100-justine walked over to [the vestibule]2388-the vestibule -- yes , both doors were wide . The night rushed in on a vicious wind . As [she]100-justine pushed the vestibule door shut , [she]100-justine heard the dogs sniffing and whining on the threshold . [She]100-justine crossed [the vestibule]2388-the vestibule , and heard voices and the tramping of feet in the darkness -- then saw a lantern gleam . Suddenly [Knowles]199-knowles shot out of the night -- the lantern struck on [his]199-knowles bleached face . [Justine]100-justine , stepping back , pressed the electric button in the wall , and the wide door - step was abruptly illuminated , with its huddled , pushing , heavily - breathing group ... [black figures writhing out of darkness , strange faces distorted in the glare]2390-black figures writhing out of darkness , strange faces distorted in the glare . " Bessy ! "[100-justine] [she]100-justine cried , and sprang forward ; but suddenly [Wyant]165-wyant was before [her]100-justine , [his]165-wyant hand on [her]100-justine arm ; and as [the dreadful group]2391-the dreadful group struggled by into [the hall]505-the hall , [he]165-wyant froze [her]100-justine to [him]165-wyant with a whisper : " The spine---- "[165-wyant] XXVI WITHIN [Justine]100-justine there was a moment 's darkness ; then , like [terror - struck workers]2393-terror - struck workers rallying to [their]2393-terror - struck workers tasks , [every faculty]2394-every faculty was again at its post , receiving and transmitting signals , taking observations , anticipating orders , making [her]100-justine brain ring with the hum of a controlled activity . [She]100-justine had known the sensation before -- the transmuting of terror and pity into this miraculous lucidity of thought and action ; but never had it snatched [her]100-justine from such depths . Oh , thank heaven for [her]100-justine knowledge now -- for the trained mind that could take command of [her]100-justine senses and bend them firmly to its service ! [Wyant]165-wyant seconded [her]100-justine well , after a moment 's ague - fit of fear . [She]100-justine pitied and pardoned the moment , aware of its cause , and respecting [him]165-wyant for the way in which [he]165-wyant rose above it into the clear air of professional self - command . Through the first hours [they]2395-they worked shoulder to shoulder , conscious of [each other]407-each other only as of kindred will - powers , stretched to the utmost tension of discernment and activity , and hardly needing speech or look to further [their]2395-they swift co - operation . It was thus that [she]100-justine had known [him]165-wyant in [the hospital]3333-the hospital , in the heat of [his]165-wyant youthful zeal : [the doctor [she]100-justine liked best to work with]2398-the doctor she liked best to work with , because no other so tempered ardour with judgment . [The great surgeon]2399-the great surgeon , arriving from [town]3932-town at midnight , confirmed [his]165-wyant diagnosis : there was undoubted injury to the spine . [Other consultants]2401-other consultants were summoned in haste , and in the winter dawn the verdict was pronounced -- a fractured vertebra , and possibly lesion of the cord .... [Justine]100-justine got a moment alone when [the surgeons]2402-the surgeons returned to [the sick - room]2403-the sick - room . [Other nurses]2404-other nurses were [there]3361-there now , capped , aproned , quickly and silently unpacking [their]2404-other nurses appliances .... [She]100-justine must call a halt , clear [her]100-justine brain again , decide rapidly what was to be done next .... Oh , if only the crawling hours could bring [Amherst]96-amherst ! It was strange that there was no telegram yet -- no , not strange , after all , since it was barely six in the morning , and [her]100-justine message had not been despatched till seven the night before . It was not unlikely that , in [that little southern settlement]2406-that little southern settlement , [the telegraph office]2407-the telegraph office closed at six . [She]100-justine stood in [[Bessy]170-bessy 's sitting - room]2408-bessy 's sitting - room , [her]100-justine forehead pressed to the window - pane , [her]100-justine eyes straining out into the thin February darkness , through which the morning star swam white . As soon as [she]100-justine had yielded [her]100-justine place to [the other nurses]2409-the other nurses [her]100-justine nervous tension relaxed , and [she]100-justine hung again above the deeps of anguish , terrified and weak . In a moment the necessity for action would snatch [her]100-justine back to a firm footing -- [her]100-justine thoughts would clear , [her]100-justine will affirm itself , all the wheels of the complex machine resume their functions . But now [she]100-justine felt only the horror .... [She]100-justine knew so well what was going on in [the next room]427-the next room . [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford , [the great surgeon , who had known [her]100-justine at [Saint Elizabeth 's]58-saint elizabeth 's]2411-the great surgeon , who had known her at saint elizabeth 's , had evidently expected [her]100-justine to take command of [the nurses [he]95-dr. garford had brought from [town]3932-town]2412-the nurses he had brought from town ; but there were enough without [her]100-justine , and there were other cares which , for the moment , [she]100-justine only could assume -- the despatching of messages to [the scattered family]2414-the scattered family , the incessant telephoning and telegraphing to [town]3932-town , the general guidance of [the household]1514-the household swinging rudderless in the tide of disaster . [Cicely]167-cicely , above all , must be watched over and guarded from alarm . [The little governess , reduced to a twittering heap of fears]2417-the little governess , reduced to a twittering heap of fears , had been quarantined in [a distant room]2418-a distant room till reason returned to [her]100-justine ; and [the child]3698-the child , meanwhile , slept quietly in [the old nurse]2420-the old nurse 's care . [Cicely]167-cicely would wake presently , and [Justine]100-justine must go up to [her]167-cicely with a bright face ; other duties would press thick on the heels of this ; [their]2421-their feet were already on the threshold . But meanwhile [she]100-justine could only follow in imagination what was going on in [the other room]2422-the other room .... [She]100-justine had often thought with dread of such a contingency . [She]100-justine always sympathized too much with [[her]100-justine patients]2423-her patients -- [she]100-justine knew it was the joint in [her]100-justine armour . [Her]100-justine quick - gushing pity lay too near that professional exterior which [she]100-justine had managed to endue with such a bright glaze of insensibility that [some sentimental patients]2424-some sentimental patients -- without much the matter -- had been known to call [her]100-justine " a little hard . "[100-justine] How , then , should [she]100-justine steel [herself]100-justine if it fell to [her]100-justine lot to witness a cruel accident to [some one [she]100-justine loved]2425-some one she loved , and to have to perform [a nurse]254-a nurse 's duties , steadily , expertly , unflinchingly , while every fibre was torn with inward anguish ? [She]100-justine knew the horror of it now -- and [she]100-justine knew also that [her]100-justine self - enforced exile from [the sick - room]2403-the sick - room was a hundred times worse . To stand there , knowing , with each tick of the clock , what was being said and done within -- how [the great luxurious room]2428-the great luxurious room , with [its]2428-the great luxurious room pale draperies and scented cushions , and the hundred pretty trifles strewing the lace toilet - table and the delicate old furniture , was being swept bare , cleared for action like [a ship]2429-a ship 's deck , drearily garnished with rows of instruments , rolls of medicated cotton , oiled silk , bottles , bandages , water - pillows -- all the grim paraphernalia of the awful rites of pain : to know this , and to be able to call up with torturing vividness that poor pale face on the pillows , vague - eyed , expressionless , perhaps , as [she]100-justine had last seen it , or -- worse yet -- stirred already with the first creeping pangs of consciousness : to have these images slowly , deliberately burn themselves into [her]100-justine brain , and to be aware , at the same time , of that underlying moral disaster , of which the accident seemed the monstrous outward symbol -- ah , this was worse than anything [she]100-justine had ever dreamed ! [She]100-justine knew that the final verdict could not be pronounced till the operation which was about to take place should reveal the extent of injury to the spine . [Bessy]170-bessy , in falling , must have struck on the back of [her]170-bessy head and shoulders , and it was but too probable that the fractured vertebra had caused a bruise if not a lesion of the spinal cord . In that case paralysis was certain -- and a slow crawling death the almost inevitable outcome . There had been cases , of course -- [Justine]100-justine 's professional memory evoked [them]2430-them -- cases of so - called " recovery , "[2430-them] where actual death was kept at bay , a semblance of life preserved for years in the poor petrified body .... But the mind shrank from such a fate for [Bessy]170-bessy . And it might still be that the injury to the spine was not grave -- though , here again , the fracturing of the fourth vertebra was ominous . The door opened and [some one]3457-some one came from [the inner room]2432-the inner room -- [Wyant]165-wyant , in search of an instrument - case . [Justine]100-justine turned and [they]2433-they looked at [each other]407-each other . " It will be now ? "[100-justine] " Yes . [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford asked if there was no one [you]100-justine could send for . "[3457-some one] " [No one]3425-no one but [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy and [the Halford Gaineses]127-the gaineses . [They]2433-they 'll be [here]3415-here this evening , [I]2433-they suppose . "[2433-they] [They]2433-they exchanged a discouraged glance , knowing how little difference the presence of [the Halford Gaineses]127-the gaineses would make . " [He]95-dr. garford wanted to know if there was no telegram from [Amherst]170-bessy . "[3457-some one] " No . "[2433-they] " Then [they]2433-they mean to begin . "[2435-a nursemaid] [A nursemaid]2435-a nursemaid appeared in the doorway . " [Miss Cicely--]204-miss cicely-- "[2435-a nursemaid] [she]2435-a nursemaid said ; and [Justine]100-justine bounded [upstairs]1423-upstairs . The day 's work had begun . From [Cicely]167-cicely to [the governess]3694-the governess -- from [the governess]3694-the governess to [the housekeeper]2167-the housekeeper -- from the telephone to the writing - table -- [Justine]100-justine vibrated back and forth , quick , noiseless , self - possessed -- sobering , guiding , controlling [her]100-justine confused and panic - stricken world . It seemed to [her]100-justine that half the day had elapsed before [the telegraph office at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]2440-the telegraph office at lynbrook opened -- [she]100-justine was at the telephone at the stroke of the hour . No telegram ? Only one -- a message from [Halford Gaines--"Arrive]205-halford gaines--"arrive at eight tonight . "[205-halford gaines--"arrive] [Amherst]96-amherst was still silent ! Was there a difference of time to be allowed for ? [She]100-justine tried to remember , to calculate , but [her]100-justine brain was too crowded with other thoughts .... [She]100-justine turned away from the instrument discouraged . Whenever [she]100-justine had time to think , [she]100-justine was overwhelmed by the weight of [her]100-justine solitude . [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope was in [Egypt]44-egypt , accessible only through [a [London]60-london banker]2441-a london banker -- [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell presumably wandering on [the continent]2442-the continent . [Her]100-justine cables might not reach [them]2443-them for days . And among [the throng of [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook habitues]2444-the throng of lynbrook habitues , [she]100-justine knew not to whom to turn . To loose [the Telfer tribe]2445-the telfer tribe and [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury upon [that stricken house]2446-that stricken house -- [her]100-justine thought revolted from it , and [she]100-justine was thankful to know that [February]206-february had dispersed [their]2443-them migratory flock to [southern shores]2447-southern shores . But if only [Amherst]170-bessy would come ! [Cicely]167-cicely and [the tranquillized governess]2448-the tranquillized governess had been despatched on a walk with the dogs , and [Justine]100-justine was returning [upstairs]1423-upstairs when [she]100-justine met [one of [the servants]746-the servants]2386-one of the servants with a telegram . [She]100-justine tore it open with a great throb of relief . It was [her]100-justine own message to [Amherst--_address]207-amherst--_address unknown _ .... Had [she]100-justine misdirected it , then ? In that first blinding moment [her]100-justine mind might so easily have failed [her]100-justine . But no -- there was the name of [the town]329-the town before [her]100-justine ... [Millfield]59-millfield , [Georgia]57-georgia ... the same name as in [his]2453-his letter .... [She]100-justine had made no mistake , but [he]2453-his was gone ! Gone -- and without leaving an address .... For a moment [her]100-justine tired mind refused to work ; then [she]100-justine roused [herself]100-justine , ran down the stairs again , and rang up [the telegraph - office]2454-the telegraph - office . The thing to do , of course , was to telegraph to [the owner of [the mills]3324-the mills]3411-the owner of the mills -- of whose very name [she]100-justine was ignorant!--enquiring where [Amherst]170-bessy was , and asking [him]3411-the owner of the mills to forward the message . Precious hours must be lost meanwhile -- but , after all , [they]2457-they were waiting for [no one]3425-no one [upstairs]1423-upstairs . * * * * * The verdict had been pronounced : dislocation and fracture of the fourth vertebra , with consequent injury to the spinal cord . [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford and [Wyant]165-wyant came out alone to tell [her]100-justine . [She]100-justine asked no questions as to the future -- [she]100-justine knew it was impossible to tell . But there were no immediate signs of a fatal ending : [the patient]258-the patient had rallied well , and the general conditions were not unfavourable . " [You]100-justine have heard from [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst ? "[95-dr. garford] [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford concluded . " Not yet ... "[100-justine] * * * * * At dusk , [Justine]100-justine sat in [the library]483-the library , waiting for [Cicely]167-cicely to be brought to [her]100-justine . A lull had descended on [the house]311-the house -- a new order developed out of the morning 's chaos . With soundless steps , with lowered voices , the machinery of life was carried on . And [Justine]100-justine , caught in one of the pauses of inaction which [she]100-justine had fought off since morning , was reliving , for the hundredth time , [her]100-justine few moments at [Bessy]170-bessy 's bedside .... [She]100-justine had been summoned in the course of the afternoon , and stealing into [the darkened room]2466-the darkened room , had bent over the bed while [the nurses]2467-the nurses noiselessly withdrew . There lay the white face which had been burnt into [her]100-justine inward vision -- the motionless body , and the head stirring ceaselessly , as though to release the agitation of the imprisoned limbs . [Bessy]170-bessy 's eyes turned to [her]100-justine , drawing [her]100-justine down . " Am [I]170-bessy going to die , [Justine]100-justine ? "[170-bessy] " No . "[170-bessy] " The pain is ... so awful .... "[170-bessy] " It will pass ... [you]100-justine will sleep .... "[170-bessy] " [Cicely----]210-cicely---- "[170-bessy] " [She]167-cicely has gone for a walk . [You]100-justine 'll see [her]167-cicely presently . "[170-bessy] The eyes faded , releasing [Justine]100-justine . [She]100-justine stole away , and [the nurses]2467-the nurses came back . [Bessy]170-bessy had spoken of [Cicely]167-cicely -- but not a word of [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband ! Perhaps [her]100-justine poor dazed mind groped for [him]3393-her husband , or perhaps it shrank from [his]3393-her husband name .... [Justine]100-justine was thankful for [her]100-justine silence . For the moment [her]100-justine heart was bitter against [Amherst]96-amherst . Why , so soon after [her]100-justine appeal and [his]3393-her husband answer , had [he]3393-her husband been false to the spirit of [their]2470-their agreement ? This unannounced , unexplained departure was nothing less than a breach of [his]3393-her husband tacit pledge -- the pledge not to break definitely with [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . And why had [he]3393-her husband gone to [South America]61-south america ? [She]100-justine drew [her]100-justine aching brows together , trying to retrace a vague memory of some allusion to the cotton - growing capabilities of [the region]2471-the region .... Yes , [he]3393-her husband had spoken of it once in talking of [the world]259-the world 's area of cotton production . But what impulse had sent [him]3393-her husband off on such an exploration ? Mere unrest , perhaps -- the intolerable burden of [his]3393-her husband useless life ? The questions spun round and round in [her]100-justine head , weary , profitless , yet persistent .... It was a relief when [Cicely]167-cicely came -- a relief to measure out the cambric tea , to make the terrier beg for ginger - bread , even to take up the thread of the interrupted fairy - tale -- though through it all [she]100-justine was wrung by the thought that , just twenty - four hours earlier , [she]100-justine and [the child]3698-the child had sat in [the same place]2474-the same place , listening for the trot of [Bessy]170-bessy 's horse .... The day passed : the hands of the clocks moved , food was cooked and served , blinds were drawn up or down , lamps lit and fires renewed ... all these tokens of the passage of time took place before [her]100-justine , while [her]100-justine real consciousness seemed to hang in some dim central void , where nothing happened , nothing would ever happen .... And now [Cicely]167-cicely was in bed , the last " long - distance "[167-cicely] call was answered , the last orders to [kitchen]2475-kitchen and [stable]2476-stable had been despatched , [Wyant]165-wyant had stolen down to [her]100-justine with [his]3393-her husband hourly report--"no change"--and[165-wyant] [she]100-justine was waiting in [the library]483-the library for [the Gaineses]127-the gaineses . Carriage - wheels on the gravel : [they]2478-they were there at last . [Justine]100-justine started up and went into [the hall]505-the hall . As [she]100-justine passed out of [the library]483-the library the outer door opened , and the gusty night swooped in -- as , at the same hour the day before , it had swooped in ahead of the dreadful procession -- preceding now the carriageful of [Hanaford]164-hanaford relations : [Mr. Gaines]110-mr. gaines , red - glazed , brief and interrogatory ; [Westy]113-westy , small , nervous , ill at ease with [his]113-westy grief ; and [Mrs. Gaines]140-mrs. gaines , [supreme in the possession of a consolatory yet funereal manner]2481-supreme in the possession of a consolatory yet funereal manner , and sinking on [Justine]100-justine 's breast with the solemn whisper : " Have [you]100-justine sent for [the clergyman]4448-the clergyman ? "[140-mrs. gaines] XXVII [THE house]311-the house was empty again . A week had passed since [Bessy]170-bessy 's accident , and [friends]1747-friends and relations had dispersed . [The household]1514-the household had fallen into its routine , the routine of sickness and silence , and once more the perfectly - adjusted machine was working on steadily , inexorably , like a natural law .... So at least it seemed to [Justine]100-justine 's nerves , intolerably stretched , at times , on the rack of solitude , of suspense , of forebodings . [She]100-justine had been thankful when [the Gaineses]127-the gaineses left -- doubly thankful when a telegram from [Bermuda]62-bermuda declared [Mrs. Carbury]193-mrs. carbury to be " in despair "[193-mrs. carbury] at [her]100-justine inability to fly to [Bessy]170-bessy 's side -- thankful even that [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's professional engagements made it impossible for [him]125-bessy to do more than come down , every second or third day , for a few hours ; yet , though in some ways it was a relief to be again in sole command , there were moments when the weight of responsibility , and the inability to cry out [her]100-justine fears and [her]100-justine uncertainties , seemed almost unendurable . [Wyant]165-wyant was [her]100-justine chief reliance . [He]165-wyant had risen so gallantly above [his]165-wyant weakness , become again so completely [the indefatigable worker of former days]2485-the indefatigable worker of former days , that [she]100-justine accused [herself]100-justine of injustice in ascribing to physical causes the vague eye and tremulous hand which might merely have betokened a passing access of nervous sensibility . Now , at any rate , [he]165-wyant had [his]165-wyant nerves so well under control , and had shown such a grasp of the case , and such marked executive capacity , that on the third day after the accident [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford , withdrawing [[his]95-dr. garford own assistant]2486-his own assistant , had left [him]95-dr. garford in control at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . At the same time [Justine]100-justine had taken up [her]100-justine attendance in [the sick - room]2403-the sick - room , replacing one of [the subordinate nurses who had been suddenly called away]2488-the subordinate nurses who had been suddenly called away . [She]100-justine had done this the more willingly because [Bessy]170-bessy , who was now conscious for the greater part of the time , had asked for [her]100-justine once or twice , and had seemed easier when [she]100-justine was in [the room]3355-the room . But [she]100-justine still gave only occasional aid , relieving [the other nurses]2409-the other nurses when [they]2409-the other nurses dined or rested , but keeping [herself]100-justine partly free in order to have an eye on [the household]1514-the household , and give a few hours daily to [Cicely]167-cicely . All this had become part of a system that already seemed as old as memory . [She]100-justine could hardly recall what life had been before the accident -- the seven dreadful days seemed as long as the days of creation . Every morning [she]100-justine rose to the same report--"no change"--and[100-justine] every day passed without a word from [Amherst]170-bessy . Minor news , of course , had come : [poor Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , at length overtaken at [Wady Halfa]63-wady halfa , was hastening back as fast as [ship and rail]2492-ship and rail could carry [him]120-mr. langhope ; [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , anchored at [Algiers]64-algiers with [[her]178-mrs. ansell invalid]2493-her invalid , cabled anxious enquiries ; but still no word from [Amherst]170-bessy . [The correspondent at [Buenos Ayres]65-buenos ayres]2494-the correspondent at buenos ayres had simply cabled " Not [here]3415-here . Will enquire"--and[2494-the correspondent at buenos ayres] since then , silence . [Justine]100-justine had taken to sitting in [a small room beyond [Amherst]170-bessy 's bedroom]2495-a small room beyond amherst 's bedroom , near enough to [Bessy]170-bessy to be within call , yet accessible to [the rest of [the household]1514-the household]2496-the rest of the household . The walls were hung with old prints , and with two or three photographs of early Italian pictures ; and in a low bookcase [Amherst]170-bessy had put the books [he]120-mr. langhope had brought from [Hanaford]1-hanaford -- [the English poets]2498-the english poets , [the Greek dramatists]2499-the greek dramatists , some text - books of biology and kindred subjects , and a few stray well - worn volumes : [Lecky]211-lecky 's European Morals , [Carlyle]212-carlyle 's translation of [Wilhelm Meister]213-wilhelm meister , [Seneca]214-seneca , Epictetus , a German grammar , a pocket Bacon . It was unlike [any other room at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]2500-any other room at lynbrook -- even through [her]100-justine benumbing misery , [Justine]100-justine felt the relief of escaping [there]3361-there from the rest of [the great soulless house]2502-the great soulless house . Sometimes [she]100-justine took up one of the books and read a page or two , letting the beat of the verse lull [her]100-justine throbbing brain , or the strong words of stoic wisdom sink into [her]100-justine heart . And even when there was no time for these brief flights from reality , it soothed [her]100-justine to feel [herself]100-justine in the presence of great thoughts -- to know that in [this room]2503-this room , among these books , another restless baffled mind had sought escape from the " dusty answer "[100-justine] of life . [Her]100-justine hours there made [her]100-justine think less bitterly of [Amherst]170-bessy -- but also , alas , made [her]100-justine see more clearly the irreconcilable difference between the two natures [she]100-justine had striven to reunite . That which was the essence of life to one was a meaningless shadow to the other ; and the gulf between [them]2504-them was too wide for the imagination of either to bridge . As [she]100-justine sat there on the seventh afternoon there was a knock on the door and [Wyant]165-wyant entered . [She]100-justine had only time to notice that [he]165-wyant was very pale -- [she]100-justine had been struck once or twice with [his]165-wyant look of sudden exhaustion , which passed as quickly as it came -- then [she]100-justine saw that [he]165-wyant carried a telegram , and [her]100-justine mind flew back to its central anxiety . [She]100-justine grew pale [herself]100-justine as [she]100-justine read the message . " [He]165-wyant has been found -- at [Corrientes]66-corrientes . It will take [him]165-wyant at least a month to get [here]3415-here . "[100-justine] " A month -- good [God]156-god ! "[165-wyant] " And it may take [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope longer . "[2504-them] [Their]2504-them eyes met . " It 's too long---- ? "[100-justine] [she]100-justine asked . " [I]100-justine do n't know -- [I]100-justine do n't know . "[100-justine] [He]165-wyant shivered slightly , turning away into the window . [Justine]100-justine sat down to dash off messages to [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy and [the Gaineses]127-the gaineses : [Amherst]170-bessy 's return must be made known at once . When [she]100-justine glanced up , [Wyant]165-wyant was standing near [her]100-justine . [His]165-wyant air of intense weariness had passed , and [he]165-wyant looked calm and ready for action . " Shall [I]165-wyant take these down ? "[165-wyant] " No . Ring , please . [I]2505-the servant who answered the bell want to ask [you]165-wyant a few questions . "[2505-the servant who answered the bell] [The servant who answered the bell]2505-the servant who answered the bell brought in a tea - tray , and [Justine]100-justine , having despatched the telegrams , seated [herself]100-justine and began to pour out [her]100-justine tea . Food had been repugnant to [her]100-justine during the first anguished unsettled days , but with the resumption of [the nurse]260-the nurse 's systematic habits [the nurse]260-the nurse 's punctual appetite returned . Every drop of energy must be husbanded now , and only sleep and nourishment could fill the empty cisterns . [She]100-justine held out a cup to [Wyant]165-wyant , but [he]165-wyant drew back with a gesture of aversion . " Thanks ; [I]100-justine 'm not hungry . "[100-justine] " [You]100-justine ought to eat more . "[100-justine] " No , no . [I]100-justine 'm very well . "[100-justine] [She]100-justine lifted [her]100-justine head , revived by the warm draught . The mechanical act of nourishment performed , [her]100-justine mind leapt back to the prospect of [Amherst]170-bessy 's return . A whole month before [he]165-wyant reached [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ! [He]165-wyant had instructed [her]100-justine where news might find [him]165-wyant on the way ... but a whole month to wait ! [She]100-justine looked at [Wyant]165-wyant , and [they]2508-they read [each other]407-each other 's thoughts . " It 's a long time , "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant said . " Yes . "[165-wyant] " But [Garford]95-dr. garford can do wonders -- and [she]100-justine 's very strong . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine shuddered . Just so [a skilled agent of the Inquisition]2510-a skilled agent of the inquisition might have spoken , calculating how much longer the power of suffering might be artificially preserved in a body broken on the wheel .... " How does [she]100-justine seem to [you]100-justine today ? "[165-wyant] " The general conditions are about the same . The heart keeps up wonderfully , but there is a little more oppression of the diaphragm . "[165-wyant] " Yes -- [her]100-justine breathing is harder . Last night [she]100-justine suffered horribly at times . "[165-wyant] " Oh -- she'll suffer , "[165-wyant] [Wyant]165-wyant murmured . " Of course the hypodermics can be increased . "[165-wyant] " Just what did [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford say this morning ? "[165-wyant] " [He]95-dr. garford is astonished at [her]100-justine strength . "[165-wyant] " But there 's no hope?--I do n't know why [I]165-wyant ask ! "[165-wyant] " Hope ? "[165-wyant] [Wyant]165-wyant looked at [her]100-justine . " [I]100-justine must go to [Cicely----]210-cicely---- "[100-justine] [The rector of [Saint Anne 's]67-saint anne 's]2511-the rector of saint anne 's had called again . [Bessy]170-bessy 's religious practices had been purely mechanical : [her]170-bessy faith had never been associated with the graver moments of [her]170-bessy life , and the apparition of [a clerical figure at [her]170-bessy bedside]2514-a clerical figure at her bedside would portend not consolation but calamity . [The Reverend Ernest Lynde]216-the reverend ernest lynde , who was [a young man , with more zeal than experience]2516-a young man , with more zeal than experience , deemed it [his]2511-the rector of saint anne 's duty to obey this injunction to the letter ; but hitherto [he]2511-the rector of saint anne 's had had to content [himself]2511-the rector of saint anne 's with a talk with [the housekeeper]2167-the housekeeper , or a brief word on the doorstep from [Wyant]165-wyant . Today , however , [he]2511-the rector of saint anne 's had asked somewhat insistently for [Miss Brent]97-miss brent ; and [Justine]100-justine , who was free at the moment , felt that [she]100-justine could not refuse to go down . " [The men of [the older generation]4466-the older generation]4465-the men of the older generation -- [clergymen]4467-clergymen , [I]100-justine mean , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine went on in a low controlled voice , " would of course take that view -- must take it . "[100-justine] " [I]217-mr. lynde understand , "[217-mr. lynde] [he]217-mr. lynde rejoined sympathetically , forgetting [his]217-mr. lynde youth and [his]217-mr. lynde inexperience in the simple desire to bring solace to a troubled mind . " [I]100-justine understand [your]100-justine feeling -- but [you]100-justine need have no doubt . Human life is sacred , and the fact that , even in this materialistic age , science is continually struggling to preserve and prolong it , shows -- very beautifully , [I]100-justine think -- how all things work together to fulfill the divine will . "[100-justine] " Then [you]2528-the young rector believe that the divine will delights in mere pain -- mere meaningless animal suffering -- for its own sake ? "[100-justine] " Surely not ; but for the sake of the spiritual life that may be mysteriously wrung out of it . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine bent [her]100-justine puzzled brows on [him]217-mr. lynde . " [I]100-justine could understand that view of moral suffering -- or even of physical pain moderate enough to leave the mind clear , and to call forth qualities of endurance and renunciation . But where the body has been crushed to a pulp , and the mind is no more than a machine for the registering of sense - impressions of physical anguish , of what use can such suffering be to [its owner]4468-its owner -- or to the divine will ? "[100-justine] [The young rector]2528-the young rector looked at [her]100-justine sadly , almost severely . "[100-justine] " None -- none , "[2529-its authorized exponent] [its authorized exponent]2529-its authorized exponent pronounced emphatically . " Then Christianity and science are agreed . "[100-justine] [She]100-justine rose , and [the young rector]2528-the young rector , with visible reluctance , stood up also . " That , again , is one of the most striking evidences-- "[2528-the young rector] [he]2528-the young rector began ; and then , as the necessity of taking leave was forced upon [him]2528-the young rector , [he]2528-the young rector added appealingly : " [I]2528-the young rector understand [your]100-justine uncertainties , [your]100-justine questionings , and [I]2528-the young rector wish [I]2528-the young rector could have made [my]2528-the young rector point clearer---- "[2528-the young rector] " Thank [you]100-justine ; it is quite clear . XXVIII THAT evening , when [Justine]100-justine took [her]100-justine place at the bedside , and [the other two nurses]2532-the other two nurses had gone down to supper , [Bessy]170-bessy turned [her]170-bessy head slightly , resting [her]170-bessy eyes on [[her]170-bessy friend]706-her friend . The rose - shaded lamp cast a tint of life on [her]170-bessy face , and the dark circles of pain made [her]170-bessy eyes look deeper and brighter . [Justine]100-justine was almost deceived by the delusive semblance of vitality , and a hope that was half anguish stirred in [her]100-justine . [She]100-justine sat down by the bed , clasping the hand on the sheet . " [You]170-bessy feel better tonight ? "[100-justine] " [I]100-justine breathe ... better .... "[100-justine] The words came brokenly , between long pauses , but without the hard agonized gasps of the previous night . " That 's a good sign . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine paused , and then , letting [her]100-justine fingers glide once or twice over the back of [Bessy]170-bessy 's hand--"You know , [dear]3468-dear , [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst is coming , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine leaned down to say . [Bessy]170-bessy 's eyes moved again , slowly , inscrutably . [She]170-bessy had never asked for [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband . " Soon ? "[170-bessy] [she]170-bessy whispered . " [He]96-amherst had started on a long journey -- to [out - of - the - way places]4472-out - of - the - way places -- to study something about cotton growing -- [my]100-justine message has just overtaken [him]96-amherst , "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine explained . [Bessy]170-bessy lay still , [her]170-bessy breast straining for breath . [She]170-bessy remained so long without speaking that [Justine]100-justine began to think [she]170-bessy was falling back into the somnolent state that intervened between [her]170-bessy moments of complete consciousness . But at length [she]170-bessy lifted [her]170-bessy lids again , and [her]170-bessy lips stirred . " [He]96-amherst will be ... long ... coming ? "[170-bessy] " Some days . "[170-bessy] " How ... many ? "[170-bessy] " [We]4473-we ca n't tell yet . "[170-bessy] Silence again . [Bessy]170-bessy 's features seemed to shrink into a kind of waxen quietude -- as though [her]170-bessy face were seen under clear water , a long way down . And then , as [she]170-bessy lay thus , without sound or movement , two tears forced themselves through [her]170-bessy lashes and rolled down [her]170-bessy cheeks . [Justine]100-justine , bending close , wiped them away . " [Bessy--]174-bessy-- "[100-justine] The wet lashes were raised -- an anguished look met [her]100-justine gaze . " [I]100-justine -- [I]100-justine ca n't bear it .... "[100-justine] " What , [dear]3468-dear ? "[100-justine] " The pain .... Sha n't [I]100-justine die ... before ? "[100-justine] " [You]174-bessy-- may get well , [Bessy]170-bessy . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine felt [her]100-justine hand quiver . " Walk again ... ? "[100-justine] " Perhaps ... not that . "[100-justine] " _ This ? _ [I]170-bessy ca n't bear it .... "[170-bessy] [Her]170-bessy head drooped sideways , turning away toward the wall . [Justine]100-justine , that night , kept [her]100-justine vigil with an aching heart . The news of [Amherst]96-amherst 's return had produced no sign of happiness in [[his]96-amherst wife---]2535-his wife--- the tears had been forced from [her]170-bessy merely by the dread of being kept alive during the long days of pain before [he]96-amherst came . The medical explanation might have been that repeated crises of intense physical anguish , and the deep lassitude succeeding [them]2536-them , had so overlaid all other feelings , or at least so benumbed [their]2536-them expression , that it was impossible to conjecture how [Bessy]170-bessy 's little half - smothered spark of soul had really been affected by the news . But [Justine]100-justine did not believe in this argument . [Her]100-justine experience among [the sick]2537-the sick had convinced [her]100-justine , on the contrary , that the shafts of grief or joy will find a crack in the heaviest armour of physical pain , that the tiniest gleam of hope will light up depths of mental inanition , and somehow send a ray to the surface .... It was true that [Bessy]170-bessy had never known how to bear pain , and that [her]170-bessy own sensations had always formed the centre of [her]170-bessy universe -- yet , for that very reason , if the thought of seeing [Amherst]96-amherst had made [her]100-justine happier it would have lifted , at least momentarily , the weight of death from [her]100-justine body . [Justine]100-justine , at first , had almost feared the contrary effect -- feared that the moral depression might show itself in a lowering of physical resistance . But [the body]2538-the body kept up its obstinate struggle against death , drawing strength from sources of vitality unsuspected in that frail envelope . [The surgeon]2460-the surgeon 's report the next day was more favourable , and every day won from death pointed now to a faint chance of recovery . Such at least was [Wyant]165-wyant 's view . [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford and [the consulting surgeons]2540-the consulting surgeons had not yet declared [themselves]2541-themselves ; but [the young doctor , strung to the highest point of watchfulness]2542-the young doctor , strung to the highest point of watchfulness , and constantly in attendance on [the patient]258-the patient , was tending toward a hopeful prognosis . The growing conviction spurred [him]95-dr. garford to fresh efforts ; at [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford 's request , [he]95-dr. garford had temporarily handed over [[his]95-dr. garford Clifton practice]2544-his clifton practice to a young [New York]7-new york [doctor in need of change]2545-doctor in need of change , and having installed [himself]95-dr. garford at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook [he]95-dr. garford gave up [his]95-dr. garford days and nights to [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst 's case . " If [any one]3517-any one can save [her]117-mrs. amherst , [Wyant]165-wyant will , "[95-dr. garford] [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford had declared to [Justine]100-justine , when , on the tenth day after the accident , [the surgeons]2402-the surgeons held [their]2402-the surgeons third consultation . [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford reserved [his]95-dr. garford own judgment . [He]95-dr. garford had seen cases -- [they]2402-the surgeons had all seen cases ... but just at present the signs might point either way .... Meanwhile [Wyant]165-wyant 's confidence was an invaluable asset toward [the patient]258-the patient 's chances of recovery . Hopefulness in [the physician]422-the physician was almost as necessary as in [the patient]258-the patient -- contact with such faith had been known to work miracles . [Justine]100-justine listened in silence , wishing that [she]100-justine too could hope . But whichever way the prognosis pointed , [she]100-justine felt only a dull despair . [She]100-justine believed no more than [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford in the chance of recovery -- that conviction seemed to [her]100-justine a mirage of [Wyant]165-wyant 's imagination , of [his]165-wyant boyish ambition to achieve the impossible -- and every hopeful symptom pointed , in [her]100-justine mind , only to a longer period of useless suffering . [Her]100-justine hours at [Bessy]170-bessy 's side deepened [her]100-justine revolt against the energy spent in the fight with death . Since [Bessy]170-bessy had learned that [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband was returning [she]170-bessy had never , by sign or word , reverted to the fact . Except for a gleam of tenderness , now and then , when [Cicely]167-cicely was brought to [her]100-justine , [she]100-justine seemed to have sunk back into [herself]100-justine , as though [her]100-justine poor little flicker of consciousness were wholly centred in the contemplation of its pain . It was not that [her]100-justine mind was clouded -- only that it was immersed , absorbed , in that dread mystery of disproportionate anguish which a capricious fate had laid on it .... And what if [she]100-justine recovered , as [they]2551-they called it ? If the flood - tide of pain should ebb , leaving [her]100-justine stranded , a helpless wreck on [the desert shores of inactivity]2552-the desert shores of inactivity ? What would life be to [Bessy]170-bessy without movement ? Thought would never set [her]100-justine blood flowing -- motion , in [her]100-justine , could only take the form of the physical processes . [Her]100-justine love for [Amherst]170-bessy was dead -- even if it flickered into life again , it could but put the spark to smouldering discords and resentments ; and would [her]100-justine one uncontaminated sentiment -- [her]100-justine affection for [Cicely]167-cicely -- suffice to reconcile [her]100-justine to the desolate half - life which was the utmost that science could hold out ? Here again , [Justine]100-justine 's experience answered no . [She]100-justine did not believe in [Bessy]170-bessy 's powers of moral recuperation -- [her]100-justine body seemed less near death than [her]100-justine spirit . Life had been poured out to [her]100-justine in generous measure , and [she]100-justine had spilled the precious draught -- the few drops remaining in the cup could no longer renew [her]100-justine strength . Pity , not condemnation -- profound illimitable pity -- flowed from this conclusion of [Justine]100-justine 's . To a compassionate heart there could be no sadder instance of the wastefulness of life than this struggle of the small half - formed soul with a destiny too heavy for its strength . If [Bessy]170-bessy had had any moral hope to fight for , every pang of suffering would have been worth enduring ; but it was intolerable to witness the spectacle of [her]170-bessy useless pain . Incessant commerce with such thoughts made [Justine]100-justine , as the days passed , crave any escape from solitude , any contact with other ideas . Even the reappearance of [Westy Gaines]113-westy , bringing a breath of common - place conventional grief into the haunted silence of [the house]311-the house , was a respite from [her]100-justine questionings . If it was hard to talk to [him]2554-his , to answer [his]2554-his enquiries , to assent to [his]2554-his platitudes , it was harder , a thousand times , to go on talking to [herself]100-justine .... [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's coming was a distinct relief . [His]2554-his dryness was like cautery to [her]100-justine wound . [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy undoubtedly grieved for [Bessy]125-bessy ; but [his]2554-his grief struck inward , exuding only now and then , through the fissures of [his]2554-his hard manner , in a touch of extra solemnity , the more laboured rounding of a period . Yet , on the whole , it was to [his]2554-his feeling that [Justine]100-justine felt [her]100-justine own to be most akin . If [his]2554-his stoic acceptance of the inevitable proceeded from the resolve to spare [himself]2554-his pain , that at least was a form of strength , an indication of character . [She]100-justine had never cared for the fluencies of invertebrate sentiment . Now , on the evening of the day after [her]100-justine talk with [Bessy]125-bessy , it was more than ever a solace to escape from the torment of [her]100-justine thoughts into the rarefied air of [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's presence . The day had been a bad one for [the patient]258-the patient , and [Justine]100-justine 's distress had been increased by the receipt of a cable from [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , announcing that , owing to delay in reaching [Brindisi]70-brindisi , [he]2554-his had missed [the fast steamer]2556-the fast steamer from [Cherbourg]71-cherbourg , and would not arrive till four or five days later than [he]2554-his had expected . [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy , in response to [her]100-justine report , had announced [his]125-bessy intention of coming down by [a late train]2557-a late train , and now [he]125-bessy and [Justine]100-justine and [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant , after dining together , were seated before the fire in [the smoking - room]1582-the smoking - room . " [I]125-bessy take it , then , "[125-bessy] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy said , turning to [Wyant]165-wyant , " that the chances of [her]100-justine living to see [[her]100-justine father]3496-her father are very slight . "[125-bessy] [The young doctor]2559-the young doctor raised [his]2559-the young doctor head eagerly . " Not in [my]2559-the young doctor opinion , [sir]3495-sir . Unless unforeseen complications arise , [I]2559-the young doctor can almost promise to keep [her]100-justine alive for another month -- [I'm]2559-the young doctor not afraid to call it six weeks ! "[2559-the young doctor] " H'm -- [Garford]95-dr. garford does n't say so . "[125-bessy] " No ; [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford argues from precedent . "[2559-the young doctor] " And [you]2559-the young doctor ? "[125-bessy] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's thin lips were visited by the ghost of a smile . " Oh , [I]165-wyant do n't argue -- [I]165-wyant just feel [my]165-wyant way , "[165-wyant] said [Wyant]165-wyant imperturbably . " And yet [you]2559-the young doctor do n't hesitate to predict---- "[165-wyant] " No , [I]125-bessy do n't , [sir]3495-sir ; because the case , as [I]125-bessy see it , presents certain definite indications . "[125-bessy] [He]125-bessy began to enumerate them , cleverly avoiding the use of technicalities and trying to make [his]125-bessy point clear by the use of simple illustration and analogy . It sickened [Justine]100-justine to listen to [his]125-bessy passionate exposition -- [she]100-justine had heard it so often , [she]100-justine believed in it so little . [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy turned a probing glance on [him]125-bessy as [he]125-bessy ended . " Then , today even , [you]125-bessy believe not only in the possibility of prolonging life , but of ultimate recovery ? "[125-bessy] [Wyant]165-wyant hesitated . " [I]165-wyant wo n't call it recovery -- today . Say -- life indefinitely prolonged . "[165-wyant] " And the paralysis ? "[125-bessy] " It might disappear -- after a few months -- or a few years . "[125-bessy] " Such an outcome would be unusual ? "[165-wyant] " Exceptional . But then there _ are _ exceptions . And [I]125-bessy 'm straining every nerve to make this one ! "[125-bessy] " Well -- as the anaesthetics lose their effect .... "[125-bessy] There was a tap on the door , and [one of [the nurses]2467-the nurses]2560-one of the nurses entered to report to [Wyant]165-wyant . "[125-bessy] There was a moment 's pause ; then [Justine]100-justine murmured : " It can be done ... [I]100-justine think .... "[100-justine] " Yes -- it 's horrible , "[125-bessy] said [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy suddenly , as if in answer to [her]100-justine thought . " These new devices for keeping [people]3450-people alive , "[100-justine] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy continued ; " [they]4485-they increase the suffering besides prolonging it ? "[125-bessy] [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy looked at [her]100-justine in surprise , as though wondering at so unprofessional an utterance from [one who , under ordinary circumstances , showed the absolute self - control and submission of the well - disciplined nurse]2563-one who , under ordinary circumstances , showed the absolute self - control and submission of the well - disciplined nurse . " Human life is sacred , "[125-bessy] [he]125-bessy said sententiously . " Ah , that must have been decreed by [some one who had never suffered]4487-some one who had never suffered ! "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine exclaimed . [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy smiled compassionately : [he]125-bessy evidently knew how to make allowances for the fact that [she]100-justine was overwrought by the sight of [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend 's suffering : " [Society]72-society decreed it -- [not one person]4488-not one person , "[125-bessy] [he]125-bessy corrected . " Society -- science -- religion ! "[100-justine] [she]100-justine murmured , as if to [herself]100-justine . " Precisely . Of course [your]100-justine training has taught [you]100-justine all this ; but [I]100-justine can understand that at such a time .... "[100-justine] " Yes , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said , rising wearily as [Wyant]165-wyant came in . * * * * * [Her]100-justine worst misery , now , was to have to discuss [Bessy]125-bessy 's condition with [Wyant]165-wyant . To [the young physician]2565-the young physician [Bessy]125-bessy was no longer [a suffering , agonizing creature]2566-a suffering , agonizing creature : [she]100-justine was a case -- a beautiful case . As the problem developed new intricacies , becoming more and more of a challenge to [his]2565-the young physician faculties of observation and inference , [Justine]100-justine saw the abstract scientific passion supersede [his]2565-the young physician personal feeling of pity . Though [his]2565-the young physician professional skill made [him]2565-the young physician exquisitely tender to [the patient]258-the patient under [his]2565-the young physician hands , [he]2565-the young physician seemed hardly conscious that [she]100-justine was [a woman who had befriended [him]2565-the young physician , and whom [he]2565-the young physician had so lately seen in the brightness of health and enjoyment]2568-a woman who had befriended him , and whom he had so lately seen in the brightness of health and enjoyment . This view was normal enough -- it was , as [Justine]100-justine knew , the ideal state of mind for [the successful physician]2569-the successful physician , in whom sympathy for [the patient]258-the patient as [an individual]2571-an individual must often impede swift choice and unfaltering action . But what [she]100-justine shrank from was [his]2565-the young physician resolve to save [Bessy]125-bessy 's life -- a resolve fortified to the point of exasperation by the scepticism of [the consulting surgeons]2540-the consulting surgeons , who saw in it only [the youngster]2573-the youngster 's natural desire to distinguish [himself]2573-the youngster by performing a feat which [[his]2573-the youngster elders]2574-his elders deemed impossible . As the days dragged on , and [Bessy]125-bessy 's sufferings increased , [Justine]100-justine longed for a protesting word from [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford or [one of [[his]95-dr. garford colleagues]2576-his colleagues]2575-one of his colleagues . In [her]100-justine hospital experience [she]100-justine had encountered cases where the useless agonies of death were mercifully shortened by [the physician]422-the physician ; why was not this a case for such treatment ? The answer was simple enough -- in the first place , it was the duty of [the surgeons]2402-the surgeons to keep [[their]2402-the surgeons patient]2579-their patient alive till [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband and [[her]100-justine father]3496-her father could reach [her]100-justine ; and secondly , there was that faint illusive hope of so - called recovery , in which none of [them]2402-the surgeons believed , yet which [they]2402-the surgeons could not ignore in [their]2402-the surgeons treatment . The evening after [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's departure [Wyant]165-wyant was setting this forth at great length to [Justine]100-justine . [Bessy]125-bessy had had a bad morning : the bronchial symptoms which had developed a day or two before had greatly increased [her]100-justine distress , and there had been , at dawn , a moment of weakness when it seemed that some pitiful power was about to defeat the relentless efforts of science . But [Wyant]165-wyant had fought off the peril . By the prompt and audacious use of stimulants -- by a rapid marshalling of resources , a display of self - reliance and authority , which [Justine]100-justine could not but admire as [she]100-justine mechanically seconded [his]165-wyant efforts -- the spark of life had been revived , and [Bessy]125-bessy won back for fresh suffering . " Yes -- [I]165-wyant say it can be done : tonight [I]165-wyant say it more than ever , "[165-wyant] [Wyant]165-wyant exclaimed , pushing the disordered hair from [his]165-wyant forehead , and leaning toward [Justine]100-justine across the table on which [their]2582-we brief evening meal had been served . " [I]165-wyant say the way the heart has rallied proves that [we]2582-we 've got more strength to draw on than any of [them]4490-them have been willing to admit . The breathing 's better too . If [we]2582-we can fight off the degenerative processes -- and , by [George]218-george , [I]165-wyant believe [we]2582-we can ! "[165-wyant] [He]165-wyant looked up suddenly at [Justine]100-justine . " With [you]100-justine to work with , [I]165-wyant believe [I]165-wyant could do anything . How [you]100-justine do back [a man]3349-a man up ! [You]100-justine think with [your]100-justine hands -- with every individual finger ! "[165-wyant] [Justine]100-justine turned [her]100-justine eyes away : [she]100-justine felt a shudder of repulsion steal over [her]100-justine tired body . It was not that [she]100-justine detected any note of personal admiration in [his]165-wyant praise -- [he]165-wyant had commended [her]100-justine as [the surgeon]2460-the surgeon might commend a fine instrument fashioned for [his]165-wyant use . But that [she]100-justine should be the instrument to serve such a purpose -- that [her]100-justine skill , [her]100-justine promptness , [her]100-justine gift of divining and interpreting the will [she]100-justine worked with , should be at the service of this implacable scientific passion ! Ah , no -- [she]100-justine could be silent no longer .... [She]100-justine looked up at [Wyant]165-wyant , and [their]2584-their eyes met . " Why do [you]165-wyant do it ? "[100-justine] [she]100-justine asked . [He]165-wyant stared , as if thinking that [she]100-justine referred to some special point in [his]165-wyant treatment . " Do what ? "[165-wyant] " It 's so useless ... [you]4492-you all know [she]100-justine must die . "[165-wyant] " [I]165-wyant know nothing of the kind ... and even [the others]620-the others are not so sure today . "[165-wyant] [He]165-wyant began to go over it all again -- repeating [his]165-wyant arguments , developing new theories , trying to force into [her]100-justine reluctant mind [his]165-wyant own faith in the possibility of success . * * * * * [Justine]100-justine sat resting [her]100-justine chin on [her]100-justine clasped hands , [her]100-justine eyes gazing straight before [her]100-justine under dark tormented brows . When [he]165-wyant paused [she]100-justine remained silent . " Well -- don't [you]100-justine believe [me]165-wyant ? "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant broke out with sudden asperity . " [I]165-wyant do n't know ... [I]165-wyant ca n't tell .... "[165-wyant] " But as long as there 's a doubt , even -- a doubt [my]165-wyant way -- and [I]165-wyant 'll show [you]100-justine there is , if [you]100-justine 'll give [me]165-wyant time---- "[165-wyant] " How much time ? "[100-justine] [she]100-justine murmured , without shifting [her]100-justine gaze . " Ah -- that depends on [ourselves]4494-ourselves : on [you]165-wyant and [me]100-justine chiefly . "[100-justine] Under the challenge of [his]2585-his tone [Justine]100-justine rose to [her]100-justine feet with a low murmur of fear . " Ah , do n't ask [me]100-justine ! "[100-justine] " Do n't ask [you----]4497-you---- ? "[100-justine] " [I]165-wyant can't -- [I]165-wyant ca n't . "[165-wyant] [Wyant]165-wyant stood up also , turning on [her]100-justine an astonished glance . " [You]165-wyant ca n't what-- ? "[165-wyant] [Their]2586-their eyes met , and [she]100-justine thought [she]100-justine read in [his]165-wyant a sudden divination of [her]100-justine inmost thoughts . The discovery electrified [her]100-justine flagging strength , restoring [her]100-justine to immediate clearness of brain . [She]100-justine saw the gulf of self - betrayal over which [she]100-justine had hung , and the nearness of the peril nerved [her]100-justine to a last effort of dissimulation . " [I]100-justine can't ... talk of it ... any longer , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine faltered , letting [her]100-justine tears flow , and turning on [him]165-wyant a face of pure womanly weakness .
