Did [he]165-wyant distrust even these plain physical evidences of exhaustion , or was [he]165-wyant merely disappointed in [her]100-justine , as in [one whom [he]165-wyant had believed to be above the emotional failings of [her]100-justine sex]2587-one whom he had believed to be above the emotional failings of her sex ? " [You]100-justine 're over - tired , "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant said coldly . " Take tonight to rest . [Miss Mace]219-miss mace can replace [you]100-justine for the next few hours -- and [I]165-wyant may need [you]100-justine more tomorrow . "[165-wyant] XXIX FOUR more days had passed . [Bessy]125-bessy seldom spoke when [Justine]100-justine was with [her]100-justine . [She]100-justine was wrapped in a thickening cloud of opiates -- morphia by day , bromides , sulphonal , chloral hydrate at night . When the cloud broke and consciousness emerged , it was centred in the one acute point of bodily anguish . Darting throes of neuralgia , agonized oppression of the breath , the diffused misery of [the whole helpless body]2588-the whole helpless body -- these were reducing [their]2589-their victim to a mere instrument on which pain played its incessant deadly variations . Once or twice [she]100-justine turned [her]100-justine dull eyes on [Justine]100-justine , breathing out : " [I]100-justine want to die , "[100-justine] as some inevitable lifting or readjusting thrilled [her]100-justine body with fresh pangs ; but there were no signs of contact with [the outer world]1539-the outer world -- [she]100-justine had ceased even to ask for [Cicely]167-cicely .... And yet , according to [the doctors]3800-the doctors , [the patient]258-the patient held [her]258-the patient own . Certain alarming symptoms had diminished , and while others persisted , the strength to fight [them]2593-them persisted too . With such strength to call on , what fresh agonies were reserved for [the poor body when the narcotics]2594-the poor body when the narcotics had lost [their]2589-their power ? That was the question always before [Justine]100-justine . [She]100-justine never again betrayed [her]100-justine fears to [Wyant]165-wyant -- [she]100-justine carried out [his]165-wyant orders with morbid precision , trembling lest any failure in efficiency should revive [his]165-wyant suspicions . [She]100-justine hardly knew what [she]100-justine feared [his]165-wyant suspecting -- [she]100-justine only had a confused sense that [they]2595-they were [enemies]2596-enemies , and that [she]100-justine was [the weaker of [the two]271-the two]2597-the weaker of the two . And then the anaesthetics began to fail . It was the sixteenth day since the accident , and the resources of alleviation were almost exhausted . It was not sure , even now , that [Bessy]125-bessy was going to die -- and [she]100-justine was certainly going to suffer a long time . [Wyant]165-wyant seemed hardly conscious of the increase of pain -- [his]165-wyant whole mind was fixed on the prognosis . What matter if [the patient]258-the patient suffered , as long as [he]165-wyant proved [his]165-wyant case ? That , of course , was not [his]165-wyant way of putting it . In reality , [he]165-wyant did all [he]165-wyant could to allay the pain , surpassed [himself]165-wyant in new devices and experiments . But death confronted [him]165-wyant implacably , claiming [his]165-wyant due : so many hours robbed from [him]165-wyant , so much tribute to pay ; and [Wyant]165-wyant , setting [his]165-wyant teeth , fought on -- and [Bessy]125-bessy paid . * * * * * [Justine]100-justine had begun to notice that it was hard for [her]100-justine to get a word alone with [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford . [The other nurses]2409-the other nurses were not in the way -- it was [Wyant]165-wyant who always contrived to be [there]3361-there . Perhaps [she]100-justine was unreasonable in seeing a special intention in [his]165-wyant presence : it was natural enough that [the two persons in charge of the case]2602-the two persons in charge of the case should confer together with [[their]2602-the two persons in charge of the case chief]2603-their chief . But [his]165-wyant persistence annoyed [her]100-justine , and [she]100-justine was glad when , one afternoon , [the surgeon]2460-the surgeon asked [him]165-wyant to telephone an important message to [town]3932-town . As soon as the door had closed , [Justine]100-justine said to [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford : " [She]100-justine is beginning to suffer terribly . "[100-justine] [He]95-dr. garford answered with the large impersonal gesture of [the man to whom physical suffering has become a painful general fact of life , no longer divisible into individual cases]2606-the man to whom physical suffering has become a painful general fact of life , no longer divisible into individual cases . " [We]2602-the two persons in charge of the case are doing all [we]2602-the two persons in charge of the case can . "[95-dr. garford] " Yes . "[100-justine] [She]100-justine paused , and then raised [her]100-justine eyes to [his]95-dr. garford dry kind face . " Is there any hope ? "[100-justine] Another gesture -- the fatalistic sweep of the lifted palms . " The next ten days will tell -- the fight is on , as [Wyant]165-wyant says . And if [any one]3517-any one can do it , [that young fellow]4479-that young fellow can . There 's stuff in [him]4479-that young fellow -- and infernal ambition . "[100-justine] " Yes : but do _ [you]100-justine _ believe [she]100-justine can live-- ? "[95-dr. garford] [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford smiled indulgently on such unprofessional insistence ; but [she]100-justine was past wondering what [they]2607-they must all think of [her]100-justine . " [[My]95-dr. garford dear]3368-my dear [Miss Brent]97-miss brent , "[95-dr. garford] [he]95-dr. garford said , " [I]95-dr. garford have reached the age when one always leaves a door open to the unexpected . "[95-dr. garford] As [he]95-dr. garford spoke , a slight sound at [her]100-justine back made [her]100-justine turn . [Wyant]165-wyant was behind [her]100-justine -- [he]165-wyant must have entered as [she]100-justine put [her]100-justine question . And [he]95-dr. garford certainly could not have had time to descend the stairs , walk the length of [the house]311-the house , ring up [New York]7-new york , and deliver [Dr Garford]220-dr garford 's message .... The same thought seemed to strike [the surgeon]2460-the surgeon . " Hello , [Wyant]165-wyant ? "[95-dr. garford] [he]95-dr. garford said . " Line busy , "[165-wyant] said [Wyant]165-wyant curtly . * * * * * About this time , [Justine]100-justine gave up [her]100-justine night vigils . [She]100-justine could no longer face the struggle of the dawn hour , when life ebbs lowest ; and since [her]100-justine duties extended beyond [the sick - room]2403-the sick - room [she]100-justine could fairly plead that [she]100-justine was more needed about [the house]311-the house by day . But [Wyant]165-wyant protested : [he]165-wyant wanted [her]100-justine most at the difficult hour . " [You]100-justine know [you]100-justine 're taking a chance from [her]100-justine , "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant said , almost sternly . " Oh , no---- "[165-wyant] [He]165-wyant looked at [her]100-justine searchingly . " [You]100-justine do n't feel up to it ? "[165-wyant] " No . "[165-wyant] [He]165-wyant turned away with a slight shrug ; but [she]100-justine knew [he]165-wyant resented [her]100-justine defection . The day watches were miserable enough . It was the nineteenth day now ; and [Justine]100-justine lay on the sofa in [[Amherst]170-bessy 's sitting - room]2612-amherst 's sitting - room , trying to nerve [herself]100-justine for [the nurse]260-the nurse 's summons . A page torn out of the calendar lay before [her]100-justine -- [she]100-justine had been calculating again how many days must elapse before [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope could arrive . Ten days -- ten days and ten nights ! And the length of the nights was double .... As for [Amherst]170-bessy , it was impossible to set a date for [his]120-mr. langhope coming , for [[his]120-mr. langhope steamer]2614-his steamer from [Buenos Ayres]65-buenos ayres called at [various ports on the way northward]2615-various ports on the way northward , and the length of [her]100-justine stay at each was dependent on the delivery of freight , and on the dilatoriness of [the South American official]2616-the south american official . [She]100-justine threw down the calendar and leaned back , pressing [her]100-justine hands to [her]100-justine temples . Oh , for a word with [Amherst]170-bessy -- [he]120-mr. langhope alone would have understood what [she]100-justine was undergoing ! [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's coming would make no difference -- or rather , it would only increase the difficulty of the situation . [Instinctively Justine]100-justine felt that , though [his]120-mr. langhope heart would be wrung by the sight of [Bessy]170-bessy 's pain , [his]120-mr. langhope cry would be the familiar one , the traditional one : _ Keep [her]170-bessy alive ! _ Under [his]120-mr. langhope surface originality , [his]120-mr. langhope verbal audacities and ironies , [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope was [the creature of accepted forms]2617-the creature of accepted forms , inherited opinions : [he]120-mr. langhope had never really thought for [himself]120-mr. langhope on any of the pressing problems of life . But [Amherst]170-bessy was different . Close contact with many forms of wretchedness had freed [him]120-mr. langhope from the bondage of accepted opinion . [He]120-mr. langhope looked at life through no eyes but [his]120-mr. langhope own ; and what [he]120-mr. langhope saw , [he]120-mr. langhope confessed to seeing . [He]120-mr. langhope never tried to evade the consequences of [his]120-mr. langhope discoveries . [Justine]100-justine 's remembrance flew back to [their]2618-their first meeting at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , when [his]120-mr. langhope confidence in [his]120-mr. langhope own powers was still unshaken , [his]120-mr. langhope trust in [others]3447-others unimpaired . And , gradually , [she]100-justine began to relive each detail of [their]2618-their talk at [Dillon]98-dillon 's bedside -- [her]100-justine first impression of [him]120-mr. langhope , as [he]120-mr. langhope walked down [the ward]270-the ward ; the first sound of [his]120-mr. langhope voice ; [her]100-justine surprised sense of [his]120-mr. langhope authority ; [her]100-justine almost involuntary submission to [his]120-mr. langhope will .... Then [her]100-justine thoughts passed on to [their]2618-their walk [home]3405-home from [the hospital]3333-the hospital -- [she]100-justine recalled [his]120-mr. langhope sober yet unsparing summary of the situation at [Westmore]104-westmore , and the note of insight with which [he]120-mr. langhope touched on the hardships of [the workers]349-the workers .... Then , word by word , [their]2618-their talk about [Dillon]98-dillon came back ... [Amherst]170-bessy 's indignation and pity ... [his]120-mr. langhope shudder of revolt at [the man]3594-the man 's doom . " _ In [your]120-mr. langhope work , do n't [you]120-mr. langhope ever feel tempted to set [a poor devil]3401-a poor devil free ? _ "[120-mr. langhope] And then , after [her]100-justine conventional murmur of protest : " _ To save what , when all the good of life is gone ? _ "[120-mr. langhope] To distract [her]100-justine thoughts [she]100-justine stretched [her]100-justine hand toward the book - case , taking out the first volume in reach -- the little copy of [Bacon]221-bacon . [She]100-justine leaned back , fluttering its pages aimlessly -- so wrapped in [her]100-justine own misery that the meaning of the words could not reach [her]100-justine . It was useless to try to read : every perception of [the outer world]1539-the outer world was lost in the hum of inner activity that made [her]100-justine mind like a forge throbbing with heat and noise . But suddenly [her]100-justine glance fell on some pencilled sentences on the fly - leaf . [They]2626-they were in [Amherst]170-bessy 's hand , and the sight arrested [her]100-justine as though [she]100-justine had heard [him]120-mr. langhope speak . _ La vraie morale se moque de la morale .... _ _ [We]2627-we perish because [we]2627-we follow [other men]2628-other men 's examples .... _ _ [Socrates]222-socrates used to call the opinions of [the many]2629-the many by the name of [Lamiae]223-lamiae -- bugbears to frighten [children]3598-children .... _ A rush of air seemed to have been let into [her]100-justine stifled mind . Were [they]2631-they [his]120-mr. langhope own thoughts ? No -- [her]100-justine memory recalled some confused association with great names . But at least they must represent [his]120-mr. langhope beliefs -- must embody deeply - felt convictions -- or [he]120-mr. langhope would scarcely have taken the trouble to record them . [She]100-justine murmured over the last sentence once or twice : _ The opinions of [the many -- bugbears]2632-the many -- bugbears to frighten [children]3598-children .... _ Yes , [she]100-justine had often heard [him]120-mr. langhope speak of current judgments in that way ... [she]100-justine had never known a mind so free from the spell of [the Lamiae]223-lamiae . * * * * * [Some one]3457-some one knocked , and [she]100-justine put aside the book and rose to [her]100-justine feet . It was [a maid]2635-a maid bringing a note from [Wyant]165-wyant . " There has been a motor accident beyond [Clifton]26-clifton , and [I]100-justine have been sent for . [I]100-justine think [I]100-justine can safely be away for two or three hours , but ring [me]100-justine up at [Clifton]26-clifton if [you]100-justine want [me]100-justine . [Miss Mace]219-miss mace has instructions , and [[Garford]95-dr. garford 's assistant]4502-garford 's assistant will be down at seven . "[100-justine] [She]100-justine looked at the clock : it was just three , the hour at which [she]100-justine was to relieve [Miss Mace]219-miss mace . [She]100-justine smoothed the hair from [her]100-justine forehead , straightened [her]100-justine cap , tied on the apron [she]100-justine had laid aside .... As [she]100-justine entered [[Bessy]170-bessy 's sitting - room]2408-bessy 's sitting - room [the nurse]260-the nurse came out , memoranda in hand . [The two]271-the two moved to the window for a moment 's conference , and as the wintry light fell on [Miss Mace]219-miss mace 's face , [Justine]100-justine saw that it was white with fatigue . " [You]170-bessy 're ill ! "[100-justine] [she]100-justine exclaimed . [The nurse]260-the nurse shook [her]260-the nurse head . " No -- but it 's awful ... this afternoon .... "[260-the nurse] [Her]100-justine glance turned to [the sick - room]2403-the sick - room . " Go and rest -- [I'll]100-justine stay till bedtime , "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine said . " [Miss Safford]224-miss safford 's down with another headache . "[100-justine] " [I]736-the other know : it does n't matter . [I]736-the other 'm quite fresh . "[736-the other] " [You]100-justine _ do _ look rested ! "[736-the other] [the other]736-the other exclaimed , [her]736-the other eyes lingering enviously on [Justine]100-justine 's face . [She]736-the other stole away , and [Justine]100-justine entered [the room]3355-the room . It was true that [she]100-justine felt fresh -- a new spring of hope had welled up in [her]100-justine . [She]100-justine had [her]100-justine nerves in hand again , [she]100-justine had regained [her]100-justine steady vision of life .... But in [the room]3355-the room , as [the nurse]260-the nurse had said , it was awful . The time had come when the effect of the anaesthetics must be carefully husbanded , when long intervals of pain must purchase the diminishing moments of relief . Yet from [Wyant]165-wyant 's standpoint it was a good day -- things were looking well , as [he]165-wyant would have phrased it . And each day now was a fresh victory . [Justine]100-justine went through [her]100-justine task mechanically . The glow of strength and courage remained , steeling [her]100-justine to bear what had broken down [Miss Mace]219-miss mace 's professional fortitude . But when [she]100-justine sat down by the bed [Bessy]170-bessy 's moaning began to wear on [her]100-justine . It was no longer the utterance of human pain , but the monotonous whimper of an animal -- the kind of sound that a compassionate hand would instinctively crush into silence . But [her]100-justine hand had other duties ; [she]100-justine must keep watch on pulse and heart , must reinforce [their]2645-their action with the tremendous stimulants which [Wyant]165-wyant was now using , and , having revived fresh sensibility to pain , must presently try to allay it by the cautious use of narcotics . It was all simple enough -- but suppose [she]100-justine should not do it ? Suppose [she]100-justine left the stimulants untouched ? [Wyant]165-wyant was absent , [one nurse exhausted with fatigue]2646-one nurse exhausted with fatigue , the other laid low by headache . [Justine]100-justine had [the field]2647-the field to [herself]100-justine . For three hours at least [no one]3425-no one was likely to cross the threshold of [the sick - room]2403-the sick - room .... Ah , if no more time were needed ! But there was too much life in [Bessy]122-bessy -- [her]100-justine youth was fighting too hard for [her]100-justine ! [She]100-justine would not sink out of life in three hours ... and [Justine]100-justine could not count on more than that . [She]100-justine looked at the little travelling - clock on the dressing - table , and saw that its hands marked four . An hour had passed already .... [She]100-justine rose and administered the prescribed restorative ; then [she]100-justine took the pulse , and listened to the beat of the heart . Strong still -- too strong ! As [she]100-justine lifted [her]100-justine head , the vague animal wailing ceased , and [she]100-justine heard [her]100-justine name : " [Justine----]157-justine---- "[100-justine] [She]100-justine bent down eagerly . " Yes ? "[100-justine] No answer : the wailing had begun again . But the one word showed [her]100-justine that the mind still lived in [[its]2650-its torture - house]2651-its torture - house , that [the poor powerless body before [her]100-justine]2652-the poor powerless body before her was not yet a mere bundle of senseless reflexes , but [[her]100-justine friend]706-her friend [Bessy Amherst]170-bessy , dying , and feeling [herself]100-justine die .... [Justine]100-justine reseated [herself]100-justine , and the vigil began again . The second hour ebbed slowly -- ah , no , it was flying now ! [Her]100-justine eyes were on the hands of the clock and [they]2654-they seemed leagued against [her]100-justine to devour the precious minutes . And now [she]100-justine could see by certain spasmodic symptoms that another crisis of pain was approaching -- one of the struggles that [Wyant]165-wyant , at times , had almost seemed to court and exult in . [Bessy]170-bessy 's eyes turned on [her]100-justine again . " _ [Justine_----]225-justine_---- "[170-bessy] [She]100-justine knew what that meant : it was an appeal for the hypodermic needle . The little instrument lay at hand , beside a newly - filled bottle of morphia . But [she]100-justine must wait -- must let the pain grow more severe . Yet [she]100-justine could not turn [her]100-justine gaze from [Bessy]170-bessy , and [Bessy]170-bessy 's eyes entreated [her]100-justine again--_Justine _ ! There was really no word now -- the whimperings were uninterrupted . But [Justine]100-justine heard an inner voice , and its pleading shook [her]100-justine heart . [She]100-justine rose and filled the syringe -- and returning with it , bent above the bed .... * * * * * [She]100-justine lifted [her]100-justine head and looked at the clock . The second hour had passed . As [she]100-justine looked , [she]100-justine heard a step in [the sitting - room]415-the sitting - room . Who could it be ? Not [[Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford 's assistant]2656-dr. garford 's assistant -- [he]95-dr. garford was not due till seven . [She]100-justine listened again .... [One of [the nurses]2467-the nurses]2560-one of the nurses ? No , not [a woman]3817-a woman 's step---- The door opened , and [Wyant]165-wyant came in . [Justine]100-justine stood by the bed without moving toward [him]165-wyant . [He]165-wyant paused also , as if surprised to see [her]100-justine there motionless . In the intense silence [she]100-justine fancied for a moment that [she]100-justine heard [Bessy]170-bessy 's violent agonized breathing . [She]100-justine tried to speak , to drown the sound of the breathing ; but [her]100-justine lips trembled too much , and [she]100-justine remained silent . [Wyant]165-wyant seemed to hear nothing . [He]165-wyant stood so still that [she]100-justine felt [she]100-justine must move forward . As [she]100-justine did so , [she]100-justine picked up from the table by the bed the memoranda that it was [her]100-justine duty to submit to [him]165-wyant . " Well ? "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant said , in the familiar sick - room whisper . " [She]100-justine is dead . "[165-wyant] [He]165-wyant fell back a step , glaring at [her]100-justine , white and incredulous . " _ Dead?_--When---- ? "[165-wyant] " A few minutes ago .... "[165-wyant] " _ Dead-- ? _ It 's not possible ! "[165-wyant] [He]165-wyant swept past [her]100-justine , shouldering [her]100-justine aside , pushing in an electric button as [he]165-wyant sprang to the bed . [She]100-justine perceived then that [the room]3355-the room had been almost in darkness . [She]100-justine recovered command of [herself]100-justine , and followed [him]165-wyant . [He]165-wyant was going through the usual rapid examination -- pulse , heart , breath -- hanging over the bed like some angry animal balked of its prey . Then [he]165-wyant lifted the lids and bent close above the eyes . " Take the shade off that lamp ! "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant commanded . [Justine]100-justine obeyed [him]165-wyant . [He]165-wyant stooped down again to examine the eyes ... [he]165-wyant remained stooping a long time . Suddenly [he]165-wyant stood up and faced [her]100-justine . " Had [she]100-justine been in great pain ? "[165-wyant] " Yes . "[165-wyant] " Worse than usual ? "[165-wyant] " Yes . "[165-wyant] " What had [you]165-wyant done ? "[165-wyant] " Nothing -- there was no time . "[165-wyant] " No time ? "[165-wyant] [He]165-wyant broke off to sweep [the room]3355-the room again with [his]165-wyant excited incredulous glance . " Where are [the others]620-the others ? Why were [you]100-justine here alone ? "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant demanded . " It came suddenly . [I]165-wyant was going to call---- "[165-wyant] [Their]2662-their eyes met for a moment . [Her]100-justine face was perfectly calm -- [she]100-justine could feel that [her]100-justine lips no longer trembled . [She]100-justine was not in the least afraid of [Wyant]165-wyant 's scrutiny . As [he]165-wyant continued to look at [her]100-justine , [his]165-wyant expression slowly passed from incredulous wrath to something softer -- more human -- [she]100-justine could not tell what .... " This has been too much for [you]100-justine -- go and send [one of [the others]620-the others]4504-one of the others .... It 's all over , "[165-wyant] [he]165-wyant said . BOOK IV XXX ON a September day , somewhat more than a year and a half after [Bessy Amherst]170-bessy 's death , [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband and [[his]3393-her husband mother]396-his mother sat at luncheon in [the dining - room of [the Westmore house at [Hanaford]1-hanaford]2666-the westmore house at hanaford]2665-the dining - room of the westmore house at hanaford . [The house]311-the house was [[John Amherst]99-amherst 's]2668-john amherst 's now , and shortly after the loss of [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife [he]3393-her husband had established [himself]3393-her husband [there]3361-there with [[his]3393-her husband mother]396-his mother . By a will made some six months before [her]170-bessy death , [Bessy]170-bessy had divided [her]170-bessy estate between [[her]170-bessy husband]3393-her husband and [daughter]2673-daughter , placing [Cicely]167-cicely 's share in trust , and appointing [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope and [Amherst]170-bessy as [[her]170-bessy guardians]2674-her guardians . As [the latter]673-the latter was also [[her]170-bessy trustee]2676-her trustee , the whole management of [the estate]2677-the estate devolved on [him]3393-her husband , while [his]3393-her husband control of [the Westmore mills]3336-the westmore mills was ensured by [his]3393-her husband receiving a slightly larger proportion of the stock than [[his]3393-her husband step - daughter]1946-his step - daughter . The will had come as a surprise , not only to [Amherst]170-bessy [himself]170-bessy , but to [[[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife 's family]2681-his wife 's family , and more especially to [[her]170-bessy legal adviser]2682-her legal adviser . [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy had in fact had nothing to do with the drawing of the instrument ; but as it had been drawn in due form , and by a firm of excellent standing , [he]125-bessy was obliged , in spite of [his]125-bessy private views , and [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's open adjurations that [he]125-bessy should " do something , "[125-bessy] to declare that there was no pretext for questioning the validity of the document . To [Amherst]170-bessy the will was something more than a proof of [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife 's confidence : it came as a reconciling word from [her]170-bessy grave . For the date showed that it had been made at a moment when [he]3393-her husband supposed [himself]3393-her husband to have lost all influence over [her]170-bessy -- on the morrow of the day when [she]170-bessy had stipulated that [he]3393-her husband should give up the management of [the Westmore mills]3336-the westmore mills , and yield the care of [[her]170-bessy property]2685-her property to [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy . While [she]170-bessy smote [him]3393-her husband with one hand , [she]170-bessy sued for pardon with the other ; and the contradiction was so characteristic , it explained and excused in so touching a way the inconsistencies of [her]170-bessy impulsive heart and hesitating mind , that [he]3393-her husband was filled with that tender compunction , that searching sense of [his]3393-her husband own shortcomings , which generous natures feel when [they]2686-they find [they]2686-they have underrated the generosity of [others]3447-others . But [Amherst]170-bessy 's was not an introspective mind , and [his]3393-her husband sound moral sense told [him]3393-her husband , when the first pang of self - reproach had subsided , that [he]3393-her husband had done [his]3393-her husband best by [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife , and was in no way to blame if [her]170-bessy recognition of the fact had come too late . The self - reproach subsided ; and , instead of the bitterness of the past , it left a softened memory which made [him]3393-her husband take up [his]3393-her husband task with the sense that [he]3393-her husband was now working with [Bessy]170-bessy and not against [her]170-bessy . Yet perhaps , after all , it was chiefly the work itself which had healed old wounds , and quelled the tendency to vain regrets . [Amherst]170-bessy was only thirty - four ; and in the prime of [his]3393-her husband energies the task [he]3393-her husband was made for had been given back to [him]3393-her husband . To a sound nature , which finds its outlet in fruitful action , nothing so simplifies the complexities of life , so tends to a large acceptance of its vicissitudes and mysteries , as the sense of doing something each day toward clearing [one 's own bit of [the wilderness]1106-the wilderness]2689-one 's own bit of the wilderness . And this was the joy at last conceded to [Amherst]170-bessy . [The mills]3324-the mills were virtually [his]3393-her husband ; and the fact that [he]3393-her husband ruled [them]3324-the mills not only in [his]3393-her husband own right but as [[Cicely]167-cicely 's representative]2692-cicely 's representative , made [him]3393-her husband doubly eager to justify [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife 's trust in [him]3393-her husband . [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst , looking up from a telegram which [the parlour - maid]2694-the parlour - maid had handed [her]117-mrs. amherst , smiled across the table at [[her]117-mrs. amherst son]393-her son . " From [Maria Ansell]123-maria -- [they]3324-the mills are all coming tomorrow . "[117-mrs. amherst] " Ah -- that 's good , "[117-mrs. amherst] [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst rejoined . " [I]117-mrs. amherst should have been sorry if [Cicely]167-cicely had not been [here]3415-here . "[117-mrs. amherst] " [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope is coming too , "[396-his mother] [[his]393-her son mother]396-his mother continued . " [I]396-his mother 'm glad of that , [John]99-amherst . "[396-his mother] " Yes , "[99-amherst] [Amherst]99-amherst again assented . The morrow was to be a great day at [Westmore]104-westmore . [The Emergency Hospital]1319-the emergency hospital , planned in the first months of [his]3393-her husband marriage , and abandoned in the general reduction of expenditure at [the mills]3324-the mills , had now been completed on a larger and more elaborate scale , as a memorial to [Bessy]170-bessy . The strict retrenchment of all personal expenses , and the leasing of [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook and [the town house]1874-the town house , had enabled [Amherst]170-bessy , in eighteen months , to lay by enough income to carry out this plan , which [he]99-amherst was impatient to see executed as a visible commemoration of [[his]99-amherst wife]3350-his wife 's generosity to [Westmore]104-westmore . For [Amherst]170-bessy persisted in regarding the gift of [her]3350-his wife fortune as a gift not to [himself]170-bessy but to [the mills]3324-the mills : [he]99-amherst looked on [himself]170-bessy merely as the agent of [her]3350-his wife beneficent intentions . [He]99-amherst was anxious that [Westmore]167-cicely and [Hanaford]164-hanaford should take the same view ; and the opening of [the Westmore Memorial Hospital]2702-the westmore memorial hospital was therefore to be performed with an unwonted degree of ceremony . " [I]117-mrs. amherst am glad [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope is coming , "[117-mrs. amherst] [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst repeated , as [they]2703-they rose from the table . " It shows , [dear]3468-dear -- doesn't it?--that [he]120-mr. langhope 's really gratified -- that [he]120-mr. langhope appreciates [your]117-mrs. amherst motive .... "[117-mrs. amherst] [She]117-mrs. amherst raised a proud glance to [[her]117-mrs. amherst tall son]2704-her tall son , whose head seemed to tower higher than ever above [her]117-mrs. amherst small proportions . Renewed self - confidence , and the habit of command , had in fact restored the erectness to [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst 's shoulders and the clearness to [his]99-amherst eyes . The cleft between the brows was gone , and [his]99-amherst veiled inward gaze had given place to a glance almost as outward - looking and unspeculative as [[his]99-amherst mother]396-his mother 's . " It shows -- well , yes -- what [you]117-mrs. amherst say ! "[99-amherst] [he]99-amherst rejoined with a slight laugh , and a tap on [her]117-mrs. amherst shoulder as [she]117-mrs. amherst passed . [He]99-amherst was under no illusions as to [[his]99-amherst father - in - law]2004-his father - in - law 's attitude : [he]99-amherst knew that [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope would willingly have broken the will which deprived [[his]120-mr. langhope grand - daughter]2707-his grand - daughter of half [her]2707-his grand - daughter inheritance , and that [his]120-mr. langhope subsequent show of friendliness was merely a concession to expediency . But in [his]99-amherst present mood [Amherst]117-mrs. amherst almost believed that time and closer relations might turn such sentiments into honest liking . [He]99-amherst was very fond of [[his]99-amherst little step - daughter]2708-his little step - daughter , and deeply sensible of [his]99-amherst obligations toward [her]2708-his little step - daughter ; and [he]99-amherst hoped that , as [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope came to recognize this , it might bring about a better understanding between [them]2709-them . " Oh , [I]117-mrs. amherst do n't know . [They]2718-they were never very fond of [this house]4516-this house . "[117-mrs. amherst] There was an added note of authority in [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's accent . In the last few months [she]118-mrs. dressel had been to [Europe]17-europe and had had nervous prostration , and these incontestable evidences of growing prosperity could not always be kept out of [her]118-mrs. dressel voice and bearing . At any rate , [they]2718-they justified [her]118-mrs. dressel in thinking that [her]118-mrs. dressel opinion on almost any subject within the range of human experience was a valuable addition to the sum - total of wisdom ; and unabashed by the silence with which [her]118-mrs. dressel comment was received , [she]118-mrs. dressel continued [her]118-mrs. dressel critical survey of [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room . " [Dear Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst -- [you]117-mrs. amherst know [I]118-mrs. dressel ca n't help saying what [I]118-mrs. dressel think -- and [I]118-mrs. dressel 've so often wondered why [you]117-mrs. amherst do n't do [this room]2503-this room over . "[118-mrs. dressel] * * * * * That afternoon , as [Amherst]96-amherst walked out toward [Westmore]104-westmore for a survey of the final preparations , [he]96-amherst found that , among the pleasant thoughts accompanying [him]96-amherst , one of the pleasantest was the anticipation of seeing [Justine Brent]100-justine . Among [the little group who were to surround [him]96-amherst on the morrow]2728-the little group who were to surround him on the morrow , [she]100-justine was the only one discerning enough to understand what the day meant to [him]96-amherst , or with sufficient knowledge to judge of the use [he]96-amherst had made of [his]96-amherst great opportunity . Even now that the opportunity had come , and all obstacles were levelled , sympathy with [his]96-amherst work was as much lacking as ever ; and only [Duplain]138-duplain , at length reinstated as [manager]2258-manager , really understood and shared in [his]96-amherst aims . But [Justine Brent]100-justine 's sympathy was of a different kind from [the manager]3346-the manager 's . If less logical , it was warmer , more penetrating -- like some fine imponderable fluid , so subtle that it could always find a way through the clumsy processes of human intercourse . [Amherst]96-amherst had thought very often of this quality in [her]100-justine during the weeks which followed [his]96-amherst abrupt departure for [Georgia]57-georgia ; and in trying to define it [he]96-amherst had said to [himself]96-amherst that [she]100-justine felt with [her]100-justine brain . And now , aside from the instinctive understanding between [them]2731-them , [she]100-justine was set apart in [his]96-amherst thoughts by [her]100-justine association with [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife 's last days . On [his]96-amherst arrival from [the south]4404-the south [he]96-amherst had gathered on all sides evidences of [her]100-justine tender devotion to [Bessy]170-bessy : even [Mr. Tredegar]125-bessy 's chary praise swelled the general commendation . From [the surgeons]2402-the surgeons [he]96-amherst heard how [her]100-justine unwearied skill had helped [them]2402-the surgeons in [their]2402-the surgeons fruitless efforts ; [poor Cicely]167-cicely , awed by [her]167-cicely loss , clung to [[[her]167-cicely mother]1105-her mother 's friend]2736-her mother 's friend with childish tenacity ; and [the young rector of [Saint Anne 's]67-saint anne 's]2737-the young rector of saint anne 's , shyly acquitting [himself]2737-the young rector of saint anne 's of [his]2737-the young rector of saint anne 's visit of condolence , dwelt chiefly on the consolatory thought of [Miss Brent]97-miss brent 's presence at the death - bed . The knowledge that [Justine]100-justine had been with [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife till the end had , in fact , done more than anything else to soften [Amherst]96-amherst 's regrets ; and [he]96-amherst had tried to express something of this in the course of [his]96-amherst first talk with [her]100-justine . [Justine]100-justine had given [him]96-amherst a clear and self - possessed report of the dreadful weeks at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ; but at [his]96-amherst first allusion to [her]100-justine own part in [them]2739-them , [she]100-justine shrank into a state of distress which seemed to plead with [him]96-amherst to refrain from even the tenderest touch on [her]100-justine feelings . It was a peculiarity of [their]2740-their friendship that silence and absence had always mysteriously fostered its growth ; and [he]96-amherst now felt that [her]100-justine reticence deepened the understanding between [them]2740-their as the freest confidences might not have done . Soon afterward , an opportune attack of nervous prostration had sent [Mrs. Harry Dressel]118-mrs. dressel abroad ; and [Justine]100-justine was selected as [[her]100-justine companion]296-her companion . [They]2740-their remained in [Europe]17-europe for six months ; and on [their]2740-their return [Amherst]96-amherst learned with pleasure that [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope had asked [Miss Brent]97-miss brent to take charge of [Cicely]167-cicely . [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's sorrow for [[his]120-mr. langhope daughter]514-his daughter had been aggravated by futile wrath at [her]100-justine unaccountable will ; and the mixed sentiment thus engendered had found expression in a jealous outpouring of affection toward [Cicely]167-cicely . [He]120-mr. langhope took immediate possession of [the child]3698-the child , and in the first stages of [his]120-mr. langhope affliction [her]100-justine companionship had been really consoling . But as time passed , and the pleasant habits of years reasserted themselves , [her]100-justine presence became , in small unacknowledged ways , a source of domestic irritation . Nursery hours disturbed the easy routine of [[his]120-mr. langhope household]2744-his household ; [the elderly parlour - maid who had long ruled it]2745-the elderly parlour - maid who had long ruled it resented the intervention of [[Cicely]167-cicely 's nurse]2746-cicely 's nurse ; [the little governess , involved in the dispute]2747-the little governess , involved in the dispute , broke down and had to be shipped [home]3405-home to [Germany]76-germany ; [a successor]2749-a successor was hard to find , and in the interval [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's privacy was invaded by a stream of [visiting teachers]2750-visiting teachers , who were always wanting to consult [him]120-mr. langhope about [Cicely]167-cicely 's lessons , and lay before [him]120-mr. langhope [their]2750-visiting teachers tiresome complaints and perplexities . [Poor Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope found [himself]120-mr. langhope in the position of [the mourner who , in the first fervour of bereavement]2751-the mourner who , in the first fervour of bereavement , has undertaken the construction of [an imposing monument]2752-an imposing monument without having counted the cost . [He]120-mr. langhope had meant that [his]120-mr. langhope devotion to [Cicely]167-cicely should be a monument to [his]120-mr. langhope paternal grief ; but the foundations were scarcely laid when [he]120-mr. langhope found that the funds of time and patience were almost exhausted . [Pride]226-pride forbade [his]120-mr. langhope consigning [Cicely]167-cicely to [[her]167-cicely step - father]1905-her step - father , though [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst would gladly have undertaken [her]117-mrs. amherst care ; [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's migratory habits made it impossible for [her]178-mrs. ansell to do more than intermittently hover and advise ; and a new hope rose before [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope when it occurred to [him]120-mr. langhope to appeal to [Miss Brent]97-miss brent . The experiment had proved a success , and when [Amherst]96-amherst met [Justine]100-justine again [she]100-justine had been for some months in charge of [the little girl]1723-the little girl , and change and congenial occupation had restored [her]100-justine to a normal view of life . There was no trace in [her]100-justine now of the dumb misery which had haunted [him]96-amherst at [their]2755-their parting ; [she]100-justine was again the vivid creature who seemed more charged with life than [any one [he]96-amherst had ever known]2756-any one he had ever known . The crisis through which [she]100-justine had passed showed itself only in a smoothing of the brow and deepening of the eyes , as though a bloom of experience had veiled without deadening the first brilliancy of youth . As [he]96-amherst lingered on the image thus evoked , [he]96-amherst recalled [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's words : " [Justine]100-justine is twenty - seven -- [she]100-justine 's not likely to marry now . "[118-mrs. dressel] Oddly enough , [he]96-amherst had never thought of [her]100-justine marrying -- but now that [he]96-amherst heard the possibility questioned , [he]96-amherst felt a disagreeable conviction of its inevitableness . [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's view was of course absurd . In spite of [Justine]100-justine 's feminine graces , [he]96-amherst had formerly felt in [her]100-justine a kind of elfin immaturity , as of [a flitting Ariel with untouched heart and senses]2757-a flitting ariel with untouched heart and senses : it was only of late that [she]100-justine had developed the subtle quality which calls up thoughts of love . Not marry ? Why , the vagrant fire had just lighted on [her]100-justine -- and the fact that [she]100-justine was poor and unattached , with [her]100-justine own way to make , and no setting of pleasure and elegance to embellish [her]100-justine -- these disadvantages seemed as nothing to [Amherst]96-amherst against the warmth of personality in which [she]100-justine moved . And besides , [she]100-justine would never be drawn to [the kind of man who needed fine clothes and luxury to point [him]96-amherst to the charm of sex]2758-the kind of man who needed fine clothes and luxury to point him to the charm of sex . [She]100-justine was always finished and graceful in appearance , with [the pretty woman]1848-the pretty woman 's art of wearing [her]100-justine few plain dresses as if they were many and varied ; yet [no one]3425-no one could think of [her]100-justine as attaching much importance to the upholstery of life .... No , [the man who won [her]100-justine]2761-the man who won her would be of a different type , have other inducements to offer ... and [Amherst]96-amherst found [himself]96-amherst wondering just what those inducements would be . Suddenly [he]96-amherst remembered something [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother had said as [he]96-amherst left [the house]311-the house -- something about [a distinguished - looking young man who had called to ask for [Miss Brent]97-miss brent]2764-a distinguished - looking young man who had called to ask for miss brent . [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst , innocently inquisitive in small matters , had followed [[her]117-mrs. amherst son]393-her son into [the hall]505-the hall to ask [the parlour - maid]2694-the parlour - maid if [the gentleman]4359-the gentleman had left [his]4359-the gentleman name ; and [the parlour - maid]2694-the parlour - maid had answered in the negative . [The young man]426-the young man was evidently not indigenous : [all the social units of [Hanaford]1-hanaford]2771-all the social units of hanaford were intimately known to [each other]407-each other . [He]426-the young man was [a stranger]1209-a stranger , therefore , presumably drawn there by the hope of seeing [Miss Brent]97-miss brent . But if [he]426-the young man knew that [she]97-miss brent was coming [he]426-the young man must be intimately acquainted with [her]97-miss brent movements .... The thought came to [Amherst]96-amherst as an unpleasant surprise . It showed [him]96-amherst for the first time how little [he]96-amherst knew of [Justine]100-justine 's personal life , of the ties [she]100-justine might have formed outside the [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook circle . After all , [he]96-amherst had seen [her]100-justine chiefly not among [[her]100-justine own friends]2774-her own friends but among [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife 's . Was it reasonable to suppose that a creature of [her]100-justine keen individuality would be content to subsist on the fringe of other existences ? Somewhere , of course , [she]100-justine must have a centre of [her]100-justine own , must be subject to influences of which [he]96-amherst was wholly ignorant . And since [her]100-justine departure from [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook [he]96-amherst had known even less of [her]100-justine life . [She]100-justine had spent the previous winter with [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope in [New York]7-new york , where [Amherst]96-amherst had seen [her]100-justine only on [his]96-amherst rare visits to [Cicely]130-cicely ; and [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , on going abroad for the summer , had established [[his]120-mr. langhope grand - daughter]2707-his grand - daughter in [a Bar Harbour cottage]2777-a bar harbour cottage , where , save for two flying visits from [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , [Miss Brent]97-miss brent had reigned alone till [his]96-amherst return in September . Very likely , [Amherst]96-amherst reflected , [the mysterious visitor]2778-the mysterious visitor was [a Bar Harbour acquaintance]2779-a bar harbour acquaintance -- no , more than [an acquaintance]2780-an acquaintance : [a friend]4121-a friend . And as [[Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's party]2782-mr. langhope 's party had left [Mount Desert]78-mount desert but three days previously , the arrival of the unknown at [Hanaford]1-hanaford showed a singular impatience to rejoin [Miss Brent]97-miss brent . As [he]96-amherst reached this point in [his]96-amherst meditations , [Amherst]96-amherst found [himself]96-amherst at the street - corner where it was [his]96-amherst habit to pick up [the Westmore trolley]2783-the westmore trolley . Just as it bore down on [him]96-amherst , and [he]96-amherst sprang to [the platform]2784-the platform , [another car]2785-another car , coming in from [the mills]3324-the mills , stopped to discharge [[its]2785-another car passengers]2787-its passengers . Among [them]2787-its passengers [Amherst]96-amherst noticed [a slender undersized man in shabby clothes]2788-a slender undersized man in shabby clothes , about whose retreating back , as [he]96-amherst crossed [the street]3968-the street to signal [a Station Avenue car]2790-a station avenue car , there was something dimly familiar , and suggestive of troubled memories . [Amherst]96-amherst leaned out and looked again : yes , the back was certainly like [Dr. Wyant's]227-dr. wyant's -- but what could [Wyant]165-wyant be doing at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , and in [a Westmore car]2791-a westmore car ? [Amherst]96-amherst 's first impulse was to spring out and overtake [him]165-wyant . [He]96-amherst knew how admirably [the young physician]2565-the young physician had borne [himself]96-amherst at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ; [he]96-amherst even recalled [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford 's saying , with [his]95-dr. garford kindly sceptical smile : " [Poor Wyant]228-wyant believed to the end that [we]4526-we could save [her"--and]4527-her"--and[95-dr. garford] felt again [his]96-amherst own inward movement of thankfulness that the cruel miracle had not been worked . [He]96-amherst owed a great deal to [Wyant]228-wyant , and had tried to express [his]96-amherst sense of the fact by warm words and a liberal fee ; but since [Bessy]170-bessy 's death [he]96-amherst had never returned to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , and had consequently lost sight of [the young doctor]2559-the young doctor . Now [he]96-amherst felt that [he]96-amherst ought to try to rejoin [him]2559-the young doctor , to find out why [he]2559-the young doctor was at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , and make some proffer of hospitality ; but if [the stranger]2794-the stranger were really [Wyant]228-wyant , [his]96-amherst choice of [the Station Avenue car]2795-the station avenue car made it appear that [he]96-amherst was on [his]96-amherst way to catch [the New York express]2796-the new york express ; and in any case [Amherst]96-amherst 's engagements at [Westmore]104-westmore made immediate pursuit impossible . [He]96-amherst consoled [himself]96-amherst with the thought that if [the physician]422-the physician was not leaving [Hanaford]1-hanaford [he]96-amherst would be certain to call at [the house]311-the house ; and then [his]96-amherst mind flew back to [Justine Brent]100-justine . But the pleasure of looking forward to [her]100-justine arrival was disturbed by new feelings . A sense of reserve and embarrassment had sprung up in [his]96-amherst mind , checking that free mental communion which , as [he]96-amherst now perceived , had been one of the unconscious promoters of [their]2799-their friendship . It was as though [his]96-amherst thoughts faced [a stranger]1209-a stranger instead of the familiar presence which had so long dwelt in [them]2801-them ; and [he]96-amherst began to see that the feeling of intelligence existing between [Justine]100-justine and [himself]96-amherst was not the result of actual intimacy , but merely of the charm [she]100-justine knew how to throw over casual intercourse . When [he]96-amherst had left [[his]96-amherst house]694-his house , [his]96-amherst mind was like a summer sky , all open blue and sunlit rolling clouds ; but gradually the clouds had darkened and massed themselves , till they drew an impenetrable veil over the upper light and stretched threateningly across [his]96-amherst whole horizon . XXXI THE celebrations at [Westmore]104-westmore were over . [Hanaford society , mustering for the event]2803-hanaford society , mustering for the event , had streamed through [the hospital]3333-the hospital , inspected [the clinic]2805-the clinic , complimented [Amherst]96-amherst , recalled [itself]2803-hanaford society , mustering for the event to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope and [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , and streamed out again to regain [its carriages]2806-its carriages and motors . [The chief actors in the ceremony]2807-the chief actors in the ceremony were also taking leave . [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , somewhat pale and nervous after the ordeal , had been helped into [the Gaines]110-mr. gaines landau with [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell and [Cicely]167-cicely ; [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst had accepted a seat in [the Dressel victoria]2808-the dressel victoria ; and [Westy Gaines]113-westy , with an _ empressement _ slightly tinged by condescension , was in the act of placing [his]113-westy electric phaeton at [Miss Brent]97-miss brent 's disposal . [She]97-miss brent stood in [the pretty white porch of [the hospital]3333-the hospital]2809-the pretty white porch of the hospital , looking out across [its]3333-the hospital squares of flower - edged turf at [the long street of [Westmore]104-westmore]2811-the long street of westmore . In the warm gold - powdered light of [September]79-september [the factory town]2812-the factory town still seemed a blot on the face of nature ; yet here and there , on all sides , [Justine]100-justine 's eye saw signs of humanizing change . The rough banks along [the street]3968-the street had been levelled and sodded ; young maples , set in rows , already made a long festoon of gold against the dingy house - fronts ; and [the houses]335-the houses [themselves]335-the houses -- once so irreclaimably outlawed and degraded -- showed , in [their]335-the houses white - curtained windows , [[their]335-the houses flowery white - railed yards]2815-their flowery white - railed yards , a growing approach to [civilized human dwellings]2816-civilized human dwellings . Glancing the other way , one still met the grim pile of [factories]4421-factories cutting the sky with [their]335-the houses harsh roof - lines and blackened chimneys ; but here also were signs of improvement . [One of [the mills]3324-the mills]2818-one of the mills had already been enlarged , another was scaffolded for the same purpose , and young trees and neatly - fenced turf replaced [the surrounding desert of trampled earth]2820-the surrounding desert of trampled earth . As [Amherst]96-amherst came out of [the hospital]3333-the hospital , [he]96-amherst heard [Miss Brent]97-miss brent declining a seat in [[Westy]113-westy 's phaeton]2822-westy 's phaeton . " Thank [you]96-amherst so much ; but there 's some one here [I]97-miss brent want to see first -- one of [the operatives]3426-the operatives -- and [I]97-miss brent can easily take [a Hanaford car]4529-a hanaford car . "[97-miss brent] [She]97-miss brent held out [her]97-miss brent hand with the smile that ran like colour over [her]97-miss brent whole face ; and [Westy]113-westy , nettled by this unaccountable disregard of [her]97-miss brent privileges , mounted [his]113-westy chariot alone . As [he]113-westy glided mournfully away , [Amherst]96-amherst turned to [Justine]100-justine . " [You]100-justine wanted to see [the Dillons]142-the dillons ? "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst asked . [Their]2823-they eyes met , and [she]100-justine smiled again . [He]96-amherst had never seen [her]100-justine so sunned - over , so luminous , since the distant November day when [they]2823-they had picnicked with [Cicely]167-cicely beside [the swamp]1914-the swamp . [He]96-amherst wondered vaguely if [she]100-justine were more elaborately dressed than usual , or if the festal impression [she]100-justine produced were simply a reflection of [her]100-justine mood . " [I]100-justine do want to see [the Dillons]142-the dillons -- how did [you]96-amherst guess ? "[100-justine] [she]100-justine rejoined ; and [Amherst]96-amherst felt a sudden impulse to reply : " For the same reason that made [you]100-justine think of [them]142-the dillons . "[100-justine] The fact of [her]100-justine remembering [the Dillons]142-the dillons made [him]96-amherst absurdly happy ; it re - established between [them]2823-they the mental communion that had been checked by [his]96-amherst thoughts of the previous day . " [I]96-amherst suppose [I]96-amherst 'm rather self - conscious about [the Dillons]142-the dillons , because they 're one of [my]96-amherst object lessons -- [they]142-the dillons illustrate the text , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said laughing , as [they]2823-they went down the steps . [Westmore]167-cicely had been given a half - holiday for the opening of [the hospital]3333-the hospital , and as [Amherst]96-amherst and [Justine]100-justine turned into [the street]3968-the street , [parties of [workers]652-workers]2827-parties of workers were dispersing toward [[their]2827-parties of workers houses]3659-their houses . [They]2827-parties of workers were still [a dull - eyed stunted throng , to whom air and movement seemed to have been too long denied]2830-a dull - eyed stunted throng , to whom air and movement seemed to have been too long denied ; but there was more animation in [the groups]2831-the groups , more light in individual faces ; [many of [the younger men]2833-the younger men]2832-many of the younger men returned [Amherst]96-amherst 's good - day with a look of friendliness , and [the women to whom [he]96-amherst spoke]2834-the women to whom he spoke met [him]96-amherst with a volubility that showed the habit of frequent intercourse . " How much [you]96-amherst have done ! "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine exclaimed , as [he]96-amherst rejoined [her]100-justine after one of these asides ; but the next moment [he]96-amherst saw a shade of embarrassment cross [her]100-justine face , as though [she]100-justine feared to have suggested comparisons [she]100-justine had meant to avoid . [He]96-amherst answered quite naturally : " Yes -- [I'm]96-amherst beginning to see [my]96-amherst way now ; and it 's wonderful how [they]142-the dillons respond-- "[96-amherst] and [they]2835-they walked on without a shadow of constraint between [them]2835-they , while [he]96-amherst described to [her]100-justine what was already done , and what direction [his]96-amherst projected experiments were taking . [The Dillons]142-the dillons had been placed in charge of [one of [the old factory tenements]2837-the old factory tenements]2836-one of the old factory tenements , now transformed into [a lodging - house for]2838-a lodging - house for [unmarried operatives]2839-unmarried operatives . [Even]2840-even [its]2836-one of the old factory tenements harsh brick exterior , hung with creepers and brightened by flower - borders , had taken on a friendly air ; and indoors [it]2836-one of the old factory tenements had [a clean sunny kitchen]2841-a clean sunny kitchen , [a big dining - room with cheerful - coloured walls]2842-a big dining - room with cheerful - coloured walls , and [a room where [the men]474-the men could lounge and smoke about a table covered with papers]2843-a room where the men could lounge and smoke about a table covered with papers . The creation of [these model lodging - houses]2845-these model lodging - houses had always been a favourite scheme of [Amherst]96-amherst 's , and [the Dillons]142-the dillons , incapacitated for [factory]2846-factory work , had shown [themselves]142-the dillons admirably adapted to [their]142-the dillons new duties . In [[Mrs. Dillon]98-dillon 's small hot sitting - room]2847-mrs. dillon 's small hot sitting - room , among the starched sofa - tidies and pink shells that testified to the family prosperity , [Justine]100-justine shone with enjoyment and sympathy . [She]100-justine had always taken an interest in the lives and thoughts of [working - people]2848-working - people : not so much the constructive interest of the sociological mind as the vivid imaginative concern of a heart open to every human appeal . [She]100-justine liked to hear about [their]142-the dillons hard struggles and small pathetic successes : [the children]3618-the children 's sicknesses , [the father]2850-the father 's lucky job , the little sum [they]142-the dillons had been able to put by , the plans [they]142-the dillons had formed for [Tommy]229-tommy 's advancement , and how [Sue]230-sue 's good marks at [school]2851-school were still ahead of [[Mrs. Hagan]231-mrs. hagan 's [Mary]232-mary 's]2852-mrs. hagan 's mary 's . " What [I]100-justine really like is to gossip with [them]142-the dillons , and give [them]142-the dillons advice about [the baby]3523-the baby 's cough , and the cheapest way to do [their]142-the dillons marketing , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said laughing , as [she]100-justine and [Amherst]96-amherst emerged once more into [the street]3968-the street . " It 's the same kind of interest [I]100-justine used to feel in [my]100-justine dolls and guinea pigs -- [a managing , interfering old maid]4531-a managing , interfering old maid 's interest . [I]100-justine do n't believe [I]100-justine should care a straw for [them]142-the dillons if [I]100-justine could n't dose [them]142-the dillons and order [them]142-the dillons about . "[100-justine] [Amherst]96-amherst laughed too : [he]96-amherst recalled the time when [he]96-amherst had dreamed that just such warm personal sympathy was [her]100-justine sex 's destined contribution to the broad work of human beneficence . Well , it had not been a dream : here was [a woman whose deeds spoke for [her]100-justine]2854-a woman whose deeds spoke for her . And suddenly the thought came to [him]96-amherst : what might [they]2855-they not do at [Westmore]104-westmore together ! The brightness of it was blinding -- like the dazzle of sunlight which faced [them]2855-they as [they]2855-they walked toward [the mills]3324-the mills . But it left [him]96-amherst speechless , confused -- glad to have a pretext for routing [Duplain]138-duplain out of [the office]3467-the office , introducing [him]96-amherst to [Miss Brent]97-miss brent , and asking [him]96-amherst for the keys of [the buildings]618-the buildings .... It was wonderful , again , how [she]100-justine grasped what [he]96-amherst was doing in [the mills]3324-the mills , and saw how [his]96-amherst whole scheme hung together , harmonizing the work and leisure of [the operatives]3426-the operatives , instead of treating [them]3426-the operatives as half machine , [half man]2861-half man , and neglecting [the man]3594-the man for the machine . Nor was [she]100-justine content with Utopian generalities : [she]100-justine wanted to know the how and why of each case , to hear what conclusions [he]96-amherst drew from [his]96-amherst results , to what solutions [his]96-amherst experiments pointed . In explaining the mill work [he]96-amherst forgot [his]96-amherst constraint and returned to the free comradery of mind that had always marked [their]2863-their relation . [He]96-amherst turned the key reluctantly in the last door , and paused a moment on the threshold . " Anything more ? "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said , with a laugh meant to hide [his]96-amherst desire to prolong [their]2863-their tour . " But [I]96-amherst hope [Cicely]167-cicely will be [here]3415-here often , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said . [Amherst]96-amherst hesitated . [He]96-amherst had meant to propose a visit to [the old Eldorado building]2865-the old eldorado building , which now at last housed [the long - desired night - schools and nursery]2866-the long - desired night - schools and nursery ; but since [she]100-justine had spoken [he]96-amherst felt a sudden indifference to showing [her]100-justine anything more . [He]96-amherst remembered a vague [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook rumour to the effect that [the young doctor]2559-the young doctor had been attracted to [Miss Brent]97-miss brent . Such floating seeds of gossip seldom rooted themselves in [his]96-amherst mind , but now the fact acquired a new significance , and [he]96-amherst wondered how [he]96-amherst could have thought so little of it at the time . "[100-justine] [She]100-justine spoke earnestly , almost passionately , and as [he]96-amherst listened [his]96-amherst undefined fear was lifted . " [I]96-amherst mean -- It 's only that [an unknown visitor]4536-an unknown visitor called at [the house]311-the house yesterday , and insisted that [you]96-amherst must have arrived . All within [him]96-amherst was flood - tide : this was the top of life , surely -- to feel [her]100-justine alike in [his]96-amherst brain and [his]96-amherst pulses , to steep sight and hearing in the joy of [her]100-justine nearness , while all the while thought spoke clear : " This is the mate of [my]96-amherst mind . "[96-amherst] [He]96-amherst began again abruptly . " Would n't [you]100-justine marry , if it gave [you]100-justine the chance to do what [you]100-justine say -- if it offered [you]100-justine hard work , and the opportunity to make things better ... for [a great many people]4184-a great many people ... as [no one]3425-no one but [yourself]100-justine could do it ? "[96-amherst] It was a strange way of putting [his]96-amherst case : [he]96-amherst was aware of it before [he]96-amherst ended . [She]100-justine stiffened a little , remaining quite motionless , [her]100-justine eyes on [the street]3968-the street . " _ [You]96-amherst ! _ "[100-justine] [she]100-justine just breathed ; and [he]96-amherst saw that [she]100-justine was beginning to tremble . " [I]100-justine only thought -- it would be a dull business to [most women]4067-most women -- and [I]100-justine 'm tied to it for life ... but [I]100-justine thought ... " Oh , [I]100-justine _ hate _ suffering ! "[100-justine] [she]100-justine broke out , raising [her]100-justine hands to [her]100-justine face . [Amherst]96-amherst was frightened . " [I]96-amherst only meant -- [I]96-amherst was trying to make [my]96-amherst work recommend [me]96-amherst ... " [I]100-justine 'm really just like [other women]1120-other women , [you]96-amherst know -- [I]100-justine shall like it because it 's [your]96-amherst work , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine said . XXXII EVERY one agreed that , on the whole , [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope had behaved extremely well . [He]120-mr. langhope was just beginning to regain [his]120-mr. langhope equanimity in the matter of the will -- to perceive that , in the eyes of [the public]2889-the public , something important and distinguished was being done at [Westmore]104-westmore , and that the venture , while reducing [Cicely]167-cicely 's income during [her]167-cicely minority , might , in some incredible way , actually make for its ultimate increase . So much [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , always eager to take the easiest view of the inevitable , had begun to let fall in [his]120-mr. langhope confidential comments on [Amherst]96-amherst ; when [his]120-mr. langhope newly - regained balance was rudely shaken by the news of [[his]120-mr. langhope son - in - law]1787-his son - in - law 's marriage . The free expression of [his]120-mr. langhope anger was baffled by the fact that , even by the farthest stretch of self - extenuating logic , [he]120-mr. langhope could find [no one to blame for the event]2891-no one to blame for the event but [himself]120-mr. langhope . " Why on earth do n't [you]178-mrs. ansell say so -- don't [you]178-mrs. ansell call [me]120-mr. langhope [a triple - dyed fool for bringing [them]2892-them together]4544-a triple - dyed fool for bringing them together ? "[120-mr. langhope] [he]120-mr. langhope challenged [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , as [they]2892-them had the matter out together in [the small intimate drawing - room]2893-the small intimate drawing - room of [[her]178-mrs. ansell New York apartment]2894-her new york apartment . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , stirring [her]178-mrs. ansell tea with a pensive hand , met the challenge composedly . " At present [you]120-mr. langhope 're doing it for [me]178-mrs. ansell , "[178-mrs. ansell] [she]178-mrs. ansell reminded [him]120-mr. langhope ; " and after all , [I]178-mrs. ansell 'm not so disposed to agree with [you]120-mr. langhope . "[178-mrs. ansell] " Not agree with [me]178-mrs. ansell ? But [you]120-mr. langhope told [me]178-mrs. ansell not to engage [Miss Brent]97-miss brent ! Did n't [you]120-mr. langhope tell [me]178-mrs. ansell not to engage [her]97-miss brent ? "[178-mrs. ansell] [She]178-mrs. ansell made a hesitating motion of assent . " Of course , if [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope approves-- "[178-mrs. ansell] society reluctantly murmured ; and that [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope did approve was presently made manifest by every outward show of consideration toward [the newly - wedded couple]2898-the newly - wedded couple . * * * * * [Amherst]96-amherst and [Justine]100-justine had been married in September ; and after a holiday in [Canada]80-canada and [the Adirondacks]35-the adirondacks [they]2898-the newly - wedded couple returned to [Hanaford]1-hanaford for the winter . [Amherst]96-amherst had proposed a short flight to [Europe]17-europe ; but [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife preferred to settle down at once to [her]3350-his wife new duties . The announcement of [her]3350-his wife marriage had been met by [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel with a comment which often afterward returned to [her]3350-his wife memory . " It 's splendid for [you]100-justine , of course , [dear]3468-dear , _ in one way _ , "[706-her friend] [[her]3350-his wife friend]706-her friend had murmured , between disparagement and envy--"that is , if [you]100-justine can stand talking about [the Westmore mill]4559-the westmore mill - hands all the rest of [your]100-justine life . "[706-her friend] " Oh , but [I]100-justine couldn't -- [I]100-justine should hate it ! "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine had energetically rejoined ; meeting [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's admonitory " Well , then ? "[118-mrs. dressel] with the laughing assurance that _ [she]100-justine _ meant to lead the conversation . [She]100-justine knew well enough what the admonition meant . To [Amherst]96-amherst , so long thwarted in [his]96-amherst chosen work , the subject of [Westmore]167-cicely was becoming an _ idee fixe _ ; and it was natural that [Hanaford]164-hanaford should class [him]96-amherst as [a man of one topic]2901-a man of one topic . But [Justine]100-justine had guessed at [his]96-amherst other side ; a side as long thwarted , and far less articulate , which [she]100-justine intended to wake into life . [She]100-justine had felt it in [him]96-amherst from the first , though [their]2902-their talks had so uniformly turned on the subject which palled on [Hanaford]164-hanaford ; and it had been revealed to [her]100-justine during the silent hours among [his]96-amherst books , when [she]100-justine had grown into such close intimacy with [his]96-amherst mind . [She]100-justine did not , assuredly , mean to spend the rest of [her]100-justine days talking about [the Westmore mill]4559-the westmore mill - hands ; but in the arrogance of [her]100-justine joy [she]100-justine wished to begin [her]100-justine married life in the setting of its habitual duties , and to achieve the victory of evoking the secret unsuspected [Amherst]96-amherst out of [the preoccupied business man chained to [his]96-amherst task]2904-the preoccupied business man chained to his task . [Dull lovers]2905-dull lovers might have to call on romantic scenes to wake romantic feelings ; but [Justine]100-justine 's glancing imagination leapt to the challenge of extracting poetry from the prose of routine . And this was precisely the triumph that the first months brought [her]100-justine . To mortal eye , [Amherst]96-amherst and [Justine]100-justine seemed to be living at [Hanaford]1-hanaford : in reality [they]2906-their were voyaging on [unmapped seas of adventure]2907-unmapped seas of adventure . [The seas]1932-the seas were limitless , and studded with [happy islands]2909-happy islands : every fresh discovery [they]2906-their made about [each other]407-each other , every new agreement of ideas and feelings , offered itself to [these intrepid explorers]2911-these intrepid explorers as [a friendly coast where [they]2911-these intrepid explorers might beach [their]2911-these intrepid explorers keel and take [their]2911-these intrepid explorers bearings]2912-a friendly coast where they might beach their keel and take their bearings . Thus , in the thronging hum of metaphor , [Justine]100-justine sometimes pictured [their]2906-their relation ; seeing it , again , as a journey through [crowded populous cities]2913-crowded populous cities , where every face [she]100-justine met was [Amherst]96-amherst 's ; or , contrarily , as a multiplication of points of perception , so that one became , for [the world]259-the world 's contact , a surface so multitudinously alive that the old myth of hearing the grass grow and walking the rainbow explained itself as the heightening of personality to the utmost pitch of sympathy . In reality , the work at [Westmore]104-westmore became an almost necessary sedative after these flights into the blue . [She]100-justine felt sometimes that [they]2906-their would have been bankrupted of sensations if daily hours of drudgery had not provided a reservoir in which fresh powers of enjoyment could slowly gather . And [their]2906-their duties had the rarer quality of constituting , precisely , the deepest , finest bond between [them]2906-their , the clarifying element which saved [their]2906-their happiness from stagnation , and kept it in the strong mid - current of human feeling . It was this element in [their]2906-their affection which , in the last days of November , was unexpectedly put on trial . [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , since [his]120-mr. langhope return from [his]120-mr. langhope annual visit to [Europe]17-europe , showed signs of diminishing strength and elasticity . [He]120-mr. langhope had had to give up [his]120-mr. langhope nightly dinner parties , to desert [his]120-mr. langhope stall at [the Opera]2915-the opera : to take , in short , as [he]120-mr. langhope plaintively put it , [his]120-mr. langhope social pleasures homoeopathically . [Certain of [[his]120-mr. langhope friends]2917-his friends]2916-certain of his friends explained the change by saying that [he]120-mr. langhope had never been " quite the same "[120-mr. langhope] since [[his]120-mr. langhope daughter]514-his daughter 's death ; while [others]3447-others found its determining cause in the shock of [Amherst]96-amherst 's second marriage . But this insinuation [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope in due time discredited by writing to ask [the Amhersts]159-john if [they]2920-they would not pity [his]96-amherst loneliness and spend the winter in [town]3932-town with [him]96-amherst . The proposal came in a letter to [Justine]100-justine , which [she]100-justine handed to [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband one afternoon on [his]3393-her husband return from [the mills]3324-the mills . [She]100-justine sat behind the tea - table in [the Westmore drawing - room]2924-the westmore drawing - room , now at last transformed , not into [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's vision of " something lovely in [Louis Seize]81-louis seize , "[118-mrs. dressel] but into a warm yet sober setting for books , for scattered flowers , for deep chairs and shaded lamps in pleasant nearness to each other . [Amherst]96-amherst raised [his]96-amherst eyes from the letter , thinking as [he]96-amherst did so how well [her]100-justine bright head , with its flame - like play of meanings , fitted into the background [she]100-justine had made for it . Still unobservant of external details , [he]96-amherst was beginning to feel a vague well - being of the eye wherever [her]100-justine touch had passed . " Well , [we]4560-we must do it , "[96-amherst] [he]96-amherst said simply . " Oh , must [we]4560-we ? "[100-justine] [she]100-justine murmured , holding out [his]96-amherst cup . " [I]100-justine shall be very glad to be with [Cicely]167-cicely again -- and that , of course , "[100-justine] [she]100-justine reflected , " is the reason why [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope wants [us]4560-we . "[100-justine] " Well -- if it is , it 's a good reason . "[100-justine] " Yes . But how much shall [you]100-justine be with [us]4560-we ? "[100-justine] " Yes , [I]100-justine suppose so . "[100-justine] [She]100-justine put aside [her]100-justine untasted cup , resting [her]100-justine elbows on [her]100-justine knees , and [her]100-justine chin on [her]100-justine clasped hands , in the attitude habitual to [her]100-justine in moments of inward debate . " Shall [I]96-amherst tell [you]100-justine ? [I]96-amherst feel that it 's a sort of ring of [Polycrates]4565-polycrates . It may buy off [the jealous gods]4566-the jealous gods .
