"[96-amherst] [Amherst]96-amherst drew [her]100-justine to [him]96-amherst . " Is n't it , on the contrary , in the ash - heaps that the rag - pickers prowl ? "[96-amherst] * * * * * There was no disguising it : [she]100-justine was growing afraid of [her]100-justine happiness . [[Her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband 's analogy of the ring expressed [her]100-justine fear . [She]100-justine seemed to [herself]100-justine to carry a blazing jewel on [her]100-justine breast -- something that singled [her]100-justine out for human envy and divine pursuit . [She]100-justine had a preposterous longing to dress plainly and shabbily , to subdue [her]100-justine voice and gestures , to try to slip through life unnoticed ; yet all the while [she]100-justine knew that [her]100-justine jewel would shoot its rays through every disguise . And from the depths of ancient atavistic instincts came the hope that [Amherst]96-amherst was right -- that by sacrificing [their]2926-their precious solitude to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's convenience [they]2926-their might still deceive [the gods]3946-the gods . * * * * * Once pledged to [her]100-justine new task , [Justine]100-justine , as usual , espoused it with ardour . It was pleasant , even among greater joys , to see [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband again frankly welcomed by [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope ; to see [Cicely]167-cicely bloom into happiness at [their]2926-their coming ; and to overhear [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope exclaim , in a confidential aside to [[his]120-mr. langhope son - in - law]1787-his son - in - law : " It 's wonderful , the _ bien - etre _ [that wife of yours]4567-that wife of yours diffuses about [her]4567-that wife of yours ! "[120-mr. langhope] The element of _ bien - etre _ was the only one in which [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope could draw breath ; and to those who kept [him]120-mr. langhope immersed in it [he]120-mr. langhope was prodigal of delicate attentions . The experiment , in short , was a complete success ; and even [Amherst]96-amherst 's necessary weeks at [Hanaford]1-hanaford had the merit of giving a finer flavour to [his]96-amherst brief appearances . Of all this [Justine]100-justine was thinking as [she]100-justine drove down [Fifth Avenue]82-fifth avenue one January afternoon to meet [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband at [the Grand Central station]2931-the grand central station . [She]100-justine had tamed [her]100-justine happiness at last : the quality of fear had left it , and it nestled in [her]100-justine heart like some wild creature subdued to human ways . And , as [her]100-justine inward bliss became more and more a quiet habit of the mind , the longing to help and minister returned , absorbing [her]100-justine more deeply in [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband 's work . [She]100-justine dismissed [the carriage]547-the carriage at [the station]4112-the station , and when [[his]3393-her husband train]2935-his train had arrived [they]2936-they emerged together into the cold winter twilight and turned up [Madison Avenue]51-madison avenue . [These walks]2937-these walks [home]3405-home from [the station]4112-the station gave [them]2936-they a little more time to [themselves]2936-they than if [they]2936-they had driven ; and there was always so much to tell on both sides . This time the news was all good : the work at [Westmore]104-westmore was prospering , and on [Justine]100-justine 's side there was a more cheerful report of [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's health , and -- best of all -- [his]3393-her husband promise to give [them]2936-they Cicely for the summer . [Amherst]96-amherst and [Justine]100-justine were both anxious that [the child]3698-the child should spend more time at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , that [[her]100-justine young associations]2941-her young associations should begin to gather about [Westmore]104-westmore ; and [Justine]100-justine exulted in the fact that the suggestion had come from [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope [himself]3393-her husband , while [she]100-justine and [Amherst]96-amherst were still planning how to lead [him]3393-her husband up to it . [They]2936-they reached [the house]311-the house while this triumph was still engaging [them]2936-they ; and in the doorway [Amherst]96-amherst turned to [her]100-justine with a smile . " And of course -- [dear man!--he]4568-dear man!--he believes the idea is all [his]3393-her husband . There 's nothing [you]4568-dear man!--he ca n't make [people]3450-people believe , [[you]4568-dear man!--he little Jesuit]4570-you little jesuit ! "[96-amherst] " [I]100-justine do n't think there is ! "[100-justine] [she]100-justine boasted , falling gaily into [his]96-amherst tone ; and then , as the door opened , and [she]100-justine entered [the hall]505-the hall , [her]100-justine eyes fell on a blotted envelope which lay among the letters on the table . [The parlour - maid]2694-the parlour - maid proffered it with a word of explanation . " [A gentleman]4571-a gentleman left it for [you]100-justine , [madam]4572-madam ; [he]4571-a gentleman asked to see [you]100-justine , and said [he]4571-a gentleman 'd call for the answer in a day or two . "[2694-the parlour - maid] " Another begging letter , [I]96-amherst suppose , "[96-amherst] said [Amherst]96-amherst , turning into [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room , where [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope and [Cicely]167-cicely awaited [them]2946-them ; and [Justine]100-justine , carelessly pushing the envelope into [her]100-justine muff , murmured " [I]100-justine suppose so "[100-justine] as [she]100-justine followed [him]96-amherst . XXXIII OVER the tea - table [Justine]100-justine forgot the note in [her]100-justine muff ; but when [she]100-justine went [upstairs]1423-upstairs to dress it fell to the floor , and [she]100-justine picked it up and laid it on [her]100-justine dressing - table . [She]100-justine had already recognized the hand as [Wyant]165-wyant 's , for it was not the first letter [she]100-justine had received from [him]96-amherst . Three times since [her]100-justine marriage [he]96-amherst had appealed to [her]100-justine for help , excusing [himself]96-amherst on the plea of difficulties and ill - health . The first time [he]96-amherst wrote , [he]96-amherst alluded vaguely to having married , and to being compelled , through illness , to give up [his]96-amherst practice at [Clifton]26-clifton . On receiving this letter [she]100-justine made enquiries , and learned that , a month or two after [her]100-justine departure from [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , [Wyant]165-wyant had married [a Clifton girl]2948-a clifton girl -- a pretty piece of flaunting innocence , whom [she]100-justine remembered about [the lanes]2949-the lanes , generally with [a young man]4512-a young man in a buggy . There had evidently been something obscure and precipitate about the marriage , which was a strange one for [the ambitious young doctor]2951-the ambitious young doctor . [Justine]100-justine conjectured that it might have been the cause of [his]96-amherst leaving [Clifton]26-clifton -- or or perhaps [he]96-amherst had already succumbed to the fatal habit [she]100-justine had suspected in [him]96-amherst . At any rate [he]96-amherst seemed , in some mysterious way , to have dropped in two years from promise to failure ; yet [she]100-justine could not believe that , with [his]96-amherst talents , and the name [he]96-amherst had begun to make , such a lapse could be more than temporary . [She]100-justine had often heard [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford prophesy great things for [him]96-amherst ; but [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford had died suddenly during the previous summer , and the loss of [this powerful friend]2952-this powerful friend was mentioned by [Wyant]165-wyant among [his]96-amherst misfortunes . [Justine]100-justine was anxious to help [him]96-amherst , but [her]100-justine marriage to [a rich man]4190-a rich man had not given [her]100-justine the command of much money . [She]100-justine and [Amherst]96-amherst , choosing to regard [themselves]2954-their as [pensioners on the Westmore fortune]2955-pensioners on the westmore fortune , were scrupulous in restricting [their]2954-their personal expenditure ; and [her]100-justine work among [the mill - hands]3347-the mill - hands brought many demands on the modest allowance which [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband had insisted on [her]100-justine accepting . In reply to [Wyant]165-wyant 's first appeal , which reached [her]100-justine soon after [her]100-justine marriage , [she]100-justine had sent [him]165-wyant a hundred dollars ; but when the second came , some two months later -- with a fresh tale of ill - luck and ill - health -- [she]100-justine had not been able to muster more than half the amount . Finally a third letter had arrived , a short time before [their]2954-their leaving for [New York]7-new york . It told the same story of persistent misfortune , but on this occasion [Wyant]165-wyant , instead of making a direct appeal for money , suggested that , through [her]100-justine hospital connections , [she]100-justine should help [him]165-wyant to establish a [New York]7-new york practice . [His]165-wyant tone was half - whining , half - peremptory , [his]165-wyant once precise writing smeared and illegible ; and these indications , combined with [her]100-justine former suspicions , convinced [her]100-justine that , for the moment , [he]165-wyant was unfit for medical work . At any rate , [she]100-justine could not assume the responsibility of recommending [him]165-wyant ; and in answering [she]100-justine advised [him]165-wyant to apply to [some of [the physicians [he]165-wyant had worked with at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]2959-the physicians he had worked with at lynbrook]2958-some of the physicians he had worked with at lynbrook , softening [her]100-justine refusal by the enclosure of a small sum of money . To this letter [she]100-justine received no answer . [Wyant]165-wyant doubtless found the money insufficient , and resented [her]100-justine unwillingness to help [him]165-wyant by the use of [her]100-justine influence ; and [she]100-justine felt sure that the note before [her]100-justine contained a renewal of [his]165-wyant former request . An obscure reluctance made [her]100-justine begin to undress before opening it . [She]100-justine felt slightly tired and indolently happy , and [she]100-justine did not wish any jarring impression to break in on the sense of completeness which [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband 's coming always put into [her]100-justine life . [Her]100-justine happiness was making [her]100-justine timid and luxurious : [she]100-justine was beginning to shrink from even trivial annoyances . But when at length , in [her]100-justine dressing - gown , [her]100-justine loosened hair about [her]100-justine shoulders , [she]100-justine seated [herself]100-justine before the toilet - mirror , [Wyant]165-wyant 's note once more confronted [her]100-justine . It was absurd to put off reading it -- if [he]165-wyant asked for money again , [she]100-justine would simply confide the whole business to [Amherst]96-amherst . [She]100-justine had never spoken to [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband of [her]100-justine correspondence with [Wyant]165-wyant . The mere fact that [the latter]673-the latter had appealed to [her]100-justine , instead of addressing [himself]165-wyant to [Amherst]96-amherst , made [her]100-justine suspect that [he]165-wyant had a weakness to hide , and counted on [her]100-justine professional discretion . But [his]165-wyant continued importunities would certainly release [her]100-justine from any such supposed obligation ; and [she]100-justine thought with relief of casting the weight of [her]100-justine difficulty on [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband 's shoulders . [She]100-justine opened the note and read . " [I]100-justine did not acknowledge [your]3393-her husband last letter because [I]100-justine was ashamed to tell [you]3393-her husband that the money was not enough to be of any use . But [I]100-justine am past shame now . [[My]100-justine wife]3819-my wife was confined three weeks ago , and has been desperately ill ever since . [She]3819-my wife is in no state to move , but [we]4574-we shall be put out of [these rooms]4575-these rooms unless [I]100-justine can get money or work at once . A word from [you]2964-you would have given [me]100-justine a start in [New York]7-new york -- and [I]100-justine 'd be willing to begin again as [an interne]4576-an interne or [a doctor 's assistant]4577-a doctor 's assistant . "[100-justine] [I]0-i have never reminded [you]2964-you of what [you]2964-you owe [me]0-i , and [I]0-i should not do so now if [I]0-i had n't been to hell and back since [I]0-i saw [you]2964-you . But [I]0-i suppose [you]2964-you would rather have [me]0-i remind [you]2964-you than apply to [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst . [You]2964-you can tell [me]0-i when to call for [my]0-i answer . " [Justine]100-justine laid down the letter and looked up . [Her]100-justine eyes rested on [her]100-justine own reflection in the glass , and it frightened [her]100-justine . [She]100-justine sat motionless , with a thickly - beating heart , one hand clenched on the letter . _ "[2964-you] [I]0-i suppose [you]2964-you would rather have [me]0-i remind [you]2964-you than apply to [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst . " _ That was what [his]96-amherst importunity meant , then ! [She]100-justine had been paying blackmail all this time .... Somewhere , from the first , in an obscure fold of consciousness , [she]100-justine had felt the stir of an unnamed , unacknowledged fear ; and now the fear raised its head and looked at [her]100-justine . Well ! [She]100-justine would look back at it , then : look it straight in the malignant eye . What was it , after all , but a "[2964-you] bugbear to scare children"--the ghost of the opinion of [the many]2629-the many ? [She]100-justine had suspected from the first that [Wyant]165-wyant knew of [her]100-justine having shortened the term of [Bessy Amherst]170-bessy 's sufferings -- returning to [the room]3355-the room when [he]96-amherst did , it was almost impossible that [he]96-amherst should not have guessed what had happened ; and [his]96-amherst silence had made [her]100-justine believe that [he]96-amherst understood [her]100-justine motive and approved it . But , supposing [she]100-justine had been mistaken , [she]100-justine still had nothing to fear , since [she]100-justine had done nothing that [her]100-justine own conscience condemned . If the act were to do again [she]100-justine would do it -- [she]100-justine had never known a moment 's regret ! Suddenly [she]100-justine heard [Amherst]96-amherst 's step in [the passage]411-the passage -- heard [him]96-amherst laughing and talking as [he]96-amherst chased [Cicely]167-cicely up the stairs to [the nursery]4581-the nursery . _ If [she]100-justine was not afraid , why had [she]100-justine never told [Amherst]96-amherst ? _ Why , the answer to that was simple enough ! [She]100-justine had not told [him]96-amherst _ because [she]100-justine was not afraid _ . From the first [she]100-justine had retained sufficient detachment to view [her]100-justine act impartially , to find it completely justified by circumstances , and to decide that , since those circumstances could be but partly and indirectly known to [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband , [she]100-justine not only had the right to keep [her]100-justine own counsel , but was actually under a kind of obligation not to force on [him]96-amherst the knowledge of a fact that [he]96-amherst could not alter and could not completely judge .... Was there any flaw in this line of reasoning ? Did it not show a deliberate weighing of conditions , a perfect rectitude of intention ? And , after all , [she]100-justine had had [Amherst]96-amherst 's virtual consent to [her]100-justine act ! [She]100-justine knew [his]96-amherst feelings on such matters -- [his]96-amherst independence of traditional judgments , [his]96-amherst horror of inflicting needless pain -- [she]100-justine was as sure of [his]96-amherst intellectual assent as of [her]100-justine own . [She]100-justine was even sure that , when [she]100-justine told [him]96-amherst , [he]96-amherst would appreciate [her]100-justine reasons for not telling [him]96-amherst before .... For now of course [he]96-amherst must know everything -- this horrible letter made it inevitable . [She]100-justine regretted that [she]100-justine had decided , though for the best of reasons , not to speak to [him]96-amherst of [her]100-justine own accord ; for it was intolerable that [he]96-amherst should think of any external pressure as having brought [her]100-justine to [avowal]83-avowal . But no ! [he]96-amherst would not think that . The understanding between [them]4583-them was so complete that no deceptive array of circumstances could ever make [her]100-justine motives obscure to [him]96-amherst . [She]100-justine let [herself]100-justine rest a moment in the thought .... Presently [she]100-justine heard [him]96-amherst moving in [the next room]427-the next room -- [he]96-amherst had come back to dress for dinner . [She]100-justine would go to [him]96-amherst now , at once -- [she]100-justine could not bear this weight on [her]100-justine mind the whole evening . [She]100-justine pushed back [her]100-justine chair , crumpling the letter in [her]100-justine hand ; but as [she]100-justine did so , [her]100-justine eyes again fell on [her]100-justine reflection . [She]100-justine could not go to [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband with such a face ! If [she]100-justine was not afraid , why did [she]100-justine look like that ? Well -- [she]100-justine was afraid ! It would be easier and simpler to admit it . [She]100-justine was afraid -- afraid for the first time -- afraid for [her]100-justine own happiness ! [She]100-justine had had just eight months of happiness -- it was horrible to think of losing it so soon .... Losing it ? But why should [she]100-justine lose it ? The letter must have affected [her]100-justine brain ... all [her]100-justine thoughts were in a blur of fear .... Fear of what ? Of [the man who understood [her]100-justine as [no one else]3640-no one else understood [her]100-justine]4586-the man who understood her as no one else understood her ? [The man to whose wisdom and mercy [she]100-justine trusted as [the believer]883-the believer trusts in [God]156-god]4588-the man to whose wisdom and mercy she trusted as the believer trusts in god ? This was a kind of abominable nightmare -- even [Amherst]96-amherst 's image had been distorted in [her]100-justine mind ! The only way to clear [her]100-justine brain , to recover the normal sense of things , was to go to [him]96-amherst now , at once , to feel [his]96-amherst arms about [her]100-justine , to let [his]96-amherst kiss dispel [her]100-justine fears .... [She]100-justine rose with a long breath of relief . [She]100-justine had to cross the length of [the room]3355-the room to reach [his]96-amherst door , and when [she]100-justine had gone half - way [she]100-justine heard [him]96-amherst knock . "[2964-you] May [I]0-i come in ? " [She]100-justine was close to [the fire - place]4591-the fire - place , and a bright fire burned on the hearth . "[0-i] Come in ! " [she]100-justine answered ; and as [she]100-justine did so , [she]100-justine turned and dropped [Wyant]165-wyant 's letter into the fire . [Her]100-justine hand had crushed it into a little ball , and [she]100-justine saw the flames spring up and swallow it before [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband entered . It was not that [she]100-justine had changed [her]100-justine mind -- [she]100-justine still meant to tell [him]96-amherst everything . But to hold the letter was like holding a venomous snake -- [she]100-justine wanted to exterminate it , to forget that [she]100-justine had ever seen the blotted repulsive characters . And [she]100-justine could not bear to have [Amherst]96-amherst 's eyes rest on it , to have [him]96-amherst know that [any man]4593-any man had dared to write to [her]100-justine in that tone . What vile meanings might not be read between [Wyant]165-wyant 's phrases ? [She]100-justine had a right to tell the story in [her]100-justine own way -- the true way .... As [Amherst]96-amherst approached , in [his]96-amherst evening clothes , the heavy locks smoothed from [his]96-amherst forehead , a flower of [Cicely]167-cicely 's giving in [his]96-amherst button - hole , [she]100-justine thought [she]100-justine had never seen [him]96-amherst look so kind and handsome . "[0-i] Not dressed ? Do [you]2965-you know that it 's ten minutes to eight ? " [he]96-amherst said , coming up to [her]100-justine with a smile . [She]100-justine roused [herself]100-justine , putting [her]100-justine hands to [her]100-justine hair . "[2965-you] Yes , [I]0-i know -- [I]0-i forgot , " [she]100-justine murmured , longing to feel [his]96-amherst arms about [her]100-justine , but standing rooted to the ground , unable to move an inch nearer . It was [he]96-amherst who came close , drawing [her]100-justine lifted hands into [his]96-amherst . "[0-i] [You]2965-you look worried -- [I]0-i hope it was nothing troublesome that made [you]2965-you forget ? " The divine kindness in [his]96-amherst voice , [his]96-amherst eyes ! Yes -- it would be easy , quite easy , to tell [him]96-amherst .... "[0-i] No -- yes -- [I]0-i was a little troubled .... " [she]100-justine said , feeling the warmth of [his]96-amherst touch flow through [her]100-justine hands reassuringly . "[3468-dear] [Dear]3468-dear ! What about ? " [She]100-justine drew a deep breath . "[3468-dear] The letter---- " [He]96-amherst looked puzzled . "[3468-dear] What letter ? " "[3468-dear] [Downstairs]486-downstairs ... when [we]2968-we came in ... it was not an ordinary begging - letter . " "[0-i] No ? What then ? " [he]96-amherst asked , [his]96-amherst face clouding . [She]100-justine noticed the change , and it frightened [her]100-justine . Was [he]96-amherst angry ? Was [he]96-amherst going to be angry ? But how absurd ! [He]96-amherst was only distressed at [her]100-justine distress . "[0-i] What then ? " [he]96-amherst repeated , more gently . [She]100-justine looked up into [his]96-amherst eyes for an instant . "[0-i] It was a horrible letter---- " [she]100-justine whispered , as [she]100-justine pressed [her]100-justine clasped hands against [him]96-amherst . [His]96-amherst grasp tightened on [her]100-justine wrists , and again the stern look crossed [his]96-amherst face . "[0-i] Horrible ? What do [you]2969-you mean ? " [She]100-justine had never seen [him]96-amherst angry -- but [she]100-justine felt suddenly that , to [the guilty creature]4594-the guilty creature , [his]96-amherst anger would be terrible . [He]96-amherst would crush [Wyant]165-wyant -- [she]100-justine must be careful how [she]100-justine spoke . "[2969-you] [I]0-i did n't mean that -- only painful .... " "[2969-you] Where is the letter ? Let [me]0-i see it . " "[2969-you] Oh , no " [she]100-justine exclaimed , shrinking away . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine , what has happened ? What ails [you]100-justine ? " On a blind impulse [she]100-justine had backed toward the hearth , propping [her]100-justine arms against the mantel - piece while [she]100-justine stole a secret glance at the embers . Nothing remained of it -- no , nothing . But suppose it was against [herself]100-justine that [his]96-amherst anger turned ? The idea was preposterous , yet [she]100-justine trembled at it . It was clear that [she]100-justine must say _ something _ at once -- must somehow account for [her]100-justine agitation . But the sense that [she]100-justine was unnerved -- no longer in control of [her]100-justine face , [her]100-justine voice -- made [her]100-justine feel that [she]100-justine would tell [her]100-justine story badly if [she]100-justine told it now .... Had [she]100-justine not the right to gain a respite , to choose [her]100-justine own hour ? Weakness -- weakness again ! Every delay would only increase the phantom terror . Now , _ now_--with [her]0-i head on [his]96-amherst breast ! [She]0-i turned toward [him]96-amherst and began to speak impulsively . "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't show [you]2970-you the letter , because it 's not -- not [my]0-i secret---- " "[0-i] Ah ? " [he]96-amherst murmured , perceptibly relieved . "[0-i] It 's from some one -- unlucky -- whom [I]0-i 've known about .... " "[0-i] And whose troubles have been troubling [you]2970-you ? But ca n't [we]2971-we help ? " [He]96-amherst had [her]0-i in [his]96-amherst arms now , [his]96-amherst kisses drying [her]0-i cheek ; and [she]0-i turned [her]0-i head so that [their]4595-their lips met in a long pressure . "[0-i] Will a hundred dollars do ? " [he]96-amherst asked with a smile as [he]96-amherst released [her]0-i . _ A hundred dollars ! _ No -- [she]0-i was almost sure [they]4595-their would not . But [she]0-i tried to shape a murmur of gratitude . "[0-i] Thank [you]120-mr. langhope -- thank [you]120-mr. langhope ! [I]0-i hated to ask .... " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll write the cheque at once . " "[0-i] No -- no , " [she]0-i protested , "[0-i] there 's no hurry . " But [he]96-amherst went back to [[his]96-amherst room]1444-his room , and [she]0-i turned again to the toilet - table . [Her]0-i face was painful to look at still -- but a light was breaking through its fear . [She]0-i felt the touch of a narcotic in [her]0-i veins . How calm and peaceful [the room]3355-the room was -- and how delicious to think that [her]0-i life would go on in it , safely and peacefully , in the old familiar way ! As [she]0-i swept up [her]0-i hair , passing the comb through it , and flinging it dexterously over [her]0-i lifted wrist , [she]0-i heard [Amherst]96-amherst cross the floor behind [her]0-i , and pause to lay something on [her]0-i writing - table . "[0-i] Thank [you]120-mr. langhope , " [she]0-i murmured again , lowering [her]0-i head as [he]96-amherst passed . When the door had closed on [him]96-amherst [she]0-i thrust the last pin into [her]0-i hair , dashed some drops of Cologne on [her]0-i face , and went over to the writing - table . As [she]0-i picked up the cheque [she]0-i saw it was for three hundred dollars . XXXIV ONCE or twice , in the days that followed , [Justine]100-justine found [herself]100-justine thinking that [she]100-justine had never known happiness before . The old state of secure well - being seemed now like a dreamless sleep ; but this new bliss , on its sharp pinnacle ringed with fire -- this thrilling conscious joy , daily and hourly snatched from fear -- this was living , not sleeping ! [Wyant]165-wyant acknowledged [her]100-justine gift with profuse , almost servile thanks . [She]100-justine had sent it without a word -- saying to [herself]100-justine that pity for [his]96-amherst situation made it possible to ignore [his]96-amherst baseness . And the days went on as before . [She]100-justine was not conscious of any change , save in the heightened , almost artificial quality of [her]100-justine happiness , till one day in March , when [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope announced that [he]96-amherst was going for two or three weeks to [[a friend]4121-a friend 's shooting - box in [the south]4404-the south]4599-a friend 's shooting - box in the south . The anniversary of [Bessy]170-bessy 's death was approaching , and [Justine]100-justine knew that at that time [he]96-amherst always absented [himself]96-amherst . "[120-mr. langhope] Supposing [you]2974-you and [Amherst]96-amherst were to carry off [Cicely]167-cicely till [I]0-i come back ? Perhaps [you]2974-you could persuade [him]96-amherst to break away from work for once -- or , if that 's impossible , [you]2974-you could take [her]167-cicely with [you]2974-you to [Hanaford]1-hanaford . [She]167-cicely looks a little pale , and the change would be good for [her]167-cicely . " This was a great concession on [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's part , and [Justine]100-justine saw the pleasure in [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband 's face . It was the first time that [[his]3393-her husband father - in - law]2004-his father - in - law had suggested [Cicely]167-cicely 's going to [Hanaford]1-hanaford . "[167-cicely] [I]0-i 'm afraid [I]0-i ca n't break away just now , [sir]3495-sir , " [Amherst]96-amherst said , "[0-i] but it will be delightful for [Justine]100-justine if [you]3495-sir 'll give [us]2976-us [Cicely]167-cicely while [you]3495-sir 're away . " "[3495-sir] Take [her]167-cicely by all means , [[my]0-i dear fellow]2977-my dear fellow : [I]0-i always sleep on both ears when [she]167-cicely 's with [[your]3495-sir wife]4011-your wife . " It was nearly three months since [Justine]100-justine had left [Hanaford]1-hanaford -- and now [she]100-justine was to return [there]3361-there alone with [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband ! There would be hours , of course , when [the child]3698-the child 's presence was between [them]2976-us -- or when , again , [his]3393-her husband work would keep [him]3393-her husband at [the mills]3324-the mills . But in the evenings , when [Cicely]167-cicely was in bed -- when [he]3393-her husband and [she]100-justine sat alone , together in [the Westmore drawing - room]2924-the westmore drawing - room -- in [[Bessy]170-bessy 's drawing - room]4608-bessy 's drawing - room ! ... No -- [she]100-justine must find some excuse for remaining away till [she]100-justine had again grown used to the idea of being alone with [Amherst]96-amherst . Every day [she]100-justine was growing a little more used to it ; but it would take time -- time , and the full assurance that [Wyant]165-wyant was silenced . Till then [she]100-justine could not go back to [Hanaford]1-hanaford . [She]100-justine found a pretext in [her]100-justine own health . [She]100-justine pleaded that [she]100-justine was a little tired , below par ... and to return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford meant returning to hard work ; with the best will in [the world]259-the world [she]100-justine could not be idle [there]3361-there . Might [she]100-justine not , [she]100-justine suggested , take [Cicely]167-cicely to [Tuxedo]84-tuxedo or [Lakewood]85-lakewood , and thus get quite away from household cares and good works ? The pretext rang hollow -- it was so unlike [her]100-justine ! [She]100-justine saw [Amherst]96-amherst 's eyes rest anxiously on [her]100-justine as [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope uttered [his]120-mr. langhope prompt assent . Certainly [she]100-justine did look tired -- [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope [himself]120-mr. langhope had noticed it . Had [he]120-mr. langhope perhaps over - taxed [her]100-justine energies , left the household too entirely on [her]100-justine shoulders ? Oh , no -- it was only the [New York]7-new york air ... like [Cicely]167-cicely , [she]100-justine pined for a breath of [the woods]1012-the woods .... And so , the day [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope left , [she]100-justine and [Cicely]167-cicely were packed off to [Lakewood]85-lakewood . [They]4612-they stayed [there]3361-there a week : then a fit of restlessness drove [Justine]100-justine back to [town]3932-town . [She]100-justine found an excuse in the constant rain -- it was really useless , as [she]100-justine wrote [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , to keep [the child]3698-the child imprisoned in [an over - heated hotel]4616-an over - heated hotel while [they]4612-they could get no benefit from the outdoor life . In reality , [she]100-justine found the long lonely hours unendurable . [She]100-justine pined for a sight of [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband , and thought of committing [Cicely]167-cicely to [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's care , and making a sudden dash for [Hanaford]164-hanaford . But the vision of the long evenings in [the Westmore drawing - room]2924-the westmore drawing - room again restrained [her]100-justine . No -- [she]100-justine would simply go back to [New York]7-new york , dine out occasionally , go to a concert or two , trust to the usual demands of [town]3932-town life to crowd [her]100-justine hours with small activities .... And in another week [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope would be back and the days would resume their normal course . On arriving , [she]100-justine looked feverishly through the letters in [the hall]505-the hall . None from [Wyant]165-wyant -- that fear was allayed ! Every day added to [her]100-justine reassurance . By this time , no doubt , [he]4571-a gentleman was on [his]4571-a gentleman feet again , and ashamed -- unutterably ashamed -- of the threat that despair had wrung from [him]4571-a gentleman . [She]100-justine felt almost sure that [his]4571-a gentleman shame would keep [him]4571-a gentleman from ever attempting to see [her]100-justine , or even from writing again . "[4571-a gentleman] [A gentleman]4571-a gentleman called to see [you]2980-you yesterday , [madam]4572-madam -- [he]4571-a gentleman would give no name , " [the parlour - maid]2694-the parlour - maid said . And there was the sick fear back on [her]100-justine again ! [She]100-justine could hardly control the trembling of [her]100-justine lips as [she]100-justine asked : "[4571-a gentleman] Did [he]4571-a gentleman leave no message ? " "[4571-a gentleman] No , [madam]4572-madam : [he]4571-a gentleman only wanted to know when [you]2980-you 'd be back . " [She]100-justine longed to return : "[4571-a gentleman] And did [you]4571-a gentleman tell [him]4571-a gentleman ? " but restrained [herself]100-justine , and passed into [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room . After all , [the parlour - maid]2694-the parlour - maid had not described [the caller]4624-the caller -- why jump to the conclusion that it was [Wyant]165-wyant ? Three days passed , and no letter came -- no sign . [She]100-justine struggled with the temptation to describe [Wyant]165-wyant to [the servants]746-the servants , and to forbid [his]4571-a gentleman admission . But it would not do . [They]746-the servants were nearly [all old servants , in whose eyes [she]100-justine was still [the intruder]4627-the intruder]4626-all old servants , in whose eyes she was still the intruder , [the upstart sick - nurse]4628-the upstart sick - nurse -- [she]100-justine could not wholly trust [them]746-the servants . And each day [she]100-justine felt a little easier , a little more convinced that [the unknown visitor]4629-the unknown visitor had not been [Wyant]165-wyant . On the fourth day [she]100-justine received a letter from [Amherst]96-amherst . [He]96-amherst hoped to be back on the morrow , but as [his]96-amherst plans were still uncertain [he]96-amherst would telegraph in the morning -- and meanwhile [she]100-justine must keep well , and rest , and amuse [herself]100-justine .... Amuse [herself]100-justine ! That evening , as it happened , [she]100-justine was going to [the theatre]2229-the theatre with [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell . [She]100-justine and [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , though outwardly on perfect terms , had not greatly advanced in intimacy . The agitated , decentralized life of [the older woman]1491-the older woman seemed futile and trivial to [Justine]100-justine ; but on [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's account [she]100-justine wished to keep up an appearance of friendship with [[his]120-mr. langhope friend]754-his friend , and the same motive doubtless inspired [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell . Just now , at any rate , [Justine]100-justine was grateful for [her]100-justine attentions , and glad to go about with [her]100-justine . Anything -- anything to get away from [her]100-justine own thoughts ! That was the pass [she]100-justine had come to . At [the theatre]2229-the theatre , in a proscenium box , the publicity , the light and movement , the action of the play , all helped to distract and quiet [her]100-justine . At such moments [she]100-justine grew ashamed of [her]100-justine fears . Why was [she]100-justine tormenting [herself]100-justine ? If anything happened [she]100-justine had only to ask [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband for more money . [She]100-justine never spoke to [him]3393-her husband of [her]100-justine good works , and there would be nothing to excite suspicion in [her]100-justine asking help again for [the friend whose secret [she]100-justine was pledged to keep ....]4635-the friend whose secret she was pledged to keep .... But nothing was going to happen . As the play progressed , and the stimulus of talk and laughter flowed through [her]100-justine veins , [she]100-justine felt a complete return of confidence . And then suddenly [she]100-justine glanced across [the house]311-the house , and saw [Wyant]165-wyant looking at [her]100-justine . [He]165-wyant sat rather far back , in one of the side rows just beneath [the balcony]4637-the balcony , so that [his]165-wyant face was partly shaded . But even in the shadow it frightened [her]100-justine . [She]100-justine had been prepared for a change , but not for this ghastly deterioration . And [he]165-wyant continued to look at [her]100-justine . [She]100-justine began to be afraid that [he]165-wyant would do something conspicuous -- point at [her]100-justine , or stand up in [his]165-wyant seat . [She]100-justine thought [he]165-wyant looked half - mad -- or was it [her]100-justine own hallucination that made [him]165-wyant appear so ? [She]100-justine and [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell were alone in the box for the moment , and [she]100-justine started up , pushing back [her]100-justine chair .... [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell leaned forward . "[4571-a gentleman] What is it ? " "[4571-a gentleman] Nothing -- the heat -- [I'll]2983-i'll sit back for a moment . " But as [she]100-justine withdrew into the back of the box , [she]100-justine was seized by a new fear . If [he]165-wyant was still watching , might [he]165-wyant not come to the door and try to speak to [her]100-justine ? [Her]100-justine only safety lay in remaining in full view of [the audience]4638-the audience ; and [she]100-justine returned to [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's side . [The other members of the party]4639-the other members of the party came back -- the bell rang , the foot - lights blazed , the curtain rose . [She]100-justine lost [herself]100-justine in the mazes of the play . [She]100-justine sat so motionless , [her]100-justine face so intently turned toward the stage , that the muscles at the back of [her]100-justine neck began to stiffen . And then , quite suddenly , toward the middle of the act , [she]100-justine felt an undefinable sense of relief . [She]100-justine could not tell what caused it -- but slowly , cautiously , while the eyes of [the others]620-the others were intent upon the stage , [she]100-justine turned [her]100-justine head and looked toward [Wyant]165-wyant 's seat . It was empty . [Her]100-justine first thought was that [he]165-wyant had gone to wait for [her]100-justine outside . But no -- there were two more acts : why should [he]165-wyant stand at the door for half the evening ? At last the act ended ; the entr'acte elapsed ; the play went on again -- and still the seat was empty . Gradually [she]100-justine persuaded [herself]100-justine that [she]100-justine had been mistaken in thinking that [the man who had occupied [it]4642-it]4641-the man who had occupied it was [Wyant]165-wyant . [Her]100-justine self - command returned , [she]100-justine began to think and talk naturally , to follow the dialogue on the stage -- and when the evening was over , and [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell set [her]100-justine down at [her]100-justine door , [she]100-justine had almost forgotten [her]100-justine fears . The next morning [she]100-justine felt calmer than for many days . [She]100-justine was sure now that if [Wyant]165-wyant had wished to speak to [her]100-justine [he]165-wyant would have waited at the door of [the theatre]2229-the theatre ; and the recollection of [his]165-wyant miserable face made apprehension yield to pity . [She]100-justine began to feel that [she]100-justine had treated [him]165-wyant coldly , uncharitably . [They]4644-they had been [friends]1747-friends once , as well as [fellow - workers]4646-fellow - workers ; but [she]100-justine had been false even to the comradeship of [the hospital]3333-the hospital . [She]100-justine should have sought [him]165-wyant out and given [him]165-wyant sympathy as well as money ; had [she]100-justine shown some sign of human kindness [his]165-wyant last letter might never have been written . In the course of the morning [Amherst]96-amherst telegraphed that [he]165-wyant hoped to settle [his]165-wyant business in time to catch the two o'clock express , but that [his]165-wyant plans were still uncertain . [Justine]100-justine and [Cicely]167-cicely lunched alone , and after luncheon [the little girl]1723-the little girl was despatched to [[her]1723-the little girl dancing - class]4649-her dancing - class . [Justine]100-justine [herself]100-justine meant to go out when the brougham returned . [She]100-justine went up to [[her]100-justine room]1426-her room to dress , planning to drive in [the park]4651-the park , and to drop in on [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell before [she]100-justine called for [Cicely]167-cicely ; but on the way [downstairs]486-downstairs [she]100-justine saw [the servant]2028-the servant opening the door to [a visitor]4654-a visitor . It was too late to draw back ; and descending the last steps [she]100-justine found [herself]100-justine face to face with [Wyant]165-wyant . [They]4655-they looked at [each other]407-each other a moment in silence ; then [Justine]100-justine murmured a word of greeting and led the way to [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room . It was a snowy afternoon , and in the raw ash - coloured light [she]100-justine thought [he]165-wyant looked more changed than at [the theatre]2229-the theatre . [She]100-justine remarked , too , that [his]165-wyant clothes were worn and untidy , [his]165-wyant gloveless hands soiled and tremulous . None of the degrading signs of [his]165-wyant infirmity were lacking ; and [she]100-justine saw at once that , while in the early days of the habit [he]165-wyant had probably mixed [his]165-wyant drugs , so that the conflicting symptoms neutralized each other , [he]165-wyant had now sunk into open morphia - taking . [She]100-justine felt profoundly sorry for [him]165-wyant ; yet as [he]165-wyant followed [her]100-justine into [the room]3355-the room physical repulsion again mastered the sense of pity . But where action was possible [she]100-justine was always self - controlled , and [she]100-justine turned to [him]165-wyant quietly as [they]4660-they seated [themselves]4660-they . "[2983-i'll] [I]0-i have been wishing to see [you]2984-you , " [she]100-justine said , looking at [him]165-wyant . "[0-i] [I]0-i have felt that [I]0-i ought to have done so sooner -- to have told [you]2984-you how sorry [I]0-i am for [your]2984-you bad luck . " [He]165-wyant returned [her]100-justine glance with surprise : they were evidently the last words [he]165-wyant had expected . "[0-i] [You]0-i 're very kind , " [he]165-wyant said in a low embarrassed voice . [He]165-wyant had kept on [his]165-wyant shabby over - coat , and [he]165-wyant twirled [his]165-wyant hat in [his]165-wyant hands as [he]165-wyant spoke . "[0-i] [I]0-i have felt , " [Justine]100-justine continued , "[0-i] that perhaps a talk with [you]2984-you might be of more use---- " [He]165-wyant raised [his]165-wyant head , fixing [her]100-justine with bright narrowed eyes . "[0-i] [I]0-i have felt so too : that 's [my]0-i reason for coming . [You]0-i sent [me]0-i a generous present some weeks ago -- but [I]0-i do n't want to go on living on charity . " "[0-i] [I]0-i understand that , " [she]100-justine answered . "[0-i] But why have [you]2984-you had to do so ? Wo n't [you]2984-you tell [me]0-i just what has happened ? " [She]100-justine felt the words to be almost a mockery ; yet [she]100-justine could not say "[2984-you] [I]0-i read [your]2984-you history at a glance " ; and [she]100-justine hoped that [her]100-justine question might draw out [his]2984-you wretched secret , and thus give [her]100-justine the chance to speak frankly . [He]2984-you gave a nervous laugh . "[0-i] Just what has happened ? It 's a long story -- and some of the details are not particularly pretty . Here was the truth , then : [she]100-justine could no longer be the dupe of [her]100-justine own compassion . [The man]3594-the man knew [his]3594-the man power and meant to use it . But [you]2984-you took everything from [me]0-i -- first [my]0-i hope of marrying [you]2984-you ; then [my]0-i chance of a big success in [my]0-i career ; and [I]0-i was desperate -- weak , if [you]2984-you like -- and tried to deaden [my]0-i feelings in order to keep up [my]0-i pluck . "[2984-you] Every word [you]2984-you say proves how unfit [you]2984-you are to assume any responsibility -- to do anything but try to recover [your]2984-you health . "[2984-you] Oh , [I]0-i 'm sorry for [you]2984-you -- very sorry ! Why do [you]2984-you try to deceive [me]0-i ? " "[2984-you] Why do [you]2984-you deceive _ [me]0-i _ ? " As [they]3006-they faced [each other]407-each other in silence [Justine]100-justine 's pity gave way to a sudden hatred for [the poor creature who stood shivering and sneering before [her]100-justine]4666-the poor creature who stood shivering and sneering before her . [He]2984-you was abominable -- but [he]2984-you was pitiable too . "[0-i] [I]0-i will really help [you]2984-you -- [I]0-i will see [[your]2984-you wife]4011-your wife and do what [I]0-i can -- but [I]0-i can give [you]2984-you no money today . " "[0-i] Why not ? " "[0-i] Because [I]0-i have none . [I]0-i am not as rich as [you]2984-you think . " [He]2984-you smiled incredulously . "[0-i] Give [me]0-i a line to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , then . " "[120-mr. langhope] No . " [He]2984-you sat down once more , leaning back with a weak assumption of ease . "[120-mr. langhope] Perhaps [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst will think differently . " [She]2984-you whitened , but said steadily : "[96-amherst] [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst is away . " "[96-amherst] Very well -- [I]0-i can write . " For the last five minutes [Justine]100-justine had foreseen this threat , and had tried to force [her]100-justine mind to face dispassionately the chances it involved . After all , why not let [him]2984-you write to [Amherst]96-amherst ? The very vileness of the deed must rouse an indignation which would be all in [her]100-justine favour , would inevitably dispose [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband to readier sympathy with the motive of [her]100-justine act , as contrasted with the base insinuations of [her]100-justine slanderer . It seemed impossible that [Amherst]96-amherst should condemn [her]100-justine when [his]96-amherst condemnation involved the fulfilling of [Wyant]165-wyant 's calculations : a reaction of scorn would throw [him]96-amherst into unhesitating championship of [her]100-justine conduct . All this was so clear that , had [she]100-justine been advising [any one else]3853-any one else , [her]100-justine confidence in the course to be taken might have strengthened the feeblest will ; but with the question lying between [herself]100-justine and [Amherst]96-amherst -- with the vision of those soiled hands literally laid on the spotless fabric of [her]100-justine happiness , judgment wavered , foresight was obscured -- [she]100-justine felt tremulously unable to face the steps between exposure and vindication . [Her]100-justine final conclusion was that [she]100-justine must , at any rate , gain time : buy off [Wyant]165-wyant till [she]100-justine had been able to tell [her]100-justine story in [her]100-justine own way , and at [her]100-justine own hour , and then defy [him]165-wyant when [he]165-wyant returned to the assault . The idea that whatever concession [she]100-justine made would be only provisional , helped to excuse the weakness of making it , and enabled [her]100-justine at last , without too painful a sense of falling below [her]100-justine own standards , to reply in a low voice : "[0-i] If [you]3010-you 'll go now , [I]0-i will send [you]3010-you something next week . " But [Wyant]165-wyant did not respond as readily as [she]100-justine had expected . [He]165-wyant merely asked , without altering [his]165-wyant insolently easy attitude : "[0-i] How much ? Unless it 's a good deal , [I]0-i prefer the letter . " Oh , why could [she]100-justine not cry out : "[0-i] Leave [the house]311-the house at once -- [your]0-i vulgar threats are nothing to me"--Why could [she]100-justine not even say in [her]100-justine own heart : _ [I]0-i will tell [[my]0-i husband]3575-my husband tonight ? _ "[0-i] [You]3010-you 're afraid , " said [Wyant]165-wyant , as if answering [her]3010-you thought . "[3010-you] What 's the use of being afraid when [you]3010-you can make [yourself]3010-you comfortable so easily ? [You]3010-you called [me]0-i [a systematic blackmailer]3012-a systematic blackmailer -- well , [I]0-i 'm not that yet . Give [me]0-i a thousand and [you]3010-you 'll see the last of [me]0-i -- on what used to be [my]0-i honour . " [Justine]100-justine 's heart sank . [She]0-i had reached the point of being ready to appeal again to [Amherst]96-amherst -- but on what pretext could [she]0-i ask for such a sum ? In a lifeless voice [she]0-i said : "[3010-you] [I]0-i could not possibly get more than one or two hundred . " [Wyant]165-wyant scrutinized [her]0-i a moment : [her]0-i despair must have rung true to [him]165-wyant . "[3010-you] Well , [you]3010-you must have something of [your]3010-you own -- [I]0-i saw [your]3010-you jewelry last night at [the theatre]2229-the theatre , " [he]165-wyant said . So it had been [he]165-wyant -- and [he]165-wyant had sat there appraising [her]0-i value like [a murderer]4670-a murderer ! "[3010-you] Jewelry-- ? " [she]0-i faltered . "[0-i] [You]0-i had a thumping big sapphire -- wasn't it?--with diamonds round it . " It was [her]0-i only jewel -- [Amherst]96-amherst 's marriage gift . [She]0-i would have preferred a less valuable present , but [[his]96-amherst mother]396-his mother had persuaded [her]0-i to accept it , saying that it was [the bride]4672-the bride 's duty to adorn [herself]0-i for [the bridegroom]4673-the bridegroom . "[0-i] [I]0-i will give [you]0-i nothing-- " [she]0-i was about to exclaim ; when suddenly [her]0-i eyes fell on the clock . If [Amherst]96-amherst had caught the two o'clock express [he]96-amherst would be at [the house]311-the house within the hour ; and the only thing that seemed of consequence now , was that [he]96-amherst should not meet [Wyant]165-wyant . Supposing [she]0-i still found courage to refuse -- there was no knowing how long the humiliating scene might be prolonged : and [she]0-i must be rid of [the creature]4675-the creature at any cost . After all , [she]0-i seldom wore the sapphire -- months might pass without its absence being noted by [Amherst]96-amherst 's careless eye ; and if [Wyant]165-wyant should pawn it , [she]0-i might somehow save money to buy it back before it was missed . [She]0-i went through these calculations with feverish rapidity ; then [she]0-i turned again to [Wyant]165-wyant . "[0-i] [You]0-i wo n't come back -- ever ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i swear [I]0-i wo n't , " [he]165-wyant said . [He]165-wyant moved away toward the window , as if to spare [her]0-i ; and [she]0-i turned and slowly left [the room]3355-the room . [She]0-i never forgot the moments that followed . Once outside the door [she]0-i was in such haste that [she]0-i stumbled on the stairs , and had to pause on the landing to regain [her]0-i breath . In [[her]0-i room]1426-her room [she]0-i found [one of [the housemaids]4679-the housemaids]4678-one of the housemaids busy , and at first could think of no pretext for dismissing [her]0-i . Then [she]0-i bade [the woman]4680-the woman go down and send [the brougham]2137-the brougham away , telling [the coachman]2235-the coachman to call for [Miss Cicely]130-cicely at six . Left alone , [she]0-i bolted the door , and as if with [a thief]4683-a thief 's hand , opened [her]0-i wardrobe , unlocked [her]0-i jewel - box , and drew out the sapphire in its flat morocco case . [She]0-i restored the box to its place , the key to its ring -- then [she]0-i opened the case and looked at the sapphire . As [she]0-i did so , a little tremor ran over [her]0-i neck and throat , and closing [her]0-i eyes [she]0-i felt [[her]0-i husband]3393-her husband 's kiss , and the touch of [his]3393-her husband hands as [he]3393-her husband fastened on the jewel . [She]0-i unbolted the door , listened intently on [the landing]1583-the landing , and then went slowly down [the stairs]1577-the stairs . [None of [the servants]746-the servants]4687-none of the servants were in sight , yet as [she]0-i reached [the lower hall]4689-the lower hall [she]0-i was conscious that the air had grown suddenly colder , as though the outer door had just been opened . [She]0-i paused , and listened again . There was a sound of talking in [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room . Could it be that in [her]0-i absence [a visitor]4654-a visitor had been admitted ? The possibility frightened [her]0-i at first -- then [she]0-i welcomed it as an unexpected means of ridding [herself]0-i of [[her]0-i tormentor]4692-her tormentor . [She]0-i opened the drawing - room door , and saw [[her]0-i husband]3393-her husband talking with [Wyant]165-wyant . XXXV [AMHERST]96-amherst , [his]96-amherst back to the threshold , sat at a table writing : [Wyant]165-wyant stood a few feet away , staring down at the fire . [Neither]234-neither had heard the door open ; and before [they]4694-they were aware of [her]0-i entrance [Justine]100-justine had calculated that [she]0-i must have been away for at least five minutes , and that in that space of time almost anything might have passed between [them]4694-they . For a moment the power of connected thought left [her]0-i ; then [her]0-i heart gave a bound of relief . [She]0-i said to [herself]0-i that [Wyant]165-wyant had doubtless made some allusion to [his]165-wyant situation , and that [[her]0-i husband]3393-her husband , conscious only of a great debt of gratitude , had at once sat down to draw a cheque for [him]165-wyant . The idea was so reassuring that it restored all [her]0-i clearness of thought . [Wyant]165-wyant was the first to see [her]0-i . [He]165-wyant made an abrupt movement , and [Amherst]96-amherst , rising , turned and put an envelope in [his]96-amherst hand . "[0-i] There , [[my]0-i dear]3368-my dear fellow---- " As [he]96-amherst turned [he]96-amherst caught sight of [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife . "[0-i] [I]0-i caught [the twelve o'clock train]3015-the twelve o'clock train after all -- [you]3368-my dear got [my]0-i second wire ? " [he]96-amherst asked . "[3368-my dear] No , " [she]3368-my dear faltered , pressing [her]3368-my dear left hand , with the little case in it , close to the folds of [her]3368-my dear dress . "[3368-my dear] [I]0-i was afraid not . There was a bad storm at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , and [they]3016-they said there might be a delay . " At the same moment [she]3368-my dear found [Wyant]165-wyant advancing with extended hand , and understood that [he]165-wyant had concealed the fact of having already seen [her]3368-my dear . [She]3368-my dear accepted the cue , and shook [his]165-wyant hand , murmuring : "[3016-they] How do [you]0-i do ? " [Amherst]96-amherst looked at [her]3368-my dear , perhaps struck by [her]3368-my dear manner . "[0-i] [You]3368-my dear have not seen [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant since [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ? " "[165-wyant] No , " [she]3368-my dear answered , thankful to have this pretext for [her]3368-my dear emotion . "[165-wyant] [I]0-i have been telling [him]165-wyant that [he]165-wyant should not have left [us]3017-us so long without news -- especially as [he]165-wyant has been ill , and things have gone rather badly with [him]165-wyant . But [I]0-i hope [we]3017-us can help now . [He]165-wyant has heard that [Saint Christopher]87-saint christopher 's is looking for [a house - physician for [[the paying patients]3019-the paying patients ' wing]3020-the paying patients ' wing]3018-a house - physician for the paying patients ' wing , and as [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope is away [I]0-i have given [him]165-wyant a line to [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell . " "[178-mrs. ansell] Extremely kind of [you]0-i , " [Wyant]165-wyant murmured , passing [his]165-wyant hand over [his]165-wyant forehead . [Justine]100-justine stood silent . [She]100-justine wondered that [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband had not noticed that tremulous degraded hand . But [he]3393-her husband was always so blind to externals -- and [he]3393-her husband had no medical experience to sharpen [his]3393-her husband perceptions . Suddenly [she]0-i felt impelled to speak "[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant has been -- unfortunate . Of course [you]0-i will want to do everything to help [him]165-wyant ; but would it not be better to wait till [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope comes back ? " "[165-wyant] [Wyant]165-wyant thinks the delay might make [him]165-wyant lose [the place]3515-the place . It seems [the board]3022-the board meets tomorrow . And [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell really knows much more about it . Is n't [she]3023-she [the secretary of [the ladies]1817-the ladies ' committee]3024-the secretary of the ladies ' committee ? " "[3023-she] [I]0-i 'm not sure -- [I]0-i believe so . But surely [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope should be consulted . " [She]0-i felt [Wyant]165-wyant 's face change : [his]165-wyant eyes settled on [her]0-i in a threatening stare . [Amherst]96-amherst looked at [her]0-i also , and there was surprise in [his]96-amherst glance . "[120-mr. langhope] [I]0-i think [I]0-i can answer for [[my]0-i father - in - law]3026-my father - in - law . [He]3026-my father - in - law feels as strongly as [I]0-i do how much [we]3027-we all owe to [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant . " [He]96-amherst seldom spoke of [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope as [[his]96-amherst father - in - law]2004-his father - in - law , and the chance designation seemed to mark a closer tie between [them]3027-we , to exclude [Justine]100-justine from what was after all a family affair . For a moment [she]100-justine felt tempted to accept the suggestion , and let the responsibility fall where it would . But it would fall on [Amherst]96-amherst -- and that was intolerable . "[3026-my father - in - law] [I]0-i think [you]0-i ought to wait , " [she]100-justine insisted . An embarrassed silence settled on [the three]2296-the three . [Wyant]165-wyant broke it by advancing toward [Amherst]96-amherst . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall never forget [your]0-i kindness , " [he]165-wyant said ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i hope to prove to [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst that it 's not misplaced . " The words were well chosen , and well spoken ; [Justine]100-justine saw that they produced a good effect . [Amherst]96-amherst grasped [the physician]422-the physician 's hand with a smile . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear fellow]2977-my dear fellow , [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could do more . Be sure to call on [me]0-i again if [you]0-i want help . " "[0-i] Oh , [you]0-i 've put [me]0-i on [my]0-i feet , " said [Wyant]165-wyant gratefully . [He]96-amherst bowed slightly to [Justine]100-justine and turned to go ; but as [he]96-amherst reached the threshold [she]100-justine moved after [him]96-amherst . "[165-wyant] [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant -- [you]165-wyant must give back that letter . " [He]96-amherst stopped short with a whitening face . [She]100-justine felt [Amherst]96-amherst 's eyes on [her]100-justine again ; and [she]100-justine said desperately , addressing [him]96-amherst : "[165-wyant] [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant understands [my]0-i reasons . " [[Her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband 's glance turned abruptly to [Wyant]165-wyant . "[165-wyant] Do [you]165-wyant ? " [he]96-amherst asked after a pause . [Wyant]165-wyant looked from one to the other . The moisture came out on [his]165-wyant forehead , and [he]165-wyant passed [his]165-wyant hand over it again . "[165-wyant] Yes , " [he]96-amherst said in a dry voice . "[117-mrs. amherst] [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst wants [me]0-i farther off -- out of [New York]7-new york . " "[117-mrs. amherst] Out of [New York]7-new york ? What do [you]165-wyant mean ? " [Justine]100-justine interposed hastily , before the answer could come . "[165-wyant] It is because [Dr. Wyant]165-wyant is not in condition -- for such a place -- just at present . " "[165-wyant] But [he]165-wyant assures [me]0-i [he]165-wyant is quite well . " There was another silence ; and again [Wyant]165-wyant broke in , this time with a slight laugh . "[165-wyant] [I]0-i can explain what [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst means ; [she]117-mrs. amherst intends to accuse [me]0-i of the morphine habit . And [I]0-i can explain [her]117-mrs. amherst reason for doing so -- [she]117-mrs. amherst wants [me]0-i out of the way . " [Amherst]96-amherst turned on [the speaker]1483-the speaker ; and , as [she]100-justine had foreseen , [his]96-amherst look was terrible . "[117-mrs. amherst] [You]165-wyant have n't explained that yet , " [he]96-amherst said . "[165-wyant] Well -- [I]0-i can . " [Wyant]165-wyant waited another moment . "[0-i] [I]0-i know too much about [her]117-mrs. amherst , " [he]165-wyant declared . There was a low exclamation from [Justine]100-justine , and [Amherst]96-amherst strode toward [Wyant]165-wyant . "[0-i] [[You]165-wyant infernal blackguard]3029-you infernal blackguard ! " [he]96-amherst cried . "[165-wyant] Oh , gently---- " [Wyant]165-wyant muttered , flinching back from [his]96-amherst outstretched arm . "[165-wyant] [[My]0-i wife]3819-my wife 's wish is sufficient . Give [me]0-i back that letter . " [Wyant]165-wyant straightened [himself]165-wyant . "[156-god] No , by [God]156-god , [I]0-i wo n't ! " [he]165-wyant retorted furiously . "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't ask [you]165-wyant for it till [you]165-wyant offered to help [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i wo n't let it be taken back without a word , like a thief that [you]165-wyant 'd caught with [your]165-wyant umbrella . If [[your]165-wyant wife]4011-your wife wo n't explain [I]0-i will . [She]4011-your wife 's , afraid [I]0-i 'll talk about what happened at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . " [Amherst]96-amherst 's arm fell to [his]96-amherst side . "[4011-your wife] At [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ? " Behind [him]96-amherst there was a sound of inarticulate appeal -- but [he]96-amherst took no notice . "[4011-your wife] Yes . It 's [she]4011-your wife who used morphia -- but not on [herself]4011-your wife . [She]4011-your wife gives it to [other people]3861-other people . [She]4011-your wife gave an overdose to [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst . " [Amherst]96-amherst looked at [him]96-amherst confusedly . "[4011-your wife] An overdose ? " "[4011-your wife] Yes -- purposely , [I]0-i mean . And [I]0-i came into [the room]3355-the room at the wrong time . [I]0-i can prove that [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst died of morphia - poisoning . " "[159-john] [John]159-john ! " [Justine]100-justine gasped out , pressing between [them]4703-them . [Amherst]96-amherst gently put aside the hand with which [she]100-justine had caught [his]96-amherst arm . "[159-john] Wait a moment : this ca n't rest here . [You]117-mrs. amherst ca n't want it to , " [he]96-amherst said to [her]117-mrs. amherst in an undertone . "[0-i] [You]117-mrs. amherst can see [I]0-i am not wanted [here]3415-here , " [Wyant]165-wyant threw in with a sneer . [Amherst]96-amherst remained silent for a brief space ; then [he]96-amherst turned [his]96-amherst eyes once more to [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife . [Justine]100-justine lifted [her]100-justine face : it looked small and spent , like an extinguished taper . "[117-mrs. amherst] It 's true , " [she]100-justine said . "[117-mrs. amherst] True ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i _ did _ give [...]3036-she an overdose ... intentionally , when [I]0-i knew there was no hope , and when [the surgeons]2402-the surgeons said [she]3036-she might go on suffering . [She]3036-she was very strong ... and [I]0-i could n't bear it ... [you]0-i could n't have borne it .... " There was another silence ; then [she]100-justine went on in a stronger voice , looking straight at [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband : "[0-i] And now will [you]0-i send [this man]3038-this man away ? " [Amherst]96-amherst glanced at [Wyant]165-wyant without moving . "[0-i] Go , " [he]96-amherst said curtly . [Wyant]165-wyant , instead , moved a step nearer . "[0-i] Just a minute , please . It 's only fair to hear [my]0-i side . [[Your]0-i wife]4011-your wife says there was no hope ; yet the day before [she]4011-your wife ... gave the dose , [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford told [her]4011-your wife in [my]0-i presence that [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst might live . " Again [Amherst]96-amherst 's eyes addressed [themselves]4706-themselves slowly to [Justine]100-justine ; and [she]100-justine forced [her]100-justine lips to articulate an answer . "[95-dr. garford] [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford said ... [one]3402-one could never tell ... but [I]0-i know [he]95-dr. garford did n't believe in the chance of recovery ... [no one]3425-no one did . " "[95-dr. garford] [Dr. Garford]95-dr. garford is dead , " said [Wyant]165-wyant grimly . [Amherst]96-amherst strode up to [him]165-wyant again . "[3042-you] [[You]3042-you scoundrel]3043-you scoundrel -- leave [the house]311-the house ! " [he]96-amherst commanded . But still [Wyant]165-wyant sneeringly stood [his]165-wyant ground . "[3042-you] Not till [I]0-i 've finished . [I]0-i ca n't afford to let [myself]0-i be kicked out like a dog because [I]0-i happen to be in the way . [Every doctor]3045-every doctor knows that in cases of spinal lesion recovery is becoming more and more frequent -- if [the patient]258-the patient survives the third week there 's every reason to hope . Those are the facts as they would appear to [any surgeon]3047-any surgeon . If they 're not true , why is [Mrs. Amherst]117-mrs. amherst afraid of having [them]3048-them stated ? Why has [she]117-mrs. amherst been paying [me]0-i for nearly a year to keep [them]3048-them quiet ? " "[117-mrs. amherst] Oh---- " [Justine]100-justine moaned . "[0-i] [I]0-i never thought of talking till luck went against [me]0-i . Then [I]0-i asked [her]117-mrs. amherst for help -- and reminded [her]117-mrs. amherst of certain things . After that [she]117-mrs. amherst kept [me]0-i supplied pretty regularly . " [He]4707-he thrust [his]4707-he shaking hand into an inner pocket . "[117-mrs. amherst] Here are [her]117-mrs. amherst envelopes ... [Quebec]88-quebec ... [Montreal]89-montreal ... [Saranac]90-saranac ... [I]0-i know just where [you]3049-you went on [your]3049-you honeymoon . [She]117-mrs. amherst had to write often , because the sums were small . Why did [she]117-mrs. amherst do it , if [she]117-mrs. amherst was n't afraid ? And why did [she]117-mrs. amherst go [upstairs]1423-upstairs just now to fetch [me]0-i something ? If [you]3049-you do n't believe [me]0-i , ask [her]117-mrs. amherst what [she]117-mrs. amherst 's got in [her]117-mrs. amherst hand . " [Amherst]96-amherst did not heed this injunction . [He]96-amherst stood motionless , gripping the back of a chair , as if [his]96-amherst next gesture might be to lift and hurl it at the speaker . "[3049-you] Ask her---- " [Wyant]165-wyant repeated . [Amherst]96-amherst turned [his]96-amherst head slowly , and [his]96-amherst dull gaze rested on [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife . [His]96-amherst face looked years older -- lips and eyes moved as heavily as [an old man]4709-an old man 's . As [he]96-amherst looked at [her]3350-his wife , [Justine]100-justine came forward without speaking , and laid the little morocco case in [his]96-amherst hand . [He]96-amherst held it there a moment , as if hardly understanding [her]100-justine action -- then [he]96-amherst tossed it on the table at [his]96-amherst elbow , and walked up to [Wyant]165-wyant . "[3052-you hound] [[You]3051-you hound]3052-you hound , " [he]96-amherst said--"now[3051-you] go ! " XXXVI WHEN [Wyant]165-wyant had left [the room]3355-the room , and the house - door had closed on [him]96-amherst , [Amherst]96-amherst spoke to [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife . "[3051-you] Come [upstairs]1423-upstairs , " [he]96-amherst said . [Justine]100-justine followed [him]96-amherst , scarcely conscious where [she]100-justine went , but moving already with a lighter tread . Part of [her]100-justine weight of misery had been lifted with [Wyant]165-wyant 's going . [She]100-justine had suffered less from the fear of what [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband might think than from the shame of making [her]100-justine avowal in [her]100-justine defamer 's presence . And [her]100-justine faith in [Amherst]96-amherst 's comprehension had begun to revive . [He]96-amherst had dismissed [Wyant]165-wyant with scorn and horror -- did not that show that [he]96-amherst was on [her]100-justine side already ? And how many more arguments [she]100-justine had at [her]100-justine call ! [Her]100-justine brain hummed with them as [she]100-justine followed [him]96-amherst up [the stairs]1577-the stairs . In [[her]100-justine bedroom]4714-her bedroom [he]96-amherst closed the door and stood motionless , the same heavy half - paralyzed look on [his]96-amherst face . It frightened [her]100-justine and [she]100-justine went up to [him]96-amherst . "[159-john] [John]159-john ! " [she]100-justine said timidly . [He]96-amherst put [his]96-amherst hand to [his]96-amherst head . "[159-john] Wait a moment---- " [he]96-amherst returned ; and [she]100-justine waited , [her]100-justine heart slowly sinking again . The moment over , [he]96-amherst seemed to recover [his]96-amherst power of movement . [He]96-amherst crossed [the room]3355-the room and threw [himself]96-amherst into the armchair near the hearth . "[159-john] Now tell [me]0-i everything . " [He]96-amherst sat thrown back , [his]96-amherst eyes fixed on the fire , and the vertical lines between [his]96-amherst brows forming a deep scar in [his]96-amherst white face . [Justine]100-justine moved nearer , and touched [his]96-amherst arm beseechingly . "[159-john] Wo n't [you]159-john look at [me]0-i ? " [He]96-amherst turned [his]96-amherst head slowly , as if with an effort , and [his]96-amherst eyes rested reluctantly on [hers]100-justine . "[159-john] Oh , not like that ! " [she]100-justine exclaimed . [He]96-amherst seemed to make a stronger effort at self - control . "[159-john] Please do n't heed [me]0-i -- but say what there is to say , " [he]96-amherst said in a level voice , [his]96-amherst gaze on the fire . [She]100-justine stood before [him]96-amherst , [her]100-justine arms hanging down , [her]100-justine clasped fingers twisting restlessly . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know that there is much to say -- beyond what [I]0-i 've told [you]159-john . " There was a slight sound in [Amherst]96-amherst 's throat , like the ghost of a derisive laugh . After another interval [he]96-amherst said : "[0-i] [I]0-i wish to hear exactly what happened . " [She]100-justine seated [herself]100-justine on the edge of a chair near by , bending forward , with hands interlocked and arms extended on [her]100-justine knees -- every line reaching out to [him]96-amherst , as though [her]100-justine whole slight body were an arrow winged with pleadings . It was a relief to speak at last , even face to face with the stony image that sat in [[her]100-justine husband]3393-her husband 's place ; and [she]100-justine told [her]100-justine story , detail by detail , omitting nothing , exaggerating nothing , speaking slowly , clearly , with precision , aware that the bare facts were [her]100-justine strongest argument . [Amherst]96-amherst , as [he]96-amherst listened , shifted [his]96-amherst position once , raising [his]96-amherst hand so that it screened [his]96-amherst face ; and in that attitude [he]96-amherst remained when [she]100-justine had ended . As [she]100-justine waited for [him]96-amherst to speak , [Justine]100-justine realized that [her]100-justine heart had been alive with tremulous hopes . All through [her]100-justine narrative [she]100-justine had counted on a murmur of perception , an exclamation of pity : [she]100-justine had felt sure of melting the stony image . But [Amherst]96-amherst said no word . At length [he]96-amherst spoke , still without turning [his]96-amherst head . "[0-i] [You]3054-you have not told [me]0-i why [you]3054-you kept this from [me]0-i . " A sob formed in [her]100-justine throat , and [she]100-justine had to wait to steady [her]100-justine voice . "[3054-you] No -- that was [my]0-i wrong -- [my]0-i weakness . When [I]0-i did it [I]0-i never thought of being afraid to tell [you]0-i -- [I]0-i had talked it over with [you]0-i in [my]0-i own mind ... so often ... before .... " "[0-i] Well ? " "[0-i] Then--- when [you]0-i came back it was harder ... though [I]0-i was still sure [you]0-i would approve [me]0-i . " "[0-i] Why harder ? " "[0-i] Because at first -- at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook -- [I]0-i _ could not _ tell it all over , in detail , as [I]0-i have now ... it was beyond human power ... and without doing so , [I]0-i could n't make it all clear to [you]0-i ... and so should only have added to [your]0-i pain . [no one who was not there]3056-no one who was not there could judge ... and [I]0-i wanted to spare [you]0-i .... " "[0-i] And afterward ? " [She]0-i had shrunk in advance from this question , and [she]0-i could not answer it at once . To gain time [she]0-i echoed it . "[0-i] Afterward ? " "[0-i] Did it never occur to [you]0-i , when [we]3057-we met later -- when [you]0-i first went to [Mr. Langhope----]236-mr. langhope---- " ? "[0-i] To tell [you]0-i then ? [No one who was not there at the time]3058-no one who was not there at the time could know what it was to see [her]3059-her suffer . " "[0-i] [You]0-i thought it all over , then -- decided definitely against telling [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i did not have to think long . [I]0-i felt [I]0-i had done right -- [I]0-i still feel so -- and [I]0-i was sure [you]0-i would feel so , if [you]0-i were in the same circumstances . " There was another pause . Then [Amherst]96-amherst said : "[0-i] And last September -- at [Hanaford]1-hanaford ? " It was the word for which [she]0-i had waited -- the word of [her]0-i inmost fears . [She]0-i felt the blood mount to [her]0-i face . "[0-i] Did [you]0-i see no difference -- no special reason for telling [me]0-i then ? " "[0-i] Yes---- " [she]0-i faltered . "[0-i] Yet [you]0-i said nothing . " "[0-i] No . " Silence again . [Her]0-i eyes strayed to the clock , and some dim association of ideas told [her]0-i that [Cicely]130-cicely would soon be coming in . "[0-i] Why did [you]0-i say nothing ? " [He]96-amherst lowered [his]96-amherst hand and turned toward [her]0-i as [he]96-amherst spoke ; and [she]0-i looked up and faced [him]96-amherst . "[0-i] Because [I]0-i regarded the question as settled . [I]0-i had decided it in [my]0-i own mind months before , and had never regretted [my]0-i decision . " broke from [him]3062-that cur harshly , and [she]0-i drew back , cut to the heart . "[159-john] [John]159-john -- [John]159-john ! Is that all [you]159-john have to say ? " "[159-john] What more is there ? " "[159-john] What more ? Everything!--What right have [you]159-john to turn from [me]0-i as if [I]0-i were [a murderess]3068-a murderess ? [I]0-i did nothing but what [your]159-john own reason , [your]159-john own arguments , have justified a hundred times ! [I]0-i made a mistake in not telling [you]159-john at once -- but a mistake is not a crime . It ca n't be [your]159-john real feeling that turns [you]159-john from [me]0-i -- it must be the dread of what [other people]3861-other people would think ! But when have [you]159-john cared for what [other people]3861-other people thought ? When have [your]159-john own actions been governed by it ? " [He]159-john moved another step without speaking , and [she]0-i caught [him]159-john by the arm . "[159-john] No ! [you]159-john sha'n't go -- not like that!--Wait ! "[159-john] Read it -- read it ! " [she]0-i commanded ; and mechanically [he]159-john read out the words [he]159-john had written . "[159-john] _ La vraie morale se moque de la morale .... " [he]159-john exclaimed , flinging the book from [him]159-john with a gesture of abhorrence .
