[I]0-i thought [you]159-john meant it ! " [she]0-i cried , as the book spun across a table and dropped to the floor . [He]159-john looked at [her]0-i coldly , almost apprehensively , as if [she]0-i had grown suddenly dangerous and remote ; then [he]159-john turned and walked out of [the room]3355-the room . * * * * * The striking of the clock roused [her]0-i . [She]0-i rose to [her]0-i feet , rang the bell , and told [the maid]4369-the maid , through the door , that [she]0-i had a headache , and was unable to see [Miss Cicely]130-cicely . Then [she]0-i turned back into [the room]3355-the room , and darkness closed on [her]0-i . [She]0-i was not the kind to take grief passively -- it drove [her]0-i in anguished pacings up and down the floor . [She]0-i walked and walked till [her]0-i legs flagged under [her]0-i ; then [she]0-i dropped stupidly into the chair where [Amherst]170-bessy had sat .... All [[her]0-i world]1145-her world had crumbled about [her]0-i . It was as if some law of mental gravity had been mysteriously suspended , and every firmly - anchored conviction , every accepted process of reasoning , spun disconnectedly through space . [Amherst]170-bessy had not understood [her]0-i -- worse still , [he]4723-he had judged [her]0-i as [the world]259-the world might judge [her]0-i ! The core of [her]0-i misery was there . With terrible clearness [she]0-i saw the suspicion that had crossed [his]4723-he mind -- the suspicion that [she]0-i had kept silence in the beginning because [she]0-i loved [him]4723-he , and feared to lose [him]4723-he if [she]0-i spoke . And what if it were true ? What if [her]0-i unconscious guilt went back even farther than [his]4723-he thought dared to track it ? [She]0-i could not now recall a time when [she]0-i had not loved [him]4723-he . Every chance meeting with [him]4723-he , from [their]4725-their first brief talk at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , stood out embossed and glowing against the blur of lesser memories . Was it possible that [she]0-i had loved [him]4723-he during [Bessy]170-bessy 's life -- that [she]0-i had even , sub - consciously , blindly , been urged by [her]0-i feeling for [him]4723-he to perform the act ? But [she]0-i shook [herself]0-i free from this morbid horror -- the rebound of health was always prompt in [her]0-i , and [her]0-i mind instinctively rejected every form of moral poison . No ! [Her]0-i motive had been normal , sane and justifiable -- completely justifiable . [Her]0-i fault lay in having dared to rise above conventional restrictions , [her]0-i mistake in believing that [[her]0-i husband]3393-her husband could rise with [her]0-i . These reflections steadied [her]0-i but they did not bring much comfort . For [her]0-i whole life was centred in [Amherst]170-bessy , and [she]0-i saw that [he]4723-he would never be able to free [himself]4723-he from the traditional view of [her]0-i act . In looking back , and correcting [her]0-i survey of [his]4723-he character in the revealing light of the last hours , [she]0-i perceived that , like [many men of emancipated thought]4727-many men of emancipated thought , [he]4723-he had remained subject to the old conventions of feeling . And [he]4723-he had probably never given much thought to [women]497-women till [he]4723-he met [her]0-i -- had always been content to deal with [them]497-women in the accepted currency of sentiment . After all , it was the currency [they]497-women liked best , and for which [they]497-women offered [their]497-women prettiest wares ! But what of the intellectual accord between [himself]4723-he and [her]0-i ? [She]0-i had not been deceived in that ! [He]4723-he and [she]0-i had really been wedded in mind as well as in heart . But until now there had not arisen in [their]497-women lives one of those searching questions which call into play emotions rooted far below reason and judgment , in the dark primal depths of inherited feeling . It is easy to judge impersonal problems intellectually , turning on them the full light of acquired knowledge ; but too often [one]3402-one must still grope [one]3402-one 's way through the personal difficulty by the dim taper carried in long - dead hands .... But was there then no hope of lifting [one]3402-one 's individual life to a clearer height of conduct ? Must [one]3402-one be content to think for the race , and to feel only -- feel blindly and incoherently -- for [one]3402-one 's self ? And was it not from such natures as [Amherst's]237-amherst's -- natures in which independence of judgment was blent with strong human sympathy -- that the liberating impulse should come ? [Her]0-i mind grew weary of revolving in this vain circle of questions . The fact was that , in [their]497-women particular case , [Amherst]170-bessy had not risen above prejudice and emotion ; that , though [her]0-i act was one to which [his]4723-he intellectual sanction was given , [he]4723-he had turned from [her]0-i with instinctive repugnance , had dishonoured [her]0-i by the most wounding suspicions . The tie between [them]497-women was forever stained and debased . [Justine]100-justine 's long hospital - discipline made it impossible for [her]0-i to lose consciousness of the lapse of time , or to let [her]0-i misery thicken into mental stupor . [She]0-i could not help thinking and moving ; and [she]0-i presently lifted [herself]0-i to [her]0-i feet , turned on the light , and began to prepare for dinner . It would be terrible to face [[her]0-i husband]3393-her husband across [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's pretty dinner - table , and afterward in [the charming drawing - room]4735-the charming drawing - room , with [its]4735-the charming drawing - room delicate old ornaments and intimate luxurious furniture ; but [she]0-i could not continue to sit motionless in the dark : it was [her]0-i innermost instinct to pick [herself]0-i up and go on . While [she]0-i dressed [she]0-i listened anxiously for [Amherst]170-bessy 's step in [the next room]427-the next room ; but there was no sound , and when [she]0-i dragged [herself]0-i downstairs [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room was empty , and [the parlour - maid]2694-the parlour - maid , after a decent delay , came to ask if dinner should be postponed . [She]0-i said no , murmuring some vague pretext for [[her]0-i husband]3393-her husband 's absence , and sitting alone through the succession of courses which composed the brief but carefully - studied _ menu _ . When this ordeal was over [she]0-i returned to [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room and took up a book . It chanced to be a new volume on labour problems , which [Amherst]170-bessy must have brought back with [him]3393-her husband from [Westmore]104-westmore ; and it carried [her]0-i thoughts instantly to [the mills]3324-the mills . Would this disaster poison [their]4742-their work [there]3361-there as well as [their]4742-their personal relation ? Would [he]3393-her husband think of [her]0-i as carrying contamination even into the task [their]4742-their love had illumined ? The hours went on without [his]3393-her husband returning , and at length it occurred to [her]0-i that [he]3393-her husband might have taken the night train to [Hanaford]1-hanaford . [Her]0-i heart contracted at the thought : [she]0-i remembered -- though every nerve shrank from the analogy -- [his]3393-her husband sudden flight at another crisis in [his]3393-her husband life , and [she]0-i felt obscurely that if [he]3393-her husband escaped from [her]0-i now [she]0-i would never recover [her]0-i hold on [him]3393-her husband . But could [he]3393-her husband be so cruel -- could [he]3393-her husband wish [any one]3517-any one to suffer as [she]0-i was suffering ? At ten o'clock [she]0-i could endure [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room no longer , and went up to [[her]0-i room]1426-her room again . [She]0-i undressed slowly , trying to prolong the process as much as possible , to put off the period of silence and inaction which would close in on [her]0-i when [she]0-i lay down on [her]0-i bed . But at length the dreaded moment came -- there was nothing more between [her]0-i and the night . [She]0-i crept into bed and put out the light ; but as [she]0-i slipped between the cold sheets a trembling seized [her]0-i , and after a moment [she]0-i drew on [her]0-i dressing - gown again and groped [her]0-i way to the lounge by the fire . [She]0-i pushed [the lounge]1433-the lounge closer to the hearth and lay down , still shivering , though [she]0-i had drawn the quilted coverlet up to [her]0-i chin . [She]0-i lay there a long time , with closed eyes , in a mental darkness torn by sudden flashes of memory . In one of these flashes a phrase of [Amherst]170-bessy 's stood out -- a word spoken at [Westmore]104-westmore , on the day of the opening of [the Emergency Hospital]1319-the emergency hospital , about [a good - looking young man who had called to see [her]0-i]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her . And no doubt it _ was [_ Wyant]165-wyant -- [Wyant who had come to [Hanaford]1-hanaford to threaten [her]0-i , and who , baffled by [her]0-i non - arrival , or for some other unexplained reason , had left again without carrying out [his]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her purpose]238-hanaford . " ... Already [she]0-i was feeling [Amherst]170-bessy 's pain more than [her]0-i own , understanding that it was harder to bear than [hers]0-i because it was at war with all the reflective part of [his]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her nature . [She]0-i turned cold , and lay listening with strained ears .... Yes ; now there was a step on the stairs -- [[her]0-i husband]3393-her husband 's step ! [She]0-i heard [him]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her turn into [[his]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her own room]1783-his own room . Then [her]0-i door opened and [he]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her entered . [He]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her stumbled slightly in the darkness before [he]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her found the switch of the lamp ; and as [he]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her bent over it [she]0-i saw that [his]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her face was flushed , and that [his]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her eyes had an excited light which , in any one less abstemious , might almost have seemed like the effect of wine . "[159-john] Are [you]3075-you awake ? " [he]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her asked . And so [they]3077-they managed to let [me]0-i run across [him]3062-that cur -- by the merest accident -- and [I]0-i gave [him]3062-that cur something to remember . " [He]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her spoke in a strong clear voice that had a brightness like the brightness in [his]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her eyes . " As [she]0-i questioned [him]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her , there rose before [her]0-i the terrified vision of [a crowd gathering]4757-a crowd gathering -- [the police]4758-the police , newspapers , a hideous publicity . [He]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her must have been mad to do it -- and yet [he]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her must have done it because [he]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her loved [her]0-i ! "[159-john] No -- no . Do n't be afraid . [The powers]3079-the powers looked after that too . There was [no one]3425-no one about -- and [I]0-i do n't think [he]3081-he 'll talk much about it . " [She]0-i trembled , fearing yet adoring [him]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her . Nothing could have been more unlike the Amherst [she]0-i fancied [she]0-i knew than this act of irrational anger which had magically lifted the darkness from [his]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her spirit ; yet , magically also , it gave [him]4749-a good - looking young man who had called to see her back to [her]0-i , made [them]4759-them one flesh once more . And suddenly the pressure of opposed emotions became too strong , and [she]0-i burst into tears . [She]0-i wept painfully , violently , with the resistance of strong natures unused to emotional expression ; till at length , through the tumult of [her]0-i tears , [she]0-i felt [[her]0-i husband]3393-her husband 's reassuring touch . "[100-justine] [Justine]100-justine , " [he]3393-her husband said , speaking once more in [his]3393-her husband natural voice . " And in the clasp of [his]3393-her husband arms [her]0-i terror and anguish subsided , giving way , not to the deep peace of tranquillized thought , but to a confused well - being that lulled all thought to sleep . XXXVII BUT thought could never be long silent between [them]3089-they ; and [Justine]100-justine 's triumph lasted but a day . With its end [she]100-justine saw what it had been made of : the ascendency of youth and sex over [his]3393-her husband subjugated judgment . [Her]100-justine first impulse was to try and maintain it -- why not use the protective arts with which love inspired [her]100-justine ? [She]100-justine who lived so keenly in the brain could live as intensely in [her]100-justine feelings ; [her]100-justine quick imagination tutored [her]100-justine looks and words , taught [her]100-justine the spells to weave about shorn giants . And for a few days [she]100-justine and [Amherst]170-bessy lost [themselves]3089-they in this self - evoked cloud of passion , both clinging fast to the visible , the palpable in [their]3089-they relation , as if conscious already that its finer essence had fled . [Amherst]170-bessy made no allusion to what had passed , asked for no details , offered no reassurances -- behaved as if the whole episode had been effaced from [his]3393-her husband mind . And from [Wyant]238-hanaford there came no sound : [he]3393-her husband seemed to have disappeared from life as [he]3393-her husband had from [their]3089-they talk . Toward the end of the week [Amherst]170-bessy announced that [he]3393-her husband must return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford ; and [Justine]100-justine at once declared [her]100-justine intention of going with [him]3393-her husband . [He]3393-her husband seemed surprised , disconcerted almost ; and for the first time the shadow of what had happened fell visibly between [them]3089-they . "[3090-you] But ought [you]3090-you to leave [Cicely]130-cicely before [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope comes back ? " [he]3393-her husband suggested . "[120-mr. langhope] [He]120-mr. langhope will be here in two days . " "[120-mr. langhope] But [he]120-mr. langhope will expect to find [you]3090-you . " "[120-mr. langhope] It is almost the first of April . [We]3091-we are to have [Cicely]130-cicely with [us]3091-we for the summer . " There was in fact no reason that [he]3393-her husband could produce ; and the next day [they]3089-they returned to [Hanaford]1-hanaford together . With [her]100-justine perceptions strung to the last pitch of sensitiveness , [she]100-justine felt a change in [Amherst]170-bessy as soon as [they]3089-they re - entered [[Bessy]170-bessy 's house]4762-bessy 's house . [He]3393-her husband was still scrupulously considerate , almost too scrupulously tender ; but with a tinge of lassitude , like [a man who tries to keep up under the stupefying approach of illness]4763-a man who tries to keep up under the stupefying approach of illness . And [she]100-justine began to hate the power by which [she]100-justine held [him]3393-her husband . It was not thus [they]3089-they had once walked together , free in mind though so linked in habit and feeling ; when [their]3089-they love was not a deadening drug but a vivifying element that cleared thought instead of stifling it . There were moments when [she]100-justine felt that open alienation would be easier , because it would be nearer the truth . And at such moments [she]100-justine longed to speak , to beg [him]3393-her husband to utter [his]3393-her husband mind , to go with [her]100-justine once for all into the depths of the subject [they]3089-they continued to avoid . But at the last [her]100-justine heart always failed [her]100-justine : [she]100-justine could not face the thought of losing [him]3393-her husband , of hearing [him]3393-her husband speak estranging words to [her]100-justine . [They]3089-they had been at [Hanaford]1-hanaford for about ten days when , one morning at breakfast , [Amherst]170-bessy uttered a sudden exclamation over a letter [he]3393-her husband was reading . "[0-i] What is it ? " [she]100-justine asked in a tremor . "[0-i] What is it ? " [Justine]100-justine repeated , [her]100-justine fear growing . "[0-i] Please go out to [Westmore]104-westmore as usual -- as if nothing had happened . And tonight ... when [you]3118-his come back ... [I]0-i shall have decided . " "[0-i] Very well , " [he]3118-his repeated . "[0-i] [You]3118-his 'll be gone all day ? " [He]3118-his glanced at [his]3118-his watch . "[3118-his] Yes -- [I]0-i had meant to be ; unless---- " "[0-i] No ; [I]0-i would rather be alone . Good - bye , " [she]0-i said , letting [her]0-i hand slip softly along [his]3118-his coat - sleeve as [he]3118-his turned to the door . XXXVIII AT half - past six that afternoon , just as [Amherst]170-bessy , on [his]3118-his return from [the mills]3324-the mills , put the key into [his]3118-his door at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , in [New York]7-new york , was being shown into [[Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's library]4778-mr. langhope 's library . As [she]178-mrs. ansell entered , [[her]178-mrs. ansell friend]706-her friend rose from [his]706-her friend chair by the fire , and turned on [her]178-mrs. ansell a face so disordered by emotion that [she]178-mrs. ansell stopped short with an exclamation of alarm . "[118-mrs. dressel] [Henry]118-mrs. dressel -- what has happened ? Why did [you]118-mrs. dressel send for [me]0-i ? " "[118-mrs. dressel] Because [I]0-i could n't go to [you]118-mrs. dressel . [I]0-i could n't trust [myself]0-i in [the streets]3119-the streets -- in the light of day . " "[0-i] But why ? What is [it?--Not Cicely----]210-cicely---- ? " [He]706-her friend struck both hands upward with a comprehensive gesture . "[130-cicely] [Cicely]130-cicely -- [everyone]3120-everyone -- [the whole world]3121-the whole world ! " [His]706-her friend clenched fist came down on the table against which [he]706-her friend was leaning . "[123-maria] [Maria]123-maria , [[my]0-i girl]3122-my girl might have been saved ! " [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell looked at [him]706-her friend with growing perturbation . "[123-maria] [Saved]240-saved -- [Bessy]170-bessy 's life ? But how ? By whom ? " [He]706-her friend seated [himself]706-her friend opposite to [her]178-mrs. ansell , clutching at [his]706-her friend stick , and leaning [his]706-her friend weight heavily on it -- [a white dishevelled old man]4780-a white dishevelled old man . " [He]4782-he laughed silently , with a tear on [his]4782-he reddened eye - lids . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell groaned . "[0-i] [Henry]118-mrs. dressel , [you]118-mrs. dressel are raving -- [I]0-i understand less and less . " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't see how [I]0-i can speak more plainly . " [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , leaning back in [her]178-mrs. ansell chair , with hands meditatively stretched along its arms , gave [herself]178-mrs. ansell up to silent consideration of the fragmentary statements cast before [her]178-mrs. ansell . The long habit of ministering to [[her]178-mrs. ansell friends]1229-her friends in moments of perplexity and distress had given [her]178-mrs. ansell an almost judicial keenness in disentangling and coordinating facts incoherently presented , and in seizing on the thread of motive that connected them ; but [she]178-mrs. ansell had never before been confronted with a situation so poignant in itself , and bearing so intimately on [her]178-mrs. ansell personal feelings ; and [she]178-mrs. ansell needed time to free [her]178-mrs. ansell thoughts from the impending rush of emotion . " "[3137-she] Ah -- that 's it ! Why _ did _ [she]3137-she face [you]96-amherst ? " [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope raised [his]120-mr. langhope eyebrows slightly . "[96-amherst] [We]3164-we have n't seen [him]96-amherst since this became known to [him]96-amherst . _ [She]3137-she _ has ; and [she]3137-she let slip that [he]96-amherst was horror - struck . " [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell looked up with a quick exclamation . "[3137-she] Let slip ? Is n't it much more likely that [she]3137-she forced it on [you]0-i -- emphasized it to the last limit of credulity ? " [She]178-mrs. ansell sank [her]178-mrs. ansell hands to the arms of the chair , and exclaimed , looking [him]120-mr. langhope straight in the eyes : "[0-i] [You]0-i say [she]3137-she was frightened ? It strikes [me]0-i [she]3137-she was dauntless ! " [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope stared a moment ; then [he]120-mr. langhope said , with an ironic shrug : "[3137-she] No doubt , then , [she]3137-she counted on its striking [me]0-i too . " [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell breathed a shuddering sigh . "[3137-she] Oh , [I]0-i understand [your]0-i feeling as [you]0-i do -- I'm deep in the horror of it [myself]0-i . But [I]0-i ca n't help seeing that [this woman]3165-this woman might have saved [herself]3165-this woman -- and that [she]3165-this woman 's chosen to save [[her]3165-this woman husband]3393-her husband instead . What [I]0-i do n't see , from what [I]0-i know of [him]3393-her husband , " [she]0-i musingly proceeded , "[3137-she] is how , on any imaginable pretext , [she]3137-she will induce [him]3393-her husband to accept the sacrifice . " [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope made a resentful movement . "[3137-she] If that 's the only point [your]0-i mind dwells on---- ! " [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell looked up . "[3137-she] It does n't dwell anywhere as yet -- except , [my]0-i poor [Henry]118-mrs. dressel , " [she]0-i murmured , rising to move toward [him]120-mr. langhope , and softly laying [her]0-i hand on [his]120-mr. langhope bent shoulder--"except[118-mrs. dressel] on [your]118-mrs. dressel distress and misery -- on the very part [I]0-i ca n't yet talk of , ca n't question [you]118-mrs. dressel about .... " [He]120-mr. langhope let [her]0-i hand rest there a moment ; then [he]120-mr. langhope turned , and drawing it into [his]120-mr. langhope own tremulous fingers , pressed it silently , with a clinging helpless grasp that drew the tears to [her]0-i eyes . * * * * * [Justine Brent]100-justine , in [her]100-justine earliest girlhood , had gone through one of those emotional experiences that are the infantile diseases of the heart . [She]100-justine had fancied [herself]100-justine beloved of [a youth of [her]100-justine own age]4787-a youth of her own age ; had secretly returned [his]120-mr. langhope devotion , and had seen it reft from [her]100-justine by another . Such an incident , as inevitable as the measles , sometimes , like that mild malady , leaves traces out of all proportion to its actual virulence . The blow fell on [Justine]100-justine with tragic suddenness , and [she]100-justine reeled under it , thinking darkly of death , and renouncing all hopes of future happiness . [Her]100-justine ready pen often beguiled [her]100-justine into recording [her]100-justine impressions , and [she]100-justine now found an escape from despair in writing the history of [a damsel similarly wronged]4788-a damsel similarly wronged . In [her]100-justine tale , [the heroine]4196-the heroine killed [herself]4196-the heroine ; but [the author , saved by this vicarious sacrifice]4790-the author , saved by this vicarious sacrifice , lived , and in time even smiled over [her]100-justine manuscript . It was many years since [Justine Amherst]241-justine had recalled this youthful incident ; but the memory of it recurred to [her]100-justine as [she]100-justine turned from [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's door . For a moment death seemed the easiest escape from what confronted [her]100-justine ; but though [she]100-justine could no longer medicine [her]100-justine despair by turning it into fiction , [she]100-justine knew at once that [she]100-justine must somehow transpose it into terms of action , that [she]100-justine must always escape from life into more life , and not into its negation . [She]100-justine had been carried into [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's presence by that expiatory passion which still burns so high , and draws its sustenance from so deep down , in the unsleeping hearts of [women]497-women . Though [she]100-justine had never wavered in [her]100-justine conviction that [her]100-justine act had been justified [her]100-justine ideas staggered under the sudden comprehension of its consequences . Not till that morning had [she]100-justine seen those consequences in their terrible , unsuspected extent , had [she]100-justine understood how one stone rashly loosened from the laboriously erected structure of [human society]4792-human society may produce remote fissures in that clumsy fabric . [She]100-justine saw that , having hazarded the loosening of the stone , [she]100-justine should have held [herself]100-justine apart from ordinary human ties , like [some priestess set apart for the service of the temple]4793-some priestess set apart for the service of the temple . And instead , [she]100-justine had seized happiness with both hands , taken it as the gift of the very fate [she]100-justine had [herself]100-justine precipitated ! [She]100-justine remembered [some old Greek]4794-some old greek saying to the effect that [the gods]3946-the gods never forgive [the mortal who presumes to love and suffer like a god]4796-the mortal who presumes to love and suffer like a god . [She]100-justine had dared to do both , and [the gods]3946-the gods were bringing ruin on that deeper self which had its life in those about [her]100-justine . So much had become clear to [her]100-justine when [she]100-justine heard [Amherst]241-justine declare [his]4798-his intention of laying the facts before [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope . [His]4798-his few broken words lit up the farthest verge of [their]4799-their lives . [She]100-justine saw that [his]4798-his retrospective reverence for [[his]4798-his wife]3350-his wife 's memory , which was far as possible removed from the strong passion of the mind and senses that bound [him]4798-his to [herself]100-justine , was indelibly stained and desecrated by the discovery that all [he]4798-his had received from [the one woman]4801-the one woman had been won for [him]4798-his by the deliberate act of the other . This was what no reasoning , no appeal to the calmer judgment , could ever , in [his]4798-his inmost thoughts , undo or extenuate . It could find appeasement only in the renunciation of all that had come to [him]4798-his from [Bessy]170-bessy ; and this renunciation , so different from the mere sacrifice of material well - being , was bound up with consequences so far - reaching , so destructive to the cause which had inspired [his]4798-his whole life , that [Justine]241-justine felt the helpless terror of [the mortal who has launched one of the heavenly bolts]4802-the mortal who has launched one of the heavenly bolts . [She]241-justine could think of no way of diverting it but the way [she]241-justine had chosen . [She]241-justine must see [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope first , must clear [Amherst]170-bessy of the least faint association with [her]241-justine act or [her]241-justine intention . And to do this [she]241-justine must exaggerate , not [her]241-justine own compunction -- for [she]241-justine could not depart from the exact truth in reporting [her]241-justine feelings and convictions -- but [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband 's first instinctive movement of horror , the revulsion of feeling [her]241-justine confession had really produced in [him]4798-his . This was the most painful part of [her]241-justine task , and for this reason [her]241-justine excited imagination clothed it with a special expiatory value . If [she]241-justine could purchase [Amherst]170-bessy 's peace of mind , and the security of [his]4798-his future , by confessing , and even over - emphasizing , the momentary estrangement between [them]4804-them there would be a bitter joy in such payment ! [Her]241-justine hour with [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope proved the correctness of [her]241-justine intuition . [She]241-justine could save [Amherst]170-bessy only by effacing [herself]241-justine from [his]4798-his life : those about [him]4798-his would be only too ready to let [her]241-justine bear the full burden of obloquy . [She]241-justine could see that , for a dozen reasons , [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , even in the first shock of [his]120-mr. langhope dismay , unconsciously craved a way of exonerating [Amherst]170-bessy , of preserving intact the relation on which so much of [his]4798-his comfort had come to depend . And [she]241-justine had the courage to make the most of [his]4798-his desire , to fortify it by isolating [Amherst]170-bessy 's point of view from [hers]241-justine ; so that , when the hour was over , [she]241-justine had the solace of feeling that [she]241-justine had completely freed [him]4798-his from any conceivable consequence of [her]241-justine act . So far , the impetus of self - sacrifice had carried [her]241-justine straight to [her]241-justine goal ; but , as frequently happens with such atoning impulses , it left [her]241-justine stranded just short of any subsequent plan of conduct . [Her]241-justine next step , indeed , was clear enough : [she]241-justine must return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford , explain to [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband that [she]241-justine had felt impelled to tell [her]241-justine own story to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , and then take up [her]241-justine ordinary life till chance offered [her]241-justine a pretext for fulfilling [her]241-justine promise . But what pretext was likely to present itself ? No symbolic horn would sound the hour of fulfillment ; [she]241-justine must be [[her]241-justine own judge]4806-her own judge , and hear the call in the depths of [her]241-justine own conscience . XXXIX WHEN [Amherst]170-bessy , returning late that afternoon from [Westmore]104-westmore , learned of [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife 's departure , and read the note [she]3350-his wife had left , [he]3393-her husband found it , for a time , impossible to bring order out of the confusion of feeling produced in [him]3393-her husband . [His]3393-her husband mind had been disturbed enough before . All day , through the routine of work at [the mills]3324-the mills , [he]3393-her husband had laboured inwardly with the difficulties confronting [him]3393-her husband ; and [his]3393-her husband unrest had been increased by the fact that [his]3393-her husband situation bore an ironic likeness to that in which , from a far different cause , [he]3393-her husband had found [himself]3393-her husband at the other crisis of [his]3393-her husband life . Once more [he]3393-her husband was threatened with the possibility of having to give up [Westmore]167-cicely , at a moment when concentration of purpose and persistency of will were at last beginning to declare themselves in tangible results . Before , [he]3393-her husband had only given up dreams ; now it was [their]4809-their fruition that [he]3393-her husband was asked to surrender . And [he]3393-her husband was fixed in [his]3393-her husband resolve to withdraw absolutely from [Westmore]104-westmore if the statement [he]3393-her husband had to make to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope was received with the least hint of an offensive mental reservation . All forms of moral compromise had always been difficult to [Amherst]170-bessy , and like many men absorbed in large and complicated questions [he]3393-her husband craved above all clearness and peace in [his]3393-her husband household relation . The first months of [his]3393-her husband second marriage had brought [him]3393-her husband , as a part of richer and deeper joys , this enveloping sense of a clear moral medium , in which no subterfuge or equivocation could draw breath . [He]3393-her husband had felt that henceforth [he]3393-her husband could pour into [his]3393-her husband work all the combative energy , the powers of endurance , resistance , renovation , which had once been unprofitably dissipated in the vain attempt to bring some sort of harmony into life with [Bessy]170-bessy . Between [himself]3393-her husband and [Justine]241-justine , apart from [their]4809-their love for [each other]407-each other , there was the wider passion for [their]4809-their kind , which gave back to [them]4809-their an enlarged and deepened reflection of [their]4809-their personal feeling . In such an air it had seemed that no petty egotism could hamper [their]4809-their growth , no misintelligence obscure [their]4809-their love ; yet all the while this pure happiness had been unfolding against a sordid background of falsehood and intrigue from which [his]3393-her husband soul turned with loathing . [Justine]241-justine was right in assuming that [Amherst]241-justine had never thought much about [women]497-women . [He]3393-her husband had vaguely regarded [them]497-women as meant to [people]3450-people that hazy domain of feeling designed to offer [the busy man]1897-the busy man an escape from thought . [His]3393-her husband second marriage , leading [him]3393-her husband to the blissful discovery that [woman]4240-woman can think as well as feel , that there are [beings of the ornamental sex in whom brain and heart have so enlarged each other]4815-beings of the ornamental sex in whom brain and heart have so enlarged each other that [their]4815-beings of the ornamental sex in whom brain and heart have so enlarged each other emotions are as clear as thought , [their]4815-beings of the ornamental sex in whom brain and heart have so enlarged each other thoughts as warm as emotions -- this discovery had had the effect of making [him]3393-her husband discard [his]3393-her husband former summary conception of [woman]4240-woman as a bundle of inconsequent impulses , and admit [her]4240-woman at a stroke to full mental equality with [[her]4240-woman lord]4817-her lord . The result of this act of manumission was , that in judging [Justine]241-justine [he]3393-her husband could no longer allow for what was purely feminine in [her]241-justine conduct . It was incomprehensible to [him]3393-her husband that [she]241-justine , to whom truth had seemed the essential element of life , should have been able to draw breath , and find happiness , in an atmosphere of falsehood and dissimulation . [His]3393-her husband mind could assent -- at least in the abstract -- to the reasonableness of [her]241-justine act ; but [he]3393-her husband was still unable to understand [her]241-justine having concealed it from [him]3393-her husband . [He]3393-her husband could enter far enough into [her]241-justine feelings to allow for [her]241-justine having kept silence on [his]3393-her husband first return to [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook , when [she]241-justine was still under the strain of a prolonged and terrible trial ; but that [she]241-justine should have continued to do so when [he]3393-her husband and [she]241-justine had discovered and confessed [their]4818-their love for [each other]407-each other , threw an intolerable doubt on [her]241-justine whole course . [He]3393-her husband stayed late at [the mills]3324-the mills , finding one pretext after another for delaying [his]3393-her husband return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford , and trying , while [he]3393-her husband gave one part of [his]3393-her husband mind to the methodical performance of [his]3393-her husband task , to adjust the other to some definite view of the future . But all was darkened and confused by the sense that , between [himself]3393-her husband and [Justine]241-justine , complete communion of thought was no longer possible . It had , in fact , never existed ; there had always been a locked chamber in [her]241-justine mind , and [he]3393-her husband knew not yet what other secrets might inhabit [it]4821-it . The shock of finding [her]241-justine gone when [he]3393-her husband reached [home]3405-home gave a new turn to [his]3393-her husband feelings . [She]241-justine had made no mystery of [her]241-justine destination , leaving word with [the servants]746-the servants that [she]241-justine had gone to [town]3932-town to see [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope ; and [Amherst]241-justine found a note from [her]241-justine on [his]3393-her husband study table . "[0-i] [I]0-i feel , " [she]0-i wrote , "[0-i] that [I]0-i ought to see [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope [myself]0-i , and be the first to tell [him]120-mr. langhope what must be told . It was like [you]3167-you , dearest , to wish to spare [me]0-i this , but it would have made [me]0-i more unhappy ; and [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope might wish to hear the facts in [my]0-i own words . [I]0-i shall come back tomorrow , and after that it will be for [you]3167-you to decide what must be done . " The brevity and simplicity of the note were characteristic ; in moments of high tension [Justine]241-justine was always calm and direct . And it was like [her]241-justine , too , not to make any covert appeal to [his]3393-her husband sympathy , not to seek to entrap [his]3393-her husband judgment by caressing words and plaintive allusions . The quiet tone in which [she]241-justine stated [her]241-justine purpose matched the firmness and courage of the act , and for a moment [Amherst]241-justine was shaken by a revulsion of feeling . [Her]241-justine heart was level with [his]3393-her husband , after all -- if [she]241-justine had done wrong [she]241-justine would bear the brunt of it alone . It was so exactly what [he]3393-her husband [himself]3393-her husband would have felt and done in such a situation that faith in [her]241-justine flowed back through all the dried channels of [his]3393-her husband heart . But an instant later the current set the other way . The wretched years of [his]3393-her husband first marriage had left in [him]3393-her husband a residue of distrust , a tendency to dissociate every act from its ostensible motive . [He]3393-her husband had been too profoundly the dupe of [his]3393-her husband own enthusiasm not to retain this streak of scepticism , and it now moved [him]3393-her husband to ask if [Justine]241-justine 's sudden departure had not been prompted by some other cause than the one [she]241-justine avowed . Had that alone actuated [her]241-justine , why not have told it to [him]3393-her husband , and asked [his]3393-her husband consent to [her]241-justine plan ? Why let [him]3393-her husband leave [the house]311-the house without a hint of [her]241-justine purpose , and slip off by [the first train]1870-the first train as soon as [he]3393-her husband was safe at [Westmore]104-westmore ? Might it not be that [she]241-justine had special reasons for wishing [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope to _ hear [her]241-justine own version first_--that there were questions [she]241-justine wished to parry [herself]241-justine , explanations [she]241-justine could trust [no one]3425-no one to make for [her]241-justine ? The thought plunged [Amherst]241-justine into deeper misery . [He]3393-her husband knew not how to defend [himself]3393-her husband against these disintegrating suspicions -- [he]3393-her husband felt only that , once the accord between two minds is broken , it is less easy to restore than the passion between two hearts . [He]3393-her husband dragged heavily through [his]3393-her husband solitary evening , and awaited with dread and yet impatience a message announcing [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife 's return . * * * * * It would have been easier -- far easier -- when [she]241-justine left [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's door , to go straight out into the darkness and let it close in on [her]241-justine for good . [Justine]241-justine felt [herself]241-justine yielding to the spell of that suggestion as [she]241-justine walked along [the lamplit pavement]4829-the lamplit pavement , hardly conscious of the turn [her]241-justine steps were taking . The door of [the house]311-the house which a few weeks before had been virtually [hers]241-justine had closed on [her]241-justine without a question . [She]241-justine had been suffered to go out into the darkness without being asked whither [she]241-justine was going , or under what roof [her]241-justine night would be spent . The contrast between [her]241-justine past and present sounded through the tumult of [her]241-justine thoughts like the evil laughter of temptation . [The house at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , to which [she]241-justine was returning]4831-the house at hanaford , to which she was returning , would look at [her]241-justine with the same alien face -- [nowhere on earth]4832-nowhere on earth , at that moment , was a door which would open to [her]241-justine like the door of [home]3405-home . In [her]241-justine painful self - absorption [she]241-justine followed [the side street]4834-the side street toward [Madison Avenue]51-madison avenue , and struck southward down [that tranquil thoroughfare]4835-that tranquil thoroughfare . There was a physical relief in rapid motion , and [she]241-justine walked on , still hardly aware of [her]241-justine direction , toward the clustered lights of [Madison Square]53-madison square . Should [she]241-justine return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford , [she]241-justine had still several hours to dispose of before the departure of [the midnight train]4836-the midnight train ; and if [she]241-justine did not return , hours and dates no longer existed for [her]241-justine . It would be easier -- infinitely easier -- not to go back . To take up [her]241-justine life with [Amherst]241-justine would , under any circumstances , be painful enough ; to take it up under the tacit restriction of [her]241-justine pledge to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope seemed more than human courage could face . As [she]241-justine approached [the square]4352-the square [she]241-justine had almost reached the conclusion that such a temporary renewal was beyond [her]241-justine strength -- beyond what any standard of duty exacted . The question of an alternative hardly troubled [her]241-justine . [She]241-justine would simply go on living , and find an escape in work and material hardship . It would not be hard for [so inconspicuous a person to slip back into the obscure mass of humanity]4838-so inconspicuous a person to slip back into the obscure mass of humanity . [She]241-justine paused a moment on the edge of [the square]4352-the square , vaguely seeking a direction for [her]241-justine feet that might permit the working of [her]241-justine thoughts to go on uninterrupted ; and as [she]241-justine stood there , [her]241-justine eyes fell on the bench near the corner of [Twenty - sixth Street]92-twenty - sixth street , where [she]241-justine had sat with [Amherst]241-justine on the day of [his]120-mr. langhope flight from [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . [He]120-mr. langhope too had dreamed of escaping from insoluble problems into the clear air of hard work and simple duties ; and [she]241-justine remembered the words with which [she]241-justine had turned [him]120-mr. langhope back . The cases , of course , were not identical , since [he]120-mr. langhope had been flying in anger and wounded pride from a situation for which [he]120-mr. langhope was in no wise to blame ; yet , if even at such a moment [she]241-justine had insisted on charity and forbearance , how could [she]241-justine now show less self - denial than [she]241-justine had exacted of [him]120-mr. langhope ? "[0-i] If [you]3168-you go away for a time , surely it ought to be in such a way that [your]3168-you going does not seem to cast any reflection on [Bessy]170-bessy .... " That was how [she]241-justine had put it to [him]120-mr. langhope , and how , with the mere change of a name , [she]241-justine must now , for reasons as cogent , put it to [herself]241-justine . It was just as much a part of the course [she]241-justine had planned to return to [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband now , and take up [their]4841-their daily life together , as it would , later on , be [her]241-justine duty to drop out of that life , when [her]241-justine doing so could no longer involve [him]120-mr. langhope in the penalty to be paid . [She]241-justine stood a little while looking at the bench on which [they]4841-their had sat , and giving thanks in [her]241-justine heart for the past strength which was now helping to build up [her]241-justine failing courage : such a patchwork business are [our]4841-their best endeavours , yet so faithfully does each weak upward impulse reach back a hand to the next . * * * * * [Justine]241-justine 's explanation of [her]241-justine visit to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope was not wholly satisfying to [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband . [She]241-justine did not conceal from [him]120-mr. langhope that the scene had been painful , but [she]241-justine gave [him]120-mr. langhope to understand , as briefly as possible , that [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope , after [his]120-mr. langhope first movement of uncontrollable distress , had seemed able to make allowances for the pressure under which [she]241-justine had acted , and that [he]120-mr. langhope had , at any rate , given no sign of intending to let [her]241-justine confession make any change in the relation between [the households]4843-the households . If [she]241-justine did not -- as [Amherst]241-justine afterward recalled -- put all this specifically into words , [she]241-justine contrived to convey it in [her]241-justine manner , in [her]241-justine allusions , above all in [her]241-justine recovered composure . [She]241-justine had the demeanour of [one who has gone through a severe test of strength , but come out of it in complete control of the situation]4844-one who has gone through a severe test of strength , but come out of it in complete control of the situation . There was something slightly unnatural in this prompt solution of so complicated a difficulty , and it had the effect of making [Amherst]241-justine ask [himself]241-justine what , to produce such a result , must have been the gist of [her]241-justine communication to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope . If [the latter]673-the latter had shown any disposition to be cruel , or even unjust , [Amherst]241-justine 's sympathies would have rushed instantly to [[his]120-mr. langhope wife]3350-his wife 's defence ; but the fact that there was apparently to be no call on [them]4847-them left [his]120-mr. langhope reason free to compare and discriminate , with the final result that the more [he]120-mr. langhope pondered on [[his]120-mr. langhope father - in - law]2004-his father - in - law 's attitude the less intelligible it became . A few days after [Justine]241-justine 's return [he]120-mr. langhope was called to [New York]7-new york on business ; and before leaving [he]120-mr. langhope told [her]241-justine that [he]120-mr. langhope should of course take the opportunity of having a talk with [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope . [She]241-justine received the statement with the gentle composure from which [she]241-justine had not departed since [her]241-justine return from [town]3932-town ; and [he]120-mr. langhope added tentatively , as if to provoke [her]241-justine to a clearer expression of feeling : "[0-i] [I]0-i shall not be satisfied , of course , till [I]0-i see for [myself]0-i just how [he]3169-his feels -- just how much , at bottom , this has affected [him]3169-his -- since [my]0-i own future relation to [him]3169-his will , as [I]0-i have already told [you]3170-you , depend entirely on [his]3169-his treatment of [you]3170-you . " [She]241-justine met this without any sign of disturbance . "[3169-his] [His]3169-his treatment of [me]0-i was very kind , " [she]241-justine said . "[3169-his] But would it not , on [your]3169-his part , " [she]241-justine continued hesitatingly , "[3169-his] be kinder not to touch on the subject so soon again ? " The line deepened between [his]3169-his brows . "[3169-his] Touch on it ? [I]0-i sha'n't rest till [I]0-i 've gone to the bottom of it ! Till then , [you]3170-you must understand , " [he]3169-his summed up with decision , "[3170-you] [I]0-i feel [myself]0-i only on sufferance here at [Westmore]104-westmore . " "[0-i] Yes -- [I]0-i understand , " [she]241-justine assented ; and as [he]3169-his bent over to kiss [her]241-justine for goodbye a tenuous impenetrable barrier seemed to lie between [their]4850-their lips . * * * * * It was [Justine]241-justine 's turn to await with a passionate anxiety [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband 's home - coming ; and when , on the third day , [he]3169-his reappeared , [her]241-justine dearly acquired self - control gave way to a tremulous eagerness . This was , after all , the turning - point in [their]4850-their lives : everything depended on how [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope had "[0-i] played up " to [his]3169-his cue ; had kept to [his]3169-his side of [their]4850-their bond . [Amherst]241-justine 's face showed signs of emotional havoc : when feeling once broke out in [him]3169-his it had full play , and [she]241-justine could see that [his]3169-his hour with [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope had struck to the roots of life . But the resultant expression was one of invigoration , not defeat ; and [she]241-justine gathered at a glance that [[her]241-justine partner]4852-her partner had not betrayed [her]241-justine . [She]241-justine drew a tragic solace from the success of [her]241-justine achievement ; yet it flung [her]241-justine into [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband 's arms with a passion of longing to which , as [she]241-justine instantly felt , [he]3169-his did not as completely respond . There was still , then , something "[0-i] between " [them]4854-them : somewhere the mechanism of [her]241-justine scheme had failed , or its action had not produced the result [she]241-justine had counted on . As soon as [they]4854-them were alone in [the study]4855-the study [she]241-justine said , as quietly as [she]241-justine could : "[3171-you] [You]3171-you saw [[your]3171-you father - in - law]3172-your father - in - law ? [You]3171-you talked with [him]3172-your father - in - law ? " "[3171-you] Yes -- [I]0-i spent the afternoon with [him]3172-your father - in - law . [Cicely]167-cicely sent [you]3171-you [her]167-cicely love . " [She]241-justine coloured at the mention of [the child]3698-the child 's name and murmured : "[167-cicely] And [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope ? " "[3172-your father - in - law] [He]3172-your father - in - law is perfectly calm now -- perfectly impartial.--This business has made [me]0-i feel , " [Amherst]241-justine added abruptly , "[3172-your father - in - law] that [I]0-i have never been quite fair to [him]3172-your father - in - law . [I]0-i never thought [him]3172-your father - in - law [a magnanimous man]3173-a magnanimous man . " "[3172-your father - in - law] [He]3172-your father - in - law has proved [himself]3172-your father - in - law so , " [Justine]241-justine murmured , [her]241-justine head bent low over a bit of needlework ; and [Amherst]241-justine affirmed energetically : "[3172-your father - in - law] [He]3172-your father - in - law has been more than that -- generous ! " [She]0-i looked up at [him]3468-dear with a smile . "[3172-your father - in - law] [I]0-i am so glad , [dear]3468-dear ; so glad there is not to be the least shadow between [you]3468-dear .... " "[3172-your father - in - law] No , " [Amherst]241-justine said , [his]3468-dear voice flagging slightly . There was a pause , and then [he]3468-dear went on with renewed emphasis : "[3172-your father - in - law] Of course [I]0-i made [my]0-i point clear to [him]3172-your father - in - law . " "[0-i] [Your]0-i point ? " "[0-i] That [I]0-i stand or fall by [his]3172-your father - in - law judgment of [you]3468-dear . " Oh , if [he]3468-dear had but said it more tenderly ! But [he]3468-dear delivered it with the quiet resolution of [a man who contends for an abstract principle of justice , and not for a passion grown into the fibres of]4857-a man who contends for an abstract principle of justice , and not for a passion grown into the fibres of [his]3468-dear heart ! "[0-i] [You]3468-dear are generous too , " [she]3468-dear faltered , [her]3468-dear voice trembling a little . [Amherst]241-justine frowned ; and [she]3468-dear perceived that any hint , on [her]3468-dear part , of recognizing the slightest change in [their]3175-their relations was still like pressure on a painful bruise . "[3468-dear] There is no need for such words between [us]3175-their , " [he]3468-dear said impatiently ; "[3175-their] and [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's attitude , " [he]3468-dear added , with an effort at a lighter tone , "[3172-your father - in - law] has made it unnecessary , thank heaven , that [we]3175-their should ever revert to the subject again . " [He]3468-dear turned to [his]3468-dear desk as [he]3468-dear spoke , and plunged into perusal of the letters that had accumulated in [his]3468-dear absence . * * * * * There was a temporary excess of work at [Westmore]104-westmore , and during the days that followed [he]3468-dear threw [himself]3468-dear into it with a zeal that showed [Justine]241-justine how eagerly [he]3468-dear sought any pretext for avoiding confidential moments . The perception was painful enough , yet not as painful as another discovery that awaited [her]241-justine . [She]241-justine too had [her]241-justine tasks at [Westmore]104-westmore : the supervision of [the hospital]3333-the hospital , [the day nursery]4859-the day nursery , [the mothers]1315-the mothers ' club , and the various other organizations whereby [she]241-justine and [Amherst]241-justine were trying to put some sort of social unity into the lives of [the mill - hands]3347-the mill - hands ; and when , on the day after [his]3468-dear return from [New York]7-new york , [she]241-justine presented [herself]241-justine , as usual , at [the Westmore office]4862-the westmore office , where [she]241-justine was in the habit of holding a brief consultation with [him]3468-dear before starting on [her]241-justine rounds , [she]241-justine was at once aware of a new tinge of constraint in [his]3468-dear manner . It hurt [him]3468-dear , then , to see [her]241-justine at [Westmore]104-westmore -- hurt [him]3468-dear more than to live with [her]241-justine , at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , under [Bessy]170-bessy 's roof ! For it was there , at [the mills]3324-the mills , that [his]3468-dear real life was led , the life with which [Justine]241-justine had been most identified , the life that had been made possible for both by the magnanimity of [that other woman whose presence was now forever between [them]4865-their]4864-that other woman whose presence was now forever between them . [Justine]241-justine made no sign . [She]241-justine resumed [her]241-justine work as though unconscious of any change ; but whereas in the past [they]4865-their had always found pretexts for seeking [each other]407-each other out , to discuss the order of the day 's work , or merely to warm [their]4865-their hearts by a rapid word or two , now [each]4867-each went a separate way , sometimes not meeting till [they]4865-their regained [the house]311-the house at night - fall . And as the weeks passed [she]241-justine began to understand that , by a strange inversion of probability , the relation between [Amherst]170-bessy and [herself]241-justine was to be the means of holding [her]241-justine to [her]241-justine compact with [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope -- if indeed it were not nearer the truth to say that it had made such a compact unnecessary . [Amherst]170-bessy had done [his]3468-dear best to take up [their]4865-their life together as though there had been no break in it ; but slowly the fact was being forced on [her]241-justine that by remaining with [him]3468-dear [she]241-justine was subjecting [him]3468-dear to intolerable suffering -- was coming to be the personification of the very thoughts and associations from which [he]3468-dear struggled to escape . [Happily]242-happily [her]241-justine promptness of action had preserved [Westmore]167-cicely to [him]3468-dear , and in [Westmore]104-westmore [she]241-justine believed that [he]3468-dear would in time find a refuge from even the memory of what [he]3468-dear was now enduring . But meanwhile [her]241-justine presence kept the thought alive ; and , had every other incentive lost its power , this would have been enough to sustain [her]241-justine . [Fate]243-fate had , ironically enough , furnished [her]241-justine with an unanswerable reason for leaving [Amherst]96-amherst ; the impossibility of [their]4865-their keeping up such a relation as now existed between [them]4865-their would soon become too patent to be denied . Meanwhile , as summer approached , [she]241-justine knew that external conditions would also call upon [her]241-justine to act . The visible signal for [her]241-justine withdrawal would be [Cicely]167-cicely 's next visit to [Westmore]104-westmore . [The child]3698-the child 's birthday fell in early June ; and [Amherst]170-bessy , some months previously , had asked that [she]241-justine should be permitted to spend it at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , and that it should be chosen as the date for the opening of [the first model cottages at [Hopewood]11-hopewood]4870-the first model cottages at hopewood . It was [Justine]241-justine who had originated the idea of associating [Cicely]167-cicely 's anniversaries with some significant moment in the annals of [the mill colony]4871-the mill colony ; and struck by the happy suggestion , [he]4872-he had at once applied [himself]4872-he to hastening on the work at [Hopewood]11-hopewood . The eagerness of both [Amherst]170-bessy and [Justine]241-justine that [Cicely]167-cicely should be identified with the developing life of [Westmore]167-cicely had been one of the chief influences in reconciling [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope to [[his]120-mr. langhope son - in - law]1787-his son - in - law 's second marriage . [Husband]2016-husband and [wife]2017-wife had always made it clear that [they]4876-they regarded [themselves]4876-they as [the mere trustees of [the Westmore revenues]4878-the westmore revenues]4877-the mere trustees of the westmore revenues , and that [Cicely]167-cicely 's name should , as early as possible , be associated with every measure taken for the welfare of [the people]4879-the people . But now , as [Justine]241-justine knew , the situation was changed ; and [Cicely]167-cicely would not be allowed to come to [Hanaford]1-hanaford until [she]241-justine [herself]241-justine had left [it]1-hanaford . The manifold threads of divination that [she]241-justine was perpetually throwing out in [Amherst]241-justine 's presence told [her]241-justine , without word or sign on [his]2016-husband part , that [he]2016-husband also awaited [Cicely]167-cicely 's birthday as a determining date in [their]4876-they lives . [He]2016-husband spoke confidently , and as a matter of course , of [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's bringing [[his]2016-husband grand - daughter]2707-his grand - daughter at the promised time ; but [Justine]241-justine could hear a note of challenge in [his]2016-husband voice , as though [he]2016-husband felt that [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's sincerity had not yet been put to the test . As the time drew nearer it became more difficult for [her]241-justine to decide just how [she]241-justine should take the step [she]241-justine had determined on . [She]241-justine had no material anxiety for the future , for although [she]241-justine did not mean to accept a penny from [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband after [she]241-justine had left [him]3393-her husband , [she]241-justine knew it would be easy for [her]241-justine to take up [her]241-justine nursing again ; and [she]241-justine knew also that [her]241-justine hospital connections would enable [her]241-justine to find work in [a part of [the country]3812-the country]4882-a part of the country far enough distant to remove [her]241-justine entirely from [his]3393-her husband life . But [she]241-justine had not yet been able to invent a reason for leaving that should be convincing enough to satisfy [him]3393-her husband , without directing [his]3393-her husband suspicions to the truth . As [she]241-justine revolved the question [she]241-justine suddenly recalled an exclamation of [Amherst's]237-amherst's -- a word spoken as [they]4884-they entered [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's door , on the fatal afternoon when [she]241-justine had found [Wyant]165-wyant 's letter awaiting [her]241-justine . "[3172-your father - in - law] There 's nothing [you]3176-you ca n't make [people]3450-people believe , [[you]3176-you little Jesuit]4570-you little jesuit ! " [She]241-justine had laughed in pure joy at [his]3393-her husband praise of [her]241-justine ; for every bantering phrase had then been a caress . But now the words returned with a sinister meaning . [She]241-justine knew they were true as far as [Amherst]241-justine was concerned : in the arts of casuistry and equivocation [a child]804-a child could have outmatched [him]3393-her husband , and [she]241-justine had only to exert [her]241-justine will to dupe [him]3393-her husband as deeply as [she]241-justine pleased . Well ! the task was odious , but it was needful : it was the bitterest part of [her]241-justine expiation that [she]241-justine must deceive [him]3393-her husband once more to save [him]3393-her husband from the results of [her]241-justine former deception . This decision once reached , every nerve in [her]241-justine became alert for an opportunity to do the thing and have it over ; so that , whenever [they]4886-they were alone together , [she]241-justine was in an attitude of perpetual tension , [her]241-justine whole mind drawn up for its final spring . The decisive word came , one evening toward the end of May , in the form of an allusion on [Amherst]241-justine 's part to [Cicely]167-cicely 's approaching visit . [Husband]244-husband and [wife]2017-wife were seated in [the drawing - room]4158-the drawing - room after dinner , [he]3393-her husband with a book in hand , [she]241-justine bending , as usual , over the needlework which served at once as a pretext for lowered eyes , and as a means of disguising [her]241-justine fixed preoccupation . "[4570-you little jesuit] Have [you]3179-you worked out a plan ? " [he]3393-her husband asked , laying down [his]3393-her husband book . "[3179-you] It occurred to [me]0-i that it would be rather a good idea if [we]3180-we began with a sort of festivity for [the kids]3181-the kids at [the day nursery]4859-the day nursery . [You]3179-you could take [Cicely]167-cicely [there]3361-there early , and [I]0-i could bring out [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope after luncheon . " "[120-mr. langhope] Will [you]0-i see about the details , then ? [You]0-i know it 's only a week off . " "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i know . " [She]241-justine hesitated , and then took the spring . "[0-i] [I]0-i ought to tell [you]0-i [John]99-amherst -- that [I]0-i -- [I]0-i think [I]0-i may not be [here]3415-here .... " [He]99-amherst raised [his]99-amherst head abruptly , and [she]241-justine saw the blood mount under [his]99-amherst fair skin . "[0-i] Not be here ? " [he]99-amherst exclaimed . [She]241-justine met [his]99-amherst look as steadily as [she]241-justine could . "[0-i] [I]0-i think of going away for awhile . " "[0-i] Going away ? Where ? What is the matter -- are [you]0-i not well ? " There was [her]241-justine pretext -- [he]99-amherst had found it for [her]241-justine ! Why should [she]241-justine not simply plead ill - health ? Afterward [she]241-justine would find a way of elaborating the details and making them plausible . But suddenly , as [she]241-justine was about to speak , there came to [her]241-justine the feeling which , up to one fatal moment in [their]4889-them lives , had always ruled [their]4889-them intercourse -- the feeling that there must be truth , and absolute truth , between [them]4889-them . Absolute , indeed , it could never be again , since [he]99-amherst must never know of the condition exacted by [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope ; but that , at the moment , seemed almost a secondary motive compared to the deeper influences that were inexorably forcing [them]4889-them apart . At any rate , [she]241-justine would trump up no trivial excuse for the step [she]241-justine had resolved on ; there should be truth , if not the whole truth , in this last decisive hour between [them]4889-them . "[0-i] Yes ; [I]0-i am quite well -- at least [my]0-i body is , " [she]241-justine said quietly . "[0-i] But [I]0-i am tired , perhaps ; [my]0-i mind has been going round too long in the same circle . " [She]241-justine paused for a brief space , and then , raising [her]241-justine head , and looking [him]3185-him straight in the eyes : "[0-i] Has it not been so with [you]3185-him ? " [she]241-justine asked . The question seemed to startle [Amherst]99-amherst . [He]99-amherst rose from [his]99-amherst chair and took a few steps toward the hearth , where a small fire was crumbling into embers . [He]99-amherst turned [his]99-amherst back to it , resting an arm on the mantel - shelf ; then [he]99-amherst said , in a somewhat unsteady tone : "[0-i] [I]0-i thought [we]3186-we had agreed not to speak of all that again . " [Justine]241-justine shook [her]0-i head with a fugitive half - smile . "[0-i] [I]0-i made no such agreement . And besides , what is the use , when [we]3186-we can always hear [each other]407-each other 's thoughts speak , and [they]3188-they speak of nothing else ? " [Amherst]241-justine 's brows darkened . "[3188-they] It is not so with [mine]0-i , " [he]99-amherst began ; but [she]0-i raised [her]0-i hand with a silencing gesture . "[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]0-i have tried [your]0-i best that it should not be so ; and perhaps [you]0-i have succeeded better than [I.]0-i But [I]0-i am tired , horribly tired -- [I]0-i want to get away from everything ! " [She]0-i saw a look of pain in [his]99-amherst eyes . " "[0-i] Thank [you]0-i , " [she]0-i answered , in the same tone . There was another pause , for [she]0-i could not trust [herself]0-i to go on speaking ; and presently [he]99-amherst asked , with a tinge of bitterness in [his]99-amherst voice : "[0-i] That does not satisfy [you]0-i ? " "[0-i] Just what [I]0-i say . [We]3189-we can neither of [us]3189-we go on living on that understanding just at present . " [She]0-i rose as [she]0-i spoke , and crossed over to the hearth . "[0-i] [I]0-i want to go back to [[my]0-i nursing]3190-my nursing -- to go out to [Michigan]93-michigan , to [a town where [I]0-i spent a few months the year before [I]0-i first came to [Hanaford]1-hanaford]3191-a town where i spent a few months the year before i first came to hanaford . But in the space of a heart - beat [she]0-i knew that peril -- that longed - for peril!--was past . [[Her]0-i husband]3393-her husband had remained silent -- [he]4892-he neither moved toward [her]0-i nor looked at [her]0-i ; and [she]0-i felt in every slackening nerve that in the end [he]4892-he would let [her]0-i go . [Cicely]167-cicely had reached the age when [children]3598-children put [their]3598-children questions with as much ingenuity as persistence , and both [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope and [Amherst]241-justine longed for [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's aid in parrying [her]178-mrs. ansell incessant interrogations as to the cause and length of [Justine]241-justine 's absence , what [she]178-mrs. ansell had said before going , and what promise [she]178-mrs. ansell had made about coming back . "[246-poor devil] [Poor devil]246-poor devil -- I'm sorry for [him]246-poor devil : [he]246-poor devil can hardly speak of [her]3819-my wife , " [he]120-mr. langhope broke out at once to [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , in the course of [their]4911-their first confidential hour together .
