" * * * * * [Amherst]241-justine went to the Berne conference in July , and spent six weeks afterward in rapid visits to [various industrial centres]4912-various industrial centres and [model factory villages]4913-model factory villages . During [his]120-mr. langhope previous European pilgrimages [his]120-mr. langhope interest had by no means been restricted to sociological questions : the appeal of an old civilization , reaching [him]120-mr. langhope through its innumerable forms of tradition and beauty , had roused that side of [his]120-mr. langhope imagination which [his]120-mr. langhope work at [home]3405-home left untouched . But upon [his]120-mr. langhope present state of deep moral commotion the spells of art and history were powerless to work . The foundations of [his]120-mr. langhope life had been shaken , and the fair exterior of [the world]259-the world was as vacant as [a maniac]4916-a maniac 's face . [He]120-mr. langhope could only take refuge in [his]120-mr. langhope special task , barricading [himself]120-mr. langhope against every expression of beauty and poetry as so many poignant reminders of a phase of life that [he]120-mr. langhope was vainly trying to cast off and forget . Even [his]120-mr. langhope work had been embittered to [him]120-mr. langhope , thrust out of its place in the ordered scheme of things . It had cost [him]120-mr. langhope a hard struggle to hold fast to [his]120-mr. langhope main purpose , to convince [himself]120-mr. langhope that [his]120-mr. langhope real duty lay , not in renouncing the Westmore money and its obligations , but in carrying out [his]120-mr. langhope projected task as if nothing had occurred to affect [his]120-mr. langhope personal relation to it . The mere fact that such a renunciation would have been a deliberate moral suicide , a severing once for all of every artery of action , made it take on , at first , the semblance of an obligation , a sort of higher duty to the abstract conception of what [he]120-mr. langhope owed [himself]120-mr. langhope . But [Justine]241-justine had not erred in [her]241-justine forecast . Once [she]241-justine had passed out of [his]120-mr. langhope life , it was easier for [him]120-mr. langhope to return to a dispassionate view of [his]120-mr. langhope situation , to see , and boldly confess to [himself]120-mr. langhope that [he]120-mr. langhope saw , the still higher duty of sticking to [his]120-mr. langhope task , instead of sacrificing it to any ideal of personal disinterestedness . It was this gradual process of adjustment that saved [him]120-mr. langhope from the desolating scepticism which falls on [the active man]4917-the active man when the sources of [his]120-mr. langhope activity are tainted . Having accepted [his]120-mr. langhope fate , having consented to see in [himself]120-mr. langhope merely the necessary agent of a good to be done , [he]120-mr. langhope could escape from self - questioning only by shutting [himself]120-mr. langhope up in the practical exigencies of [his]120-mr. langhope work , closing [his]120-mr. langhope eyes and [his]120-mr. langhope thoughts to everything which had formerly related it to [a wider world]4918-a wider world , had given meaning and beauty to life as a whole . The return from [Europe]17-europe , and the taking up of the daily routine at [Hanaford]1-hanaford , were the most difficult phases in this process of moral adaptation . [Justine]241-justine 's departure had at first brought relief . [He]120-mr. langhope had been too sincere with [himself]120-mr. langhope to oppose [her]241-justine wish to leave [Hanaford]1-hanaford for a time , since [he]120-mr. langhope believed that , for [her]241-justine as well as for [himself]120-mr. langhope , a temporary separation would be less painful than a continuance of [their]4919-their actual relation . But as the weeks passed into months [he]120-mr. langhope found [he]120-mr. langhope was no nearer to a clear view of [his]120-mr. langhope own case : the future was still dark and enigmatic . [Justine]241-justine 's desire to leave [him]120-mr. langhope had revived [his]120-mr. langhope unformulated distrust of [her]241-justine . What could it mean but that there were thoughts within [her]241-justine which could not be at rest in [his]120-mr. langhope presence ? [He]120-mr. langhope had given [her]241-justine every proof of [his]120-mr. langhope wish to forget the past , and [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope had behaved with unequalled magnanimity . Yet [Justine]241-justine 's unhappiness was evident : [she]241-justine could not conceal [her]241-justine longing to escape from the conditions [her]241-justine act had created . Was it because , in reality , [she]241-justine was conscious of other motives than the one [she]241-justine acknowledged ? [She]241-justine had insisted , almost unfeelingly as it might have seemed , on the abstract rightness of what [she]241-justine had done , on the fact that , ideally speaking , [her]241-justine act could not be made less right , less justifiable , by the special accidental consequences that had flowed from it . Because these consequences had caught [her]241-justine in a web of tragic fatality [she]241-justine would not be guilty of the weakness of tracing back the disaster to any intrinsic error in [her]241-justine original motive . Why , then , if this was [her]241-justine real , [her]241-justine proud attitude toward the past -- and since those about [her]241-justine believed in [her]241-justine sincerity , and accepted [her]241-justine justification as valid from [her]241-justine point of view if not from [theirs]4920-theirs -- why had [she]241-justine not been able to maintain [her]241-justine posture , to carry on life on the terms [she]241-justine had exacted from [others]3447-others ? A special circumstance contributed to this feeling of distrust ; the fact , namely , that [Justine]241-justine , a week after [her]241-justine departure from [Hanaford]1-hanaford , had written to say that [she]241-justine could not , from that moment till [her]241-justine return , consent to accept any money from [Amherst]241-justine . As [her]241-justine manner was , [she]241-justine put [her]241-justine reasons clearly and soberly , without evasion or ambiguity . "[3819-my wife] Since [you]3209-his and [I]0-i , " [she]0-i wrote , "[3209-his] have always agreed in regarding the Westmore money as a kind of wage for [our]3210-our services at [the mills]3324-the mills , [I]0-i can not be satisfied to go on drawing that wage while [I]0-i am unable to do any work in return . [I]0-i am sure [you]3209-his must feel as [I]0-i do about this ; and [you]3209-his need have no anxiety as to the practical side of the question , since [I]0-i have enough to live on in some savings from [my]0-i hospital days , which were invested for [me]0-i two years ago by [Harry Dressel]118-mrs. dressel , and are beginning to bring in a small return . This being the case , [I]0-i feel [I]0-i can afford to interpret in any way [I]0-i choose the terms of the bargain between [myself]0-i and [Westmore]167-cicely . " On reading this , [Amherst]241-justine 's mind had gone through the strange dual process which now marked all [his]3209-his judgments of [[his]3209-his wife]3350-his wife . At first [he]3209-his had fancied [he]3209-his understood [her]3350-his wife , and had felt that [he]3209-his should have done as [she]3350-his wife did ; then the usual reaction of distrust set in , and [he]3209-his asked [himself]3209-his why [she]3350-his wife , who had so little of the conventional attitude toward money , should now develop this unexpected susceptibility . And so the old question presented itself in another shape : if [she]3350-his wife had nothing to reproach [herself]3350-his wife for , why was it intolerable to [her]3350-his wife to live on [Bessy]245-bessy 's money ? The fact that [she]3350-his wife was doing no actual service at [Westmore]104-westmore did not account for [her]3350-his wife scruples -- [she]3350-his wife would have been [the last person to think that a sick servant]4923-the last person to think that a sick servant should be docked of [his]3209-his pay . [Her]3350-his wife reluctance could come only from that hidden cause of compunction which had prompted [her]3350-his wife departure , and which now forced [her]3350-his wife to sever even the merely material links between [herself]3350-his wife and [her]3350-his wife past . [Amherst]241-justine , on [his]3209-his return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford , had tried to find in these considerations a reason for [his]3209-his deep unrest . It was [[his]3209-his wife]3350-his wife 's course which still cast a torturing doubt on what [he]3209-his had braced [his]3209-his will to accept and put behind [him]3209-his . And [he]3209-his now told [himself]3209-his that the perpetual galling sense of [her]3350-his wife absence was due to this uneasy consciousness of what it meant , of the dark secrets it enveloped and held back from [him]3209-his . In actual truth , every particle of [his]3209-his being missed [her]3350-his wife , [he]3209-his lacked [her]3350-his wife at every turn . [She]3350-his wife had been at once [the partner of [his]3209-his task]4925-the partner of his task , and the _ pays bleu _ into which [he]3209-his escaped from it ; the vivifying thought which gave meaning to the life [he]3209-his had chosen , yet never let [him]3209-his forget that there was a larger richer life outside , to which [he]3209-his was rooted by deeper and more intrinsic things than any abstract ideal of altruism . [His]3209-his love had preserved [his]3209-his identity , saved [him]3209-his from shrinking into the mere nameless unit which [the social enthusiast]4926-the social enthusiast is in danger of becoming unless the humanitarian passion is balanced , and a little overweighed , by a merely human one . And now this equilibrium was lost forever , and [his]3209-his deepest pain lay in realizing that [he]3209-his could not regain it , even by casting off [Westmore]167-cicely and choosing the narrower but richer individual existence that [her]3350-his wife love might once have offered . [His]3209-his life was in truth one indivisible organism , not two halves artificially united . [Self]247-self and other - self were ingrown from the roots -- whichever portion fate restricted [him]3209-his to would be but a mutilated half - live fragment of the whole . Happily for [him]3209-his , chance made this crisis of [his]3209-his life coincide with a strike at [Westmore]104-westmore . Soon after [his]3209-his return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford [he]3209-his found [himself]3209-his compelled to grapple with the hardest problem of [his]3209-his industrial career , and [he]3209-his was carried through the ensuing three months on that tide of swift obligatory action that sweeps the ship - wrecked spirit over so many sunken reefs of fear and despair . The knowledge that [he]3209-his was better able to deal with the question than [any one who might conceivably have taken [his]3209-his place]4927-any one who might conceivably have taken his place -- this conviction , which was presently confirmed by the peaceable adjustment of the strike , helped to make the sense of [his]3209-his immediate usefulness outbalance that other , disintegrating doubt as to the final value of such efforts . And so [he]3209-his tried to settle down into a kind of mechanical altruism , in which the reflexes of habit should take the place of that daily renewal of faith and enthusiasm which had been fed from the springs of [his]3209-his own joy . * * * * * The autumn came and passed into winter ; and after [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope 's re - establishment in [town]3932-town [Amherst]241-justine began to resume [his]3209-his usual visits to [[his]3209-his step - daughter]1946-his step - daughter . [His]3209-his natural affection for [the little girl]1723-the little girl had been deepened by the unforeseen manner in which [her]1723-the little girl fate had been entrusted to [him]3209-his . The thought of [Bessy]245-bessy , softened to compunction by the discovery that [her]245-bessy love had persisted under [their]4931-their apparently hopeless estrangement -- this feeling , intensified to the verge of morbidness by the circumstances attending [her]245-bessy death , now sought expression in a passionate devotion to [[her]245-bessy child]1722-her child . [Accident]248-accident had , in short , created between [Bessy]245-bessy and [himself]3209-his a retrospective sympathy which the resumption of life together would have dispelled in a week -- one of the exhalations from the past that depress the vitality of [those who linger too near the grave of dead experiences]4933-those who linger too near the grave of dead experiences . Since [Justine]241-justine 's departure [Amherst]241-justine had felt [himself]3209-his still more drawn to [Cicely]167-cicely ; but [his]3209-his relation to [the child]3698-the child was complicated by the fact that [she]167-cicely would not be satisfied as to the cause of [[her]167-cicely step - mother]4905-her step - mother 's absence . Whenever [Amherst]241-justine came to [town]3932-town , [her]241-justine first question was for [Justine]241-justine ; and [her]241-justine memory had the precocious persistence sometimes developed in [children]3598-children too early deprived of [their]3598-children natural atmosphere of affection . [Cicely]167-cicely had always been petted and adored , at odd times and by [divers people]4938-divers people ; but some instinct seemed to tell [her]167-cicely that , of all the tenderness bestowed on [her]241-justine , [Justine]241-justine 's most resembled the all - pervading motherly element in which [the child]3698-the child 's heart expands without ever being conscious of its needs . If it had been embarrassing to evade [Cicely]167-cicely 's questions in June it became doubly so as the months passed , and the pretext of [Justine]241-justine 's ill - health grew more and more difficult to sustain . And in the following March [Amherst]241-justine was suddenly called from [Hanaford]1-hanaford by the news that [the little girl]1723-the little girl [herself]1723-the little girl was ill . Serious complications had developed from a protracted case of scarlet fever , and for two weeks [the child]3698-the child 's fate was uncertain . Then [she]1723-the little girl began to recover , and in the joy of seeing life come back to [her]1723-the little girl , [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope and [Amherst]241-justine felt as though [they]4942-they must not only gratify every wish [she]1723-the little girl expressed , but try to guess at those [they]4942-they saw floating below the surface of [her]1723-the little girl clear vague eyes . It was noticeable to [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , if not to [the others]620-the others , that one of these unexpressed wishes was the desire to see [[her]1723-the little girl stepmother]4944-her stepmother . [Cicely]167-cicely no longer asked for [Justine]241-justine ; but something in [her]1723-the little girl silence , or in the gesture with which [she]1723-the little girl gently put from [her]1723-the little girl other offers of diversion and companionship , suddenly struck [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell as more poignant than speech . [XLI AMHERST]249-amherst , [Cicely]167-cicely 's convalescence once assured , had been obliged to go back to [Hanaford]1-hanaford ; but some ten days later , on hearing from [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell that [the little girl]1723-the little girl 's progress was less rapid than had been hoped , [he]120-mr. langhope returned to [[his]120-mr. langhope father]3438-his father - in - law 's for a Sunday . [He]120-mr. langhope came two days after the talk recorded in the last chapter -- a talk of which [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's letter to [him]120-mr. langhope had been the direct result . [She]178-mrs. ansell had promised [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope that , in writing to [Amherst]249-amherst , [she]178-mrs. ansell would not go beyond the briefest statement of fact ; and [she]178-mrs. ansell had kept [her]178-mrs. ansell word , trusting to circumstances to speak for [her]178-mrs. ansell . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell , during [Cicely]167-cicely 's illness , had formed the habit of dropping in on [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope at the tea hour instead of awaiting [him]120-mr. langhope in [[her]178-mrs. ansell own drawing - room]4959-her own drawing - room ; and on the Sunday in question [she]178-mrs. ansell found [him]120-mr. langhope alone . [He]120-mr. langhope met it with a discouraged gesture . "[245-bessy] No great change -- [Amherst]249-amherst finds [her]3227-her less well than when [he]249-amherst was [here]3415-here before . " [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell smiled with the thin edge of [her]178-mrs. ansell lips . "[0-i] [One]3402-one can hardly set [the police]4758-the police after [her----]3239-her---- ! " "[3239-her----] No ; [we]3235-we 're powerless , " [he]249-amherst groaned in assent . As the cup passed between [them]3235-we [she]178-mrs. ansell dropped [her]178-mrs. ansell eyes to [his]249-amherst with a quick flash of interrogation ; but [he]249-amherst sat staring moodily before [him]249-amherst , and [she]178-mrs. ansell moved back to the sofa without a word . * * * * * On the way [downstairs]486-downstairs [she]178-mrs. ansell met [Amherst]249-amherst descending from [[Cicely]167-cicely 's room]4965-cicely 's room . Since the early days of [his]249-amherst first marriage there had always been , on [Amherst]249-amherst 's side , a sense of obscure antagonism toward [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell . [She]178-mrs. ansell was almost the embodied spirit of [the world [he]249-amherst dreaded and disliked]4966-the world he dreaded and disliked : [her]178-mrs. ansell serenity , [her]178-mrs. ansell tolerance , [her]178-mrs. ansell adaptability , seemed to smile away and disintegrate all the high enthusiasms , the stubborn convictions , that [he]249-amherst had tried to plant in the shifting sands of [his]249-amherst married life . And now that [Bessy]245-bessy 's death had given [her]178-mrs. ansell back the attributes with which [his]249-amherst fancy had originally invested [her]178-mrs. ansell , [he]249-amherst had come to regard [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell as embodying the evil influences that had come between [himself]249-amherst and [[his]249-amherst wife]3350-his wife . [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell was probably not unaware of the successive transitions of feeling which had led up to this unflattering view ; but [her]178-mrs. ansell life had been passed among petty rivalries and animosities , and [she]178-mrs. ansell had the patience and adroitness of [the spy in [a hostile camp]4969-a hostile camp]4968-the spy in a hostile camp . [She]178-mrs. ansell and [Amherst]249-amherst exchanged a few words about [Cicely]167-cicely ; then [she]178-mrs. ansell exclaimed , with a glance through the panes of the hall door : "[3239-her----] But [I]0-i must be off -- [I'm]0-i on foot , and [the crossings]3240-the crossings appal [me]0-i after dark . " [He]249-amherst could do no less , at that , than offer to guide [her]178-mrs. ansell across the perils of [Fifth Avenue]82-fifth avenue ; and still talking of [Cicely]167-cicely , [she]178-mrs. ansell led [him]249-amherst down [the thronged thoroughfare]4970-the thronged thoroughfare till [her]178-mrs. ansell own corner was reached , and then [her]178-mrs. ansell own door ; turning there to ask , as if by an afterthought : "[3240-the crossings] Wo n't [you]3241-you come up ? There 's one thing more [I]0-i want to say . " A shade of reluctance crossed [his]249-amherst face , which , as the vestibule light fell on it , looked hard and tired , like a face set obstinately against a winter gale ; but [he]249-amherst murmured a word of assent , and followed [her]178-mrs. ansell into the shining steel cage of [the lift]4971-the lift . In [[her]178-mrs. ansell little drawing - room]4972-her little drawing - room , among the shaded lamps and bowls of spring flowers , [she]178-mrs. ansell pushed a chair forward , settled [herself]178-mrs. ansell in [her]178-mrs. ansell usual corner of the sofa , and said with a directness that seemed an echo of [his]249-amherst own tone : "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [you]3241-you to come up because [I]0-i want to talk to [you]3241-you about [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope . " [Amherst]249-amherst looked at [her]178-mrs. ansell in surprise . Though [[his]249-amherst father - in - law]2004-his father - in - law 's health had been more or less unsatisfactory for the last year , all [their]4974-their concern , of late , had been for [Cicely]167-cicely . "[0-i] [You]0-i think [him]120-mr. langhope less well ? " [he]249-amherst enquired . [She]178-mrs. ansell waited to draw off and smooth [her]178-mrs. ansell gloves , with one of the deliberate gestures that served to shade and supplement [her]178-mrs. ansell speech . "[0-i] [I]0-i think [him]120-mr. langhope extremely unhappy . " [Amherst]249-amherst moved uneasily in [his]249-amherst seat . [He]249-amherst did not know where [she]178-mrs. ansell meant the talk to lead [them]4974-their , but [he]249-amherst guessed that it would be over painful places , and [he]249-amherst saw no reason why [he]249-amherst should be forced to follow [her]178-mrs. ansell . "[0-i] [You]0-i mean that [he]120-mr. langhope 's still anxious about [Cicely]167-cicely ? " "[120-mr. langhope] Partly that -- yes . " [She]178-mrs. ansell paused . "[0-i] [The child]3698-the child will get well , no doubt ; but [she]3698-the child is very lonely . [She]3698-the child needs youth , heat , light . "[3698-the child] [She]3698-the child is twice motherless , " [she]178-mrs. ansell said . The blood rose to [his]249-amherst neck and temples , and [he]249-amherst tightened [his]249-amherst hand on the arm of [his]249-amherst chair . But it was a part of [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell 's expertness to know when such danger signals must be heeded and when they might be ignored , and [she]178-mrs. ansell went on quietly : "[3698-the child] It 's the question of the future that is troubling [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope . After such an illness , the next months of [Cicely]167-cicely 's life should be all happiness . And money wo n't buy the kind [she]3698-the child needs : one ca n't pick out the right companion for [such a child as one]3243-such a child as one can match a ribbon . What [she]3698-the child wants is spontaneous affection , not the most superlative manufactured article . [She]3698-the child wants the sort of love that [Justine]241-justine gave [her]3698-the child . " It was the first time in months that [Amherst]241-justine had heard [[his]249-amherst wife]3350-his wife 's name spoken outside of [[his]249-amherst own house]2010-his own house . [No one but [[his]249-amherst mother]396-his mother]4977-no one but his mother mentioned [Justine]241-justine to [him]249-amherst now ; and of late even [[his]249-amherst mother]396-his mother had dropped [her]396-his mother enquiries and allusions , prudently acquiescing in the habit of silence which [his]249-amherst own silence had created about [him]249-amherst . " [No one]3425-no one but [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell -- and perhaps [she]178-mrs. ansell knew it -- could have pushed so far beyond the conventional limits of discretion without seeming to overstep [them]4987-them by a hair ; and [she]178-mrs. ansell had often said , when pressed for the secret of [her]178-mrs. ansell art , that it consisted simply in knowing the pass - word . "[0-i] It was the only solution for [her]3255-she , as well as for the rest of [you]0-i . And so [she]3255-she showed it in the only way that was safe for both of [you]0-i , by taking [herself]3255-she away and hiding it in [her]3255-she heart ; and before going , [she]3255-she secured [your]0-i peace of mind , [your]0-i future . If [she]3255-she ruined anything , [she]3255-she rebuilt the ruin . Oh , [she]3255-she paid -- [she]3255-she paid in full ! " [Justine]241-justine had paid , yes -- paid to the utmost limit of whatever debt toward [society]4991-society [she]241-justine had contracted by overstepping [its]4991-society laws . And [her]241-justine resolve to discharge the debt had been taken in a flash , as soon as [she]241-justine had seen that [man]533-man can commit no act alone , whether for good or evil . The extent to which [Amherst]241-justine 's fate was involved in [hers]241-justine had become clear to [her]241-justine with [his]533-man first word of reassurance , of faith in [her]241-justine motive . And instantly a plan for releasing [him]533-man had leapt full - formed into [her]241-justine mind , and had been carried out with swift unflinching resolution . As [he]533-man forced [himself]533-man , now , to look down the suddenly illuminated past to the weeks which had elapsed between [her]241-justine visit to [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope and [her]241-justine departure from [Hanaford]1-hanaford , [he]533-man wondered not so much at [her]241-justine swiftness of resolve as at [her]241-justine firmness in carrying out [her]241-justine plan -- and [he]533-man saw , with a blinding flash of insight , that it was in [her]241-justine love for [him]533-man that [she]241-justine had found [her]241-justine strength . In all moments of strong mental tension [he]533-man became totally unconscious of time and place , and [he]533-man now remained silent so long , [his]533-man hands clasped behind [him]533-man , [his]533-man eyes fixed on an indeterminate point in space , that [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell at length rose and laid a questioning touch on [his]533-man arm . "[3255-she] It 's not true that [you]3260-he do n't know where [she]3261-she is ? " [His]533-man face contracted . "[3260-he] At this moment [I]0-i do n't . XLII [JUSTINE]241-justine 'S answer to [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband 's letter bore a [New York]7-new york address ; and the surprise of finding [her]3819-my wife in [the same town]4995-the same town with [himself]3260-he , and not half an hour 's walk from [the room in which [he]3260-he sat]4996-the room in which he sat , was so great that it seemed to demand some sudden and violent outlet of physical movement . [He]3260-he thrust the letter in [his]3260-he pocket , took up [his]3260-he hat , and leaving [the house]311-the house , strode up [Fifth Avenue]82-fifth avenue toward [the Park]4651-the park in the early spring sunlight . The news had taken five days to reach [him]3260-he , for in order to reestablish communication with [[his]3260-he wife]3350-his wife [he]3260-he had been obliged to write to [Michigan]93-michigan , with the request that [his]3260-he letter should be forwarded . [He]3260-he had never supposed that [Justine]241-justine would be hard to find , or that [she]241-justine had purposely enveloped [her]241-justine movements in mystery . When [she]241-justine ceased to write [he]3260-he had simply concluded that , like [himself]3260-he , [she]241-justine felt the mockery of trying to keep up a sort of distant , semi - fraternal relation , marked by the occasional interchange of inexpressive letters . The inextricable mingling of thought and sensation which made the peculiar closeness of [their]5000-their union could never , to such direct and passionate natures , be replaced by the pretense of a temperate friendship . Feeling thus [himself]3260-he , and instinctively assuming the same feeling in [[his]3260-he wife]3350-his wife , [Amherst]241-justine had respected [her]241-justine silence , [her]241-justine wish to break definitely with [their]5000-their former life . [She]241-justine had written [him]3260-he , in the autumn , that [she]241-justine intended to leave [Michigan]93-michigan for a few months , but that , in any emergency , a letter addressed to [[[her]241-justine friend]706-her friend 's house]5003-her friend 's house would reach [her]241-justine ; and [he]3260-he had taken this as meaning that , unless the emergency arose , [she]241-justine preferred that [their]5000-their correspondence should cease . Acquiescence was all the easier because it accorded with [his]3260-he own desire . It seemed to [him]3260-he , as [he]3260-he looked back , that the love [he]3260-he and [Justine]241-justine had felt for [each other]407-each other was like some rare organism which could maintain life only in its special element ; and that element was neither passion nor sentiment , but truth . It was only on the heights that [they]5000-their could breathe . [Some men]5005-some men , in [his]3260-he place , even while accepting the inevitableness of the moral rupture , would have felt concerned for the material side of the case . But it was characteristic of [Amherst]241-justine that this did not trouble [him]3260-he . [He]3260-he took it for granted that [[his]3260-he wife]3350-his wife would return to [[her]241-justine nursing]5007-her nursing . From the first [he]3260-he had felt certain that it would be intolerable to [her]241-justine to accept aid from [him]3260-he , and that [she]241-justine would choose rather to support [herself]241-justine by the exercise of [her]241-justine regular profession ; and , aside from such motives , [he]3260-he , who had always turned to hard work as the rarest refuge from personal misery , thought it natural that [she]241-justine should seek the same means of escape . [He]3260-he had therefore not been surprised , on opening [her]241-justine letter that morning , to learn that [she]241-justine had taken up [her]241-justine hospital work ; but in the amazement of finding [her]241-justine so near [he]3260-he hardly grasped [her]241-justine explanation of the coincidence . There was something about [a Buffalo patient]5008-a buffalo patient suddenly ordered to [New York]7-new york for special treatment , and refusing to go in with [a new nurse]823-a new nurse -- but these details made no impression on [his]3260-he mind , which had only room for the fact that chance had brought [[his]3260-he wife]3350-his wife back at the very moment when [his]3260-he whole being yearned for [her]241-justine . [She]241-justine wrote that , owing to [her]241-justine duties , [she]241-justine would be unable to see [him]3260-he till three that afternoon ; and [he]3260-he had still six hours to consume before [their]5011-they meeting . But in spirit [they]5011-they had met already -- [they]5011-they were one in an intensity of communion which , as [he]3260-he strode northward along [the bright crowded thoroughfare]5012-the bright crowded thoroughfare , seemed to gather up [the whole world]3121-the whole world into one throbbing point of life . [He]3260-he had a boyish wish to keep the secret of [his]3260-he happiness to [himself]3260-he , not to let [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope or [Mrs. Ansell]178-mrs. ansell know of [his]3260-he meeting with [Justine]241-justine till it was over ; and after twice measuring the length of [the Park]4651-the park [he]3260-he turned in at one of [the little wooden restaurants which were beginning to unshutter]5015-the little wooden restaurants which were beginning to unshutter [themselves]5015-the little wooden restaurants which were beginning to unshutter in anticipation of spring custom . If only [he]3260-he could have seen [Justine]241-justine that morning ! If [he]3260-he could have brought [her]241-justine [there]3361-there , and [they]5011-they could have sat opposite [each other]407-each other , in [the bare empty room]5018-the bare empty room , with sparrows bustling and twittering in the lilacs against the open window ! [The room]3355-the room was ugly enough -- but how [she]241-justine would have delighted in the delicate green of [the near slopes]5020-the near slopes , and the purplish haze of [the woods beyond]5021-the woods beyond ! [She]241-justine took a childish pleasure in such small adventures , and had the knack of giving a touch of magic to [their]5011-they most commonplace details . [Amherst]241-justine , as [he]3260-he finished [his]3260-he cold beef and indifferent eggs , found [himself]3260-he boyishly planning to bring [her]241-justine back [there]3361-there the next day .... Then , over the coffee , [he]3260-he re - read [her]241-justine letter . The address [she]241-justine gave was that of [a small private hospital]5023-a small private hospital , and [she]241-justine explained that [she]241-justine would have to receive [him]3260-he in [the public parlour]5024-the public parlour , which at that hour was open to [other visitors]5025-other visitors . As the time approached , the thought that [they]5011-they might not be alone when [they]5011-they met became insufferable ; and [he]3260-he determined , if [he]3260-he found [any one else]3853-any one else , in possession of [the parlour]5027-the parlour , to wait in [the hall]505-the hall , and meet [her]241-justine as [she]241-justine came down the stairs . [He]3260-he continued to elaborate this plan as [he]3260-he walked back slowly through [the Park]4651-the park , [He]3260-he had timed [himself]3260-he to reach [the hospital]3333-the hospital a little before three ; but though it lacked five minutes to the hour when [he]3260-he entered [the parlour]5027-the parlour , [two women]5032-two women were already seated in one of [its]5027-the parlour windows . [They]5032-two women looked around as [he]3260-he came in , evidently as much annoyed by [his]3260-he appearance as [he]3260-he had been to find [them]5032-two women [there]3361-there . [The older of the two]5034-the older of the two showed a sallow middle - aged face beneath [her]5034-the older of the two limp crape veil ; [the other]736-the other was [a slight tawdry creature]5036-a slight tawdry creature , with nodding feathers , and innumerable chains and bracelets which [she]5034-the older of the two fingered ceaselessly as [she]5034-the older of the two talked . [They]5032-two women eyed [Amherst]241-justine with resentment , and then turned away , continuing [their]5032-two women talk in low murmurs , while [he]3260-he seated [himself]3260-he at the marble - topped table littered with torn magazines . Now and then [the younger woman]5037-the younger woman 's voice rose in a shrill staccato , and a phrase or two floated over to [him]3260-he . "[3819-my wife] [She]3266-she 'd simply worked [herself]3266-she to death -- [the nurse]260-the nurse told [me]0-i so .... [She]3266-she expects to go [home]3405-home in another week , though how [she]3266-she 's going to stand the _ fatigue_---- " and then , after an inaudible answer : "[3269-you] It 's all _ [his]3269-you _ fault , and if [I]0-i was [her]3266-she [I]0-i would n't go back to [him]3269-you for anything ! " "[0-i] Oh , [Cora]250-cora , [he]3269-you 's real sorry now , " [the older woman]1491-the older woman protestingly murmured ; but the other , unappeased , rejoined with ominously nodding plumes : "[3269-you] _ [You]250-cora _ see -- if [they]3270-they do make it up , it 'll never be the same between [them]3270-they ! " [Amherst]241-justine started up nervously , and as [he]3260-he did so the clock struck three , and [he]3260-he opened the door and passed out into [the hall]505-the hall . [It]505-the hall was paved with black and white marble ; the walls were washed in a dull yellowish tint , and the prevalent odour of antiseptics was mingled with a stale smell of cooking . At the back rose a straight staircase carpeted with brass - bound India - rubber , like [a ship]2429-a ship 's companion - way ; and down [that staircase]5041-that staircase [she]1491-the older woman would come in a moment -- [he]3260-he fancied [he]3260-he heard [her]1491-the older woman step now .... [Amherst]241-justine 's hopes leapt up : perhaps [she]1491-the older woman had come to fetch [the visitors]647-the visitors [upstairs]1423-upstairs ! [He]3260-he strained [his]3260-he ears to catch what was being said , and while [he]3260-he was thus absorbed the door opened , and turning at the sound [he]3260-he found [himself]3260-he face to face with [[his]3260-he wife]3350-his wife . [He]3260-he had not reflected that [Justine]241-justine would be in [[her]241-justine nurse]5048-her nurse 's dress ; and the sight of the dark blue uniform and small white cap , in which [he]3260-he had never seen [her]241-justine since [their]5049-their first meeting in [the Hope Hospital]253-the hope hospital , obliterated all bitter and unhappy memories , and gave [him]3260-he the illusion of passing back at once into the clear air of [their]5049-their early friendship . Then [he]3260-he looked at [her]241-justine and remembered . [He]3260-he noticed that [she]241-justine had grown thinner than ever , or rather that [her]241-justine thinness , which had formerly had a healthy reed - like strength , now suggested fatigue and languor . And [her]241-justine face was spent , extinguished -- the very eyes were lifeless . All [her]241-justine vitality seemed to have withdrawn itself into the arch of dense black hair which still clasped [her]241-justine forehead like the noble metal of some antique bust . The sight stirred [him]3260-he with a deeper pity , a more vehement compunction ; but the impulse to snatch [her]241-justine to [him]3260-he , and seek [his]3260-he pardon on [her]241-justine lips , was paralyzed by the sense that [the three women in the window]5051-the three women in the window had stopped talking and turned [their]5051-the three women in the window heads toward the door . " [She]241-justine made a negative gesture . "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid not to - day . " Ah , [her]241-justine deep sweet voice -- how completely [his]3260-he ear had lost the sound of it ! [She]241-justine looked doubtfully about [the room]3355-the room , and pointed to a sofa at the end farthest from the windows . "[0-i] Shall [we]3274-we sit there ? " [she]241-justine said . [He]3260-he followed [her]241-justine in silence , and [they]3274-we sat down side by side . [The matron]261-the matron had drawn up a chair and resumed [her]261-the matron whispered conference with [the women in the window]5054-the women in the window . Between [the two groups]5055-the two groups stretched the bare length of [the room]3355-the room , broken only by a few arm - chairs of stained wood , and the marble - topped table covered with magazines . The impossibility of giving free rein to [his]3260-he feelings developed in [Amherst]241-justine an unwonted intensity of perception , as though a sixth sense had suddenly emerged to take the place of those [he]3260-he could not use . And with [this new - made faculty]5057-this new - made faculty [he]3260-he seemed to gather up , and absorb into [himself]3260-he , as [he]3260-he had never done in [their]3274-we hours of closest communion , every detail of [[his]3260-he wife]3350-his wife 's person , of [her]3350-his wife face and hands and gestures . [He]3260-he noticed how [her]3350-his wife full upper lids , of the tint of yellowish ivory , had a slight bluish discolouration , and how little thread - like blue veins ran across [her]3350-his wife temples to the roots of [her]3350-his wife hair . The emaciation of [her]3350-his wife face , and the hollow shades beneath [her]3350-his wife cheek - bones , made [her]3350-his wife mouth seem redder and fuller , though a little line on each side , where it joined the cheek , gave it a tragic droop . And [her]3350-his wife hands ! When [her]3350-his wife fingers met [his]3260-he [he]3260-he recalled having once picked up , in [the winter woods]5059-the winter woods , the little feather - light skeleton of a frozen bird -- and that was what [her]3350-his wife touch was like . And it was [he]3260-he who had brought [her]3350-his wife to this by [his]3260-he cruelty , [his]3260-he obtuseness , [his]3260-he base readiness to believe the worst of [her]3350-his wife ! [He]3260-he did not want to pour [himself]3260-he out in self - accusation -- that seemed too easy a way of escape . [He]3260-he wanted simply to take [her]3350-his wife in [his]3260-he arms , to ask [her]3350-his wife to give [him]3260-he one more chance -- and then to show [her]3350-his wife ! And all the while [he]3260-he was paralyzed by [the group in the window]5060-the group in the window . "[0-i] Ca n't [we]3275-we go out ? XLIII JUNE again at [Hanaford]1-hanaford -- and [Cicely]167-cicely 's birthday . The anniversary was to coincide , this year , with the opening of [the old house at [Hopewood]11-hopewood]5073-the old house at hopewood , as a kind of [pleasure - palace -- gymnasium , [concert - hall]5075-concert - hall and museum -- for the recreation of the mill - hands]5074-pleasure - palace -- gymnasium , concert - hall and museum -- for the recreation of the mill - hands . The idea had first come to [Amherst]96-amherst on the winter afternoon when [Bessy Westmore]122-bessy had confessed [her]122-bessy love for [him]3283-his under [the snow - laden trees of [Hopewood]11-hopewood]5076-the snow - laden trees of hopewood . Even then the sense that [his]3283-his personal happiness was enlarged and secured by its promise of happiness to [others]3447-others had made [him]3283-his wish that the scene associated with the opening of [his]3283-his new life should be made to commemorate a corresponding change in the fortunes of [Westmore]122-bessy . But when the control of [the mills]3324-the mills passed into [his]3283-his hands other and more necessary improvements pressed upon [him]3283-his ; and it was not till now that the financial condition of [the company]3366-the company had permitted the execution of [his]3283-his plan . [Justine]241-justine , on [her]241-justine return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford , had found the work already in progress , and had been told by [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband that [he]3283-his was carrying out a projected scheme of [Bessy]122-bessy 's . [She]241-justine had felt a certain surprise , but had concluded that the plan in question dated back to the early days of [his]3283-his first marriage , when , in [[his]3283-his wife]3350-his wife 's eyes , [his]3283-his connection with [the mills]3324-the mills still invested [them]3324-the mills with interest . Since [Justine]241-justine had come back to [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband , [both]502-both had tacitly avoided all allusions to the past , and [the recreation - house at [Hopewood]11-hopewood]5085-the recreation - house at hopewood being , as [she]241-justine divined , in some sort an expiatory offering to [Bessy]122-bessy 's plaintive shade , [she]241-justine had purposely refrained from questioning [Amherst]241-justine about its progress , and had simply approved the plans [he]3283-his submitted to [her]241-justine . Fourteen months had passed since [her]241-justine return , and now , as [she]241-justine sat beside [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband in [the carriage which was conveying [them]3324-the mills]5087-the carriage which was conveying them to [Hopewood]11-hopewood , [she]241-justine said to [herself]241-justine that [her]241-justine life had at last fallen into what promised to be its final shape -- that as things now were [they]3324-the mills would probably be to the end . And outwardly at least [they]3324-the mills were what [she]241-justine and [Amherst]241-justine had always dreamed of [their]3324-the mills being . [Westmore]104-westmore prospered under the new rule . The seeds of life [they]3324-the mills had sown there were springing up in a promising growth of bodily health and mental activity , and above all in a dawning social consciousness . [The mill - hands]3347-the mill - hands were beginning to understand the meaning of [their]3347-the mill - hands work , in its relation to [their]3347-the mill - hands own lives and to the larger economy . And outwardly , also , the new growth was showing itself in the humanized aspect of [the place]3515-the place . [Amherst]241-justine 's young maples were tall enough now to cast a shade on [the grass - bordered streets]5090-the grass - bordered streets ; and the well - kept turf , [the bright cottage gardens]5091-the bright cottage gardens , [the new central group of [library]5093-library , [hospital]3326-hospital and [club - house]5095-club - house]5092-the new central group of library , hospital and club - house , gave to the [mill - village]5096-mill - village the hopeful air of [a "[0-i] rising " residential suburb]5097-a " rising " residential suburb . In the bright June light , behind [their]3324-the mills fresh green mantle of trees and creepers , even [the factory buildings]5098-the factory buildings looked less stern and prison - like than formerly ; and the turfing and planting of [the adjoining river - banks]5099-the adjoining river - banks had transformed a waste of foul mud and refuse into a little park where [the operatives]3426-the operatives might refresh [themselves]3426-the operatives at midday . Yes -- [Westmore]104-westmore was alive at last : [the dead city of which [Justine]241-justine had once spoken]5101-the dead city of which justine had once spoken had risen from [its]104-westmore grave , and [its]104-westmore blank face had taken on a meaning . As [Justine]241-justine glanced at [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband [she]241-justine saw that the same thought was in [his]3393-her husband mind . However achieved , at whatever cost of personal misery and error , the work of awakening and freeing [Westmore]122-bessy was done , and that work had justified itself . [She]241-justine looked from [Amherst]241-justine to [Cicely]167-cicely , who sat opposite , eager and rosy in [her]167-cicely mourning frock -- for [Mr. Langhope]120-mr. langhope had died some two months previously -- and as intent as [[her]167-cicely step - parents]5103-her step - parents on the scene before [her]167-cicely . [Cicely]167-cicely was old enough now to regard [her]167-cicely connection with [Westmore]167-cicely as something more than a nursery game . [She]167-cicely was beginning to learn a great deal about [the mills]3324-the mills , and to understand , in simple , friendly ways , something of [her]167-cicely own relation to [them]3324-the mills . The work and play of [the children]3618-the children , the interests and relaxations provided for [[their]3618-the children elders]5106-their elders , had been gradually explained to [her]167-cicely by [Justine]241-justine , and [she]167-cicely knew that this shining tenth birthday of [hers]241-justine was to throw its light as far as the clouds of factory - smoke extended . As [they]5103-her step - parents mounted the slope to [Hopewood]11-hopewood , [the spacious white building]5107-the spacious white building , with [its]5107-the spacious white building enfolding colonnades , [its]5107-the spacious white building broad terraces and [tennis - courts]5108-tennis - courts , shone through the trees like [some bright country - house adorned for [[its]5107-the spacious white building master]5110-its master 's home - coming]5109-some bright country - house adorned for its master 's home - coming ; and [Amherst]241-justine and [[his]5110-its master wife]3350-his wife might have been driving up to [the house which had been built to shelter [their]5103-her step - parents wedded happiness]5112-the house which had been built to shelter their wedded happiness . The thought flashed across [Justine]241-justine as [[their]5103-her step - parents carriage]5113-their carriage climbed [the hill]1046-the hill . [She]241-justine was as much absorbed as [Amherst]241-justine in [the welfare of [Westmore]104-westmore]5115-the welfare of westmore , it had become more and more , to both , the refuge in which [their]5103-her step - parents lives still met and mingled ; but for a moment , as [they]5103-her step - parents paused before [the flower - decked porch]5116-the flower - decked porch , and [he]5110-its master turned to help [her]241-justine from [the carriage]547-the carriage , it occurred to [her]241-justine to wonder what [her]241-justine sensations would have been if [he]5110-its master had been bringing [her]241-justine [home]3405-home -- to [a real home of [their]5103-her step - parents own]5119-a real home of their own -- instead of accompanying [her]241-justine to another philanthropic celebration . But what need had [they]5103-her step - parents of [a real home]5120-a real home , when [they]5103-her step - parents no longer had any real life of [their]5103-her step - parents own ? Nothing was left of that secret inner union which had so enriched and beautified [their]5103-her step - parents outward lives . Since [Justine]241-justine 's return to [Hanaford]1-hanaford [they]5103-her step - parents had entered , tacitly , almost unconsciously , into a new relation to [each other]407-each other : a relation in which [their]5103-her step - parents personalities were more and more merged in [their]5103-her step - parents common work , so that , as it were , [they]5103-her step - parents met only by avoiding [each other]407-each other . From the first , [Justine]241-justine had accepted this as inevitable ; just as [she]241-justine had understood , when [Amherst]241-justine had sought [her]241-justine out in [New York]7-new york , that [his]5123-his remaining at [Westmore]104-westmore , which had once been contingent on [her]241-justine leaving [him]5123-his , now depended on [her]241-justine willingness to return and take up [their]5103-her step - parents former life . [She]241-justine accepted the last condition as [she]241-justine had accepted the other , pledged to the perpetual expiation of an act for which , in the abstract , [she]241-justine still refused to hold [herself]241-justine to blame . But life is not a matter of abstract principles , but a succession of pitiful compromises with fate , of concessions to old tradition , old beliefs , old charities and frailties . That was what [her]241-justine act had taught [her]241-justine -- that was the word of [the gods]3946-the gods to [the mortal who had laid a hand on [their]5103-her step - parents bolts]5125-the mortal who had laid a hand on their bolts . And [she]241-justine had humbled [herself]241-justine to accept the lesson , seeing human relations at last as a tangled and deep - rooted growth , a dark forest through which [the idealist]5126-the idealist can not cut [his]5126-the idealist straight path without hearing at each stroke the cry of the severed branch : "[3286-thou] _ Why woundest [thou]3286-thou [me]0-i ? _ " * * * * * [The lawns leading up to [the house]311-the house]5127-the lawns leading up to the house were already sprinkled with [holiday - makers]956-holiday - makers , while along [the avenue]1023-the avenue came the rolling of wheels , the throb of [motor - cars]5131-motor - cars ; and [Justine]241-justine , with [Cicely]167-cicely beside [her]241-justine , stood in [the wide hall]5132-the wide hall to receive [the incoming throng]5133-the incoming throng , in which [Hanaford society]5134-hanaford society was indiscriminately mingled with [the operatives in [their]5135-the operatives in their sunday best Sunday best]5135-the operatives in their sunday best . While [[his]5126-the idealist wife]3350-his wife welcomed [the new arrivals]4110-the new arrivals , [Amherst]241-justine , supported by [some young Westmore cousins]5138-some young westmore cousins , was guiding [them]4110-the new arrivals into [the concert - hall]5139-the concert - hall , where [he]5126-the idealist was to say a word on the uses of [the building]308-the building before declaring [it]308-the building open for inspection . And presently [Justine]241-justine and [Cicely]167-cicely , summoned by [Westy Gaines]113-westy , made [their]4110-the new arrivals way through the rows of seats to a corner near [the platform]2784-the platform . [[Her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband was [there]3361-there already , with [Halford Gaines]164-hanaford and [a group of [Hanaford dignitaries]5145-hanaford dignitaries]5144-a group of hanaford dignitaries , and just below [them]4110-the new arrivals sat [Mrs. Gaines]140-mrs. gaines and [[her]140-mrs. gaines daughters]1162-her daughters , [the Harry Dressels]161-the kindly and prosperous dressels , and [[Amherst]241-justine 's radiant mother]5147-amherst 's radiant mother . As [Justine]241-justine passed between [them]4110-the new arrivals , [she]241-justine wondered how much [they]4110-the new arrivals knew of the events which had wrought so profound and permanent change in [her]241-justine life . [She]241-justine had never known how [Hanaford]164-hanaford explained [her]241-justine absence or what comments it had made on [her]241-justine return . But [she]241-justine saw to - day more clearly than ever that [Amherst]241-justine had become a power among [[his]5148-his townsmen]5149-his townsmen , and that if [they]4110-the new arrivals were still blind to the inner meaning of [his]5148-his work , its practical results were beginning to impress [them]4110-the new arrivals profoundly . [Hanaford]164-hanaford 's sociological creed was largely based on commercial considerations , and [Amherst]241-justine had won [Hanaford]164-hanaford 's esteem by the novel feat of defying its economic principles and snatching success out of [his]5148-his defiance . And now [he]5148-his had advanced a step or two in front of the "[0-i] representative " semi - circle on [the platform]2784-the platform , and was beginning to speak . [Justine]241-justine did not hear [his]5148-his first words . [She]241-justine was looking up at [him]5148-his , trying to see [him]5148-his with the eyes of [the crowd]654-the crowd , and wondering what manner of man [he]5148-his would have seemed to [her]241-justine if [she]241-justine had known as little as [they]4110-the new arrivals did of [his]5148-his inner history . [He]5148-his held [himself]5148-his straight , the heavy locks thrown back from [his]5148-his forehead , one hand resting on the table beside [him]5148-his , the other grasping a folded blue - print which [the architect of [the building]308-the building]5152-the architect of the building had just advanced to give [him]5148-his . As [he]5148-his stood there , [Justine]241-justine recalled [her]241-justine first sight of [him]5148-his in [the Hope Hospital]253-the hope hospital , five years earlier -- was it only five years ? [They]4110-the new arrivals had dealt deep strokes to [his]5148-his face , hollowing the eye - sockets , accentuating the strong modelling of nose and chin , fixing the lines between the brows ; but every touch had a meaning -- it was not the languid hand of time which had remade [his]5148-his features , but the sharp chisel of thought and action . [She]241-justine roused [herself]241-justine suddenly to the consciousness of what [he]5148-his was saying . "[0-i] For the idea of [this building]3287-this building -- of [a building dedicated to the recreation of [Westmore]104-westmore]3288-a building dedicated to the recreation of westmore -- is not new in [my]0-i mind ; but while it remained there as a mere idea , it had already , without [my]0-i knowledge , taken definite shape in the thoughts of [the owner of [Westmore]104-westmore]4422-the owner of westmore . " There was a slight drop in [his]5148-his voice as [he]5148-his designated [Bessy]122-bessy , and [he]5148-his waited a moment before continuing : "[4422-the owner of westmore] It was not till after the death of [[my]0-i first wife]3290-my first wife that [I]0-i learned of [her]3290-my first wife intention -- that [I]0-i found by accident , among [her]3290-my first wife papers , this carefully - studied plan for [a pleasure - house at [Hopewood]11-hopewood]3291-a pleasure - house at hopewood . " [He]5148-his paused again , and unrolling the blue - print , held it up before [[his]5148-his audience]5155-his audience . "[3292-you] [You]3292-you can not , at this distance , " [he]5148-his went on , "[3290-my first wife] see all the admirable details of [her]3290-my first wife plan ; see how beautifully they were imagined , how carefully and intelligently elaborated . [She]3290-my first wife who conceived [them]3293-them longed to see beauty everywhere -- it was [her]3290-my first wife dearest wish to bestow it on [[her]3290-my first wife people]525-her people here . And [her]3290-my first wife ardent imagination outran the bounds of practical possibility . [We]3295-we can not give [you]3292-you , in [its]3296-its completeness , the beautiful thing [she]3290-my first wife had imagined -- [the great terraces]3297-the great terraces , the marble porches , the fountains , lily - tanks , and cloisters . But [you]3292-you will see that , wherever it was possible -- though in humbler materials , and on a smaller scale -- [we]3295-we have faithfully followed [her]3290-my first wife design ; and when presently [you]3292-you go through [this building]3287-this building , and when , hereafter , [you]3292-you find health and refreshment and diversion here , [I]0-i ask [you]3292-you to remember the beauty [she]3290-my first wife dreamed of giving [you]3292-you , and to let the thought of it make [her]3290-my first wife memory beautiful among [you]3292-you and among [[your]3292-you children]3608-your children .... " [Justine]241-justine had listened with deepening amazement . [She]241-justine was seated so close to [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband that [she]241-justine had recognized the blue - print the moment [he]3393-her husband unrolled it . There was no mistaking its origin -- it was simply the plan of [the gymnasium which [Bessy]122-bessy had intended to build at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook]5157-the gymnasium which bessy had intended to build at lynbrook , and which [she]241-justine had been constrained to abandon owing to [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband 's increased expenditure at [the mills]3324-the mills . But how was it possible that [Amherst]241-justine knew nothing of the original purpose of the plans , and by what mocking turn of events had a project devised in deliberate defiance of [his]3393-her husband wishes , and intended to declare [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife 's open contempt for [them]5161-them , been transformed into a Utopian vision for the betterment of [the Westmore operatives]5162-the westmore operatives ? A wave of anger swept over [Justine]241-justine at this last derisive stroke of fate . It was grotesque and pitiable that [a man like [Amherst]241-justine]5163-a man like amherst should create out of [his]3393-her husband regrets a being who had never existed , and then ascribe to [her]3350-his wife feelings and actions of which [the real woman]5164-the real woman had again and again proved [herself]3350-his wife incapable ! Ah , no , [Justine]241-justine had suffered enough -- but to have [this imaginary Bessy]5165-this imaginary bessy called from the grave , dressed in a semblance of self - devotion and idealism , to see [her]241-justine petty impulses of vindictiveness disguised as the motions of a lofty spirit -- it was as though [her]241-justine small malicious ghost had devised this way of punishing [the wife who had taken [her]241-justine place]5166-the wife who had taken her place ! [Justine]241-justine had suffered enough -- suffered deliberately and unstintingly , paying the full price of [her]241-justine error , not seeking to evade its least consequence . But no sane judgment could ask [her]241-justine to sit quiet under this last hallucination . What ! [This unreal woman]5167-this unreal woman , this phantom that [Amherst]241-justine 's uneasy imagination had evoked , was to come between [himself]241-justine and [her]5167-this unreal woman , to supplant [her]5167-this unreal woman first as [[his]3393-her husband wife]3350-his wife , and then as [[his]3393-her husband fellow - worker]5169-his fellow - worker ? Why should [she]5167-this unreal woman not cry out the truth to [him]3393-her husband , defend [herself]5167-this unreal woman against [the dead who came back to rob [her]5167-this unreal woman of such wedded peace as was [hers]5167-this unreal woman]5170-the dead who came back to rob her of such wedded peace as was hers ? [She]5167-this unreal woman had only to tell the true story of the plans to lay [poor Bessy]122-bessy 's ghost forever ! The confused throbbing impulses within [her]5167-this unreal woman were stifled under a long burst of applause -- then [she]5167-this unreal woman saw [Westy Gaines]113-westy at [her]5167-this unreal woman side again , and understood that [he]113-westy had come to lead [Cicely]167-cicely to [the platform]2784-the platform . For a moment [she]5167-this unreal woman clung jealously to [the child]3698-the child 's hand , hardly aware of what [she]5167-this unreal woman did , feeling only that [she]5167-this unreal woman was being thrust farther and farther into the background of the life [she]5167-this unreal woman had helped to call out of chaos . Then a contrary impulse moved [her]5167-this unreal woman . [She]5167-this unreal woman gently freed [Cicely]167-cicely 's hand , and a moment later , as [she]5167-this unreal woman sat with bent head and throbbing breast , [she]5167-this unreal woman heard [the child]3698-the child 's treble piping out above [her]5167-this unreal woman : "[0-i] In [[my]0-i mother]3553-my mother 's name , [I]0-i give [this house]4516-this house to [Westmore]167-cicely . " Applause again -- and then [Justine]241-justine found [herself]241-justine enveloped in a general murmur of compliment and congratulation . [Mr. Amherst]96-amherst had spoken admirably -- a "[0-i] beautiful tribute-- " ah , [he]96-amherst had done poor [Bessy]122-bessy justice ! And to think that till now [Hanaford]164-hanaford had never fully known how [she]164-hanaford had the welfare of [the mills]3324-the mills at heart -- how it was really only _ [her]164-hanaford _ work that [he]96-amherst was carrying on [there]3361-there ! Well , [he]96-amherst had made that perfectly clear -- and no doubt [Cicely]167-cicely was being taught to follow in [[her]167-cicely mother]1105-her mother 's footsteps : [everyone]3120-everyone had noticed how [[her]167-cicely step - father]1905-her step - father was associating [her]167-cicely with the work at [the mills]3324-the mills . And [his]96-amherst little speech would , as it were , consecrate [the child]3698-the child 's relation to that work , make it appear to [her]167-cicely as the continuance of a beautiful , a sacred tradition .... * * * * * And now it was over . [The building]308-the building had been inspected , [the operatives]3426-the operatives had dispersed , [the Hanaford company]5183-the hanaford company had rolled off down [the avenue]1023-the avenue , [Cicely]167-cicely , among [them]3426-the operatives , driving away tired and happy in [Mrs. Dressel]118-mrs. dressel 's victoria , and [Amherst]96-amherst and [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife were alone . [Amherst]96-amherst , after bidding good - bye to [[his]96-amherst last guests]5186-his last guests , had gone back to [the empty concert - room]5187-the empty concert - room to fetch the blue - print lying on the platform . [He]96-amherst came back with it , between the uneven rows of empty chairs , and joined [Justine]241-justine , who stood waiting in [the hall]505-the hall . [His]96-amherst face was slightly flushed , and [his]96-amherst eyes had the light which in happy moments burned through their veil of thought . [He]96-amherst laid [his]96-amherst hand on [[his]96-amherst wife]3350-his wife 's arm , and drawing [her]3350-his wife toward a table spread out the blueprint before [her]3350-his wife . "[3302-you] [You]3302-you have n't seen this , have [you]3302-you ? " [he]96-amherst said . [She]241-justine looked down at the plan without answering , reading in the left - hand corner [the architect]2244-the architect 's conventional inscription : "[3302-you] Swimming - tank and gymnasium designed for [Mrs. John Amherst]251-mrs. john amherst . " [Amherst]96-amherst looked up , perhaps struck by [her]241-justine silence . "[251-mrs. john amherst] But perhaps [you]3302-you _ have _ seen it -- at [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ? It must have been done while [you]3302-you were [there]3361-there . " The quickened throb of [her]241-justine blood rushed to [her]241-justine brain like a signal . "[3304-she] Speak -- speak now ! " the signal commanded . [Justine]241-justine continued to look fixedly at the plan . "[3304-she] Yes , [I]0-i have seen it , " [she]241-justine said at length . "[0-i] At [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook ? " "[0-i] At [Lynbrook]27-lynbrook . " "[3304-she] _ [She]3304-she _ showed it to [you]3302-you , [I]0-i suppose -- while [I]0-i was away ? " [Justine]241-justine hesitated again . "[3304-she] Yes , while [you]3302-you were away . " "[3302-you] And did [she]3304-she tell [you]3302-you anything about it , go into details about [her]3304-she wishes , [her]3304-she intentions ? " Now was the moment -- now ! As [her]241-justine lips parted [she]241-justine looked up at [[her]241-justine husband]3393-her husband . The illumination still lingered on [his]3393-her husband face -- and it was the face [she]241-justine loved . [He]3393-her husband was waiting eagerly for [her]241-justine next word . "[3304-she] No , [I]0-i heard no details . [I]0-i merely saw the plan lying there . " [She]241-justine saw [his]3393-her husband look of disappointment . "[3304-she] [She]3304-she never told [you]3302-you about it ? " "[3304-she] No -- [she]3304-she never told [me]0-i . " It was best so , after all . [She]241-justine understood that now . It was now at last that [she]241-justine was paying [her]241-justine full price . [Amherst]96-amherst rolled up the plan with a sigh and pushed it into the drawer of the table . It struck [her]241-justine that [he]3393-her husband too had the look of one who has laid a ghost . [He]3393-her husband turned to [her]241-justine and drew [her]241-justine hand through [his]3393-her husband arm . "[3304-she] [You]0-i 're tired , [dear]3468-dear . [You]0-i ought to have driven back with [the others]620-the others , " [he]3393-her husband said . "[0-i] No , [I]0-i would rather stay with [you]0-i . " "[3302-you] [You]3302-you want to drain this good day to the dregs , as [I]0-i do ? " "[0-i] Yes , " [she]241-justine murmured , drawing [her]241-justine hand away . "[0-i] It _ is _ a good day , is n't it ? " [he]3393-her husband continued , looking about [him]3393-her husband at the white - panelled walls , the vista of [large bright rooms]5192-large bright rooms seen through the folding doors . "[0-i] [I]0-i feel as if [we]3307-we had reached a height , somehow -- a height where one might pause and draw breath for the next climb . Do n't [you]0-i feel that too , [Justine]241-justine ? " "[241-justine] Yes -- [I]0-i feel it . " "[0-i] Do [you]3302-you remember once , long ago -- one day when [you]3302-you and [I]0-i and [Cicely]167-cicely went on a picnic to hunt orchids -- how [we]3307-we got talking of the one best moment in life -- the moment when [one]3402-one wanted most to stop the clock ? " The colour rose in [her]0-i face while [he]3302-you spoke . It was a long time since [he]3302-you had referred to the early days of [their]3307-we friendship -- the days _ before _ .... "[3302-you] Yes , [I]0-i remember , " [she]0-i said . "[3302-you] And do [you]3302-you remember how [we]3307-we said that it was with most of [us]3307-we as it was with [Faust]195-faust ? That the moment [one]3402-one wanted to hold fast to was not , in most lives , the moment of keenest personal happiness , but the other kind -- the kind that would have seemed grey and colourless at first : the moment when the meaning of life began to come out from the mists -- when [one]3402-one could look out at last over [the marsh]3311-the marsh [one]3402-one had drained ? " A tremor ran through [Justine]241-justine . "[3312-it] [It]3312-it was [you]3302-you who said that , " [she]0-i said , half - smiling . "[3302-you] But did n't [you]3302-you feel it with [me]0-i ? Do n't [you]3302-you now ? " "[3302-you] Yes -- [I]0-i do now , " [she]0-i murmured . [He]3302-you came close to [her]3468-dear , and taking [her]3468-dear hands in [his]3302-you , kissed [them]5193-them one after the other . "[0-i] [Dear]3468-dear , " [he]3302-you said , "[3468-dear] let [us]3314-us go out and look at [the marsh]3311-the marsh [we]3314-us have drained . " [He]3302-you turned and led [her]3468-dear through the open doorway to [the terrace above [the river]353-the river]3316-the terrace above the river . The sun was setting behind [the wooded slopes of [Hopewood]11-hopewood]3318-the wooded slopes of hopewood , and the trees about [the house]311-the house stretched long blue shadows across [the lawn]1159-the lawn . Beyond [them]3321-them rose the smoke of [Westmore]104-westmore .
